4.title: What Analysts Think of Nike Stock Ahead of Earnings
4.snippet: Nike is set to report fiscal third-quarter earnings after the market closes Thursday, its second quarter under CEO Elliott Hill.
4.content:
Key Takeaways Nike is set to report fiscal third-quarter earnings after the market closes Thursday, its second quarter under CEO Elliott Hill.

The apparel and shoe maker is expected to report declining sales and profits, but analysts remain more bullish than bearish on the stock.

Nike's second-quarter results topped estimates, but analysts warned the company's turnaround effort could take time.

Nike (NKE) is scheduled to report earnings for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 after the closing bell on Thursday, with analysts more bullish than bearish on the apparel maker's stock.

Half of the 18 analysts tracked by Visible Alpha rate Nike stock as a "buy," with seven "hold" and two "sell" ratings. Their average price target near $82 would represent a premium of about 11% from Monday's close.

Nike is expected to report $11.02 billion in revenue for the quarter, down from $12.43 billion the same time a year ago. Earnings per share (EPS) is expected to decline year-over-year to 28 cents.

Second Report Under New CEO Amid Turnaround Effort

Thursday's report will mark Nike's second under new CEO Elliott Hill, who took over the top job in October. In the second quarter, Nike's results topped estimates, and Hill laid out his vision for improving sales. A number of analysts soon lowered their price targets, however, warning Nike's turnaround could take longer than expected.

Morgan Stanley analysts said recently they see room for "slight outperformance" in third-quarter EPS and projections for the fourth quarter. However, they still "prefer to stay on the sidelines" on the stock, considering an uncertain growth trajectory amid the company's strategic revamp.

Nike has increased its marketing and product efforts for women in recent months. The company announced a collaboration with Kim Kardashian's SKIMS for a new line of products, and aired a Super Bowl commercial highlighting prominent female athletes.

Nike shares have lost about one-quarter of their value over the past 12 months, at $73.70 as of Monday's close.

UPDATE—March 17, 2025: This article has been updated since it was first published to reflect more recent analyst estimates and share price values.

5.title: Nike Expands Its 'Mushroom Kingdom' Collection with the Vomero 5
5.snippet: Nike Sportswear recently unveiled a nature-themed Zoom Vomero 5 for kids. The pair features a 'Light Armoury Blue' color scheme and snail-reminiscent...
5.content:
Nike Sportswear is set to take over the spring and summer seasons. In addition to launching some of the brand's most iconic designs in their original colors, the lifestyle arm continues to imagine full collections rooted in playful ensembles and themes. Case in point?: A Kids' Vomero 5 inspired by the growing 'Mushroom Kingdom' collection.

Set to launch alongside the Air Force 1 Low, the newly-surfaced pair draws inspiration from nature. Its 'Light Armoury Blue/Sail/Ashen Slate/White' color scheme distances the sneaker from its performance origins, while embroidered snail-like figures on the forefoot cement its place in the aforementioned collection. Non-standard labels on the tongue are accompanied by unique lace fasteners that breathe new life into the 14-year-old design. Pull tabs at the heel also assist with easier on-and-off accessibility.

Footbeds are stamped with a thematic mushroom character, rounding out Nike Sportswear's latest easy-going offering.

Enjoy official photos of the Big Kids' Vomero 5 below. Firm release details haven't been confirmed by the brand, but pairs are expected to hit Nike.com by July for around $120.

For more sneaker news, check out House of Heatº's expansive Jordan Release Dates Calendar to stay up-to-date on styles like the Air Jordan 1 'UNC Reimagined' retro set to launch in May.

6.title: Nike’s Unreleased ‘Yankees’ Foamposite Sneakers Just Reappeared
6.snippet: A rarely seen unreleased 'Yankees' colorway of Nike's futuristic Air Foamposite One sneaker has resurfaced. Find out more.
6.content:
Nike’s futuristic Air Foamposite One sneaker has been released in colors of popular sports teams, covered in “Galaxy” prints and given metallic makeovers, yet the brand seems to always find new ways to reinvent the look of the ahead-of-its-time model. This is evident on a newly resurfaced sample colorway of the sneaker from 2018 which blends a Penny Hardaway theme with the team colors of one of Major League Baseball’s most enduring dynasties.

Recently shared by Portland-based consignment Index is a Nike Air Foamposite One “Yankees” sample. Taking its colors from the pinstripe uniform of New York’s beloved baseball team, the unreleased sneaker also draws from the model’s 2015 “Sharpie” release. That colorway featured a striped upper inspired by Hardaway’s practice of filling in the sneaker’s grooves with a black marker in order to skirt around the NBA’s uniform guidelines, which had strict regulations in the 1990s.

Watch on FN

Aside from the ’15 “Sharpie” style, Nike never revisited the striped look at retail, but this ’18 “Yankees” sample seems to indicate the brand was at least entertaining the idea.

Designed by Eric Avar and first released in 1997, the Air Foamposite One has trended on and off since its original launch. It reached peak popularity in the early 2010s with the release of styles such as the aforementioned “Galaxy” colorway and a collaboration with streetwear brand Supreme. In recent years, the sneaker has experienced yet another resurgence and has also inspired looks from other brands including Balenciaga.

The “Yankees” Air Foamposite One sample has rarely appeared on social media, and even less on the secondary market. It’s previously been shared by sample collectors @rcclientele3 and @iamdavidnyc before its latest appearance at Index. The Portland store has a size 9 in the unreleased “Midnight Navy/Wolf Grey/Sail” style listed for $3,500.

8.title: Nike Air Max Plus Phantom / Safety Orange - Jun 2025 - DM0032-019
8.snippet: The Nike Air Max Plus Phantom/Safety Orange is a contemporary take on the classic Air Max silhouette, combining style and performance with eye-catching...
8.content:
The Nike Air Max Plus Phantom/Safety Orange is a contemporary take on the classic Air Max silhouette, combining style and performance with eye-catching aesthetics. The Phantom colorway provides a clean, neutral base that allows the vibrant Safety Orange accents to pop, creating a striking visual contrast. This dynamic color scheme appeals not only to sneaker enthusiasts but also to those who prioritize fashionable, comfortable footwear. The upper construction of the shoe employs mesh and synthetic materials, ensuring breathability and durability while maintaining a lightweight feel. The iconic wavy design, characteristic of the Air Max Plus line, overlays the mesh, adding depth and texture to the overall look.

In addition to its bold exterior, the Nike Air Max Plus Phantom/Safety Orange features the innovative Tuned Air technology in its sole, offering tailored cushioning and enhanced shock absorption, perfect for everyday wear or athletic activities. The visible air units in the midsole are strategically positioned for maximum comfort and impact protection. This shoe seamlessly blends retro influences with modern design elements, paying homage to its heritage while staying relevant in today’s fashion landscape. Whether you're a long-time collector or new to the sneaker scene, the Air Max Plus Phantom/Safety Orange delivers on multiple fronts, from aesthetics and comfort to performance and versatility.

9.title: How Michelle Li styles an outfit around her sneakers
9.snippet: The stylist and writer shares how she's changing her approach to styling sneakers – starting with the new Nike Air Max Dn8.
9.content:
My goal this year was to stop overthinking my outfits – to follow my intuition for how to style something vs making it more complicated than it needs to be for the sake of standing out. Sneakers used to be an easy styling piece for me: comfortable, friendly, unassuming. But somewhere along the way, I forgot how to let them exist as their own statement piece. Sneakers are strong enough to build an outfit around, especially the new Nike Air Max Dn8, the brand’s latest iteration of the classic Air Max with bold colourways and a fluid futuristic silhouette. When it comes to styling sneakers, I now aim for cohesion instead of complications. I’ve always believed that the way you style a piece is what creates individuality, but I’ve realised that things can stand on their own and still be interesting. Just because the frills are gone doesn’t mean the personality is. Ahead, here’s how I’m styling the new Nike Air Max Dn8.

Michelle Li

Fleece² I love pairing grey and white together. I love wearing double fleece (that’s not a sweatsuit) together even more. Fleece is a texture that can quickly become too informal, but when worn in the right silhouettes, it adds just the right amount of casualness – especially to an outfit that feels too dressed up. It’s the ultimate hack for the dilemma of wanting to look like you just threw something together without trying but still wanting to look cute. Combining the silver Nike Air Max Dn8 sneakers with a gigantic fluffy white fleece bubble skirt balances this look so that it all feels intentional.

Michelle Li

Cherry red One of my favorite colours is a bright true red: it’s bold, eye-catching and looks amazing with my complexion. It’s also surprisingly easy to build fun colour combinations with. I chose to style my cherry red Nike Air Max Dn8 sneakers with a navy blue Nike track jacket, my vintage Commes des Garcons pleated silk skirt and red knee high socks. The bottom half of my outfit is bold and true-to-me, while the upper half tones it down and makes it more of a realistic, everyday look.

Michelle Li

Sliver of silver Black is a colour that has become synonymous with effortlessly chic, but it has always taken me so much effort. I really struggle with figuring out how to wear black. For me, it can overpower the outfit and make every other colour extremely contrasted. This is my best attempt at head-to-toe black, with a hint of silver thanks to my Nike Air Max Dn8 sneakers, which soften the look.

Michelle Li

Simple suede Taking notes from what I said before about keeping things simple, this is my iteration of an easy weekend outfit for meeting up with friends and running my little errands. My weekend outfits are built for comfort, so I rarely wear anything other than sneakers. These Nike Air Max Dn8 sneakers are perfect for running around the city while still feeling like my style is being reflected. Sweatpants are what I’ll automatically lean towards, but if I want to play a little bit more with my outfit, I’ll wear a pair of Nike track pants with a vintage suede jacket for a clash of textures. That’s the extent of my weekend brain’s creativity.

Michelle Li

The zip hoodie We used to fixate on how to dress up denim, and now we obsess over dressing things down and making our fancy clothing more suitable for everyday wear. Enter: the zip hoodie. It unquestionably sends the message that I’m going for relaxed and informal. I especially love this Nike terry hoodie with a fancy skirt and the Nike Air Max Dn8 that also toe the line between athletic and streetwear – it’s the perfect clash.

0.title: Nike Air Max Plus Goes Understated with "Safety Orange" Accents
0.snippet: Spring is here, and that means it's officially TN season. The Nike Air Max Plus, known for its bold, high-energy gradients, is a staple in the rotation […]
0.content:
Spring is here, and that means it’s officially TN season. The Nike Air Max Plus, known for its bold, high-energy gradients, is a staple in the rotation once the temperatures rise. But while we often see flashy colorways dominating the silhouette, Nike’s next iteration takes a more refined approach, offering a clean and understated aesthetic.

Dressed in a neutral mix of Phantom mesh and Light Orewood Brown overlays, this Air Max Plus tones things down without losing its signature appeal. Pops of Safety Orange at the midfoot Swoosh, midfoot shank, and signature Air supports provide just enough contrast to keep things interesting, while the wavy cage-like overlays maintain the model’s unmistakable DNA.

Expect the Nike Air Max Plus “Phantom/Light Orewood Brown” to release this summer.

For more from the Nike, Inc. family, check out all upcoming Air Jordan Release Dates, including the Air Jordan 4 "White Cement" on May 24th.

4.title: Migrant thieves steal $2M worth of unreleased Nike sneakers in series of train heists across California, Arizona
4.snippet: Many of the shoes were Nigel Sylvester x Air Jordan 4s, which are not available to the public until March 14 and are expected to fetch $225 retail per pair.
4.content:
Migrant thieves targeting slow-moving freight trains through remote parts of California and Arizona have run off with more than $2 million worth of not-yet-released Nike sneakers in a series of movie-like heists, officials said.

In the most recent robbery on January 13, a group of 11 suspects — 10 of whom were in the country illegally — cut an air brake hose from a BNSF freight train as it rolled through a secluded area of Arizona and stole nearly 2,000 pairs of sneakers worth some $440,000, according to a criminal complaint filed in Phoenix federal court.

Many of the shoes were Nigel Sylvester x Air Jordan 4s, which are not available to the public until March 14 and are expected to fetch $225 retail per pair, the complaint states.

Migrant thieves targeting slow-moving freight trains through remote parts of California and Arizona have run off with more than $2 million worth of not-yet-released Nike sneakers in a series of movie-like heists, officials said. Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

The robbery was one of at least 10 heists targeting BNSF trains in the Mojave Desert since last March, prompting an investigation by federal authorities, the Los Angeles Times first reported. The bandits stole Nikes in nine of the 10 incidents.

The 11 suspects in the Jan. 13 job, who were caught using tracking devices placed on some of the shoeboxes, pleaded not guilty to charges of possessing or receiving goods stolen from interstate shipment.

Ten of the defendants are Mexicans who were in the US illegally and one is a Mexican citizen who was in asylum processing, according to court records.

In 2022 a year-long investigation into burglaries of commercial railroad cargo containers resulted in 22 arrests in Los Angeles. Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

In another major heist on November 20, Sheriff’s deputies in Mohave County Arizona stopped a white van seen fleeing the area where a BNSF train came to an emergency stop near Hackberry after losing air, according to another complaint.

Roughly 180 pairs of then-unreleased Air Jordan 11 Retro Legend Blue sneakers, valued at $41,400, were found loaded in the vehicle, police said.

Two other cases BNSF freight trains were burglarized in separate incidents near Kingman and Seligman, Arizona last year resulting in the theft of $612,000 worth of Nikes and eight arrests, according to additional federal criminal complaints.

Roughly 180 pairs of then-unreleased Air Jordan 11 Retro Legend Blue sneakers, valued at $41,400, were found loaded in the vehicle, police said. Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

The thieves, sometimes tipped off by associates at warehouses, waited for the valuable merchandise to travel along rail lines parallel to Interstate 40, then boarded the lumbering freight trains when they changed tracks or opened their containers, Keith Lewis, vice president of operations at Verisk’s CargoNet and a deputy sheriff in Arizona told the LA Times.

The criminals were often aided by accomplices who followed the train cars in vehicles. Those on the train would toss them the loot when the train stopped — either scheduled or because an air hose had been slashed, according to Brynna Cooke, a Homeland Security Investigations special agent cited in affidavits filed in federal court.

Once secured, the stolen kicks are usually transported to California to be sold or put for sale online through third-party Amazon and eBay resellers, according to the LA Times.

More than 10 BNSF trains have been robbed since March, according to a federal complaint. AP

Despite railroads investing millions of dollars in security measures to protect their shipments, thefts from cargo trains cost the nation’s six largest freight railroads more than $100 million last year due to the combination of stolen goods and damaged railcars.

And the problem is only increasing as the heists are becoming better organized and more sophisticated.

There were roughly 65,000 train thefts nationwide last year — a 40% increase from the previous year, according to the Association of American Railroads trade group. Even that could be significantly understated as railroads don’t publicize all thefts, Lewis told The Times.

US Immigration and Customs Enforcement estimates that cargo thefts at various points along the supply chain from ports to trains to trucks account for between $15 billion and $35 billion in losses every year.

Thefts along any parts of the supply chain from ports to trains to trucks account for $15 billion and $35 billion in the US every year, according to ICE estimates.

BNSF has told its employees not to engage with thieves but just to report when an incident occurs.

With Post wires

NEW YORK — Coeur d’Alene High runners Mitchell Rietze, Max Cervi-Skinner, Wyatt Carr and Zack Cervi-Skinner, representing the North Idaho Distance Project, finished second in the boys 4x1 mile championship race at the Nike Indoor National meet on Saturday at the Nike Track and Field Center.

The team finished in 17 minutes, 10.47 seconds to earn All-American honors.

The meet concludes today.

at Lewiston mixer

LEWISTON — Senior Madie Thomas hit for the cycle, including an inside-the-park homer in the fourth inning, as St. Maries beat Kendrick 22-13 in their first game Saturday at the Lewiston mixer.

St. Maries fell 8-7 to the Lakeland junior varsity in its second game of the day.

Thomas finished 5 for 5 with four RBIs and four runs scored in the Kendrick game for St. Maries. Her inside-the-park shot was a two-run homer that increased the Lumberjacks’ lead to 15-12. Thomas also hit a two-run triple later in the nine-run inning.

Danika Sloper was 3 for 3 with five RBIs and two runs scored for St. Maries, which went 2-2 at the season-opening weekend event.

Addy Stewart doubled twice and scored four runs for the Lumberjacks.

“From the start of yesterday to the fourth game today, those girls improved 100 percent; it was a great way to start the season,” St. Maries coach Lane Watkins said. “We started hitting the ball; it was awesome.”

Against the Lakeland JV, Addilyn Turner drove in four runs, three on a sixth inning homer as the Lumberjacks nearly erased a 7-0 deficit.

Reagan Masters struck out 12 for the Hawks JV, and also went 2 for 5 with a triple and four RBIs.

St. Maries travels to Kellogg on Friday to begin Central Idaho League play.

7.title: Nike Delivers a Suede-Laden Air Force 1 Low “Club Gold”
7.snippet: Nike's Air Force 1 remains the brand's defining lifestyle sneaker, holding strong as a staple silhouette since its resurgence in the early 2000s. Over […]
7.content:
Nike’s Air Force 1 remains the brand’s defining lifestyle sneaker, holding strong as a staple silhouette since its resurgence in the early 2000s. Over the years, it has seen waves of popularity, but in today’s market—where hype cycles shift quickly—the model finds itself in a quieter moment. That’s good news for sneakerheads looking to grab understated, high-quality pairs without the usual frenzy, and the new Nike Air Force 1 Low “Club Gold” fits that bill perfectly.

Arriving as a women’s-exclusive release, this iteration of the AF1 comes dressed in rich two-tone tan suede, offering a refined, everyday look. The upper and overlays shift subtly in shade, with the tongue and heel delivering a slight contrast in smooth tan leather—the only real deviation from the monochromatic mix. As expected, a crisp white sole unit sits underfoot, keeping things classic and versatile.

8.title: UM Honorary doctorates go to ‘MeatEater’ hunter, former Nike exec
8.snippet: MISSOULA – Two of the University of Montana's most successful alumni, Steven Rinella and Eric Sprunk, will receive honorary doctorates from their alma mater...
8.content:
MISSOULA – Two of the University of Montana’s most successful alumni, Steven Rinella and Eric Sprunk, will receive honorary doctorates from their alma mater during UM Spring Commencement ceremonies on Saturday, May 10.

Rinella is the New York Times-bestselling author of more than 10 books, the star of the Netflix television series “MeatEater” and the host of “The MeatEater Podcast.” Hailing from Twin Lake, Michigan, Rinella has become an influential thought leader for connecting modern society with nature. UM will present him with an Honorary Doctorate of Forestry and Conservation.

A homegrown Missoula native, Sprunk worked at Nike Inc. for 27 years, rising to the rank of chief operating officer as he helped transform and grow one of the world’s most recognizable and successful brands. UM will present him with an Honorary Doctorate of Business.

These two outstanding alumni will serve as this year’s UM Spring Commencement speakers.

Steven Rinella

Rinella was taught to hunt and fish at an early age by his father. He earned a master’s degree in creative nonfiction from UM in 2000, and he published his first book, “The Scavenger’s Guide to Haute Cuisine” in 2006. Other books followed, including “MeatEater: Adventures from the Life of an American Hunter” in 2013. Among his New York Times bestsellers are 2024’s “The MeatEater Outdoor Cookbook.”

His hit hunting and fishing program, “MeatEater,” ran for six seasons on the Sportsman Channel before moving to Netflix in 2018.

“Rinella uses a trademark blend of storytelling, scholarly insight and thoughtful dialogue to enrich our national conversation around wildlife, landscape conservation and food systems,” said Randall Williams, who earned a history doctorate from UM in 2015 and now works as a senior editor for MeatEater Inc. “He approaches political and social topics with a nuance and humility, acknowledging the validity of multiple viewpoints without abandoning his own personal convictions and rigorous skepticism.”

Williams said Rinella uses his multimedia platforms to bring together people who don’t always get along – everyone from hunters, vegetarians and ranchers to environmentalists and researchers. “Rinella has the rare ability to translate academic research and complex ideas for a general audience without sacrificing intellectual depth or nuance,” he said.

Chad Bishop, who directs UM’s Wildlife Biology Program, said Rinella promotes a thoughtful consideration of hunting ethics, which is necessary to sustain support for hunting in a society increasingly composed of non-hunters.

“I think Steven Rinella’s career success represents the power of a UM education,” Bishop said. “He was formally educated within our renowned creative writing program and went on to have a significant, positive impact on wildlife conservation.”

Ben Long, a Kalispell author and conservationist, said Rinella has “raised the bar” for intelligent outdoors content while becoming the most recognized face of the hunting and angling community.

“Rinella has been called a ‘celebrity hunter,’” Long said. “His efforts have helped secure millions of dollars annually for habitat restoration, wildlife research and public land access.”

Eric Sprunk

Sprunk said playing basketball for Hellgate High School in Missoula helped develop the discipline and passion for athletics that propelled his professional business career. In 1987 he earned an accounting degree from the UM College of Business. He then worked seven years for Price Waterhouse in both Portland and Seattle, receiving early promotions twice.

One of the accounts he worked on was Nike, and soon officials there wooed him to “just do it” and bring his Montana work ethic and infectious positivity to their company. He joined Nike in 1993, and quickly rose through the ranks, serving in various executive positions over three decades.

Sprunk spent half of his career as the executive vice president and general manager of global product and merchandising. He helped shape Nike’s product portfolio and lead the company’s global strategy, setting new standards for product innovation, design and merchandising. When he retired after seven years as chief operating officer in 2020, he had demonstrated the unique ability to drive large-scale transformation within a complex, diverse, global business environment while consistently delivering shareholder value and business outcomes.

And there were perks. Sprunk was able to meet the world’s best athletes and attend the biggest sporting events across the globe. At the same time, his loyalty to Griz Nation provided a pathway for UM grads who wanted to work at Nike.

“Eric is known not only for his business acumen but also for fostering trust and loyalty among employees, customers and partners – qualities that set him apart in the global business landscape,” said Suzanne Tillman, the UM business college dean whose position Sprunk helped endow. “To this day, Eric credits much of his success to the lessons he learned (at UM) and the relationships he built along the way.”

“The greatest compliment I can give Eric is how he treats people,” UM Athletic Director Kent Haslam said. “He is never too busy, never too important … to focus on someone else and make them feel like the most important thing in his life at the moment.

“If you want to show students what you can do with a degree from UM, Eric Sprunk would be display No. 1.”

Eric Sprunk

9.title: NIKE, Inc. (NYSE:NKE) Shares Sold by Commonwealth Equity Services LLC
9.snippet: Commonwealth Equity Services LLC reduced its position in NIKE, Inc. (NYSE:NKE - Free Report) by 4.7% in the 4th quarter, according to the company in its...
9.content:
Commonwealth Equity Services LLC reduced its position in NIKE, Inc. (NYSE:NKE - Free Report) by 4.7% in the 4th quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor owned 433,339 shares of the footwear maker's stock after selling 21,380 shares during the quarter. Commonwealth Equity Services LLC's holdings in NIKE were worth $32,791,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.

Get NIKE alerts: Sign Up

Several other institutional investors also recently bought and sold shares of NKE. Harbour Investments Inc. boosted its stake in shares of NIKE by 6.6% in the 3rd quarter. Harbour Investments Inc. now owns 5,749 shares of the footwear maker's stock valued at $508,000 after buying an additional 357 shares during the period. Curi RMB Capital LLC boosted its stake in shares of NIKE by 9.6% in the 3rd quarter. Curi RMB Capital LLC now owns 6,765 shares of the footwear maker's stock valued at $598,000 after buying an additional 591 shares during the period. OneDigital Investment Advisors LLC boosted its stake in shares of NIKE by 7.8% in the 3rd quarter. OneDigital Investment Advisors LLC now owns 16,792 shares of the footwear maker's stock valued at $1,484,000 after buying an additional 1,217 shares during the period. CIBC Asset Management Inc boosted its stake in shares of NIKE by 7.1% in the 3rd quarter. CIBC Asset Management Inc now owns 185,320 shares of the footwear maker's stock valued at $16,382,000 after buying an additional 12,351 shares during the period. Finally, Sheaff Brock Investment Advisors LLC lifted its stake in NIKE by 5.8% during the third quarter. Sheaff Brock Investment Advisors LLC now owns 11,852 shares of the footwear maker's stock worth $1,048,000 after purchasing an additional 646 shares during the last quarter. 64.25% of the stock is owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.

NIKE Trading Down 1.3 %

Shares of NKE stock opened at $71.72 on Friday. NIKE, Inc. has a fifty-two week low of $68.62 and a fifty-two week high of $101.92. The stock has a market cap of $106.08 billion, a P/E ratio of 22.14, a P/E/G ratio of 2.52 and a beta of 1.02. The business has a fifty day simple moving average of $74.68 and a 200-day simple moving average of $77.81. The company has a quick ratio of 1.51, a current ratio of 2.22 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57.

NIKE (NYSE:NKE - Get Free Report) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Thursday, December 19th. The footwear maker reported $0.78 earnings per share for the quarter, beating analysts' consensus estimates of $0.63 by $0.15. NIKE had a return on equity of 36.99% and a net margin of 9.98%. The business had revenue of $12.35 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $12.11 billion. During the same quarter last year, the business posted $1.03 earnings per share. The business's revenue for the quarter was down 7.7% on a year-over-year basis. On average, analysts forecast that NIKE, Inc. will post 2.05 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.

NIKE Announces Dividend

The business also recently disclosed a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Tuesday, April 1st. Investors of record on Monday, March 3rd will be paid a dividend of $0.40 per share. This represents a $1.60 dividend on an annualized basis and a dividend yield of 2.23%. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Monday, March 3rd. NIKE's payout ratio is currently 49.38%.

Insider Activity at NIKE

In related news, Director John W. Rogers, Jr. acquired 2,500 shares of the firm's stock in a transaction that occurred on Friday, December 27th. The shares were acquired at an average price of $76.65 per share, with a total value of $191,625.00. Following the completion of the purchase, the director now directly owns 34,403 shares in the company, valued at approximately $2,636,989.95. The trade was a 7.84 % increase in their ownership of the stock. The purchase was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available through this hyperlink. Also, Chairman Mark G. Parker sold 169,732 shares of the firm's stock in a transaction dated Friday, February 14th. The stock was sold at an average price of $72.83, for a total value of $12,361,581.56. Following the completion of the sale, the chairman now directly owns 896,632 shares in the company, valued at approximately $65,301,708.56. The trade was a 15.92 % decrease in their ownership of the stock. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. Corporate insiders own 1.10% of the company's stock.

Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades

Several equities research analysts recently weighed in on the company. Bank of America decreased their target price on NIKE from $95.00 to $90.00 and set a "buy" rating for the company in a research note on Friday, December 20th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. decreased their target price on NIKE from $77.00 to $73.00 and set a "neutral" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, December 2nd. Evercore ISI decreased their target price on NIKE from $105.00 to $97.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, December 16th. Wells Fargo & Company reduced their price objective on NIKE from $95.00 to $92.00 and set an "overweight" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, December 16th. Finally, TD Cowen reduced their price objective on NIKE from $78.00 to $73.00 and set a "hold" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, November 18th. Fourteen analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, sixteen have assigned a buy rating and two have given a strong buy rating to the company. According to data from MarketBeat, NIKE has an average rating of "Moderate Buy" and a consensus price target of $89.69.

Get Our Latest Stock Analysis on NKE

NIKE Profile

NIKE, Inc, together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, markets, and sells athletic footwear, apparel, equipment, accessories, and services worldwide. The company provides athletic and casual footwear, apparel, and accessories under the Jumpman trademark; and casual sneakers, apparel, and accessories under the Converse, Chuck Taylor, All Star, One Star, Star Chevron, and Jack Purcell trademarks.

1.title: Warren Buffett's railroad is dealing with a surge in train robberies. Yes, train robberies.
1.snippet: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway owns the BNSF Railway. It's suffered a surge in thefts of items such as Nike sneakers and Turtle Beach headsets.
1.content:
Warren Buffett's railroad has been hit by thieves who've looted more than $4 million of merchandise.

They've stolen Nike sneakers, Turtle Beach gaming headsets, and Squishmallows, court filings show.

Organized crime groups board BNSF trains, break open locked containers, and force emergency stops.

Warren Buffett's railroad company is being targeted by thieves who've made off with sneakers, gaming headsets, and other merchandise worth more than $4 million in the past two years, federal authorities say.

Burlington Northern Santa Fe, owned by Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway conglomerate, has been hit repeatedly by gangs with apparent links to the Sinaloa Cartel, the Mexican organized-crime group formerly led by drug lord Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán.

The heists primarily occur in the southwestern US and have surged since 2023, according to multiple complaints filed in Phoenix federal court. The crime spree was first reported by the Los Angeles Times.

The train robbers identify high-security containers on eastbound BNSF trains from California's Interstate 40. They board and use saws, bolt-cutters, and other tools to break into the boxes and gain access to expensive footwear, tools, and electronics.

Next, they cut the train's braking system air hose to force the driver to make an emergency stop. Then, they pull the products off the train and hide them nearby for their colleagues to load into box trucks at a later point. The merch is then hauled off to be sold or fenced to resellers, court filings show.

On January 13, a BNSF police officer spotted boxes containing more than 1,000 pairs of Nike shoes next to the rail tracks and worked with authorities to place trackers in four of them. Officials later recovered 150 cases of Nigel Sylvester x Air Jordan 4 "Brick by Brick" worth an estimated $202,500 in a nearby van and also stopped a U-Haul containing shoes worth tens of thousands of dollars more. The shoe model was scheduled for release on March 14.

In April 2024, police recovered nearly 1,200 pairs of Nike shoes worth about $226,000. Two months later, they took down an alleged gang leader and reclaimed $3 million worth of merchandise believed to have been taken from BNSF trains. The items were found in storage units and residential homes and included 74 cases of Nike shoes and 108 packs of Nike socks.

In July 2023, authorities recovered 904 boxes of Turtle Beach Stealth Pro headsets, worth almost $600,000, which had been loaded into a landscaping truck and stashed in a nearby Motel 6.

Filings show that in other seizures, officials reclaimed about $48,000 worth of Nike's "Dunk Low Midnight Navy" shoes and six boxes of "Disney NBC Jack Squish" — likely a reference to "The Nightmare Before Christmas" character Jack Skellington as a Squishmallow.

Authorities have arrested several people in connection with the BNSF thefts, including 11 accused of involvement in the January heist and one man they believe to be a ringleader, but the thefts have continued.

"BNSF has robust security protocols, and our police department is focused on preventing these incidents on our network," a company spokesperson told Business Insider. "We are working with federal, state, local, and tribal police departments to coordinate our approach to disrupting criminal activity and arresting offenders."

"It's essential that the entire criminal justice system, including policymakers, district attorneys, and judges, focus on this crime trend and help to ensure these criminals are held responsible and prosecuted," the spokesperson said. "These are not victimless crimes, particularly when many of these packages include much-needed medicine, food, and critical supplies necessary for everyday life."

Cargo thefts cost the biggest railroads more than $100 million last year, according to the Association of American Railroads. There were more than 65,000 thefts in 2024, about 40% more than in 2023, the industry group said.

Buffett, one of the world's wealthiest people worth more than $150 billion, oversaw Berkshire's acquisition of BNSF in 2010. The company's railroad system spans 28 states, generating nearly $24 billion in revenue and about $5 billion in net income last year.

Welcome back to another day of sneaker drops. Today, we have a wide spectrum of shoe brands with Nike, New Balance, PUMA, and Air Jordan.

1.title: Official Images Of The Nike A’One “Pink Aura”
1.snippet: A'Ja Wilson has announced a "Pre-Heat" tour ahead of the release of her inaugural signature Nike shoe. Tap for full details.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The groundwork is in place for the launch of A’ja Wilson’s debut signature basketball model with Nike; a long-awaited and well-deserved sneaker bestowed on one of the best women hoopers of all time. The Nike A’One will release widely in “Pink Aura” on May 8th, but not before A’ja and co. stoke anticipation with a pre-launch marketing tour.

Ahead of the official Nike A’One debut, the Beaverton brand is ramping up energy around the inaugural A’ja Wilson shoe with a “Pre-Heat” event series beginning in March.

As revealed by A’ja on Instagram, Nike is hosting three pre-release activations. The first takes place at Foot Locker in Columbia, South Carolina, which is A’ja Wilson’s hometown, on March 16th. The second stop is at DICK’S in Las Vegas on March 22nd, and the third takes place at Nike Tampa on April 3rd.

Based on the social media teaser, the “Pink Aura” Nike A’One is expected to pre-release at all three occasions. Soft shades of pink appear around the center of the shoe, gradually getting more vibrant with each subsequent layer. Script “A’ja” text appears on the heel, and a hidden message reading “As a matter of fact, the best is yet to come” appears on the outsole. As for the tech, the key Nike A’One quality is Cushlon ST2 foam.

The “Pink Aura” Nike A’One releases widely on May 8th in adult and grade school sizing, retailing for $110 and $90, respectively. As mentioned, if you’re local to Columbia, SC, Vegas, or Tampa, you’ll have a chance to cop early at Nike’s various activations. Our Sneaker Release Dates page will be kept current with all Nike A’One drop dates as model rolls out throughout 2025.

3.title: Bode to Release Sophomore Nike Astrograbber Collection in March 2025
3.snippet: Bode to Release Sophomore Nike Astrograbber Collection in March 2025 ... Nike and Bode Rec. are teaming up once again in 2025 to deliver a second collaborative...
3.content:
Nike and Bode Rec. are teaming up once again in 2025 to deliver a second collaborative collection, following the success of their debut partnership. This latest release brings two new colorways of the Nike Astrograbber —a revival of one of Nike’s earliest turf shoes—alongside an apparel capsule that continues Emily Bode Aujla’s signature approach to blending sport heritage with contemporary fashion.

At the heart of this campaign is Nike athlete Ja’Marr Chase, who sports both the Black/Tan and Chlorophyll/Black colorways of the Astrograbber, cementing the once-gridiron-exclusive silhouette as a modern-day sportswear staple. The campaign, shot by Eduardo Cerruti and Stephanie Draime in New Orleans, showcases the Astrograbber’s unique fusion of vintage influence and contemporary styling, reinforcing its status as a timeless, everyday sneaker.

First released in 1974 following the success of the Waffle Trainer, the Astrograbber was originally designed for football training before evolving into a broader symbol of Nike’s innovative spirit. For this latest iteration, Bode Rec. elevates the model with premium materials and handcrafted details. The Black version features a woven textile upper that delivers a refined, versatile aesthetic, while the Chlorophyll green leather edition draws inspiration from a pair of Bill Bowerman’s homemade, hand-dyed waffle joggers, which Bode Aujla discovered while visiting the Department of Nike Archives. Both pairs are adorned with metallic gold shoelace charms and arrive in special custom packaging that highlights the collaboration.

“Bode Rec. is a line devoted to the history and evolution of athletic apparel, with a personal tie to football inspired by the time my dad spent playing the sport in high school and college,” says Bode Aujla. “Working with Nike to reimagine the Astrograbber means partnering with such a historic American brand, which really embodies the inspiration behind Bode Rec.”

Nike and Bode Rec. have confirmed that both colorways will release on March 14th via Bode.com, Bode retail stores in Los Angeles and New York City, and a newly opened Bode boutique in Paris. The Black colorway will then see a wider release on March 21st through SNKRS and select Nike and Bode Rec. retail partners. Stay tuned for further updates.

Stay tuned to our dedicated Nike Release Dates Calendar for updates as information becomes available.

4.title: Giannis Antetokounmpo Teases His Nike Giannis Freak 7
4.snippet: Giannis Antetokounmpo Teases His Nike Giannis Freak 7: Offering an in-hand preview of his next signature shoe.
4.content:
The 2024-25 NBA MVP Race may be centered around Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Nikola Jokić, but Giannis Antetokounmpo remains one of the world’s best players. The Milwaukee Bucks superstar is averaging over 30 points per game and has kept his team in the mix for home-court advantage in next month’s playoffs. After leading his team to a win over the Los Angeles Lakers, Antetokounmpo took to Instagram to preview his next signature shoe with Nike.

Presumably named the Nike Giannis Freak 7, the new sneaker was highlighted in three different colorways. Taking on a new shape that differs greatly from the line’s predecessors, the Giannis Freak 7 begins with a wavy texture at its midsole and carries this pattern across a portion of each side of the upper. He’s opted to bring back reversed Swooshes, prominently placing them on each side of the sneaker. A two-piece outsole features an “Antetokounmpo” callout towards the lateral while his “GA” logo hits the tongue. Pictured first is a black and orange rendition that carries pink Swooshes. Another look features an all-yellow composition while a mock-up of the third “Wolf in Sheep’s Clothing” seems to pair gray with “Volt” accents.

At the time of writing, neither Giannis Antetokounmpo nor Nike Basketball have indicated when the Nike Giannis Freak 7 will be making its retail debut. Based on the August release date of its predecessor, it will likely be several more months until this new model is available to the public. Based on the deck slide shown off in Antetokounmpo’s Instagram post embedded below, it looks like it will be arriving at a $110 USD starting price via Nike SNKRS and select retailers.

5.title: Nike to Drop New Air Jordan 9 Retro ‘Cool Grey’ Sneakers
5.snippet: The new Nike Air Jordan 9 Retro "Cool Grey" sneakers, which come in unisex sizes, drop on Mar.
5.content:
All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes.

In 1993, Michael Jordan retired from the NBA for the first time. He traded in the basketball court for the baseball diamond. Nike rereleased the Air Jordan 9 shoes to pay tribute to Jordan’s baseball era.

Explore Explore Billboard See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news

Priced at $210, the Nike Air Jordan 9 Retro “Cool Grey” sneakers are designed for playing competitive sports, although he never won them during a pro basketball game because he abruptly retired before the start of the NBA season. The signature shoes are also made for everyday casual use with a classic silhouette.

The Nike Air Jordan 9 Retro “Cool Grey” drop on Saturday (Mar. 14) at 10 a.m. ET/7 a.m. PT at nike.com.

The uppers of the sneakers are made from genuine leather for structure and durability, while they even have a strip of premium grey leather running around their toe caps to round out the standout style of the signature shoes.

Additionally, the sneakers feature the iconic “Jumpman” logo on the side of each midsole with MJ’s No. 23 placed on the back of the heel counters. They come in a medium grey, white and cool grey colorway.

Meanwhile, if you want more from Nike, the sneaker makers also dropped the Nike Air Jordan 1 Retro “Black Toe” sneakers for the 40th anniversary of the iconic shoes.

The Nike Air Jordan 9 Retro “Cool Grey” sneakers are come in men’s and women’s sizes for $210, while the sports apparel company has the sneakers in big kids’ sizes for $160 at nike.com. Learn more about Nike and Air Jordan sneakers here.

6.content:
SweetBabeeJay / iStock.com

He’s considered the greatest NBA player of all time, but Michael Jordan is also a savvy businessman with a massive shoe empire.

Consider This: 6 Popular Collectibles That Have Skyrocketed in Value

Read Next: These 10 Used Cars Will Last Longer Than an Average New Vehicle

The basketball legend entered a partnership with Nike at the beginning of his career, which turned him into a billionaire. Many years later in retirement, he still has an estimated net worth of $3.5 billion in small part thanks to some Air Jordan sneakers.

In 1984, Jordan debuted the sneakers that would eventually grow to become a multi-billion-dollar brand. First marketed by Nike as the “Air Jordan 1” in 1985, the brand has now evolved into an empire nearly four decades old.

Interestingly, Jordan wasn’t actually interested in a partnership with Nike at first, according to the Los Angeles Times. He only took the initial meeting at the urging of his mother and ended up with an incredible 25% royalty on the brand.

Wondering what are the most expensive Air Jordans? Here’s a look at the ten pairs that top the list of Jordan shoes and coveted sneakers.

2005 Nike Air Jordan IV Retro Eminem ‘Encore’ With Marshall Mathers Signed Card

Estimated value: $28,000 to $35,000

Rapper Eminem joined forces with Nike in 2005 to create a special blue, red and black version of the Air Jordan IV, in honor of his “Encore” album. The original release was rumored to contain only 50 pairs, which were given to friends and family, according to Sotheby’s, which sold this pair at auction in 2021.

1995 Air Jordan 11 “Concord” Player Exclusive, Game-Worn Signed Sneakers

Estimated value: $50,000 to $65,000

These size 13 mid-top sneakers were sold with the original laces, Upper Deck Authentication on the signatures and a Chicago Bulls Letter of Authenticity. They were auctioned by Christie’s in 2020.

Find Out: How To Become Rich: 9 Fastest Ways, According To Experts

1985 Air Jordan 1 TYPS Player Exclusive Signed Sneaker

Estimated value: $55,000 to $70,000

Sold by Christie’s in 2020, these high-top, black and red Air Jordan sneakers are unworn. The original laces were intact, and they came with a JSA letter of authenticity. In standard Jordan style, the left shoe is a size 13 and the right shoe is a size 13.5.

1997 Air Jordan 12 ‘Flu Game’

Estimated value: $104,765

No true Jordan fan could forget Game 5 of the 1997 NBA Finals, where he scored 38 points for the Chicago Bulls, despite displaying flu-like symptoms. In 2013, this pair of sneakers broke the previous record for game-worn, Michael Jordan sneakers, which was $31,070, according to Sole Collector.

9.title: Nike’s business plan was a ‘ticking timebomb,’ shareholder lawsuit says
9.snippet: The lawsuit cites testimony from 19 former Nike employees and claims the company's executives hid problems from investors.
9.content:
In the fall of 2023, one of Nike’s top executives stood in front of the company’s roughly 300 vice presidents and said Nike’s business plan was a “failure.”

“We have to acknowledge that,” said Craig Williams, Nike’s president of global geographies and marketplace, according to a 292-page court filing made last month in an ongoing federal lawsuit.

0.title: Green Wave Extend Apparel Partnership with Nike and BSN SPORTS
0.snippet: Tulane Athletics has agreed to a new multi-year partnership with Nike and BSN SPORTS. Nike, a global leader in athletic apparel, footwear and equipment,...
0.content: – Tulane Athletics has agreed to a new multi-year partnership with Nike and BSN SPORTS. Nike, a global leader in athletic apparel, footwear and equipment, will continue to exclusively outfit all 17 Green Wave programs."We are excited to extend our partnership with Nike and BSN SPORTS," said, Ben Weiner Director of Athletics Chair. "Nike is the preeminent brand in college sports and a longtime partner of the Green Wave. We look forward to working with the athletic apparel industry leader, along with BSN SPORTS, who are a premier service provider for universities and colleges across the country."The department-wide partnership designates BSN SPORTS, the industry leader for team sports solutions and a division of Varsity Brands, as the official supplier of Tulane Athletics uniforms, apparel, footwear, equipment and accessories. The Green Wave will wear Nike sideline gear for all games, practices and official team events.Todd Northrop, Vice President, BSN SPORTS Collegiate Select Division said, "We are thrilled to embark on this new partnership between Tulane Athletics, BSN SPORTS, and Nike. Our team is ready to provide Green Wave coaches and student-athletes with elite service, expertise and industry leading access to sports equipment and premier apparel. BSN SPORTS is ready to support Tulane in maintaining their success as a leader in the American Athletic Conference and fuel the continued growth of their "Nola Built" legacy."Fans can continue to purchase officially licensed Tulane Nike apparel at all major Tulane merchandise outlets.Tulane University is located in the city of New Orleans. It is a city built on tradition and resiliency. The lessons Green Wave student-athletes have learned through their connection with this university and city have BUILT doctors, lawyers, business leaders, conference champions, all-conference players, All-Americans, professional athletes and NCAA tournament teams. The city of New Orleans has shaped us into who we are today. We are One City. We are Tulane. We are NOLA BUILT. Check out our story.Farmers Branch-based BSN SPORTS is a leading marketer, manufacturer and distributor of sporting goods apparel and equipment. A division of Varsity Brands, BSN SPORTS markets and distributes its products to over 150,000 institutional and team sports customers in colleges and universities, middle and high schools, and recreational programs throughout the United States via catalog, e-commerce, and direct sales. Focused on providing game-changing solutions through local partnerships, multi-brand selection and one-stop shopping for equipment and uniforms, BSN SPORTS' more than 3,000 employees have been helping elevate participation in team sports since 1972. For more information about BSN SPORTS please visit https://www.bsnsports.com/

3.title: Nike’s Super Bowl Commercial Was All About Celebrating Women Athletes
3.snippet: The ad, which aired right before Kendrick Lamar's halftime show, featured a mesmerizing cast of some of the most iconic women in sports right now.
3.content:
Nike Women

Was anyone else absolutely Fired! Up! watching this year’s Super Bowl? Not because the Philadelphia Eagles finally got their win over the Kansas City Chiefs after losing to them in the Super Bowl two years ago, but because of Nike’s brand-new “So Win” commercial.

The ad, which aired right before Kendrick Lamar’s halftime show, featured a mesmerizing cast of some of the most iconic women in sports right now, including A’ja Wilson, Caitlin Clark, JuJu Watkins, Jordan Chiles, Sabrina Ionescu, Sha’Carri Richardson, Alexia Putellas, Aryna Sabalenka, and Sophia Smith Wilson.

In the commercial, clips of the women dominating in their respective sports were intermixed with gorgeous in-studio cameos, all while Grammy winner Doechii does the voiceover narration. In the “So Win” message, which Nike calls its new anthem, per a statement, Doechii gets into some of the many limitations that are put on female athletes, from their behavior being policed to how they look. By the end of the video though, those tired tropes and double standards are subverted. Watch below to witness the ad in all its glory and prepare for a pump-up like no other:

Given the enormous increase in viewership and investment across women’s sports, the timing of this ad is no surprise. “Women’s sports isn’t the future—it’s right now," says Sabrina Ionescu in the statement. “We’re seeing it in packed arenas, in TV ratings, in the way people are showing up for the game like never before. Commanding attention isn’t about being the loudest in the room. It’s about making sure that when you step up, everyone takes notice.”

But this isn’t a trend for Nike. The 60-second ad was Nike’s first Super Bowl commercial since 1998, so it’s a really big deal that the iconic brand chose to end its nearly 30-year Super Bowl hiatus highlighting women in sports, especially during an enormous cultural event that centers men.

So if you re like me and absolutely need to put the words from the “So Win” anthem on your wall to include in your morning affirmations, the full transcript is below:

“You can’t be demanding. You can’t be relentless. You can’t put yourself first. So, put yourself first. You can’t be confident. So be confident. You can’t challenge, so challenge. You can’t dominate, so dominate. You can’t flex, so flex. You can’t fill a stadium, so fill that stadium. You can’t be emotional, so be emotional. You can’t take credit. You can’t speak up. You can’t be so ambitious. Break records. You can’t have any fun. You can’t make demands. You can’t be proud. You can’t keep score. You can’t stand out. Whatever you do, you can’t win. So win.”

But the best part about this ad? The message goes well beyond sports. “Winning isn’t just about medals,” says Jordan Chiles in the Nike statement. “It’s about overcoming, about proving to yourself that you’re capable of more than you ever imagined. You put in the work, you stay ready, and when the moment comes, you own it.”

5.title: The Women's Nike V5 RNR 'Psychic Blue' Releases Soon
5.snippet: The retro Nike V5 RNR is set to launch in a 'Psychic Blue' and silver colorway throughout Spring 2025. The women's sneaker is priced at a budget-friendly...
5.content:
Nike, Inc.'s retro efforts span more than 50 years. And while widely celebrated, the Oregon-based company also commits itself on producing brand-new product inspired by its expansive archive. Case in point?: The V5 RNR for women.

Rooted in Nike Running's performance footwear of the early 2000s, the silhouette delivers heritage and a trendy aesthetic for modern audiences. The breathable, lightweight mesh upper sets the stage for a plethora of synthetic overlays, which opt for a refreshing 'Psychic Blue' color on the latest pair to surface. Reflective accents throughout the top-half harken back to beloved running franchises from the Swoosh—which now includes the marquee Pegasus Premium.

Underfoot, the tooling solution falls in line with the design principles of yesteryear. No ZoomX, ReactX, or Cushlon foam found in top-of-the-line products appears on the lifestyle shoe, but the EVA foam provided delivers a reliable ride. A mid-foot shank indulges in the titular blue tone while delivering stability to every stop. Lastly, the rubber tread features recycled materials as denoted by its speckled finish.

Enjoy official photos of the Women's 'Psychic Blue' V5 RNR below. Pairs are currently scheduled to beginning rolling out via Nike.com on Monday, March 31, for a budget-friendly $90.

For more from the Swoosh empire, check out the Jordan Release Dates Calendar, our comprehensive guide for all things from Team Jumpman. And if you're a bigger fan of retro runners than of basketball shoes, check out the 'Pink Foam' Air Max 95 Big Bubble.

0.title: Nike Continues Support of Young Athletes with USA Gymnastics Partnership and New Leotard Collection
0.snippet: Nike is introducing its first leotard collection, designed to support girls as they build their earliest foundations in movement.
0.content:
Nike is introducing its first leotard collection, inspiring the next generation of gymnasts to perform their best both on and off the mat.

The leotards were designed to support girls as they build their earliest foundations in movement, reflecting both Nike’s commitment to expanding sport for the next generation and the brand’s five-decade role as the greatest champion for women and girls in sport.

“I feel that Nike is always thinking of ways to support girls and inspire the next generation in sports," says Skye Blakely, Nike and USA Gymnastics (USAG) National Team athlete. "I can now proudly walk in my career representing Nike on my chest as a USAG National Team member, inspiring other young girls to chase their dreams.”



Nike's leotard collection includes three styles that will be available at retail for the first time.

The halter neck leotard is designed for gymnasts looking to add a dash of flair to their routine without compromising mobility. Offered in lavender and navy, the sleek halter top features a blue-patterned Swoosh; clasp-neck closure; and two thin, open-back straps.

A soft tank leotard features extra Swooshes on its black elastic straps, serving as a not-so-subtle reminder of gymnasts’ strength and power. Meanwhile, a go-to training leotard features a Swoosh at center chest and a higher neckline cut in a silhouette designed for everyday performance and comfort.

Each piece, offered in select kids’ and women’s sizing, has been created to complement Nike’s full suite of training and sportswear apparel, which gymnasts have long embraced for workouts and everyday wear.

The leotards are the first training apparel born from a five-year partnership between Nike and USAG, which began in 2023 and will provide expanded opportunities for all kids to experience the thrill of movement and the confidence it builds, from their first forward roll to their first back handspring and beyond.

With their support extending throughout all USAG disciplines — acrobatic, artistic, gymnastics for all, parkour, rhythmic, trampoline and tumbling — the partners further aim to uplift elite gymnasts on their journeys to the world’s greatest stages, in turn inspiring the next generation of athletes to experience gymnastics and joy-filled movement. (About half of all U.S. gymnasts are between the ages of 6 and 12.)

As part of the partnership, the Swoosh also will appear this year on National Team leotards and training apparel at key international and national events.

The Nike leotard collection is now available at nike.com, on the Nike App, and at select online retailers.

1.title: First Look At The Nike Air Max 95 “Pink Foam” Featuring The Big Bubble
1.snippet: First look images of this year's Nike Air Max 95 "Pink Foam" have surfaced via Size?. Tap to read our full breakdown.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Using this year’s Air Max 95 “Neon” retro as the blueprint, Nike is celebrating the model’s 30th anniversary by giving other memorable colorways the same big bubble treatment. We spilled ink on the return of the “Pink Foams” earlier this year, and now a first look confirms that the shoe is in fact coming back with OG-inspired tooling.

The “Pink Foam” Air Max 95 originally released in 2020 and was famously flaunted by Kim Kardashian on Instagram, which caused resale prices to skyrocket in the wake of a fairly mellow drop. The sneaker plays off the OG “Neon” colorway by swatching in “Pink Foam” as the accent hue, appearing notably on the eyelets, outsole, Swoosh logos, and Air units. Grey suede sidewalls and a black midsole come in as familiar makeup.

Unveiled by UK retailer Size? in the embedded video above, the 2025 retro dials is back to 1995 with an OG-inspired big bubble Air unit. While not quite on par with original Air Max 95s, the Air units are noticeably larger than those of the “modern” version used in 2020. Moreover, just like the upcoming “Neon” retro, Nike adds a seam to the center of all the bubbles.

This is one of several big bubble Air Max 95s landing in 2025, joined of course by the “Neon” retro alongside an emerging lineup that includes “Cool Grey” and black styles. A Ma Maniére and Corteiz are releasing new Air Max 95 collaborations this year, but neither have received the same big bubble treatment.

A concrete release date for the “Pink Foam” Air Max 95 hasn’t been announced yet, but we’re still expecting an April 2025 arrival. See detailed images via Size? below and visit our Sneaker Release Dates page to browse other upcoming Air Max shoes.

3.title: The Nike Book 1 CHBL Releases Exclusively in China
3.snippet: Devin Booker's Nike Book 1 gets a new colorway for the Chinese High School Basketball League. Find details and images for the exclusive pair here.
3.content:
Published March 12, 2025

Since introducing his first signature sneaker to the public at the beginning of 2024, Devin Booker’s Nike Book 1 has become a mainstay in Nike’s lineup of basketball footwear releases. The model has been subject to thematic makeovers, like those for Halloween and Christmas, and has also appeared in exclusive colorways, like the Nike EYBL PE. Nike has given the Book 1 a makeover for the Chinese High School Basketball League.

Featuring a smooth leather and mesh mixture, the upper takes on a white finish across most of its paneling. This includes the leather around the toebox, mudguard, eyestays, collar, and heel, while the midfoot panel undergoes a makeover, replacing its usual canvas twill for mesh. Contrasting the neutral hues is a gradient pattern applied to the Swoosh, beginning in a pink hue and transitioning into an orange-yellow hue as you approach the heel.

Nike Book 1 CHBL

More pops of color come in the form of the yellow Book-branded woven tongue label, which contains Chinese characters translated to Nike, and the spine of the heel, which comes with a braided nylon patch in a mixture of deep blue and light blue. Finishing the design are the 1’s embroidered into the lateral heel, the white rubber midsole, and a semi-translucent gradient outsole going from a light red-pink to icy blue as you move from the toe back.

The Nike Book 1 CHBL will release exclusively in China in Spring 2025 through Nike and select retailers. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is 1099 CNY (approx $150). Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

Where to Buy: Nike

In celebration of the 30th anniversary of the Nike Air Max 95, the Swoosh is pulling out all the stops with various new colorways for 2025. One of the offerings include a nostalgic release of the beloved “Pink Foam” hue. The fan favorite was first introduced in 2020 and is set to still maintain the original “Big Bubble” design from 1995. Continuing to carry on the legacy of the Air Max 95 aesthetic, the shoe takes on a gradient of grey tones along the upper that mimics that of the shoe’s original anatomy-inspired look. The shoe’s pink foam accents the mini Swoosh as well as the visible Air chambers along with the lace loops to round it out. The pink loops sit atop a white mesh upper for breathability and sits atop a grey midsole with Air Max cushioning for added comfort and support.

6.title: Experience High Energy Return on the Trail Running in the Nike Zegama 2
6.snippet: Hi Runners! This week we talked to RW+ member Sarah Rushing, who lives in Amarillo, Texas. Rushing tested the Nike ZoomX Zegama Trail 2.
6.content:
We earn a commission for products purchased through some links in this article. Why Trust Us?

Hi Runners!

This week we talked to RW+ member Sarah Rushing, who lives in Amarillo, Texas. Rushing tested the Nike ZoomX Zegama Trail 2.

All you need to know about the Zegama 2:

The Nike Zegama 2 has a ZoomX midsole, which may sound familiar; it’s the same Pebax foam in the Alphafly 3 and Vaporfly 3. The shoe has a tacky Vibram Megagrip outsole with spaced out lugs and an ankle gaiter to keep out trail debris.

Related Story The Best Trail Running Shoes

Meet Sarah Rushing:

Rushing’s favorite road shoe is the Hoka Clifton. In 2023, she and her friends signed up for the Chama Yak Attack in Chama, New Mexico. The starting line for the 13-miler is at 10,000 feet. The weather that day was hotter and more difficult than she anticipated.

“During the long slog, I listened to some music,” she said. “One lyric popped out that day: ‘You can’t repurpose what was never there.’ We can spend a lot of time regretting past choices, life paths, etc., and this was a good reminder that our current reality is still worthwhile, even if it’s not where we want to be eventually. Running tough races always brings me to new head spaces to see these truths more clearly.”

Catch up on last week’s episode:

We talked about the On Cloudgo with RW+ member Brian Newby, who liked the shoe’s bounciness. Newby also talked about how running played an important role throughout his life. Watch here!

8.title: NIKE Faces Headwinds Pre-Q3 Earnings: Smart Buy or a Risky Bet?
8.snippet: NIKE Inc. NKE is slated to release third-quarter fiscal 2025 results on March 20. The leading sports apparel retailer is estimated to have witnessed...
8.content:
NIKE's third-quarter fiscal 2025 results are expected to reflect ongoing challenges, including weak lifestyle product sales, sluggish digital revenues, and headwinds in Greater China and certain EMEA markets. These factors are expected to have contributed to slower revenue growth and margin pressure in the to-be-reported quarter. The lifestyle segment, comprising men's, women's, and the Jordan lines, has been facing persistent struggles, particularly in digital channels. Macroeconomic factors like inflation and rising interest rates have curbed discretionary spending, posing difficulties for premium brands in North America. In Greater China, shifting consumer behavior, lower foot traffic and weaker sell-through rates have pressured regional revenues. While NIKE has moderated its near-term expectations for the region, management has been optimistic about its long-term market position. On the last reported quarter’s earnings call, the company forecast a low-double-digit year-over-year revenue decline for the fiscal third quarter, impacted by CEO Elliott Hill’s strategic actions and foreign exchange headwinds. However, NIKE expects some benefit from the Cyber Week's timing shift into the fiscal third quarter. NKE expects the fiscal third-quarter gross margin to decrease 300-350 basis points (bps) year over year. SG&A expenses are estimated to see a slight reduction, reflecting restructuring charges from the prior year. The company anticipates other income and expenses, including net interest income, between $30 million and $40 million. Our model projects the gross margin to decline 300 bps to 41.8% for third-quarter fiscal 2025. We predict SG&A expenses of $4.1 billion for the quarter, suggesting a 2.6% year-over-year decline. As a percentage of sales, SG&A is anticipated to rise 290 basis points to 36.9%.

Our proven model does not conclusively predict an earnings beat for NIKE this time around. The combination of a positive Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold) increases the odds of an earnings beat. But that is not the case here. You can uncover the best stocks to buy or sell before they are reported with our Earnings ESP Filter. NIKE has an Earnings ESP of -6.90% and a Zacks Rank of 3. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here .

NIKE Inc. NKE is slated to release third-quarter fiscal 2025 results on March 20. The leading sports apparel retailer is estimated to have witnessed year-over-year declines in the top and bottom lines in the fiscal third quarter. Stay up-to-date with all quarterly releases: See Zacks Earnings Calendar. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for fiscal third-quarter revenues is pegged at $11.1 billion, suggesting a 10.6% decline from the year-ago quarter’s reported figure. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the company’s fiscal third-quarter earnings is pegged at 28 cents per share, indicating a decline of 71.4% from the year-ago reported number. Earnings estimates for the fiscal third quarter were unchanged in the last 30 days. In the last reported quarter, the company delivered an earnings surprise of 23.8%. Its bottom line beat the consensus estimate by 29.8%, on average, in the trailing four quarters.

Story Continues

NIKE, Inc. Price and EPS Surprise

NIKE, Inc. Price and EPS Surprise

NIKE, Inc. price-eps-surprise | NIKE, Inc. Quote

However, NKE’s strategic pricing and supply-chain optimization, including logistics, inventory management and distribution, are expected to have cushioned the bottom line in the to-be-reported quarter. Effective inventory management strategies have been another critical component of NIKE's success.



The company continues to prioritize sports performance, accelerating product innovation and storytelling to enhance brand appeal. Its innovation pipeline, driven by initiatives like Speed Lane, aims to bring new fitness and lifestyle franchises to market faster. NIKE expects these innovations and focus on its sports performance product category to have supported its fiscal third-quarter performance.



The company is intensifying its focus on sports, speeding up the introduction and expansion of new products and innovations. NKE is also enhancing its storytelling efforts with greater impact and boldness while elevating the overall marketplace to strengthen brand distinction and align with consumer preferences. Additionally, the company is accelerating its innovation pipeline, advancing several innovations. It is taking bold steps to reclaim its leading edge in innovation. Focus on its sports performance product category has been the key to its strategy.



In the second half of fiscal 2025, the company expects to see additional innovations be launched from Speed Lane, including several exciting new franchises in fitness and lifestyle, boosting performance in the to-be-reported quarter.



NIKE is transitioning its digital strategy toward a full-price model, reducing reliance on promotions. At the start of fiscal 2025, digital sales had shifted to a nearly 50-50 split between full-price and discounted items. This strategic pivot, alongside efforts to boost organic traffic and enhance consumer engagement, is expected to have supported digital sales in the to-be-reported quarter. NIKE is also leveraging value stores to clear excess inventory, reinforcing its premium positioning while optimizing sales performance.

NIKE’s Price Performance & Valuation

NKE shares have exhibited a downward trend, shedding as much as 26.8% in the past year. The stock has lost against the broader Consumer Discretionary sector and the S&P 500’s growth of 2.3% and 9.5%, respectively. The NKE stock has also underperformed the industry’s decline of 23.6% in the same period.



NIKE's performance is notably weaker than its close competitors, including Wolverine World Wide WWW and Adidas ADDYY, which rose 34% and 11.1%, respectively, in the past year. NKE also underperformed Skechers’ SKX decline of 18.2% in the past year.

NKE’s One-Year Stock Performance

Zacks Investment Research



Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

At the current price of $74.17, NIKE trades at an 8.1% premium to its 52-week low of $68.62. The current price represents a 27.6% discount to the 52-week high mark of $102.49.



Despite this recent downturn, NKE’s valuation appears quite pricey. The company trades at a forward 12-month P/E multiple of 33.24X, exceeding the industry average of 26.98X and the S&P 500’s average of 20.63X.



Given the premium valuation, investors could face significant risks if the company's future performance does not meet expectations. The Consumer Discretionary market is becoming increasingly competitive and NIKE’s initiatives may not be sufficient to drive significant growth. Macroeconomic challenges and heightened competition could impede the company's ability to sustain its current growth trajectory.

Zacks Investment Research



Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Investment Thesis

As a dominant athletic footwear and apparel market player, NKE has been showing some promise through CEO Elliot Hill’s strategies, crafted around transitioning its digital platform to a full-price model, scaling back performance marketing investments and refining its production and distribution strategy.



While these efforts are expected to create long-term value, they are expected to lead to some short-term revenue challenges. The weaker guidance for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 dampens near-term growth prospects. Also, its near-term challenges in lifestyle products and Greater China cannot be ignored.

Conclusion

As NIKE prepares to report its third-quarter fiscal 2025 results, investors may question whether now is the right time to buy. The company’s strong market position and strategic initiatives support a positive long-term outlook, making it an appealing choice for those seeking exposure to a global leader in the athletic and lifestyle sectors with growth potential and a commitment to shareholder value.



However, headwinds in the lifestyle segment, challenges in Greater China, and broader economic pressures warrant careful consideration. Assessing these factors ahead of the earnings release can help investors make more informed decisions.



While NIKE’s long-term growth prospects remain strong, a cautious approach is advisable. For existing NKE shareholders, holding the stock may be a prudent move, as the upcoming earnings report could provide key insights into the company’s future direction.

0.title: US jury finds Lululemon’s athletic shoes violate Nike’s patent rights
0.snippet: Sports apparel and accessories brand Nike has won a patent infringement case against multinational athletic apparel retailer Lululemon.
0.content:
A jury in a New York federal court has ruled that Lululemon’s athletic shoes violated Nike’s patent rights. Credit: pio3/Shutterstock.

Sports apparel and accessories brand Nike has won a patent infringement case against multinational athletic apparel retailer Lululemon.

A New York federal court jury ruled in favour of Nike, awarding the company $355,450 on the grounds that Lululemon’s athletic footwear infringed on Nike’s patented sneaker technology, as reported by Reuters.

The lawsuit, initiated by Nike in January 2023, accused Lululemon Athletica of violating its patents through the sale of at least four different shoe models.

The official verdict, released on 10 March 2025, confirmed the jury’s support for Nike’s claim that Lululemon’s Chargefeel, Strongfeel and Blissfeel lines of running and training shoes encroached upon a Nike patent detailing advancements in athletic shoe design.

However, the jury dismissed allegations concerning a second Nike patent.

Nike initially sought damages equivalent to a minimum of 5% of the revenue generated by the infringing products.

A Lululemon spokesperson downplayed the significance of the awarded damages and expressed satisfaction with the jury’s decision regarding the non-infringement of the second patent.

Lululemon plans to challenge the infringement finding on appeal. The brand has given assurances that it will not impact their product offerings.

Nike previously launched a separate legal action against Lululemon in New York in 2022, alleging that the brand’s Mirror Home Gym product infringes on Nike patents related to interactive exercise technology.

Proceedings for this case are still underway. In May 2024, Nike secured a partial victory in its dispute over stripes in its designs with rival company adidas in Germany.

1.title: The Nike Air SuperFly Retro Marches On In “Ale Brown”
1.snippet: The Nike Air Superfly cooks up an unorthodox "Ale Brown" colorway as its retro introduction continues. Click in for more info.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The ever-shifting winds of cyclical fashion has brought the Swoosh to bring back a host late 90s/early aughts classics: the Air Max Sunder and Air Max Craze each fit the bill. However, Beaverton is also aiming at fleshing out their women’s catalog with the same strategy. The Nike Air SuperFly is its strongest soldier in that regard, now appearing in an off-kilter “Ale Brown” edition.

As laid out in official Nike press, the impetus for bringing the model back to shelves was partially the building trend of low-profile, minimalist silhouettes, something the thin upper and simplified construction of the SuperFly totally embodies. Shedding the Y2K design principles seen on the debut “Metallic Silver” pair, an off-kilter blend of “Ale Brown” siding, a “Treeline” sole unit and “Team Red” Swoosh are attention-grabbing in almost the opposite way, offering up some novel statement footwear for the warmer months ahead.

As a true general release, the Nike Air SuperFly “Ale Brown” will likely pop up on Nike.com and at partnering retailers sometime in the coming weeks, retailing at $100 upon arrival.
