9.title: Nike (NKE) Gains But Lags Market: What You Should Know
9.snippet: Nike (NKE) closed at $77.81 in the latest trading session, marking a +0.63% move from the prior day.
9.content:
Nike (NKE) closed the most recent trading day at $77.81, moving +0.63% from the previous trading session. The stock's change was less than the S&P 500's daily gain of 1.12%. Meanwhile, the Dow experienced a rise of 1.14%, and the technology-dominated Nasdaq saw an increase of 1.46%.

Shares of the athletic apparel maker have appreciated by 0.78% over the course of the past month, outperforming the Consumer Discretionary sector's loss of 2.8% and the S&P 500's loss of 4.13%.

The investment community will be paying close attention to the earnings performance of Nike in its upcoming release. The company is slated to reveal its earnings on March 20, 2025. The company is expected to report EPS of $0.28, down 71.43% from the prior-year quarter. Meanwhile, the latest consensus estimate predicts the revenue to be $11.12 billion, indicating a 10.57% decrease compared to the same quarter of the previous year.

For the entire fiscal year, the Zacks Consensus Estimates are projecting earnings of $2.05 per share and a revenue of $46.24 billion, representing changes of -48.1% and -9.98%, respectively, from the prior year.

Additionally, investors should keep an eye on any recent revisions to analyst forecasts for Nike. These recent revisions tend to reflect the evolving nature of short-term business trends. Consequently, upward revisions in estimates express analysts' positivity towards the company's business operations and its ability to generate profits.

Our research shows that these estimate changes are directly correlated with near-term stock prices. To utilize this, we have created the Zacks Rank, a proprietary model that integrates these estimate changes and provides a functional rating system.

Ranging from #1 (Strong Buy) to #5 (Strong Sell), the Zacks Rank system has a proven, outside-audited track record of outperformance, with #1 stocks returning an average of +25% annually since 1988. Within the past 30 days, our consensus EPS projection has moved 0.25% higher. Nike is currently sporting a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold).

In terms of valuation, Nike is currently trading at a Forward P/E ratio of 37.66. This represents a premium compared to its industry's average Forward P/E of 12.67.

It is also worth noting that NKE currently has a PEG ratio of 2.51. Comparable to the widely accepted P/E ratio, the PEG ratio also accounts for the company's projected earnings growth. As of the close of trade yesterday, the Shoes and Retail Apparel industry held an average PEG ratio of 0.98.

The Shoes and Retail Apparel industry is part of the Consumer Discretionary sector. At present, this industry carries a Zacks Industry Rank of 216, placing it within the bottom 14% of over 250 industries.

0.title: First Look At The Nike Air Flightposite “Baroque Brown”
0.snippet: The Nike Air Flightposite One "Baroque Brown" showcases some rarely-seen hues for the Foamposite line. Click in to read more.
0.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Update: Shortly after publishing this article, additional images of the Nike Air Flightposite “Baroque Brown” surfaced, shedding light on the royal blue hits that contrast from the earthy palette elsewhere on the shoe. A release is still expected for Holiday 2025. Catch the new shots below and read our complete original coverage further down.

1 of 4

Nike’s embrace of the Y2K aesthetic isn’t limited to the tech runner space. By reviving 1999’s Nike Air Flightposite, Beaverton has tapped into one of their more totemic heritage styles in basketball, unleashing a rare retro for the model that’s set to continue throughout 2025. Will the “Baroque Brown” Nike Air Flightposite be a part of that plan? First looks at a new colorway have just landed, potentially charting the next steps for the tanky silo.

Perhaps the only comparison point for this shoe is the “Baroque Brown” Total Air Foamposite Max, a shoe itself connected to the only Foamposite One that comes to mind, the unreleased “Chocolate” sample presumably minted around the same era (the pair first surfaced in 2006). Where those colorways each utilized lighter contrast trim, this shoe keeps things to an entirely two-tone arrangement, the zipped closure and sole unit underfoot each anchor the titularly tinted hardware between.

The Nike Air Flightposite “Baroque Brown” is expected to hit the shelves for Holiday 2025, retailing for $140. Keep our Sneaker Release Dates page close by for further updates as they come.

1.title: Nike Sabrina 2 Surfaces in "Apricot Agate"
1.snippet: Name: Nike Sabrina 2 “Apricot Agate” Colorway: Apricot Agate/Washed Coral-Washed Teal-Light Bone SKU: FZ1517-801. MSRP: $130 USD Release Date: Spring 2025
1.content:
Name: Nike Sabrina 2 “Apricot Agate”

Colorway: Apricot Agate/Washed Coral-Washed Teal-Light Bone

SKU: FZ1517-801

MSRP: $130 USD

Release Date: Spring 2025

Where to Buy: Nike

Sabrina Ionescu and the Swoosh are expanding their collaborative repertoire just ahead of the WNBA season. Gearing up for another season with the New York Liberty, Nike is launching another fresh new colorway for her second signature shoe which sees the Nike Sabrina 2 take on the spring with an “Apricot Agate” colorway. Dressed in an apricot agate, washed coral and mystic teal accents, the shoe’s upper is constructed peach-hued mesh for breathability and lightweight comfort. The Swoosh is highlighted in iridescent material, giving the sneaker another touch of detail, while mystic teal hits the tongue logo, insoles as well as the medial Swoosh. The Nike Sabrina 2 sits atop a CushIon 3.0 foam for added comfort and enhanced responsiveness on the court and a TPU shank plate on the midfoot for more stability.

2.title: Best Nike Running Shoes
2.snippet: Here's our list of the Best Nike Running Shoes currently available. Of course, this does not encompass all WearTesters' Nike running shoe reviews.
2.content:
Nike wasn’t known by that name in the beginning. The original name that Phil Knight and Bill Bowerman chose was Blue Ribbon Sports. They had running shoes in mind. This was largely because Knight ran Track at the University of Oregon and Bowerman coached Track there. The first shoe they created was a running shoe called the Waffle, because of that popular story where they made a sole out of a waffle maker. That apocryphal story is immortalized in the Steve Prefontaine biopic, Without Limits. Fast forward decades later and Nike is the biggest running sports brand the world has ever seen. They’re still making a ton of running shoes so here’s our list of the Best Nike Running Shoes currently available.

Of course, this does not encompass all WearTesters’ Nike running shoe reviews. You can browse them all on our Nike reviews page or our Running Shoes Reviews page.

Each shoe is put into a specific category where its strength best shines. This way, you can easily go through the list without figuring out which shoe is meant for which type of running. You can click the category you’re most interested in, and you’ll see the best Nike has to offer.

We would also like to hear your thoughts on this list, and you can even share your own list in the comments below.

These are our picks:

Updated 03.05.2025

Best Neutral Cushioned Nike Running Shoe

Nike Vomero 18 The Nike Vomero 18 is the first entry in Nike’s new Maximum Cushioning pillar. In fact, its 46mm heel/36mm forefoot gives it the highest stack ever in a Vomero. The combination of a thin ZoomX layer on top and a beefy hunk of ReactX foam underneath make for a ride that feels more like a hybrid of the Vomero 17 and the InfinityRN 4 rather than a true Vomero (minus the InfinityRN’s polarizingly prominent arch); the Vomero 18 loses some of the uptempo versatility of Vomeros of yore as a side effect. While all that extra cushion also means a significant weight increase that won’t escape notice, performance doesn’t actually suffer. The Vomero 18 successfully resists feeling at all clompy or bulky thanks to the improved rocker geometry and smooth ride. The result is a shoe that may be less inclined toward pacy stuff but that’s highly capable of keeping you turning over in comfort through even your longest of marathon training runs. While lacing and the mesh upper are different from the Vomero 17, the added heel tab is the only significant upgrade regarding the upper. As for the outsole, there’s thick durable, waffle-patterned rubber where it counts and a less dense, boxy pattern in less high-wear areas to save a bit of weight. The waffle pattern gripped well on multiple surfaces, and, while durability may not be at the quite same (extremely high) level of the Vomero 17’s outsole, it should be in the typical 300-500 mile range. The fit is true-to-size in length; however, we’d suggest most wide footers opt for the wide version, as the standard Vomero 18 isn’t particularly accommodating. Ultimately, the Vomero 18 may sacrifice some speed in favor of cushion, but it’s a reliable, easy day and long-distance cruiser with a smooth, efficient ride – and it comes in at a surprisingly competitive price. See the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 10mm, Price: $150 9 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Vomero 18 – Men Buy Nike Vomero 18 – Women

Nike Pegasus Premium The Pegasus Premium takes its place as the – you guessed it, Premium – model at the top of Nike’s Responsive Cushioning pillar. While Nike isn’t officially touting it as a max cushion model, it comes in at 45mm in the heel and 35mm in the forefoot. But the biggest buzz around this shoe isn’t its measurements. The Nike Pegasus Premium harkens back to shoes like the Nike LeBron 10 and the Nike Zoom All Out Flyknit and looks to give us what so many models couldn’t: a full-length, visible Zoom Air unit that doesn’t have our ankles working overtime to keep us stable. To achieve this, the Pegasus Premium showcases the first sculpted (or “scooped”) visible Air Zoom unit in Nike’s history, which also attempts to return more energy to the runner by mimicking the curve of a carbon plate. The Zoom unit is paired with ReactX in the heel and fluffy ZoomX as a top layer. While there is still some mild instability at the heel, Nike has largely managed to address stability needs from a performance perspective. The forefoot bounce also exceeds any Zoom Air-packing running shoe to date, so the shaping of the Zoom bag seems to be working as Nike intended. The downside of all that glorious midsole tech is that Zoom Air is generally heavy, and the Peg Premium outweighs the majority of road shoes on the market. For that reason, along with less than ideal traction, it could end up being best suited to casual wear for those sensitive to weighty trainers (though the minor heel instability could become magnified during extended casual wear). While we weren’t crazy about the poofy, top portion of the tongue, the upper is highly breathable with good lockdown, and we’d anticipate strong durability overall. While the Peg Premium is more wide-foot friendly than many Nike Models, we’d still recommend most wide footers try them on when available. Overall, the level of cushion is what we’d expect for a super trainer at this (albeit “Premium”) price point, and the Pegasus Premium is definitely made with a performance-first mentality. But seeing as it still gets outperformed by lower-priced shoes like the Asics Superblast 2 ($200), Brooks Glycerin Max ($200), and Puma MagMax Nitro ($180), the $210 price tag might be a tough sell for many runners. But one thing is for sure: the fantastic aesthetics will make the Pegasus Premium a sought-after lifestyle option. See the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 10mm, Price: $210 8.5 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Pegasus Premium – Men Buy Nike Pegasus Premium – Women

Best Nike Speed Days Running Shoe

Nike Zoom Fly 6 Nike finally has a distance training partner worthy of the Alphafly’s legendary race day performance. The Zoom Fly 6 may also be Nike’s long-awaited competitor to supertrainers like the well-loved Asics Superblast 2 ($200). In fact, the Zoom Fly 6’s $170 price tag is only slightly higher than many “regular” daily trainers that often sit in the $160 range. While the shoe’s length feels very short at first, our testers were ultimately happy going true-to-size. The fit is surprisingly accommodating at the forefoot (for a Nike shoe), but true wide footers may still need more room, particularly through the very snug-fitting midfoot. Other cons include laces that easily come untied if you don’t have enough length to double-knot them, as well as the fact that everyone will hear you coming as you hit the pavement. But our testers loved the run experience. The Zoom Fly 6 sports a dual-layer cushioning setup of ZoomX and SR-02, with a full-length, carbon fiber Flyplate sandwiched in between. The result is a protective and responsive ride with a firmer feel. While we wouldn’t recommend it for anything other than road surfaces, the Zoom Fly 6 is more stable underfoot than expected given its midsole setup, and the well-performing, breathable upper especially shines in warm weather conditions. The Zoom Fly 6 is a versatile training option whose energy return keeps propelling you forward at any pace. It can take you through more relaxed daily runs as well as through uptempo and longer efforts without ever losing its fun factor. See the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 8mm, Price: $170 9 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Zoom Fly 6 – Men Buy Nike Zoom Fly 6 – Women

Best Nike Trail Running Shoe

None currently

Best Nike Stability Running Shoe

Nike InfinityRN 4 The Nike InfinityRN 4 is technically a stability shoe. However, the stability features are unobtrusive and won’t affect you if you don’t need the help. The very noticeable arch on previous Infinity Runs is also found on this version though it’s somewhat toned down. If you don’t like a lot of arch support, you should still stay away. If an ever-present arch doesn’t bug you, the InfinityRN 4 is a highly comfortable daily training shoe that’s ready for lots of miles while also packing a ton of casual appeal. Read the full review. Fit: Go up a half size, Drop: 9mm, Price: $160 8 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike InfinityRN 4 – Men Buy Nike InfinityRN 4 – Women

Best Nike Marathon Running Shoes

Nike Alphafly 3 The Nike Alphafly 3 is the best Alphafly to date and its super bouncy nature makes it easy to maintain marathon pace. It’s more accommodating and comfortable than previous models and includes a less pronounced arch (but it’s still ever-present). It’s still not a very stable shoe around corners and a lot of the heel material is cut away so hard heel strikers will have better options. The price is high, but if you miss the original Alphafly magic, you’ll get most of it back by wearing the Alphafly 3. Read the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 8mm, Price: $285 9 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Alphafly 3 – Men Buy Nike Alphafly 3 – Women

Nike Vaporfly 3 The Nike Vaporfly 3 is the most cushioned, comfortable, and stable Vaporfly to date thus making it also the best Vaporfly to date. It’s a great update. Stability, breathability, and comfort all improved while the Vaporfly line stayed bouncy, plush, and lightweight. Durability still needs work and the tongue is weirdly tall and wide but neither is a dealbreaker. The Vaporfly 3 is going to be many people’s racing shoe of choice. It puts Nike back in the upper echelon of marathon racing shoes for those (like us) who weren’t all that enthused with the Vaporfly 2 and Alphafly 2. Read the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 8mm, Price: $250 9 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Vaporfly 3 – Men Buy Nike Vaporfly 3 – Women

Best Nike 5k Running Shoe

Nike ZoomX Streakfly The Nike ZoomX Streakfly is a high-performing lightweight speedy shoe with a few flaws that are easy to overlook if you’re a shoe nerd. The durability needs work, the upper is sloppy, and there’s little support. But the ZoomX midsole, sleek design, versatility, and minuscule weight make the Streakfly a fun shoe for speedy workouts. See the full review. Price $160 9 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike ZoomX Streakfly

Best Nike Running Shoes – Honorable Mention

Nike Pegasus 41 The Nike Pegasus 41 changes the previous Pegasus’ midsole geometry to a more modern rocker, adds 4mm of stack height, locks down well, and is highly durable. That makes it a good running shoe. But it’s priced about $10 too high, provides a level of ground feel in the toes that’s going to be a bit much for some runners, and isn’t wide foot friendly (though an extra wide version is available). That mixed bag of pros and cons keeps the Pegasus 41 as an honorable mention. How you feel about the specific pros and cons will determine whether or not you’ll like running in the Pegasus 41. Read the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 10mm, Price: $140 8 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Pegasus 41 – Men Buy Nike Pegasus 41 – Women

Nike Invincible 3 If you want the plushest ride you can get from a Nike running shoe, you’ve found the right shoe. The Nike Invincible 3 features a thick midsole comprised entirely of Nike’s super bouncy ZoomX foam and it functions like a suspension system for your feet. While stability is improved versus previous versions, it still might be too unstable side-to-side for some. The outsole features ample rubber for serious durability and the traction is on point even in driving rainstorms. The plush upper is solid but more streamlined and not as comfy as previous versions. Other reviewers experienced bad heel slip but our reviewers didn’t have that issue…but keep it in mind as a potential drawback of the fit. So while the upper took a step back, the midsole took a step forward and we end up with another Invincible that’s not perfect but whose squishiness will garner plenty of fans. Watch the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 9mm, Price $180 7 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Invincible Run 3 – Men Buy Nike Invincible Run 3 – Women

Nike Pegasus Plus Our nostalgia keeps telling us we should love the Nike Pegasus Plus. We do love the looks and will rock them casually (a lot). But running in them regularly is a different story. Once the upper’s break in period ends, it’s comfortable. But the firm-ish midsole that’s light on squish is just a mediocre experience. The Nike Pegasus Plus is slightly above average, but it could have been so much more. Read the full review. Fit: True to size, Drop: 10mm, Price: $180 8 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Pegasus Plus – Men Buy Nike Pegasus Plus – Women

Best Nike Track Spikes

Nike ZoomX Dragonfly This shoe is so popular among Track professionals that even competitive brands are letting their athletes wear blacked-out versions of the Dragonfly in important track meets. The ZoomX midsole is really, really comfortable across distances from the 800m to 5000m. It’s an incredibly lightweight versatile track spike that the best runners love to wear. Price: $150 9.5 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike ZoomX Dragonfly

Nike Air Zoom Victory The Nike Air Zoom Victory is the Alphafly of track spikes. Incredible bounce and cushion but it’s not for everyone. In this case, the Victory’s carbon plate is too stiff for some runners as they struggle to achieve their natural running motion. But all that cushion, especially the huge articulated Zoom Air bag at the forefoot, is a real treat. Price: $180 8 / 10 Total Score Buy Nike Air Zoom Victory

3.title: BLACK COMME des GARÇONS Gives Nike's Notorious Air Force 1 Low A Fashionable Co-Sign
3.snippet: The Nike Air Force 1 Low has been delivering classic style since 1983. Over the last 42 years, Bruce Kilgore's design has been reimagined ad nauseam,...
3.content:
The Nike Air Force 1 Low has been delivering classic style since 1983. Over the last 42 years, Bruce Kilgore's design has been reimagined ad nauseam, distancing the silhouette from its performance basketball origins and cementing it as one of the most iconic footwear products in the lifestyle realm. Rei Kawakubo's BLACK COMME des GARÇONS imprint recently added another tally to these efforts, giving the model's notorious all-'Black' finish a fashion-forward co-sign.

It's been a running joke for ages that you need to be cautious of anyone seen wearing a 'Black-on-Black' pair of the Air Force 1 – especially if it's in "cooked" condition. BLACK CdG's update might get a pass, but it still exudes Black Air Force 1 Energy.

Prepped for spring, the newly-surfaced collaboration between Kawakubo's empire and the Swoosh falls in line with other recent linkups between the two. A high-quality leather build across the upper sets the stage for 'White' contrasting details along the profiles. Call outs to the black-obsessed arm of the COMME des GARÇONS network land in a mix of experimental and straightforward touches. 'Metallic Silver' lace dubraes often associated with the AF1's '07 iteration reprise their roles, while traditional Nike logos on the insole are accompanied by another nod to the Japanese institution.

Enjoy a detailed shots of the latest Air Force 1 Low by BLACK CdG below. You can head over to Dover Street Market's webstore right now to secure your pair for approximately $198.

For more from the Swoosh empire, check out the Nigel Sylvester x Air Jordan 4 'Brick by Brick' collaboration set to launch on March 14.

4.title: Nike Just Dropped This Perfect Travel Outfit As Part of Its New ‘24.7’ Collection
4.snippet: We review Nike's 24.7 collection, which blends functionality with comfort and style. See our picks for the top pieces to buy and how to style it.
4.content:
Nike has continually changed the game with its roster of athlete-approved and celeb-approved sneakers, but the athletic giant is taking on travel with its new Nike 24.7 Collection.

As the collection name suggests, Nike 24.7 features clothing and accessories designed for comfortable all-day wear, blending the functionality of the brand’s workout gear, with the fashion-forward styling of its designer collaborations.

The collection introduces two new technical innovations that Nike says “offer everyday comfort with a luxurious feel.” The first is what they’re calling their “ImpossiblySoft” fabric, a smooth and slightly silky material that’s reminiscent of scuba gear, but with more softness. The second innovation, dubbed “PerfectStretch,” is a four-way stretch fabric that allows for freer movement without feeling overly tight or restrictive.

In a press release, Nike says the new 24.7 collection “sets the standard of comfort and elevated athletic style. Engineered to embody the athlete’s mindset, the collection seamlessly blends life and sport in men’s and women’s apparel that’s versatile, distraction-free, and tailored for all-day comfort, style and function.”

First unveiled in January, the Nike 24.7 collection is available online now. Below, shop some of our favorite pieces, including the Nike zip-up, pants and baseball cap that I wear on all my travels (seriously, it’s become a cool, utilitarian uniform).

NEW RELEASE $120 I picked up this Nike 24.7 half-zip in the “steel green” colorway (at right) and in black, and it’s already taken me on multiple trips this year.



Nike says the material is “double-knit” for coziness, but to me, it really just means it’s soft enough to sleep in when I’m trying to get some zzzs on the plane. The cotton and modal blend is gentle (read: not scratchy) against my skin, and there’s just a touch of spandex for easy movement and flexibility. The sweat-wicking Dri-FIT material means I stay warm without overheating, and the zippered pockets let me keep my passport and documents safely with me at all times.



This 24.7 collection zip-up comes in sizes XS to 4XL; I’m 5 foot 7 and normally wear a size small, but I bought this in a size medium for a roomier, oversized fit. Sizes are selling quickly online so we recommend adding to cart while your size is still in stock.

EDITOR’S CHOICE $110 I pair my half-zip sweatshirt with these Nike pants for a comfortable but still put-together look. Made from Nike’s “ImpossiblySoft” material, the pants feel like sweatpants but are tailored to look like trousers. Unlike jeans or actual trousers though, they’re cozy enough to wear even if you’re sitting in a car or on a plane for hours at a time.



The pants pull on with an elastic waistband and drawstring. I love the side pockets and the hidden zippered pocket that can hold small essentials like my keys or ID. A zippered back pocket provides additional storage options. These pants feature a relaxed fit — slightly wider on the waist and thighs and then tapered just a tad around the ankles. It’s not as casual or sloppy-looking as actual sweatpants, but just as suitable for all-day wear.



These Nike 24.7 pants come in multiple colors but we like the tonal look and bought it in matching colors with our zip-up above.

WOMEN’S PICK $90 For women, Nike’s 24.7 collection includes this oversized cropped sweatshirt, which is also great for travel or for post-workout hangs. The dropped shoulders give off a fashion-forward streetwear look, but the structured silhouette keeps things tailored, in case you want to wear this crewneck to coffee or lunch. The material is super soft and lightweight, a mix of polyester, modal, cotton and spandex. Choose from two colorways in sizes XS to XXL.

ALSO CONSIDER $18.97 $26 27% off I top off my travel look with this Nike baseball cap, which is made from 100% organic cotton fibers. The cap sits perfectly on my head without being too tight or too tall (or too boxy), and the adjustable strap makes it easy to fit most crown sizes. Nike does offer it in three sizes to be safe.



I love this khaki colorway, which feels more elevated than basic black or white, but Nike has the cap available in more than a dozen other colors too.

5.title: Nike Vomero 18 First Run Review: Bigger, Plusher, Smoother
5.snippet: With 46mm of foam underfoot, the Vomero 18 is Nike's most cushioned shoe ever—but does it make a difference?
5.content:
New perk: Easily find new routes and hidden gems, upcoming running events, and more near you. Your weekly Local Running Newsletter has everything you need to lace up! Subscribe today.

Whether you like it or not, today’s running shoes are getting thicker and more cushioned. Thanks to lighter, bouncier, and more resilient foams, brands can now stack more foam underfoot without sacrificing performance. The previous stack ceiling used to look more like 30-40 mm, but as the new 46 mm Nike Vomero 18 proves, 30-40 mm is more like a jumping-off point, but why?

Historically speaking, adding more foam meant creating a less stable platform, but modern engineering has tackled that issue head-on. Midsole geometry, such as wide underfoot platforms with flared soles at the base, helps stabilize the foam and enables taller stack heights to feel more secure. And if there’s a shoe that typifies this shift, it’s the Nike Vomero 18.

For some background, Nike’s latest lineup revision uses three categories: the “Vomero silo” for maximum cushioning; the Pegasus line for everyday running; and the Structure family as the go-to supportive option.

Within each category are three models: a base or icon model, a premium model, and a plus model. The premium and plus will utilize more advanced technologies, such as additional ZoomX foam or Air Units. Two current shoes in the cushioned category—the Infinity Run and Invincible—will eventually be phased out.

Still with me? Let’s dig into the Vomero 18 to see how Nike’s max cushioning family actually performs.

The Nike Vomero 18’s cushioning is plentiful. (Photo: Jonathan Beverly)

Nike Vomero 18 Review

Weight: 11.5 oz (men’s 10) / 9.2 oz (women’s 8)

Stack Heights: 46 mm / 36 mm

Heel-to-toe Drop: 10 mm

Men’s $150 at Nike Women’s $150 at Nike

Men’s $150 at Running Warehouse Women’s $150 at Running Warehouse

At a Glance

Pros

Soft cushioning

Stable for amount of stack

Comfortable upper

Cons

Heavy

What’s New Compared to the Nike Vomero 17

Stack height increased by 6 mm

Reformulated ReactX Foam provides 13 percent more energy return, according to Nike

New waffle-design rubber outsole is lighter and grippier

Padding increased along the ankle and heel collar

Nike Vomero 18: First Impressions

Typically, before I test a running shoe, I already know the stats such as weight, stack height, and drop. While I try to be completely objective, I’m aware that I subconsciously form preconceived expectations about how the shoe will perform. However, when I received the Vomero 18 in late November, I approached the shoe blind, knowing none of the specs. This gave me a great opportunity to take my first run with a completely open mind.

I initially felt that the comfort level was off the charts. The Vomero 18 is by far the most comfortable iteration I’ve tested in Nike’s Vomero line. Everything about the shoe is plush and luxurious, especially the heavily padded engineered-mesh upper.

And despite the plushy superlatives, the Vomero 18 instantly felt familiar—like I’d been running in it for months. Often, breaking in a new running shoe feels like adjusting to driving a car that’s not your own, but this wasn’t the case. I naturally settled into my preferred cadence without having to think about it.

Underfoot, the cushioning was plentiful, protective, and stable. Not knowing what the stack height was, I assumed it was around the same height as its predecessor, which has 40 mm under the heel. When I later got the specs from the Nike rep, I was dumbfounded to find out the Vomero 18 had a whopping 46 mm of foam under the heel, making it Nike’s thickest cushioned shoe ever.

(Photo: Jonathan Beverly)

With that in mind, I was doubly shocked at how stable the shoe felt. Although brands are getting better at making taller-stacked shoes less tippy, there’s still often an elevated feeling. The Vomero 18 didn’t feel particularly high at all compared to other shoes of similar height I’ve tested.

A few design elements contribute to the Vomero 18’s more grounded feeling. For one, the shoe has a wider base platform than previous Vomero models. Additionally, the dual-density midsole combines foam and a new version of React X that Nike claims has 13 percent more energy return. React X is meant to provide structure and support on the bottom, while the softer, more energetic ZoomX—found in Nike’s Alphafly and Vaporfly lines—is layered on top for a bouncier ride.

The one downside to having this much cushioning (and foams) is weight. The Vomero 18 weighs 11.4 ounces for men and 9.2 ounces for women, making it among the heaviest shoes of this type. While it didn’t feel overweight, it’s certainly not a shoe made for uptempo running. During a few pickups, I found the Vomero 18 bulky and cumbersome to carry through the stride, and I could certainly feel its weight underfoot. It is best used on long, easy runs and everyday mileage when comfort and a plush ride are a priority.

Nike Vomero 18: Final Verdict

Like a fine wine, my relationship with the Vomero has improved over the years. As someone who enjoys a softer shoe, I’ve found each incremental change inched the shoe towards my plusher preference, culminating in Nike’s Vomero 18, the most cushioned version yet.

(Photo: Jonathan Beverly)

After running in the Vomero 18 over several distances at a variety of paces, I’ve found it to be one of the best training shoes from Nike in some time. To be honest, I’ve found Nike’s everyday trainers to be a bit underwhelming compared to the competition in recent years, and the Vomero 18 is a step in the right direction.

While Nike has concentrated on dominating the carbon fiber racing shoe market with their flagship Alphafly and Vaporfly racing models, brands like Hoka, ASICS, and Brooks have stepped in to capture a significant share of the everyday comfort trainer market. However, it’s clear that Nike is making a change by revamping their trainer roundup.

Nike Vomero 18: Who Is It For?

Nike has made a bold commitment with the redesigned Vomero 18—outside those who prefer a minimalist feeling, I’d recommend this for every type of runner. It’s cushioned, stable, and runs extremely smoothly. As long as you don’t need to pick up the pace, the Vomero 18 delivers everything I’d want in a maximum cushioned shoe.

Similar Shoes

Asics Superblast 2, Brooks Glycerin Max

7.title: StockX Liable for Selling Fake Nike Shoes, Will Face Jury Trial
7.snippet: Online sneaker re-seller StockX LLC is liable for selling counterfeit Nike shoes, and the platform will have to face a jury trial over claims that it...
7.content:
Online sneaker re-seller StockX LLC is liable for selling counterfeit Nike shoes, and the platform will have to face a jury trial over claims that it unlawfully used Nike Inc.'s trademarks for nonfungible tokens, a Manhattan federal judge ruled Tuesday.

StockX, an online marketplace founded in 2015, sold four pairs of counterfeit Nikes to company investigators and 33 pairs of counterfeit shoes to another customer despite StockX’s claims that the shoes are “100% authentic,” Judge Valerie Caproni said.

But Caproni declined to give Nike a full win on all of its legal claims, finding that only a jury can determine ...

0.title: Old-Fashioned Train Heists Yield Modern-Day Loot: Nike Air Jordans
0.snippet: Transnational gangs have been targeting sneakers, wireless gaming headsets and other modern merchandise transported by rail, according to federal...
0.content:
It sounds like something out of the Wild West.

In recent months, well-organized bandits have jumped on trains rolling through the Mojave Desert in Arizona and stolen their cargo. But these robbers were not stealing gold bullion and pocket watches. They were taking Nike Air Jordans, wireless gaming headsets and other modern-day loot, according to federal prosecutors.

In many cases, the robbers used electric saws, bolt-cutters and other tools to break open the locks on containers holding pricey merchandise. Then they cut the air hoses on the brakes, which caused the trains to come to a sudden stop and put them at risk of derailing, prosecutors said. Trains in the region often travel at 70 m.p.h.

Once the trains were stopped, the robbers took cases of Air Jordans, electronics and other goods off the trains and hid them in fields and brush by the side of the tracks. Then they contacted associates who came to pick up the goods and hauled them away in box trucks, prosecutors said.

Eventually, some of the merchandise ended up for sale from third-party vendors on Amazon and eBay.

The train heists, previously reported by The Los Angeles Times, have increased in frequency over the past two years, as more transnational gangs have been targeting high-value shipments, prosecutors said.

1.title: CR7's Nike Mercurial Vapor 1 "Dark Cinder" Returns March 3
1.snippet: Cristiano Ronaldo and Nike are celebrating an iconic moment in football history with the release of the Nike Mercurial Vapor 1 "Dark Cinder",...
1.content:
Now, over two decades later, Nike is bringing the Dark Cinder colorway back, reviving one of Ronaldo’s most significant career-defining moments. The rich brown upper stays true to the original, complemented by a crisp white Swoosh and treads that contrast beautifully against the darker base. A Maize-colored sock liner and heel trim add a bold pop of color, mirroring the exact details of Ronaldo’s debut pair and serving as a nod to the early 2000s era of football boots.

Ronaldo’s debut in the Dark Cinder Mercurials marked the start of a career that would redefine the sport. From his early years as a raw, unpredictable winger at Sporting CP to becoming a five-time Ballon d’Or winner, CR7’s relentless pursuit of excellence has been matched only by his unwavering connection to the Mercurial franchise. With every era of his career, Nike’s Mercurials have been there, evolving alongside him as he shattered records, lifted trophies, and cemented himself as one of football’s all-time greats.

3.title: The Nike A'One Black Hyper Pink Releases May 2025
3.snippet: A'ja Wilson will be making history as the latest WNBA player to get their signature sneaker when she launches her Nike sneaker, the Nike A'One, in May 2025.
3.content:
Published March 3, 2025

A’ja Wilson will be making history as the latest WNBA player to get their signature sneaker when she launches her Nike sneaker, the Nike A’One, in May 2025. While Wilson and The Swoosh debuted the model in the Pink A’ura colorway, we’ve seen A’ja rock a few colors on and off the court since the official unveiling. Early images of the Black Hyper Pink colorway have found their way online.

A trio of pinks combines with stark black hues to create this colorway of the Nike A’One, beginning with a light pink shade on the upper base. Moving up, the pearl-inspired layered upper gets darker and darker as you head toward the tongue, eventually transitioning from dark pink into a solid black along the eyelets, tongue, and heel. Nike covers the Swoosh logo on the midfoot in a stark black hue, while A’ja’s logos are dark metallic pink.

Nike A'One Black Hyper Pink

These nods to A’ja are located on the tongue and heel, with more homages to Wilson and her family found inside the sneaker. Here, we see two crests A’ja has tattooed on her body, which is meant to represent Wilson’s mom and dad. Underfoot, the full-length Cushlon midsole core is supported by a pink-injected Phylon midsole carrier and a cream TPU frame bezel. The black rubber outsole with Nike and A’ja Wilson logos is finishing the sneaker.

The Nike A’One Black Hyper Pink W will release on May 29, 2025, through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in women’s sizing, the retail price is $110. Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

4.title: For Trail Runners And Gorp-Core Fans, Nike Delivers The ACG Ultrafly 2
4.snippet: The Nike Ultrafly 2 is revealed; photos reveal that the shoe will be under the ACG line. Tap in for more details.
4.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

We’ve said it before and we’ll say it again: Nike is at its absolute best when it creates performance footwear that looks so good, it can be worn as a daily driver. This principle was the force behind the success of the Pegasus Premium‘s grand debut earlier in January, proving that the Swoosh still has the chops to design athlete-driven equipment that can be worn for fashionable purposes.

We view the upcoming ACG Ultrafly 2 in that same category. Designed for serious trail-runners, the second model of the Ultrafly series builds on the $260 Ultrafly 1 with a radical new re-design that has firm potential to be a hit amongst the gorp-core demo along with hardcore runners.

This first look at an early pair was spotted not long ago by @runners_highest on Caleb Olsen, a Nike athlete and ultramarathoner that regularly tests out upcoming Nike Trail product. The Ultrafly 2 boasts an oversized Swoosh logo that dips into the midsole while the exterior shell features a ridged pattern similar to a topographic map. It will very likely have a carbon Flyplate layered onto the ZoomX foam cushioning like Ultrafly 1 does. The outsole also features the official Vibram stamp on the outsole whereas the Ultrafly 1 did not (although that model was also designed in partnership Vibram).

1 of 3

Interestingly enough, this early Ultrafly 2 is branded with ACG on the tongue and All-Conditions Gear. This may suggest that the Nike Trail line could be absorbed into the Nike ACG mainline, or that this model specifically is being transferred over to that category. An even earlier sample of the Ultrafly 2 (pictured below) did not feature ACG logos, but rather a large NIKE TRAIL text on the medial side and the Nike Trail logo on the toe.

1 of 5

Nike has yet to officially announce the details around the Ultrafly 2, but with what appears to be finalized pairs out in the open and being tested, Nike could be announcing the model soon.

5.title: This Nike Sabrina 2 Collab Celebrates Women in Basketball — and Beyond
5.snippet: Philippines basketball retailer Titan is collaborating with Nike on a new Sabrina 2 sneaker inspired by Ionescu's impact and women in sports.
5.content:
Sabrina Ionescu’s second signature sneaker, the Nike Sabrina 2, is getting a vibrant makeover on a new collaboration courtesy of Philippines basketball concept retailer Titan.

Formally unveiled Monday is the Titan x Nike Sabrina 2 “Make Space” sneaker collab. Inspired by a 2021 Nike G.T. Cut campaign starring Ionescu, the design is rooted in her statement at the beginning of the clip: “All I wanted was space. I found it in the game.”

Watch on FN

To pull off the concept, Titan tapped brand employee Alessah Papa along with Filipina artists Aila Torre and Lari Gazmen for a colorful collaboration that’s replete with detailing. Titan says it chose a Light Bone base for a neutral overall look with accents in purple, emerald and blush, colors which were chosen to represent Titan’s Show Her Love tournament.

Titan x Nike Sabrina 2 ‘Make Space’ (on-foot).

According to Titan, the colorful Fire Spinner plant inspired the pink-to-yellow fade on the Swoosh of the Sabrina 2 — which represents both Ionescu’s “fiery passion and ice-cold game” and women’s basketball in the Philippines — and the flower is also printed on the right insole. On the left insole, a graphic of empty bleacher seats signifies making space for those who haven’t yet arrived.

“With my partnership with Titan, when anyone picks up this shoe, I just want to give them hope on being able to accomplish whatever it is they want to do, whether it’s on the court or oﬀ the court,” Ionescu said in a press release.

The Titan x Nike Sabrina 2 “Make Space” sneaker will be released March 11 exclusively at Titan and NBA Store Philippines in women’s sizes 5 through 16.5, which converts to men’s 3.5 to 15.

Following the debut launch, another release will take place March 15 during Ionescu’s Asia Tour in Guangzhou and Hong Kong. This will be followed by a global release on March 22. U.S. retail pricing is set at $140. The sneaker’s SKU is HQ1846-001 and its full colorway is “Light Bone/Calypso/Teal Tint/Racer Pink.”

6.title: Hardcore Marathoner Harry Styles Races in an Elite Pair of Nikes
6.snippet: For Grammy winner and hardcore hoofer Harry Styles, Nike's Alphafly 3 running shoes have that one thing: endurance.
6.content:
Harry Styles has been on a well-deserved break, having ended his blockbuster 22-month Love on Tour sprint in 2023. Little did we know, the Grammy-winning artist hasn't just been sittin' at home on the floor for the past couple years.

He's popped up sporadically in the public the past 12 months, notably with the very-stylish, now-ex-girlfriend Taylor Russell, at London Fashion Week, and more recently at the funeral of his former One Direction bandmate Liam Payne. But on Sunday, March 2, spectators at the Tokyo Marathon caught glimpses of the “Late Night Talking” singer doing literal laps on the streets of Japan before he finished with a 3:24:07 race time.

The most stylish man of the year in 2020, according to GQ readers, was seen sporting a look that shows running fits can look equally as good as your typical going-out getup. Styles was rocking racing sunglasses, a white headband, a black Nike hoodie, Tracksmith short-shorts, and (presumably) the Nike Alphafly 3 sneakers.

Styles' choice of sneakers (or “trainers” as the UK-born musician would call them) makes sense given the Alphafly 3s are the Swoosh's fastest (and most expensive) running shoes. Nike literally designed the Alphaflys for marathons, with a full-length carbon fiber plate for forward propulsion and dual Air Zoom units for powerful springiness. Its propensity for getting runners to cross the finish line at 26.2 miles could be the reason how Styles managed such an impressive run time (in addition to the hours of dedication to training and his diet, we presume). At his race time, Styles was averaging under eight miles an hour, and you can even view his splits at the Tokyo Marathon website.

Our resident marathoner and running shoe expert Tanner Bowden, who has completed the Tokyo Marathon himself, called the Alphafly 3s the best elite racing shoes from Nike, saying “the shoe looks like a spaceship and moves about as fast as one, with a massive stack height that feels so distinctly propulsive it makes you want to run fast.”

Could you beat Styles' race time? Depending on your aptitude for running, there's a non-zero chance you might. Of the over 38,000 runners who took part in this year's Tokyo Marathon, Styles' unofficial ranking was 6,010—quite an impressive feat for a “Golden” boy.

8.title: Nike Unveils the Vomero 18: A Running Shoe Built for Everyday Comfort
8.snippet: Nike introduces the Vomero 18, featuring dual-density cushioning, breathable mesh, and improved traction.
8.content:
Nike continues to refine its performance footwear with the release of the Vomero 18, a running shoe designed to deliver exceptional cushioning, breathability, and support. While its substantial heel structure might suggest a competition-ready design, this model prioritizes comfort and endurance, making it an ideal choice for daily runners and long-distance enthusiasts.

Equipped with a dual-density midsole that combines ZoomX foam and ReactX foam, the Vomero 18 offers a balanced ride that blends responsiveness with plush cushioning. This thoughtful construction allows runners to experience reduced impact on their joints while maintaining energy return with every stride.

Advanced Cushioning for a Smooth Ride

One of the standout features of the Nike Vomero 18 is its enhanced midsole, which integrates ZoomX foam with ReactX technology. This pairing provides a lightweight yet responsive feel, ensuring that every step is both comfortable and efficient.

ZoomX foam, Nike’s most energy-efficient cushioning, is placed strategically to absorb shock and enhance propulsion, while ReactX foam contributes to long-lasting comfort without adding unnecessary weight. The result is a shoe that delivers smooth transitions from heel to toe, allowing runners to maintain their pace with reduced fatigue.

Breathable Upper and Adaptive Fit

Nike has also focused on ventilation and flexibility with the Vomero 18’s engineered mesh upper. This material is designed to enhance airflow, keeping feet cool during long runs.

In addition to breathability, the upper’s adaptive construction provides a snug, supportive fit, reducing pressure points and allowing for natural foot movement. The plush tongue and padded lining contribute to a secure and comfortable experience, making the shoe a reliable choice for daily training sessions.

Enhanced Outsole Traction and Stability

The outsole of the Vomero 18 introduces a pod system with a reconfigured traction pattern, improving grip on various surfaces. Whether running on pavement, light trails, or the treadmill, this updated outsole ensures better agility and control, enhancing overall stability.

This new design also supports a smoother heel-to-toe transition, reducing strain on the ankles and knees, which is particularly beneficial for runners focused on long-term performance and injury prevention.

Who Should Consider the Nike Vomero 18?

Nike designed the Vomero 18 for runners who prioritize comfort and support over speed-focused performance. It’s an ideal option for:

Daily runners seeking plush cushioning for extended mileage

Athletes looking for a training shoe that minimizes impact

Those who need a breathable, secure fit for consistent running sessions

With its blend of soft and responsive cushioning, the Vomero 18 caters to those who want a well-balanced ride that adapts to different paces and training intensities.

Availability and Pricing

The Nike Vomero 18 is available now through Nike’s official website and select retailers, priced at $150 USD. With its durable construction and innovative cushioning, this model is set to become a go-to option for runners seeking a comfortable yet performance-driven shoe.

9.title: Nike ACG Ultrafly 2: The Trail Runner Built for Gorp-Core Enthusiasts
9.snippet: The Nike ACG Ultrafly 2 brings a Vibram outsole and topographic design to the trail-ready ZoomX runner. Expect a release in Summer 2025.
9.content:
Nike blends performance and style once again with the ACG Ultrafly 2. After the Pegasus Premium’s success, this trail-ready sneaker is next in line. Whether you’re a runner or a gorp-core fan, this shoe delivers.

- Advertisement -

Building on the Ultrafly 1, this version introduces a new ridged design. Its textured upper resembles a topographic map, adding to its rugged appeal. The oversized Swoosh now extends into the midsole, making a bold statement. Meanwhile, ACG branding appears on the tongue, reinforcing its outdoor-ready identity.

First seen on ultramarathoner Caleb Olsen, this model stays true to its roots. It retains ZoomX foam and a carbon Flyplate for energy return and stability. However, the biggest improvement is the Vibram outsole, which enhances grip and durability. This upgrade addresses a key weakness of its predecessor.

Interestingly, early samples featured Nike Trail branding instead of ACG. This detail suggests Nike made last-minute changes before finalizing the design. While an official release date is unknown, wear-test pairs suggest a launch is near.

Expect the Nike ACG Ultrafly 2 to drop likely in Summer 2025 at select retailers. Stay tuned for updates on Nike.com and official release details.

Stay up to date with all upcoming sneaker releases from our Sneaker Release Dates page. Be sure to follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

0.title: Nike Sabrina 2 Titan HQ1846-001
0.snippet: The Titan x Nike Sabrina 2 is launching throughout March during Ionescu's Asia Tour. Tap in for full deatils on this collaborative release.
0.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Woth Sabrina Ionescu ready to embark on her first-ever Asia tour next week, Nike has a special launch planned to commemorate this key milestone moment for the signature athlete. In collaboration with TITAN of the Philippines, Nike will launch a spirited Sabrina 2 designed by prominent individuals of the country’s footwear and art community.

TITAN’s infusion of Filipino heritage and the country’s love of the game is expressed through a collaborative execution by Titan’s own Alessah Papa and visual artists Aila Torre and Lari Gazmen. The concept has its roots in three graphic elements: the Fire Spinner plant on the right insole is reflected in the gradient coloring of the Swoosh logo, also representing the fiery passion for basketball shared by Ionescu and the women’s basketball community in the island cluster. The left insole illustrates a metaphor for all who will soon witness the growing impact of women’s basketball. Behind the tongues are the “Make Space” mantra, which was first introduced in a Nike GT Cut advertisement featuring the WNBA champion, and a visual that combines a Tangram puzzle with Bauhaus shapes.

On March 11th, coinciding with Ionescu’s first stop of her first-ever Asia Tour, Titan will host the 2025 Show Her Love Tournament Finals at the Smart Araneta Coliseum. The first launch of the collaboration will occur that day at Titan and the NBA Store in the Philippines. Titan members will get early exclusive access before the March 11th launch; more information is on Titan22.com and the Titan App.

Following the drop in the Philippines, limited launches are also scheduled on March 15th in Guangzhou, Hong Kong, and Nike South East Asia. The global launch of the Sabrina 2 by Titan will conclude the launch on March 22nd.

1.title: Check Out the Kobe Version of Nike's Offcourt Slides
1.snippet: Name: Nike Kobe Offcourt Slides “Hyper Royal” Colorway: Hyper Royal/White SKU: IF2870-400. MSRP: $40 USD Release Date: Summer 2025. Where to Buy: Nike.
1.content:
Name: Nike Kobe Offcourt Slides “Hyper Royal”

Colorway: Hyper Royal/White

SKU: IF2870-400

MSRP: $40 USD

Release Date: Summer 2025

Where to Buy: Nike

Nike has been ramping up its output of Kobe Bryant-themed releases as it not only has been steadily bringing back his signature shoes in Protro form, but putting together new Kobe-branded footwear as well — such as last year’s Air Force 1 Lows. Looking ahead, it has been reported that the Kobe 3 Protro is the next from his shoe line to return to shelves, however, another design may end up releasing first.

Adding to the list of upcoming Kobe releases is a new version of Nike’s Offcourt Slides. The slip-on silhouette is comfort-oriented with a dual-layered foam underfoot and padded strap that here sports a snakeskin-like texture with Kobe’s Sheath logo placed front and center atop it. Its “Hyper Royal” build offers a monochromatic finish, save for the aforementioned logo hit favoring white.

At the time of writing, Nike has not yet announced when this new Kobe version of the Offcourt Slides will be releasing. Stay tuned for updates, including the reveal of additional colorways to come, as we currently expect this “Hyper Royal” iteration to drop this summer via Nike and select retailers at a starting price of $40 USD.

2.title: Ben Baller is Wearing Nikes Again—And He’s Loving Adidas Too
2.snippet: Ben Baller is back in Nike sneakers—and he's showing love to Adidas, marking an unexpected turn in the sneaker world for 2025. Known for his hot takes and...
2.content:
Ben Baller is back in Nike sneakers—and he’s showing love to Adidas, marking an unexpected turn in the sneaker world for 2025. Known for his hot takes and high-profile status in both sneaker and jewelry culture, Ben had previously vowed to never wear Nike again after the brand banned him from selling their products on his platform. That decision forced him to resort to eBay for sneaker sales, leading to a public fallout with the sportswear giant.

However, time has shifted perspectives. On a recent podcast, Ben reflected on his history with Nike, admitting that while he once lashed out, he now sees that if things had gone differently, he might have been working with the company today instead of becoming a world-famous jeweler. And now, despite his past frustrations, Ben Baller is rocking with Nike once again, seen embracing one of his most anticipated releases—the Nike Kobe 6 "All-Star" (Sail), a pair he had been waiting on since last year.

But his renewed love for sneakers isn’t limited to Nike. Ben also received a pair of the Adidas Harden Vol. 9 "Cyber Metallic", which he praised as "fresh" and "clean", acknowledging the impressive direction Adidas Basketball has taken with its recent releases.

3.title: LeBron James makes a "promise" to his daughter with pink Nike sneakers
3.snippet: Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James' newly-released pink Nike sneakers are a tribute to his daughter.

4.title: Nike Is Giving Its Futuristic Foamposite Sneaker a Carbon Fiber Upgrade in All-Black
4.snippet: After releasing the Air Flightposite in a stealthy “Triple Black” style on Friday, Nike Sportswear will reportedly dip back into its Foamposite archive for...
4.content:
After releasing the Air Flightposite in a stealthy “Triple Black” style on Friday, Nike Sportswear will reportedly dip back into its Foamposite archive for a similar — yet upgraded — look on an upcoming sneaker.

According to @zsneakerheadz and Sneaker Files, the Nike Air Foamposite One will soon receive an all-black “Carbon Fiber” makeover. Coming in a “Black/Black/Dark Smoke Gray” colorway, early speculative mock-ups show a nearly blacked-out upper with a translucent rubber outsole. The Foamposite shell upper of the shoe is expected to feature a carbon fiber-inspired finish. It’s worth noting that the image pictured here is a speculative mock-up of what the pair is expected to look like and not an actual image of the upcoming shoe.

More from Footwear News

Nike Air Foamposite One ‘Carbon Fiber’ speculative mock-up. @zsneakerheadz

While a carbon fiber-patterned Air Fomaposite One in black would be a first for the model, Nike has released similar executions in the past. Most notably, in 2014, the Air Flightposite model received an all-black “Carbon Fiber” style which was a retro release of an original colorway from 1999. As for the Air Foamposite, a 2017 “Metallic Silver” Air Foamposite Pro featured a silver carbon fiber finish, but this upcoming ’24 pair is the first time it’s been featured on the Air Foamposite One.

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

What was once a fantasy caliber colorway for Air Foamposite One enthusiasts will now be reportedly releasing at retail, but it will be interesting to see if the pair is met with the same reception as other cult-favorite Foamposites. The franchise itself is trending on various levels; Balenciaga in October debuted a Foamposite-like Basketball sneaker and Nike’s buzzy G.T. Future sneaker from NBA All-Star Weekend was met with Foamposite comparisons.

The Nike Air Foamposite One “Carbon Fiber” is set to arrive during holiday 2025 with availability from SNKRS and select Nike Sportswear stockists. Retail pricing of $230 is expected, and the sneaker has a SKU of HF2902-002.

5.title: Heritage Investors Management Corp Boosts Stake in NIKE, Inc. (NYSE:NKE)
5.snippet: Heritage Investors Management Corp grew its holdings in NIKE, Inc. (NYSE:NKE - Free Report) by 1.1% in the fourth quarter, according to its most recent...
5.content:
Heritage Investors Management Corp boosted its holdings in shares of NIKE, Inc. (NYSE:NKE - Free Report) by 1.1% in the 4th quarter, according to the company in its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The fund owned 356,087 shares of the footwear maker's stock after acquiring an additional 3,888 shares during the quarter. Heritage Investors Management Corp's holdings in NIKE were worth $26,945,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.

Get NIKE alerts: Sign Up

Several other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently added to or reduced their stakes in NKE. J.W. Cole Advisors Inc. increased its stake in NIKE by 7.7% during the third quarter. J.W. Cole Advisors Inc. now owns 12,029 shares of the footwear maker's stock worth $1,063,000 after acquiring an additional 858 shares during the last quarter. Bay Colony Advisory Group Inc d b a Bay Colony Advisors acquired a new stake in NIKE during the third quarter worth $218,000. Integrated Advisors Network LLC increased its stake in NIKE by 85.4% during the third quarter. Integrated Advisors Network LLC now owns 18,607 shares of the footwear maker's stock worth $1,645,000 after acquiring an additional 8,572 shares during the last quarter. Saybrook Capital NC increased its stake in NIKE by 5.3% during the third quarter. Saybrook Capital NC now owns 170,576 shares of the footwear maker's stock worth $15,079,000 after acquiring an additional 8,560 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Avitas Wealth Management LLC grew its stake in shares of NIKE by 10.3% in the third quarter. Avitas Wealth Management LLC now owns 6,218 shares of the footwear maker's stock valued at $550,000 after buying an additional 580 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 64.25% of the company's stock.

NIKE Stock Down 0.7 %

NYSE NKE traded down $0.59 during trading on Friday, reaching $79.43. 14,109,037 shares of the company's stock were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 13,628,462. The stock has a market cap of $117.49 billion, a P/E ratio of 24.52, a price-to-earnings-growth ratio of 2.52 and a beta of 1.01. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.57, a quick ratio of 1.51 and a current ratio of 2.22. The company has a 50 day moving average price of $74.64 and a two-hundred day moving average price of $78.32. NIKE, Inc. has a 1 year low of $68.62 and a 1 year high of $105.57.

NIKE (NYSE:NKE - Get Free Report) last posted its earnings results on Thursday, December 19th. The footwear maker reported $0.78 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $0.63 by $0.15. NIKE had a return on equity of 36.99% and a net margin of 9.98%. The business had revenue of $12.35 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $12.11 billion. During the same period in the previous year, the business earned $1.03 EPS. The business's quarterly revenue was down 7.7% on a year-over-year basis. On average, equities research analysts anticipate that NIKE, Inc. will post 2.05 EPS for the current fiscal year.

NIKE Dividend Announcement

The business also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Tuesday, April 1st. Investors of record on Monday, March 3rd will be given a $0.40 dividend. This represents a $1.60 annualized dividend and a yield of 2.01%. The ex-dividend date is Monday, March 3rd. NIKE's dividend payout ratio (DPR) is presently 49.38%.

Insider Activity at NIKE

In related news, Director John W. Rogers, Jr. purchased 2,500 shares of the company's stock in a transaction that occurred on Friday, December 27th. The shares were purchased at an average price of $76.65 per share, for a total transaction of $191,625.00. Following the transaction, the director now directly owns 34,403 shares of the company's stock, valued at approximately $2,636,989.95. The trade was a 7.84 % increase in their position. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which is accessible through this link. Also, Chairman Mark G. Parker sold 169,732 shares of the business's stock in a transaction dated Friday, February 14th. The shares were sold at an average price of $72.83, for a total value of $12,361,581.56. Following the completion of the transaction, the chairman now owns 896,632 shares in the company, valued at $65,301,708.56. This trade represents a 15.92 % decrease in their position. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. 1.10% of the stock is currently owned by insiders.

Analysts Set New Price Targets

NKE has been the subject of a number of research reports. BMO Capital Markets lifted their price objective on NIKE from $92.00 to $95.00 and gave the company an "outperform" rating in a research note on Monday, February 3rd. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft dropped their price objective on NIKE from $92.00 to $82.00 and set a "buy" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, December 16th. Piper Sandler raised NIKE from a "neutral" rating to an "overweight" rating and lifted their price objective for the company from $72.00 to $90.00 in a research note on Friday, January 10th. Robert W. Baird dropped their price objective on NIKE from $110.00 to $105.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, December 23rd. Finally, Royal Bank of Canada dropped their price objective on NIKE from $82.00 to $80.00 and set a "sector perform" rating for the company in a research note on Thursday, November 7th. Fourteen analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, sixteen have issued a buy rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company's stock. According to data from MarketBeat, NIKE presently has a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" and an average target price of $89.77.

About NIKE

NIKE, Inc, together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, markets, and sells athletic footwear, apparel, equipment, accessories, and services worldwide. The company provides athletic and casual footwear, apparel, and accessories under the Jumpman trademark; and casual sneakers, apparel, and accessories under the Converse, Chuck Taylor, All Star, One Star, Star Chevron, and Jack Purcell trademarks.

6.title: Nike Sabrina 2 “Apricot Agate” [Release Date/Price/Where To Buy]
6.snippet: Nike Sabrina 2 “Apricot Agate”; SKU: FZ1517-801; Color: Apricot Agate/Washed Coral-Washed Teal-Light Bone. Check the release date and price inside.
6.content:
As the WNBA season draws near, anticipation builds for the release of Sabrina Ionescu’s latest signature shoe, the Nike Sabrina 2. The “Apricot Agate” colorway, slated for a Spring 2025 debut, promises a balance of striking and understated design elements.

About the Nike Sabrina 2 “Apricot Agate”

The shoe presents a breathable peach mesh upper, immediately catching the eye with an iridescent Swoosh. Teal accents add a subtle yet distinct contrast, appearing on the tongue and interior detailing. Notably, the embroidered side panels serve a dual purpose, delivering both structural support and a refined aesthetic.

Performance remains a key focus for the Sabrina 2. The shoe incorporates Cushion 3.0 foam and a Zoom Air unit to provide a responsive and dynamic feel on the court. Stability and traction are addressed through a herringbone outsole and a TPU shank plate.

Release Details

The Nike Sabrina 2 “Apricot Agate” is scheduled to become available at select retailers and on Nike.com in Spring 2025, with a retail price of US$130.

Source: Sneaker Bar Detroit

In other news, check out the Mizuno Wave Prophecy Moc GTX.

7.title: Sheryl Swoopes shares honest verdict on Caitlin Clark's Nike deal - 'Never thought I would see'
7.snippet: WNBA legend Sheryl Swoopes has offered a positive outlook on Caitlin Clark amid her Nike contract, after previous contentious comments about the Indiana...
7.content:
WNBA legend Sheryl Swoopes has offered a positive outlook on Caitlin Clark amid her Nike contract, after previous contentious comments about the Indiana Fever ace.

After an impressive debut season in the WNBA, where Clark was crowned Rookie of the Year having left Iowa Hawkeyes as the NCAA all-time leading scorer—surpassing Swoopes' tally—the former WNBA star erroneously suggested that Clark had spent five years in college and took over 40 shots per game to claim that NCAA record.

She also stirred up a controversy by hinting that Clark hadn't really shone during her rookie year with the Fever, despite the praise coming her way. However, as Vegas Aces icon A'ja Wilson celebrated the launch of her own new Nike signature shoe, ambassador Swoopes gave a nod to Clark concerning her deal.

"I feel so lucky to be a part of the Nike basketball family for more than 30 years now. And I love to see how the brand continues to champion women's basketball and the athletes who play it," Swoopes expressed.

Last week on the 'In Case You Missed It With Khristina Williams' podcast, Swoopes went on: "What really excites me today about where we are is it's not just the things that the women are getting on the court. You have all these women and brands who are saying, 'We see you, we hear you, we need you'

"So you have the Angel Reese's, the Caitlin Clark's, the DiJonai Carrington's, the Rickea Jackson's, the A'jas doing things that we only could dream of. And my very first Nike contract when I signed in ['95] was like $175,000. Which then I was like, 'Oh my god, I've made it', right?

This article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Learn more Get Peacock Get Peacock starting at $7.99 Looking for more to watch? Peacock has hit shows, movies, live sports, and more. You can watch popular titles like The Traitors and Love Island USA, along with NFL games and Premier League matches all in one place. Peacock offers plans starting at $7.99 a month and you can cancel anytime. $7.99 Peacock Subscribe Here

"And today to see a player like an A'ja and a Caitlin Clark signing a $20 million contract. Like, I don't even know what to say about that, because I never thought that I would see this day when we started the W back in '97, where we're sitting here actually talking about... these million-dollar contracts that female basketball players are now signing."

Clark inked a landmark deal for the WNBA with Nike in April last year, rumoured to be valued at around $28m over eight years. Before committing to Nike, Under Armour and Adidas were both contenders for Clark's endorsement.

8.title: These "Black Cat" Jordan 4s Are a Different Kind of Jumpman Feline
8.snippet: The Air Jordan 4 Net sneaker goes "Black Cat," with the updated "caged" model dressing up in the famous all-black look.
8.content:
The "Black Cat" Jordan 4s are back early. Well...sorta, kinda.

The latest "Black Cat" Jordan 4 looks a little different from the classic, and that's because it isn't the same ole Jordan 4 as before. The famous color scheme now appears on the Jordan 4 Net, an updated Air Jordan 4 model that takes the phrase "nothing but net" very seriously.

Debuted in 2024, the Air Jordan 4 Net was born to stun. The adventurous makeover includes this oversized TPU cage covering the tongue with the shoelaces on top. But inside the "cage" is the classic Jordan 4 we've loved since 1989 including its traditional fixings like the "wings," Air soles, and Jumpman motifs.

Again, the Jordan 4 Net even wears the "Black Cat" colorway, one of the AJ4's cleanest schemes ever. The all-black design has famously graced the Air Jordan 4 and Jordan 3 models. At the same time, spin-off models like the skate-ish Jordan 4 RM have also helped keep the "Black Cat" legacy alive.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

Consider the "Black Cat" 4s uncaged....no, wait...caged?

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this YouTube video. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy Subscribe to Highsnobiety on YouTube

But beyond the net, the new Jordan 4 is quite luxe. The sneaker features buttery premium leather uppers along with removable silver charms. The cage doesn't appear to be detachable. Otherwise, it wouldn't be the Jordan 4 Net!

The real-deal "Black Cat" 4s are still expected to return later this year. But if you're looking for the "Black Cats" on a weird, new sneaker vibe, the black Air Jordan 4 Net is slated to release on February 26 at 10AM EST on Nike's website.

0.title: A’ja Wilson’s Nike A’One “Black/Hyper Pink” Launches In May
0.snippet: A'ja Wilson's debut signature shoe is set to launch in the Summer, and the initial drops has Nike thinking pink. In addition to the “Pink Aura” colorway...
0.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

A’ja Wilson’s debut signature shoe is set to launch in the Summer, and the initial drops has Nike thinking pink. In addition to the “Pink Aura” colorway that served as the debut piece, the Nike A’One kicks are set to land in a Black/Hyper Pink colorway seen here.

Off the bat, the similarities between these and the Pink Auras are a bit surprising, because it’s not often that Nike will drop two colorways so close to one another with such strong resemblance. The arrangement of the pink shades are nearly identical, and the lone distinguishing characteristic is the use of black on the Swoosh logo, lace collar, ankle, and interior.

The Pink Aura, however, has a more vibrant saturation of the hue (more of “hot” pink), whereas the version seen here appears a bit softer in its appearance.

Nonetheless, Nike has plans to release the A’One in Black/Hyper Pink beginning May 29th, 2025 for $110. Check out this detailed gallery of studio shots and stay tuned for further updates on the new A’ja Wilson shoes.

1.title: The Slawn x Nike Air Max 90 Duo Releases March 1 at London's Truman Brewery
1.snippet: British-Nigerian artist Olaolu Slawn is set to release two Nike Air Max 90 collaborations throughout March 2025.
1.content:
Slawn's announcement took the form of a 24 second Instagram Reel depicting a swoosh-branded box falling from outer space. Upon crash landing on earth, one of the artist's iconic jester characters comes out of the box and finds the 'Black/White' collaborative Air Max 90. God-like hands come down from the clouds and squishes the figure.

Without the inaugural visuals, it'd be easy to mistake the unreleased sneaker duo as simply more inline takes from Nike Sportswear. The clip doesn't overtly share the backstory behind Slawn's fist project with the Swoosh, but the speckled paint on the predominantly 'Black' pair seemingly references the video's space themes in addition to the paint that stains the artist's clothing and footwear while working in his studio in north London.

'Metallic Silver' and 'Metallic Gold' eyelets near the top of the tongue work together with updates to the base layer and Nike Air branding on the spine to leave Slawn's mark on Tinker Hatfield's iconic design from 1990. Sole units underfoot, however, opt for tonal finishes that don't detract from the top-halves' 'Black' and 'Sail' finishes.

Enjoy closer looks at Slawns' Air Max 90s below – courtesy of German retailer BSTN. A firm Nike SNKRS launch date hasn't been disclosed by either party involved, but BSTN currently has pairs scheduled to drop on Saturday, March 1, at 3 a.m. EST. The Nigerian-born artist will host a pop-up at London's Truman Brewery on Saturday as well. Each pair is priced at $150.

For more from the Swoosh, check out the rumored UNDEFEATED Air Max 95 collection expected to drop before the year ends.

2.title: Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen Linen” Releases March 2025
2.snippet: Nike Air Force 1 Canvas Linen Release Date. Priced at $130 USD, the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen Linen” will release on March 20, 2025. The pair will be...
2.content:
Nike is bringing back a beloved classic with a fresh update in Spring 2025: the Air Force 1 Low Canvas “Linen.” First introduced in 2001 as part of Nike’s Japan-exclusive CO.JP collection, the “Linen” quickly gained a loyal following for its pink and tan color scheme. After a re-release in leather form in 2024, Nike is now reimagining the design with a contemporary twist.

- Advertisement -

For 2025, the iconic “Linen” undergoes a transformation with tan canvas replacing the original leather. This material change offers added texture and a laid-back aesthetic, perfect for modern sneaker enthusiasts. Signature elements remain intact, including the pink leather Swooshes, padded white nylon tongues, and pink “Nike Air” embroidery on the heel. These details ensure the shoe retains its nostalgic appeal. Completing the look, a white midsole and pink outsole maintain the colorway’s recognizable charm.

Nike Air Force 1 Canvas Linen Release Date

Priced at $130 USD, the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen Linen” will release on March 20, 2025. The pair will be available at select Nike Sportswear retailers, online, and on Nike.com.

With its blend of timeless design and modern materials, this release is sure to resonate with both longtime fans and newcomers alike.

Stay up to date with all upcoming sneaker releases from our Sneaker Release Dates page. Be sure to follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

8.title: Kevin Durant Debuted a New KD 18 Inspired by a Classic — and Controversial — Nike Sneaker
8.snippet: Kevin Durant debuted a new Nike KD 18 inspired by Nike's controversial Air Bakin sneaker from the late '90s. Find early release date details.
8.content:
Kevin Durant’s latest signature sneaker, the Nike KD 18, features a design inspired by the cult favorite Nike Air Terra Humara trail running shoe from 1997. And last night, during the Phoenix Suns’ 125-108 home win over the New Orleans Pelicans, Durant debuted a new version of the sneaker which takes its colors from yet another classic Nike design.

According to photographer Riccardo Mestre, the latest Nike KD 18 colorway takes inspiration from Durant’s Washington, D.C. birthplace and upbringing in Prince George’s County, Maryland. Referencing the area’s affinity for the retro Air Bakin basketball shoe, Durant’s new KD 18 is colored with a bright red-and-black upper which features contrasting yellow shoelaces.

Watch on FN

Mestre shared detailed images of the shoes on social media, including one styled after Nike’s “1-800” ads from the ‘90s.

Nike KD 18 ‘Air Bakin’ (1-800 ad). @uninstructedvision

The clashing color look was a signature detail of the Air Bakin, which, like the Air Terra Humara, was originally released in ’97. In the NBA, the Air Bakin was most memorably worn by Tim Hardaway while he was a member of the Miami Heat. Touted by Nike as being lightweight and breathable while still durable, the Air Bakin featured a mesh-based upper and heel Air Max cushioning.

The original Nike Air Bakin ‘1-800’ ad. Nike

Not without controversy, tens of thousands of pairs of the original Air Bakin were recalled in the late ‘90s. The heel of the shoe featured embroidery of an “Air” logo in a font which some believed too closely resembled the word “Allah” in Arabic script. The Council on American-Islamic Relations condemned the design, which reportedly led to Nike attempt to cover up the controversial logo with patches and paint. When that didn’t work, Nike recalled 38,000 pairs of the shoe and issued a formal apology to the Muslim community.

The original black, red and yellow colorway of the Air Bakin was last released in 2014. More recently, streetwear brand Supreme issued two collaborations of the Air Bakin in 2023.

Fans of Durant’s retro-inspired pair will reportedly have a chance to purchase the sneaker at retail. According to Sole Retriever, the Nike KD 18 “Air Bakin” will be released on May 15 for a retail price of $150. Its SKU is HV1992-600 and its full colorway is “Fire Red/Black-Amarillo.”

Nike KD 18 ‘Air Bakin’ (lateral). @uninstructedvision

Nike KD 18 ‘Air Bakin’ (tongue detail). @uninstructedvision

9.content:
This content has been paid for by an advertiser. If you'd like to appear on Highsnobiety, contact: advertising@highsnobiety.com.

This content has been paid for by an advertiser. If you'd like to appear on Highsnobiety, contact: advertising@highsnobiety.com. ( Sponsored Story )

Is it hot in here or is it just Nike's new volcano-themed Air Max 90 sneakers? I'll go with option number two, as Nike has indeed brought the heat with its latest Air Max shoe.

Following a smoking-hot reveal earlier this year, Nike's Air Max 90 "Volcano" sneaker has finally erupted. Translation: the cleverly made Nike shoe is officially here.

But first, let's revisit the design of the "Volcano" Air Max 90, which is — if I may — straight flames.

Expect the classic Air Max 90 sneaker, but make it extra hot like the fiery force of nature (volcanoes, of course!). First, the Air Max 90's signature layered upper gets topped with this nice black volcanic texture and a couple of splashes of blazing orange hues.
