6.title: Another Canvas And Mesh Nike Dunk Low Appears
6.snippet: Nike is adding to its canvas Dunk Low lineup for Spring 2025 with an "Amber Brown" colorway. Tap to see official images.
6.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Can unique material builds bring the Dunk Low out of its lull? Probably not, but there’s nothing stopping Nike from trying regardless. The Beaverton brand is releasing a handful of new styles featuring canvas and mesh for Spring 2025, the latest being this “Amber Brown” edition.

Much like previously-covered “Fossil Rose” and “Terra Brown” colorways, the shoe favors a mesh and canvas build as opposed to Peter Moore’s OG leather construction. Orange canvas overlays give way to a slightly lighter mesh base, while the Swoosh and backtab appear in “Pale Ivory” suede. A canvas tongue tag keeps the theme alive and well, as do unique flat hemp laces.

If you’re a fan, look for these to release via nike.com and retailers in the very near future. Retail is set at $130, which is $15 more than your average GR.

7.title: Nike’s Infamous All-Black Air Force 1 Low Is Getting Even Tougher Thanks to This Material Change
7.snippet: Nike's infamous all-black Air Force 1 Low is getting a tougher new look with a carbon fiber upper. Find out how to buy the sneaker here.
7.content:
All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Footwear News may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes.

The all-black Nike Air Force 1 Low is regarded by many as a sneaker for unsavory types, but it nonetheless carries on with those who disregard the reputation or lean into it. Whether you intend to wear the AF1 for nefarious or innocuous activities, a material change for the infamous shoe will make it a whole lot tougher.

The Nike Air Force 1 Low “Carbon Fiber” sees its namesake material take over the upper while maintaining the all-black look. This makeover is straightforward, as the woven fabric forms the entirety of the upper except for the tongue, which now appears in nylon rather than leather. The sole unit then remains unchanged, while the usual silver-tone lace dubrae also returns.

Although it came much later than the Air Force 1s reign on the hardwood, carbon fiber has now been a feature of many Nike basketball sneakers for some time. The Air Jordan 11 made history as the first basketball sneaker to use carbon fiber in 1995, and that same year also saw it included on the Zoom Flight 95, a shoe you may know best for its midsole’s “bug eyes” and which has also influenced Drake’s Nike Nocta line.

Watch on FN

On the Air Force 1 Low today, carbon fiber may not offer much more in the way of performance — but it could very well end up being more durable than the usual leather.

The Nike Air Force 1 Low “Carbon Fiber” will release February 5 through Nike’s website and select third-party retailers. Pricing is set at $120, which is only $5 more than a normal pair of AF1 Lows.

Shop the Original Nike Air Force 1 Lows

Ian Servantes is a Senior News Editor for Footwear News specializing in sneaker coverage. He’s previously reported on streetwear and sneakers at Input and Highsnobiety after beginning his career on the pop culture beat. He subscribes to the idea that “ball is life” and doesn’t fuss over his kicks getting dirty.

8.title: Nike Store With History of Shoplifting Closes on UES
8.snippet: The Nike Well Collective on Third Avenue is officially closed following long-time shoplifting issues, after over a decade at Third Avenue and 67th Street.
8.content:
The Nike Well Collective on Third Avenue is officially closed following long-time shoplifting issues, after over a decade at Third Avenue and 67th Street. Though it was among the locations that survived Nike’s worldwide COVID shutdown in 2020, a continuous stream of thefts is thought to have shut down for good.

“I thought this was the Nike store,” one passing-by resident exclaimed when Our Town stopped by on Jan. 26.

Not a shred of Nike material remained in the stripped-down shop, replaced by towers of boxes and empty racks. Other than that, what had been the corner sporting-goods store since 2013 was vacant. Even the front signage was removed.

On the official Nike website, the store is still listed, along with its hours. The website lists “Special Hours” from Monday, Jan. 27, to Friday, Jan. 31. Those “Special Hours” are listed as “Closed.” The website claims the store will be open this Saturday at 10 a.m.

While on-site security and Nike store staff declined to comment, and Nike representatives could be not reached, the store does have a history of shoplifting. The New York Post reported in 2023 that shoplifting incidents happened “at least four days a week,” with regular thefts of items worth hundreds of dollars.

One user on Instagram claims the store was robbed multiple times a day and that shoplifters could be seen carrying out handfuls of stolen clothes. Some users are sad to see the store go; others point out how close the 19th Police Precinct House is to the site of the shopliftings.

The property manager, Vornado Realty Trust, could not be reached for comment.

The closing of a Nike store in New York City is not a first for the company. In 2022, it was announced by Complex that the famous SoHo sneaker hub, NikeLab, would close in 2023. Another store, Nike by Flatiron, also closed in 2023.



Across the country, Nike stores have been getting the ax in places like Seattle, Portland and Los Angeles, where losses from shoplifting were reported in excess of $1 million.

It is unknown whether the sports-apparel giant will open a new location in the neighborhood, but for now, the Upper East Side will be without a Nike store.

9.title: Nike's Air Max DN Appears with A "Red Orbit" Patterned Upper
9.snippet: The Nike Air Max DN recently appeared in a 'Dark Smoke Grey/Red Orbit/Sweet Beet' colorway complete with bold patterns across the upper.
9.content:
The Nike Air Max DN might not have taken off exactly how the brand would've liked, but it continues to enjoy a cult-like following.

A special collaboration with Supreme shortly after its debut in 2024 gave the silhouette some cachet, as did co-signs from the likes of Corteiz's Clint419. The bulk of the sneaker's appeal, however, has come from its own merit, as a slew of colorways have allowed people of all style preferences to enjoy the futuristic design. A newly-surfaced 'Dark Smoke Grey/Red Orbit/Black/Sweet Beet' option will surely join rotations of some bold dressers.

Akin to other Air Max DN releases (and the impending Air Max DN8 that'll 'replace' it as the line's marquee product), the unreleased style takes on an eye-catching makeover across its breathable upper. 'Red Orbit' and 'Sweet Beet' come together to form an abstract pattern partly-reminiscent of heat maps and other scientific presentations. The remainder of the shoe keeps things simple in 'Dark Smoke Grey', with Dynamic Air bubbles underfoot deviating in a bold yellow.

Enjoy official photos of the pair ahead. Its inspiration has yet to be disclosed by the brand, but that and a firm Nike.com release date is likely to change by April.

For more from the Nike, Inc. family, check out the Air Jordan 1 '85 'Bred' set to return on Feb. 14 in limited quantities.

0.title: Nike Revives the Iconic Air Force 1 Low 'Linen' in Canvas for Spring 2025
0.snippet: The Nike Air Force 1 Low "Linen" is a name that resonates deeply in sneaker lore. While the leather edition reappeared in 2024 to a somewhat muted reception...
0.content:
The Nike Air Force 1 Low "Linen" is a name that resonates deeply in sneaker lore. While the leather edition reappeared in 2024 to a somewhat muted reception, Nike is doubling down on its legacy with a fresh canvas interpretation set for Spring 2025. This new iteration offers a textured homage to the classic design that first captured hearts decades ago.

Swapping premium tumbled leather for a canvas build; the shoe retains the signature elements that have made the "Linen" colorway legendary. The soft tan upper is the perfect neutral backdrop, while crisp white laces, tongue, and sock liners add balance. Completing the look is the iconic pink detailing on the Swoosh, heel tab, and Nike tongue branding, delivering the unmistakable charm that has defined the "Linen" aesthetic.

Underfoot, the timeless Air Force 1 midsole appears in white, with the "AIR" text highlighted in pink to tie together the colorway. A pink rubber outsole provides the finishing touch, blending seamlessly with the upper for a cohesive design.

1.title: Caitlin Clark's Nike signature shoe is in development, CEO Elliott Hill says
1.snippet: Caitlin Clark's Nike signature shoe is in development, CEO Elliott Hill said in an interview with Fortune.com.
1.content:
Caitlin Clark's Nike signature shoe is in development, CEO Elliott Hill says

Show Caption Hide Caption Iowa women's basketball honored during Iowa football vs. Northwestern Caitlin Clark and members of Iowa women's basketball were honored on field at Kinnick Stadium during the Iowa football vs. Northwestern game.

Caitlin Clark is working on her Nike signature shoe and logo design, Nike CEO Elliott Hill said in a video interview with Fortune.com.

Hill said in the video that Clark was at Nike headquarters recently and confirmed that Clark is "working on her signature shoe that will launch. And we're working on her logo and her design of her logo."

The former Iowa women's basketball star signed an 8-year, $28 million endorsement deal with Nike in April 2024. Since then, fans have been eagerly awaiting an announcement of a Clark signature shoe.

Hill did not say in the video when the Clark shoes will hit the market.

Clark was named Rookie of the Year and All-WNBA with the Indiana Fever last year.

"When we were running just basketball, we never got to the women's opportunity," Hill said in the video. "But by having this small team (at Nike) that is focused on women's basketball, it unlocked, we believe, for the game of basketball but also in product."

Here is the Fortune.com video interview on the magazine's YouTube channel. The conversation about Clark's shoe begins around the 6:20 mark.

2.title: Nike Releases New Line of Strength-Training Goods, Including Grind Dumbbells
2.snippet: Nike is aiming to be an all-around strength-training company.
2.content:
Image Courtesy of Nike

January 26, 2025

Nike has renewed its commitment to going “back to its roots” by releasing a new line of strength-training goods, including the very popular Grind Dumbbells.

In a press release announcement, the athletic wear company revealed that the once-faltering brand is entering a new age with the help of the Nike Grind Dumbbells and the recently announced Nike Strength Shield Curl Bar.

Each dumbbell is made from at least 20% rubber and contains recycled shoe fragments, giving it a distinctive speckled appearance that will add fun to your workout.





Lifters of all skill levels can benefit from the fantastic performance of the Grind Dumbbell, which comes with weights ranging from 2.5 to 50 pounds.

The Strength Shield Curl Bar’s orange hue references Nike’s iconic orange shoebox. It is additionally shielded by industry-leading Cerakote technology to guarantee that it withstands the most demanding gym conditions. Additionally, a 28-millimeter curved shaft lessens wrist strain while enabling alternative grips.

Part of Nike’s Larger Plan

Last month, on his first quarterly analyst call, Nike’s new CEO Elliott Hill committed to cease competing against wholesale partners while making sport “our North Star” again to boost product innovation and marketing reach.





The longtime executive was recruited back in October after a digital-led direct-to-consumer (DTC) push and weak innovation led to market share losses to longstanding competitors (i.e., Adidas, New Balance, and Skechers) and upstarts (On and Hoka). The five near-term reset actions Hill proposed included:

“Ignite our culture through a focus on obsessing sport and getting back to winning.”

“Accelerate a complete product portfolio driven by athlete-insights through sport-led fields of play.”

“Increase investment in our brand to deliver big, bold marketing statement.”

“Invest in and empower our teams in key countries and cities to win the ground game.”

“Elevate the marketplace, through a more premium Nike direct and an unwavering commitment to our wholesale partners.”

Hill asserted that the biggest sportswear company in the world had shed its “obsession with sport” and declared that Nike will shift its product development to meet the gender-specific needs of sport-focused athletes better. He stated, “We will get back to leveraging deep athlete insights to accelerate innovation, design, product creation and storytelling.”

5.title: The CdG Rejuvenation of Nike's Breezy Throwback Runner
5.snippet: COMME des GARÇONS HOMME Plus debuts a Nike Air Rejuven8 sneaker collaboration for the Fall/Winter 2025 season.
5.content:
With a new COMME des GARÇONS Homme Plus presentation comes new Nike sneakers. The CdG sub-label recently presented its Fall/Winter 2025 collection titled "To Hell With War," featuring a classic CdG take on Nike's Air Rejuven8 sneaker.

That's the sneaker, by the way, and not the new cushy ReactX Rejuven8 clog, or as I like to call it, Swoosh "Crocs."

Nike's Air Rejuven8 sneaker, on the other hand, starred in the 2008 Beijing Olympics. The sportswear giant made special versions just for the big games, with LeBron James and Kobe Bryant scoring their own pairs.

The Nike Rejuven8 shoes are pretty interesting in terms of their design, featuring this breezy lattice cage and an inner bootie. CdG preserves the OG design for its upcoming collaboration (well, more some its essence). The CdG versions ditch the bootie detail, while the "netting" follows a more web-like structure with Nike's Flymesh material.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

A few Swooshes are stamped throughout the shoe, joined by CdG Homme Plus branding on the heel and insoles. And in true CdG fashion, the Nike Rejuven8 sneakers come in classic black and white colorways, as seen with the label's other Nike collabs.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

In addition to the Nikes, CdG revealed first looks at a New Balance 509 sneakers and a Junya Watanabe MAN x New Balance 471 team-up. There's also a new BLACK COMME des GARÇONS x Nike Field General, finished with another allover pattern like those super exclusive pairs from last year.

In short, CdG's fall season is looking pretty stacked and busy with sneaker collaborations — a good thing for the brand's most diehard fans.

6.title: Nike CEO confirms Caitlin Clark's signature shoe project, release date still unknown
6.snippet: It's official: a Caitlin Clark signature shoe with Nike is in the works.In an interview with Fortune, Nike CEO Elliott Hill said that Clark is"working on...
6.content:
It's official: a Caitlin Clark signature shoe with Nike is in the works.

In an interview with Fortune, Nike CEO Elliott Hill said that Clark is "working on her signature shoe that will launch. And we're working on her logo and her design of her logo" and paid a visit to the Nike Headquarters recently.

In April of 2024, the Iowa basketball superstar signed an 8-year, $28 million endorsement deal with Nike.

When we were running just basketball, we never got to the women's opportunity," Hill said in the . "But by having this small team (at Nike) that is focused on women's basketball, it unlocked, we believe, for the game of basketball but also in product.

Hill did not disclose when the shoes will be hitting the market.

7.title: Nike CEO says Caitlin Clark signature shoe, logo are in development
7.snippet: Nike CEO Elliott Hill told Fortune magazine Fever star Caitlin Clark visited headquarters this month to continue development on signature shoe.
7.content:
Nike CEO says Caitlin Clark signature shoe, logo are in development

Show Caption Hide Caption Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark's economic impact on Indy and WNBA Dr. Ryan Brewer, associate professor of finance at Indiana University Columbus, talks Indiana Fever Star Caitlin Clark's economic impact.

The Caitlin Clark signature shoe is coming soon.

In a recently-released interview with Fortune, Nike CEO Elliott Hill said the Fever star was at the shoe company's headquarters in Beaverton, Ore., earlier this month to continue development on her signature shoe.

"We had Caitlin Clark today," Hill told Fortune. "... We're working on her signature shoe that will launch, and we're working on her logo and that design."

Hill did not say when Clark's shoe or logo would launch.

Clark, the 2024 No. 1 pick and WNBA Rookie of the Year, was sponsored by Nike throughout her college career, and signed a new eight-year, $28 million deal with Nike after she was drafted in April 2024. At the time, it was the largest sponsorship contract for a women's basketball player.

"Having a small team that's focused on women's basketball, it unlocked, we believe, opportunities for the game of basketball and also in product," Hill said. "It becomes an opportunity to grow the overall marketplace by inviting more and more girls into the world of sports. It is an area we'll continue to invest in with tremendous momentum right now."

Clark is one of three active WNBA players that have a signature shoe deal with Nike, joining the New York Liberty's Sabrina Ionescu and the Las Vegas Aces' 3-time MVP A'ja Wilson.

Ionescu's first signature shoe launched in September 2023, three years after she was drafted in 2020. Her second signature shoe, the Sabrina 2, launched in June 2024. Wilson's shoe will release sometime in 2025, which is seven years after she was drafted in 2018.

The Liberty's Breanna Stewart also has a signature shoe with Puma that released in 2022, and the Chicago Sky's Angel Reese, who was in Clark's 2024 draft class, will release her signature shoe with Reebok in 2026.

8.title: Deion Sanders' signature Nike Air Diamond Turf 1 sells out in minutes
8.snippet: His iconic Nike Air Diamond Turf 1, reintroduced in its original 1994 design, sold out within minutes of its online release on Friday morning.

9.title: Devin Booker unveils Aspen Corner ‘Book 1,’ third colorway honoring Arizona’s high country
9.snippet: Devin Booker on Saturday debuted the Aspen Corner edition of his Nike Book 1 shoe in a Phoenix Suns win over the Washington Wizards.
9.content:
Devin Booker on Saturday debuted the Aspen Corner edition of his Nike Book 1 shoe in a Phoenix Suns win over the Washington Wizards.

Devin Booker’s new Arizona-inspired Nike Book 1, dubbed “Aspen Corner,” draws inspiration from Flagstaff’s Aspen trees, which turn yellow in the fall 🍁 pic.twitter.com/BQuo0LsWot — Nice Kicks (@nicekicks) January 26, 2025

It’s the third colorway in the “No Service” pack where each shoe is named after an area in Arizona’s high country, which Booker often returns to during offseasons to get a break from the populous city and avoid Valley summers.

“I go up to Flag every time the leaves turn over and go check that out,” Booker told reporters postgame. “Any bits of stories I can give to the fans or my people without just telling them or yelling in their face, I like to do it.”

Previous editions were named after Sedona and Flagstaff, and the Aspen Corner model stayed true to the theme with the silhouette of Arizona’s tallest peak — Humphrey’s Peak near Flagstaff — on the tongue under the “Book” logo.

“When they told me I was getting a shoe, I was like, ‘What’s a better way to tell stories?’ Because, you know, I don’t really talk that much. So I’d rather just tell stories through different ways like that,” Booker said. “And I think, each story having a shoe, people are finding the connections.”

Will the Aspen Corner colorway be available to purchase?

While the Sedona edition dropped on Jan. 1 at $140 and the Flagstaff colorway is expected to be released to the public on Feb. 13 retailing at $150, the Aspen Corner color will be a player-exclusive version meant for Booker only, according to Sneaker News.

0.title: Official Images // Nike Pegasus 41 x Doernbecher Freestyle “Tima”
0.snippet: Nike is bringing another inspiring story to life with the Doernbecher Freestyle “Tima” edition of the Pegasus 41. Designed by young patient Tima, this […]
0.content:
Nike is bringing another inspiring story to life with the Doernbecher Freestyle “Tima” edition of the Pegasus 41. Designed by young patient Tima, this feline-inspired sneaker is a heartfelt tribute to his love for his cat, Murka, and the people who have supported him through his journey.

The Pegasus 41 "Tima" showcases a vibrant palette of tropical colors, chosen to honor Tima’s bone marrow donor, who resides in Florida. This personal connection is further highlighted by her name on the lace tips, alongside the date of his transplant — a touching nod to the life-saving gift she provided. The shoe’s design is filled with playful and creative elements, reflecting Tima’s personality and his affection for Murka. Glow-in-the-dark paw prints trail across the upper, while a fuzzy lace patch modeled after his favorite cat stuffie adds a tactile and whimsical touch. The outsole features a large paw print, tying the feline theme together perfectly. Murka even makes an appearance, seen hanging playfully off Nike’s iconic Swoosh logo.

The Doernbecher Freestyle program, which began in 2003, offers young patients from Oregon Health & Science University’s Doernbecher Children’s Hospital the opportunity to design their own Nike sneakers. Each release tells a unique story of courage, creativity, and resilience, and Tima’s Pegasus 41 is no exception.

Expect the Nike Pegasus 41 x Doernbecher Freestyle “Tima” to release on January 25th via Nike and select retailers as part of the Doernbecher Freestyle collection. Proceeds from the collection will benefit the hospital, continuing to support groundbreaking care and life-saving treatments for young patients like Tima.

1.title: What’s Your Major? Some Say ‘Sports’ Should Be an Acceptable Answer.
1.snippet: The idea of offering a degree in sports has gained momentum now that college athletes can be paid. Now Nike is joining some academics in pushing for it to...
1.content:
For decades, a small but passionate group of academics has offered a potential balm for the fraught relationship between athletics and education at major universities: Allow students to major in sports.

One such educator is David Hollander, a clinical professor at New York University’s School of Professional Studies. He has spent years espousing the intellectual value of basketball — positionless play, he says, can teach entrepreneurial thinking, and fast breaks can teach interpersonal communication. Mr. Hollander lobbied for the Catholic Church to name a patron saint of basketball (it did) and helped convince the United Nations to declare Dec. 21 World Basketball Day.

Within the next year, in what he sees as a small step in the road toward athletics being taken seriously in the academy, Mr. Hollander is planning to teach a course for varsity, Olympic and professional athletes in which their experiences playing and practicing their sport will be part of the curriculum.

“You can get a degree right now in higher education, in dance and art and music, drama,” Mr. Hollander said. “And I think those are totally valid degrees. They’re portals into the human condition.”

2.title: Suns' Devin Booker channels Forrest Gump in Nike ad, has a shoe giveaway across Phoenix
2.snippet: The Phoenix Suns three-time All-Star Devin Booker premiered his new Nike "Book 1" signature shoe commercial on Instagram Friday.
2.content:
Suns' Devin Booker channels Forrest Gump in Nike ad, has a shoe giveaway across Phoenix

Show Caption Hide Caption Nick Richards goes over what it has been like to adjust to the Suns New Phoenix Suns center Nick Richards explains his transition to the Suns. He is 2-1 to start his Suns career, averaging 11 points and 10 rebounds.

Run, Book, run!

Phoenix Suns star Devin Booker released his new Nike Book 1s "Forrest Gump" shoe edition on Friday. In the shoe's commercial released on his Instagram story Friday, Booker did an amusing voiceover emulating the 1994 Academy Award-winning film's lovable protagonist Gump and his memorable Southern drawl.

"It turned out good, huh?" Booker said when he was asked about the voiceover during the Suns' shootaround Saturday.

This is the second official Nike ad for his shoe. The Book 1s' first TV ad was in April 2024.

The low-cut 'Forrest Gump' shoe colorway is inspired by the Nike Cortez model's white and red colorway originally released in 1972. Those are one of nearly 20 different Book 1 shoe colorways since the first pair came out in February last year.

The ad re-enacted multiple scenes with Booker's face seamlessly blended over the face of Tom Hanks, who played Gump in the original film. One of the scenes shows Booker being given a pair of his shoes by the film's fictitious wife "Jenny," played by actor Robin Wright.

The ad closes with Booker dressed up in Gump's long beard and tattered Bubba Gump shirt -- with a mob of people following him on his cross-country run that ended on the landmark Highway 163 in Monument Valley, Arizona.

His teammate Royce O'Neale called the ad spot "hilarious," and fans raved about it on social media. However, O'Neale made a flippant dig at Booker saying "he got some work to do" regarding his voice-acting skills.

"It was funny," Booker said. "It was a great reaction, too. Everything turned out well."

Booker also showed clips on his IG story of his "Gump" shoes with his autograph and inscription that read "Finders Keepers" across Phoenix. In the form of an Easter egg hunt, he placed a few pairs in random locations, including a bus stop along Camelback Road, downtown at McKinley Avenue and under a trailer in front of the Footprint Center.

He's done the same thing in early January upon the release of his pink "Sedona" shoe edition at Red Rock State Park at a McDonald's restaurant in Sedona. When his shoe's initial "Mirage" editions were released during the 2024 Indianapolis All-Star Weekend, some were placed on a pedestrian signal.

"I think that was actually the first one in the Phoenix area, and there's people running all over for them," Booker said. "Something I plan to continue to do in the future."

Booker said earlier this season that giving the shoes away hand-to-hand is "the best way to do it" for his grassroots marketing campaign. He repeated that message at the shootaround Saturday.

"Nothing's better than free shoes," Booker said. "I know that as a kid growing up. And it just makes everybody feel involved. I've seen people reaching out to me that were late to the shoes that still had a family experience of trying to hunt them down and move throughout the city and get outside a little bit."

3.title: The Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus Takes A Price Cut, Debuts On February 7th
3.snippet: The Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus is scheduled to release in February with a $150 MSRP. Tap in for a closer look and official images.
3.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The Nike LeBron business is at a unique juncture. The signature models, despite drawing attention from hoopers worldwide, may be priced too high relative to the market as full size runs for every LeBron 22 colorway are currently sitting, bound for markdowns. There isn’t much promise around the Retro business either, because Nike already ran through the most popular models in recent years.

One strategy has been to combine those two streams into one. The LeBron NXXT Gen depicts that new-meets-old package, capturing the Air Zoom Generation essence with modern performance and design touches. Worn by Bron, his son, and several NBA players, the NXXT Gen series certainly has promise as long as the brand keeps the consumer in mind.

Sneaker News debuted a first look at the LeBron NXXT GENISUS last November revealing two upcoming colorways for Spring 2025. Keeping to the NXXT Gen AMPD style with the double-Swoosh uppers, the GENISUS features a simplified upper while staying reliant to a patterned upper across four colorways. Official images of four pairs reveal a color theme to each; the red pair features a thermometer in water, the black/grey boasting a crown and crossbones, the platinum violet alluding to science, and the teal featuring the crown floating in water.

As of the publishing of this article, the “Platinum Violet” and “Teal” colorways are confirmed to release at Nike Basketball retailers on February 7th, 2025. The remaining two colorways are expected sometime this Spring 2025 season. All four versions carry an MSRP of $150, which is a $20 reduction from the LeBron NXXT Gen model.

Devin Booker and Nike are releasing a new colorway for the Book 1, honoring Arizona once again. Named “Flagstaff,” the latest shoe arrives in a deep green hue that pays tribute to the city which is known for its iconic ponderosa pine forests. The color is a nod to the sprawling forests and the greenery, pointing at the natural beauty of Flagstaff. The shoe’s upper is covered in a topographic print to represent the area’s rugged terrain. The shoe’s tongue tag comes in a blend of colors to show off Arizona’s sunsets and are complemented by the embroidered Swooshes. Texts like “No Service” and “Flagstaff” are seen as heel details, another nod to the remote nature and serenity of the landscape. The shoe sits atop a gum outsole to round out the design.

6.title: Nike Is Releasing Even More ‘It’s Not Me, It’s You’ Valentine’s Day Break-Up Sneakers
6.snippet: Between its Nike Sportswear retro offerings and Jordan Brand's Air Jordan line, Nike, Inc. has a slew of Valentine's Day-themed sneakers in the works for...
6.content:
Between its Nike Sportswear retro offerings and Jordan Brand’s Air Jordan line, Nike, Inc. has a slew of Valentine’s Day-themed sneakers in the works for February. One such pair is a Nike Air Max 1 which takes a decidedly opposite approach to the holiday’s usual sentiments.

Rather than celebrating relationships, this year’s Valentine’s Day Air Max 1 embraces break-ups and being single. First seen in a metallic pink colorway during December’s SNKRS Showcase preview, the shiny sneakers are inspired by mylar foil balloons. In addition to the all-pink pair that debuted during the SNKRS Showcase, the sneakers later surfaced in white, which revealed yet another detail: printed shoelaces that read “it’s not me, it’s you.”

More from Footwear News

Nike Air Max 1 ‘It’s Not Me, It’s You’ shoelaces. Nike

Now, a third entry into the collection has emerged in black and pink. The color blocking of this pair echoes the white version with an all-black upper and Swoosh logos which alternate from metallic pink on the lateral to metallic red on the medial side. The laces come with removable balloon-shaped “NIKE” letters and the same printed shoelaces seen on the white and pink pairs.

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

A closer look at the laces for the pairs shows that the phrasing appears to alternate between “it’s not me, it’s you” and “it’s not you, it’s me.” Official product images for the white pair included laces which solely read “it’s not me, it’s you,” so it’s possible that multiple shoelaces will be included in the packaging — or that each phrase is printed on the opposing sides of the laces.

An official release date for the Nike Air Max 1 “Valentine’s Day” pack has not been confirmed on SNKRS, but readers can expect the shoes to arrive at retailers in early February.

8.title: Where are the Nike Air Jordan VI's from Batman Returns?
8.snippet: Props wander off movie sets all the time, inevitably becoming pieces of cinema history. The Nike Air Jordan VI's from Batman Returns are some of the most...
8.content:
Fans have always sought out movie memorabilia for the satisfaction of owning a part of pop culture history. Be the prop insignificant or something as grandiose as the Batmobile, bids will accrue. One prop that's been elusive and a grand prize to comic book fans everywhere are the Air Jordan VI's worn by Michael Keaton in Batman Returns.

In 1989's Batman, Nike came in to design a pair of Air Jordans for the Caped Crusader. Warner Bros. grafted on accents to make the basketball-style shoes more akin to boots. They replicated the design for Batman Returns, except for that movie, the design team crafted boot collars and shin guards to go along with the base shoe.

On the set of Batman Returns | Sunset Boulevard/GettyImages

What's interesting is where the shoes wound up after production wrapped. They were seemingly lost to dealers over the years and eventually came up on an eBay auction. And while that pair goes from owner to owner, at least one other pair is in a celebrity's collection.

Michael Keaton appeared on a fan's podcast to talk all things Batman, going back to his beginnings. During the interview, the Beetlejuice actor spoke about the illustrious Air Jordan VI's from the movie, confirming that Nike came in and designed them just for the production. He concluded his statement by saying he has the boots "stashed away." Such a disclosure would be a massive reveal since memorabilia seekers have focused entirely too much on the 1989 pair when Keaton had the more refined kicks from Batman Returns in his collection.

Sadly, the pricing doesn't sound like they're all that highly sought after. The 2017 auction only got up to $2500—a small sum for a piece of cinematic memorabilia. Perhaps the price is due to only one shoe going up for sale.

On the set of Batman Returns | Sunset Boulevard/GettyImages

As for the pair in Keaton's collection—they may be up for sale, too. He joked about selling them to his podcast host, all in jest, but who's to say Keaton wasn't semi-serious? He'll presumably request a much higher sum than a measly $2500. The fact that they've been in Keaton's possession this whole time would also increase their value. Props gain even more acclaim when a famous person/celebrity owns them.

If we were to estimate the shoe's potential market value, they'd probably be in the twenty-to-thirty-thousand-dollar range. A pair from the 1989 Batman movie went on sale in 2022 for around the same price. As long as they're still in fair condition, they would haul in a fair amount.

Batman (1989) and Batman Returns are currently streaming on MAX.

0.title: Giannis Antetokounmpo Teams Up with Candy Funhouse for All-Star Weekend 2025
0.snippet: The Greek Freak is bringing his sweet tooth to the sneaker world. Just in time for All-Star Weekend 2025, the two-time NBA MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo has […]
0.content:
The Greek Freak is bringing his sweet tooth to the sneaker world. Just in time for All-Star Weekend 2025, the two-time NBA MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo has partnered with Candy Funhouse, the iconic Ontario-based candy retailer, for a vibrant and whimsical take on the Nike Zoom Freak 6.

This playful collaboration infuses the performance basketball sneaker with candy-inspired design elements. The "Lightning" yellow uppers pop against "University Blue" tongues, eyestays, and midsoles, creating a striking color contrast. The visual feast includes candy pink marbled outsoles, jelly-inspired Freak dubraes, and a 3D Candy Funhouse logo on the tongue. The midfoot Swooshes and glazed insole graphics further tie in the sugary theme, prominently featuring Candy Funhouse’s branding.

Fans can expect this eye-catching release to hit shelves in early February, just in time to steal the show during All-Star Weekend in the Bay Area.

Keep an eye on our Nike Release Calendar for updates on this delightful drop!

1.title: The Spaces Where Nike Creates the Future of Sport — NIKE, Inc.
1.snippet: The Willy Wonka factory for innovation. The NASA of sports science. The epicenter of performance-product creation. Athletes, industry leaders, and visiting...
1.content: There’s something magical about putting on a fresh pair of Nike Air shoes, and we think it's thanks to our unique Air technology. In three facilities in the U.S. — two located a mile from Nike World Headquarters — experts on our Air Manufacturing Innovation (Air MI) team make that magic happen. Air MI is where we produce the propriety material that forms our Air units, and where we hold 500-plus patents. It’s also the place where a highly skilled team comes together to build the products that break sport barriers. Inside the facility is a dedicated team led by multiple manufacturing expert functions, eight PhDs and more than 100 engineers across 15 engineering specialties. Air MI custom-builds shoe technology platforms across flexible, scalable production lines to deliver the exact capabilities needed to manufacture the next generation of Air. Our skilled production teammates, trained across the line, ensure we deliver Air units with the highest fidelity and quality.

2.title: Nike Releases Cortez-Style ‘Forrest Gump’ Sneakers: Here’s Where to Score a Pair Online
2.snippet: Nike to re-release Cortez "Forrest Gump" sneakers, Book 1 sneakers, are available to purchase now: Here's where to find and buy a pair online.
2.content:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

After Phoenix Suns all-star Devin Booker debuted the signature sneakers on the court for 30th anniversary of “Forrest Gump” last year, Nike is now releasing the Cortez Book 1s online on Friday, Jan. 24 at 10 a.m. ET/7 a.m. PT.

Priced at $140 at Nike.com, the durable Nike Cortez Book 1 sneakers take their inspiration from the hit 1994 film “Forrest Gump” — which stars Tom Hanks, Robin Wright, Gary Sinise, Sally Field, Mykelti Williamson and others.

The sneakers are designed with pronounced lines and a strong color scheme with responsive traction and cushioning support for additional bounce when playing basketball or just for casual looks — especially if you’re sitting on a park bench waiting for a bus.

Made from a blend of canvas and premium leather for shape, the sneakers feature Nike’s Air Zoom forefoot for speed, absorption and cushion with a zig-zagging pattern at their soles for grippiness and traction on the court.

And since they pay homage to Forrest Gump, Nike Cortez Book 1 sneakers have a classic white and varsity red colorway with just a hint of varsity blue at the soles, while the left shoe has Devin Booker’s nickname “Book” printed on the tongue.

Although there are multiple colorways available, these Nike Cortez sneakers look amazing in iconic Forrest Gump colors from the movie.

Nike Nike Cortez Book 1 ‘Forrest Gump’ Release date: Jan. 24 at 10 a.m. ET/7 a.m. PT Buy Now at Nike.com $140

Meanwhile, the Nike Book 1 come in various other colorways, including “Magic Ember” red and coral, “Barely Grape” purple, “Sunrise” pink and orange, “Rattlesnake” multi-color and others.

The Nike Cortez Book 1 “Forrest Gump” sneakers are unisex, so they come in women’s and men’s sizes for $140. In the meantime, you can shop other Devin Booker sneakers, jerseys and apparel at Nike.com.

Want to watch “Forrest Gump” online? Currently, the movie is available stream on Paramount+ for subscribers only.

Not a subscriber? Sign up for the streaming service starting at $7.99/month. Paramount+ offers a 7-day free trial, so you can watch a few matches for free. After the free trial is up, you can cancel it altogether, or you can keep watching the streaming service for $7.99/month for the basic ad-supported plan. If you want to go ad-free, Paramount+ with Showtime is priced at $12.99/month. This plan includes programming from Showtime.

Paramount+ is the home to hit originals, like “1883,” “Evil,” “Star Trek: Strange New Worlds,” “Halo,” “The Good Fight” and others, while Paramount+ with Showtime features popular TV series, such as “Yellowjackets,” “The Curse,” “Billions,” “Dexter,” “Penny Dreadful” and more. Each plan features classic movies and TV shows from CBS, Paramount, BET, Comedy Central, Nickelodeon, MTV and the Smithsonian Channel, as well as live sports from NFL, NWSL, PGA Tour, Big 10 and other leagues.

3.title: Nike Air Max 1 "Valentine's Day" Pack 2025
3.snippet: Nike's key Valentine's Day offering of 2025 is a trio of Air Max 1s inspired by mylar balloons. A pink and red colorway was unveiled during the most recent...
3.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Updated January 30th, 2025: Release dates for the “Valentine’s Day” Air Max 1s have emerged. The white colorway releases February 1st, and the black and pink colorways release February 7th. All three retail for $160. See official images below and scroll further down the page for our full breakdown.

Original article published January 24th, 2025:

While Jordan Brand plans to release a “Valentine” Jordan 3, Nike’s key Valentine’s Day offering of 2025 is a trio of Air Max 1s inspired by mylar balloons. A pink and red colorway was unveiled during the most recent SNKRS preview, and black and white colorways have since surfaced in the lead-up to February 14th.

Valentine’s Day is a time to celebrate love, but Nike’s trio of Air Max 1s deliver a different message; one you might be familiar with if you’ve been on the receiving end of a break-up convo. The laces feature text reading “It’s not you, it’s me” as well as “It’s not me, it’s you,” two phrases the accomplish the same mission, albeit the latter one is far colder.

Diving into each of the three colorways, the headlining member features glossy pink leather panels over a red mesh base. The black and white colorways are far less eccentric by comparison, but there’s still lots to love. Both looks feature alternating red and pink Swoosh logos on the lateral and medial sides, as well as pink Air units underfoot. All three colorways come with metallic “NIKE” lace dubraes, further tying in with commonly gifted mylar balloons.

The “Valentine’s Day” Air Max 1 pack doesn’t have a release date yet, but all three colorways are expected to arrive in February.

4.title: Deion Sanders, Nike reunite for Air Diamond Turf sneakers: 'Nothing is new under the sun'
4.snippet: Deion Sanders and Nike got back together again to release the NFL Hall of Famer's signature Air Diamond Turf sneakers.
4.content:
Deion Sanders, Nike reunite for Air Diamond Turf sneakers: 'Nothing is new under the sun' The new Deion Sanders Nike Air Diamond Turf 1 sneakers are sold out at various retailers, so buying them on the resell market seems to be the only feasible option at the moment.

NFL Hall of Famer Deion Sanders' signature Air Nike Diamond Turf sneakers are back now that he and the sneaker maker have reconciled and agreed to continue their relationship after years of not seeing eye to eye.

The Air Diamond Turf shoe was released online Friday at 10 a.m. ET for $150 on Nike's website. As of Friday afternoon, the sneakers were sold out on the Nike site and at several other shoe retailers including Finish Line and Sneaker Politics.

"The Air Diamond Turf takes the iconic cross trainer from 1994 and gives it a street-ready refresh," Nike's description for the sneaker says. "This version features Air units in the heel and forefoot, plus durable leather and a midfoot strap for a secure fit. And that colorway? Same as the original."

Nike confirmed the reunion with Sanders, who is now the head football coach at the University of Colorado, in 2023 in an email to USA TODAY Sports. “We welcome Deion Sanders back to the Nike family,” the company said in a statement at the time.

Deion Sanders on his Nike Air Diamond Turf 'Sellout'

In an Instagram post on Friday, Sanders shared a picture of him wearing the sneakers with the caption, "Nothing is new under the sun, I rocked these PRIMES’ & #24 at the Pro Bowl waaay back when. I also heard from @nike that I sold out and I’m sure they weren’t saying imma 'Sellout' they were talking about me 'Selling Out' ! Think about that baby! I’m PRIME! REAL since u 1st heard of ya boy! #CoachPrime."

Why were Deion Sanders and Nike at odds?

Sanders and Nike were at odds for years with the former Atlanta Falcon and Dallas Cowboy telling Complex's Joe La Puma in 2017 that he was "upset with them right now."

"We created these together, but they don’t want to seed me. They don’t want to direct deposit," Sanders told La Puma during the interview.

Sanders' issues with Nike continued into 2019 when he was a guest on a former Complex-owned sneaker talk show, Full Size Run. His gripe with Nike this time stemmed from them not helping fund youth sports leagues, which is something rival brand Under Armour was doing, Sanders said.

“I’ve got to have a plan to sustain the shorties, with the youth leagues and all that, and they weren’t with it,” Sanders said on Full Size Run. “You’ve got to be careful how you treat people because you never know,” he said.

Although Sanders signed with Nike in 1992, he said he's never met Phil Knight, Nike's co-founder and former CEO.

What are Deion Sanders Nike Air Diamond Turf sneakers reselling for?

Since the Air Diamond Turf sneakers are sold out, those looking to grab a pair will have to pay resell prices for them.

Flight Club, a consignment sneaker retailer, is selling the sneakers for more than $200, depending on the size.

Goat and Stock X, both popular online sneaker resell marketplaces, have the Air Diamond Turf sneakers for prices ranging from about $200 to a little over $600, depending on the size.

Contributing: Brent Schrotenboer.

5.title: REI names former Nike exec as new CEO
5.snippet: Mary Beth Laughton, a former Nike executive, will replace Eric Artz, who has been REI's president and CEO since 2019.
5.content:
REI Co-op has tapped Mary Beth Laughton, a seasoned retail executive who has held roles at Nike, Athleta and Sephora, to serve as its next CEO.

Laughton will assume the role of REI’s president on Feb. 3, the retailer announced, before transitioning to full CEO responsibilities on March 31. She succeeds Eric Artz, who has served as REI’s president and CEO since 2019. Artz plans to retire in March, the company said.

“Eric has led and stabilized REI through some of the most challenging years the retail sector and our co-op ever faced,” said Chris Carr, chair of the REI board of directors, in the announcement. Carr added that Laughton “has the ideal experience to build on this foundation and to lead REI forward into our next chapter.”

The leadership change comes as the 87-year-old outdoor retailer works to chart a fresh path following financial challenges after the pandemic.

REI — with 18 million lifetime members — is the largest customer-owned retail co-op in the U.S., according to the National Retail Cooperative Association.

The company ranks No. 58 in the Top 1000, Digital Commerce 360’s database of the largest North American e-retailers by web sales. In the Top 1000, Digital Commerce 360 classifies REI as a Sporting Goods retailer.

REI web sales by year

Who is REI’s new CEO?

Laughton brings with her more than two decades of retail leadership experience, having worked with some of the world’s most recognizable brands.

Most recently, Laughton led Nike’s global direct-to-consumer business, overseeing stores, Nike.com, apps and loyalty programs, according to her LinkedIn profile.

Before joining Nike, Laughton was president and CEO of Athleta, Gap Inc.’s activewear brand, from October 2019 to April 2023.

Laughton also spent over seven years at Sephora, where she held several leadership roles, including executive vice president of omni retail, overseeing both U.S. stores and digital operations.

Her connection to REI predates her new role. Laughton was a member of the co-op’s board of directors from 2017 to 2019. She has also served on the boards of Instacart and Impossible Foods, per her LinkedIn profile.

During the leadership transition at REI, Laughton will visit stores and distribution centers to connect with employees, partners, and community members, the company said.

“From my time on the REI Board, I know how incredibly talented and passionate REI employees are,” Laughton wrote on LinkedIn. “I can’t wait to join them in the next phase of this journey and build on the positive momentum already underway.”

Artz’s leadership and REI’s uphill battle

Artz departs REI after more than a decade. He joined the co-op in 2012 and was named CEO in 2019. Before joining REI, Artz served as chief financial officer at Urban Outfitters and held leadership roles at VF Corp., the parent company of The North Face.

In a letter to employees, Artz expressed gratitude for his time at REI.

“Serving you and this enduring organization has been the honor of my professional life,” Artz said. “Being outside means something different for everyone and our job is not to tell people what that looks like. It is to show one another and to welcome others, always making time outside more accessible to more people in more ways. That is worth fighting for.”

Artz’s tenure included progress on sustainability goals. According to REI, the co-op’s emissions in 2023 were 10% lower than in 2022 and 6% lower than in its 2019 baseline year.

Artz’s time at the company was also marked by financial challenges in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. The co-op reported $3.76 billion in revenue in 2023, a 2.4% decrease from 2022, and a $311 million net loss for the year. According to the company, the loss stemmed from ongoing investments in employee hourly pay, member rewards, and a $169 million non-cash valuation allowance against its deferred tax assets.

Recent layoffs at REI

REI has responded with various cost-cutting strategies, including layoffs. Earlier this month, the co-op announced it would discontinue its REI Experiences program, which offered outdoor classes, tours, and adventure travel. The decision resulted in the elimination of 428 jobs.

Despite the setbacks, REI remains optimistic about its financial outlook. Earlier this week, the company said it is on track to achieve its 2024 goals of break-even operating profit and near-break-even free cash flow, describing them as “a significant improvement” over 2023.

The company added: “As REI moves through this transition, the board and executive leadership team remain focused on ensuring stability for its employees, members, and partners while building on the growth the co-op saw at the end of 2024.”

7.title: Nike's 'Forrest Gump' Sneakers Aren't Like a Box of Chocolates -- You Know Exactly What You're Going to Get
7.snippet: Nike just re-released their iconic Cortez sneaker, now available in varsity red, white, and varsity blue. Find out where to shop it online.
7.content:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Rolling Stone may receive an affiliate commission.

“Run, Forrest, Run!”



If you’ve always wanted to feel like Tom Hanks in the 1994 Academy Award-winning film Forrest Gump, now’s your chance. On January 24, Nike released a special edition of their iconic Cortez sneaker inspired by the film (Hanks is famously seen wearing these shoes during his three-year run), and while you won’t have to travel 15,000 miles to get a pair, you’ll want to act fast.

This release is a collaboration with Phoenix Suns shooting guard Devin Booker. These old-school-cool sneakers are Booker’s first signature basketball shoe (which he debuted on the court last year) and come in a recognizable colorway of white, varsity red, and varsity blue.

Retailing for $140, the ‘Book 1 Forrest Gump’ Cortez sneaker is made with a combination of high-quality real and synthetic leather. It features intricate detailing that pays homage to the original Cortez design, which was first introduced in 1968 by Nike co-founder Bill Bowerman. The sneakers are available in both men’s and women’s sizes, ranging from 4 to 16, and they’re comfortable enough to wear during a cross-country marathon or while sitting in a park sharing your life story (box of chocolates and all).

So, if you don’t want to wait for your “Jenny” to give you “The best gift anyone could get in the wide world,” we suggest snagging a pair now.

8.title: Cherry blossoms blooming on new sakura Air Jordans from Nike【Photos】
8.snippet: For footwear fans, the first thing that springs to mind when they hear “Air Jordans” is basketball. It makes sense, seeing as how the Nike shoe line is...
8.content:
Japanese NBA player collaborates on design that features another symbol of good luck besides sakura.

For footwear fans, the first thing that springs to mind when they hear “Air Jordans” is basketball. It makes sense, seeing as how the Nike shoe line is named after NBA legend Michael Jordan and all.

However, when you see the newest Air Jordan mode, the visual language doesn’t shout “slam dunks” so much as “blooming sakura.”

Cherry blossoms aren’t the only traditionally Japanese motif on these wearable art canvases, either. You’ll also see cranes, a symbol of longevity and prosperity in Japanese culture, which also contribute part of these sneakers’ name: the Air Jordan 1 Low OG Rui Hachimura Cranes.

Of course, you can’t ignore the “Rui Hachimura” part of that name either. A basketball star in Japan since his high school days, Hachimura, born to a Japanese mother and Beninese father, is now a member of the Los Angeles Lakers, and playing at the highest level of the sport has made him a beacon of hope for other Japanese athletes with big hoop dreams. Hachimura and Nike collaborated on the shoes’ design.

In addition to sakura and cranes, the shoes are distinguished by black/metallic gold swoosh and insoles with the letter H, stylized in a manner evocative of Japanese brushstroke calligraphy.

Seeing as how the Air Jordan 1 Low OG Rui Hachimura Cranes are low-tops, Hachimura is unlikely to suit up in them next month during the Lakers/One Piece game night collaboration. However, the stylish and unique design is sure to turn heads whenever and wherever you wear them.

The sakura Air Jordans go on sale January 25, priced at 23,650 yen (US$150), and will be available through the Nike online store here.

Source: Nike via Japaaan

Images: Nike

0.title: Nike 24.7 Apparel Collection Delivers a New Standard of Comfort and Athletic Style — NIKE, Inc.
0.snippet: Nike 24.7 is a new apparel collection featuring Nike material innovation that sets the standard of comfort and elevated athletic style.
0.content:
From sport to life. From mindset to movement. From the daily grind to daily comfort. Nike exists to serve athletes who bring the same energy and focus to everything they do — and need apparel that can keep up, around the clock.

That vision is central to the new Nike 24.7 apparel collection, which is designed to support the athlete’s complete lifestyle, redefining sport style with an elevated, polished look.

Engineered to embody the athlete’s mindset, the collection seamlessly blends life and sport in men’s and women’s apparel that’s versatile and distraction-free, tailored for all-day comfort, style and function.

“Nike Training is dedicated to supporting all athletes to be better — whether for sport or life,” says Jaclyn Safley, GM, Global Nike Training, Women’s. “The Nike 24.7 collection embodies this commitment, delivering unmatched innovation with performance materials, ultimate comfort and an elevated fit thoughtfully crafted for every body and every move.”

Nike 24.7 unveils two new technical materials that pair with the brand’s industry-leading Dri-FIT technology to offer a new standard of comfort in elevated, polished athletic style.

ImpossiblySoft is a refined, Spacer-knit fabric with four-way stretch that offers everyday comfort with a luxurious feel. The material is featured in the Nike 24.7 collection’s women’s and men’s half-zip and crew-neck silhouettes, as well as a women’s jogger and men’s pant.

PerfectStretch is a tailored, four-way stretch fabric that delivers effortless comfort and a polished look and feel. The material is featured in the pleated skirt, wide-leg pant and woven shirt for women, and chino and five-pocket pant for men.

“As an athlete, I want to feel confident, comfortable and strong in what I’m wearing — on and off the track,” says Dina Asher-Smith, sprinter and Nike athlete. “What I wear is more than just clothing. It’s an attitude and a reflection of who I am, and it impacts how I perform.

“The Nike 24.7 collection has truly raised the bar. The fabrics feel and look soft and luxurious, and the tonal branding is beautiful. The pieces have become my new favorites because they blend performance and style in a way that feels really authentic and effortless.”

Pieces from the collection pay homage to Nike’s rich heritage in sport, with locker loops inspired by gear hung to dry in the locker room and internal, heat-pressed product tags featuring the brand’s Total Orange stripe.

Tonal branding throughout the collection allows athletes to seamlessly pair Nike 24.7 pieces for a sleek, sport-style aesthetic. Women’s pieces will come in Western (2XS – 2XL) and Asian (XS – 2XL) sizing, and men’s pants will be available in numeric sizing with slim and standard styles, helping all athletes find a perfect fit.

The Nike 24.7 apparel collection will be available globally January 25 on nike.com and at select retail locations starting January 30.

The silhouette's most recognized outfit might be a special pair dedicated to the New England Patriots' Robert Kraft, but it's maintained relevance over the years thanks to a slew of different colorways. A simple, but eye-catching 'Light Bone' finish is the latest look to land on the modified sneaker. Breathable and durable Flyknit construction across the upper indulges in varying shades of the titular hue, coupling with leather panels along the tongue and profiles to bring heritage to the forefront. Underfoot, Bruce Kilgore's iconic sole unit opts for a slightly-yellowed makeover that falls in line with Nike Sportswear's other faux-aged offerings.

Enjoy official photos of the Flyknit-assisted Air Force 1 below. The pair should arrive via Nike.com by June for $160.

4.title: Official Images Of The Nike Kobe 9 Elite Protro “Masterpiece”
4.snippet: The Nike Kobe signature line has been a powerful vehicle for introducing new design and innovation to basketball. In late 2013, it unveiled the Kobe 9 Elite...
4.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The Nike Kobe signature line has been a powerful vehicle for introducing new design and innovation to basketball. In late 2013, it unveiled the Kobe 9 Elite, an unexpectedly super high-cut sneaker boasting Flyknit uppers for the first time in hoops performance. The debut colorway known as the “Masterpiece” hit retail that following season of Spring 2014, and now eleven years later, this iconic model is set to change the landscape of basketball footwear once again.

Despite being over a decade old, the Kobe 9 Elite still looks ahead of its time. The multi-colored Flyknit created one of the most dazzling uppers in Nike Kobe history, while the signature Eric Avar design touches seem to look better than anything else that’s out in the market today. This forward-thinking design is why the Kobe Retro movement continues to stay strong, and why the future is bright for the fallen hero’s legacy in footwear.

Officially unveiled earlier in January as part of the Year Of The Mamba collection, the Kobe 9 Masterpiece surfaces once more via official brand images. Adult ($240) and GS ($140) sizes have been confirmed to release on February 8th, 2025 via SNKRS and select retailers.

5.title: The Waste Management x Nike Roshe Golf 2 Prickly Pear is Available Now
5.snippet: Waste Management collaborates with Nike Golf for a special Roshe Golf 2 for the Phoenix Open. Find images and release info for this Prickly Pear edition...
5.content:
Updated on February 5, 2025 • Published January 23, 2025

Waste Management x Nike Roshe Golf 2 Prickly Pear Buy at Nike

Buy now

Nike Golf division has been on a tear over the past few years. Even with the absence of their longtime face, Tiger Woods, leaving in 2024 to start his brand, Sun Day Red, the resurgence in the sport has kept The Swoosh on top of its game. As we near the second month of 2025, one of the first PGA Tour events of the year, the Waste Management Phoenix Open (WMPO), is set to take place. With that, Nike and Waste Management have joined forces to follow up on their successful collaboration from the year prior.

Waste Management has put its unique twist on the Nike Roshe Golf 2 for this year's collaboration. This release marks the debut of the Roshe Golf 2, which looks identical to previous Roshe Golf shoes but has some slight differences. Dubbed Prickly Pear, the Waste Management x Nike Roshe Golf 2 comes in a cactus-themed key lime, light green spark, barely volt, active fuchsia, and black colorway.

Inspired by the cacti found around the course located in the Sonoran Desert off the fairways and greens, the shoe plays fun on the fact that if you hit the ball out of bounds, you might encounter cacti or even scorpions as you enter the hazard and succumb to the penalty. An embroidered green cactus Swoosh adorns the sides to remind you of the elements that sound you, should you veer off course. Inside, the sockliner is lined in leather for plush comfort, while custom-printed insoles further the warning of what lurks out of bounds.

A custom sticker accompanying the sneakers alerts golfers that "venture into the prickly pears at your own peril and put your shot back where it belongs in this special Roshe Golf 2." The joke here is that only the best survive the Phoenix Open, and if you mess with the elements that lurk around the fairways, be careful. Also, get your golf game better so you don't have to worry about what might happen.

The Waste Management x Nike Roshe Golf 2 Prickly Pear is set to release on February 5, 2025, through Waste Management, Nike, SNKRS, and select retailers online and in-store. 6.title: Nike's new CEO on the moment he knew things were really bad
6.snippet: When Elliot Hill took over as Nike's CEO, he knew the company was struggling, but one moment apparently made it clear just how bad things had become.
6.content:
When Elliot Hill took over as Nike’s CEO, he knew the company was struggling, but one moment apparently made it clear just how bad things had become.

DraftKings CEO on March Madness, AI, and the future of sports gambling CC Share Subtitles Off

English view video DraftKings CEO on March Madness, AI, and the future of sports gambling

DraftKings CEO on March Madness, AI, and the future of sports gambling CC Share Subtitles Off

English DraftKings CEO on March Madness, AI, and the future of sports gambling

It was December 2024, at the AT&T Stadium (T+1.59% ) in Dallas, when Hill said he realized the extent of the crisis. Nike (NKE-1.67% ) had secured a crucial contract extension with the NFL for its uniforms, narrowly avoiding the loss of one of its most important partnerships, Fortune first reported.



Advertisement

“Roger was my first phone call when I took over,” Hill told the magazine, referring to NFL commissioner Roger Goodell.

Advertisement

Though Nike had dodged a major blow, nearly losing the deal to a competitor helped Hill see the scale of the sportswear giant’s crisis — and the bigger picture was grim. Nike faced its worst year in decades in 2024. Sales had dropped globally, and the stock had fallen nearly 60% from its 2021 highs. The sportswear giant’s troubles weren’t just financial; they were cultural and strategic.

Advertisement

Former CEO John Donahoe’s aggressive push into e-commerce had backfired. In April 2024, he stated that he was fed up with remote work and that a “boldly disruptive shoe” couldn’t be made on Zoom. In a push to boost online sales, Nike severed ties with major retailers, including Macy’s, DSW (DBI+3.70% ), and Foot Locker (FL+0.45% ). Meanwhile, Nike laid off hundreds of employees, including senior executives.

Advertisement

Hill, who has over 30 years of experience at Nike, seemed to waste no time confronting the issues. During a December earnings call, he laid out a plan on the company’s core – sport and performance – and to repair damaged retailer relationships. The road to recovery won’t be quick, but Hill has emphasized the importance of a long-term strategy over short-term pain.

Wall Street, though cautious, shared similar sentiments and remained optimistic about Hill’s leadership, given his role in growing Nike to over $39 billion in annual revenue. When the company reported its second-quarter earnings, results came in better than expected.

Advertisement

Nike’s current plan is to pivot. The company is cutting back on taste-making street teams across 12 cities globally, and leaning on Air Jordan and Dunk nostalgia. Sneaker innovation, once a key driver, has taken a backseat, according to Fortune.

Whether AI will play a role, or how President Donald Trump’s looming tariffs may impact this pivot, remains to be seen.

Advertisement

Looking ahead, Nike is also focusing on personalized gear and unearthing new ways to connect with consumers in the age of social media. Whether AI will play a role, or how President Donald Trump’s looming tariffs may impact this pivot, remains to be seen.

7.title: The Nike Roshe Comeback Hasn’t Made Much Noise — but This Edition for a Golf Tournament Could Change That
7.snippet: Nike's Roshe Golf 2 Prickly Pear special edition for the Waste Management Phoenix Open may cast the sneaker in a new light. Find out how to buy here.
7.content:
Nike’s Roshe Run may be the sneaker with the most extreme journey through hype and mockery. The shoe was widely praised at first for its simplicity, approachable price point and fluidity for different colorways. But once the word got out, the adoption by folks far removed from sneaker culture killed the appeal — and the Roshe has never really recovered, even after being brought back out of the archives in 2023.

The WMPO x Nike Roshe Golf 2 “Prickly Pear” could be the version of the sneaker that once again shifts the perspective on it. Made for the Waste Management Phoenix Open in February, this cactus-themed Roshe features a fuzzy green upper with wales that looks a lot like corduroy. Embroidered spikes appear throughout as part of a largely tonal green makeup, while the Swoosh gets its own texture to invoke cacti along with a black outline and spikes. A pink outsole features a tread tailored to the golf course, and on one of the insoles you’ll find a scorpion graphic atop the Nike Golf logo.

For last year’s Phoenix Open, Nike leaned into the sponsor rather than the location by making a Pegasus ’89 Golf that looked like it was made out of trash. In 2019 and 2020, grass-like uppers also graced the Air Max 1 and Air Max 97, respectively, making the tournament a sleeper occasion for themed releases.

Watch on FN

The WMPO x Nike Roshe Golf 2 “Prickly Pear” will release February 5, the day before the tournament begins, through Nike’s website. Pricing is set at $110.

About the Author:

Ian Servantes is a Senior News Editor for Footwear News specializing in sneaker coverage. He’s previously reported on streetwear and sneakers at Input and Highsnobiety after beginning his career on the pop culture beat. He subscribes to the idea that “ball is life” and doesn’t fuss over his kicks getting dirty.

8.title: Shop Nike sales while you can. The new CEO says they're cutting down on promotions.
8.snippet: This spring, Nike will be cutting back on promotional sales throughout the year, new CEO Elliott Hill told Fortune.
8.content:
Nike is aiming for a retail comeback by reducing discounts and focusing on full-price sales.

CEO Elliott Hill plans to shift away from heavy discounting strategies.

Nike will prioritize running, basketball, training, football, and sportswear categories.

Nike is trying to make a comeback in the retail space. Its new approach involves offering fewer discounts.

Veteran employee Elliott Hill took over as CEO of the sports giant in October 2024. Hill had left in 2020 after over 30 years at the company, and the Nike he returned to was struggling to regain its former dominance in-store. Sales were also falling.

Nike's plans include walking back some previous business strategies, like offering discounts or shifting its attention away from its relationships with wholesalers.

That will mean fewer markdowns on Nike styles, starting this spring, as the company strives to provide an "elevated" experience for shoppers, Hill said during an interview with Fortune.

Hill told Fortune that Nike has become "too promotional," and it's hurting the business. Nike started the fiscal year with a 50-50 split of full-price and discounted items, he said during the second-quarter 2025 earnings call in December.

"Being premium also means full price. We'll focus on promotions during traditional retail moments, not at the consistent levels we are today," Hill said then.

He told Fortune that discounting is "not great for margin; it's not great for the brand; it's not great for our wholesale partners."

In the months since he became CEO — succeeding John Donahoe — Nike has also made it clear that it's getting back to its roots as an athletic wear brand.

In the future, Nike will prioritize five categories: running, basketball, training, football, and sportswear. Hill told Fortune he'll work to repair relationships with wholesale retailers after Nike distanced itself from them to focus on its direct-to-consumer business.

0.title: The best Nike shoes for your feet, according to a podiatrist
0.snippet: We spoke with experts, combed through product reviews and sourced recommendations from Shop TODAY staffers to determine the best Nike shoes and accessories.
0.content:
Since its founding in 1964, Nike's shoes have been a top pick for athletes, fitness enthusiasts and everyday comfort seekers. The brand's signature swoosh can be seen everywhere from basketball courts and major marathons to elementary school playgrounds.

In fact, in a 2021 report of the top global sneaker brands from shoe news site Sole Supplier, Nike easily secured the No. 1 spot (and ranked at No. 2 as well, with its Jordan line). All that's to say, there's no denying that Nike is a global superpower, and its sneakers are known for being sleek, on-trend and high-quality.

But since our team is always on the lookout for shoes that will feel just as good on our feet as they look, we had to know: Are Nike shoes good for your feet? A podiatrist shares everything you need to know, below.

Are Nike shoes good for your feet? | The best Nike shoes for your feet | Why are Nike Air Jordans so popular? | Nike sneaker accessories | How we chose | Meet our experts

Are Nike shoes good for your feet?

One of the best things about Nike is that they offer a wide variety of shoes at different price points, especially when it comes to sports shoes. "They definitely do rule the market in basketball shoes and cleats," says Dr. Priya Parthasarathy, a podiatrist in Silver Spring, Maryland. "There's so much variety, especially for kids and basketball players, and at a better price point than their competitors."

While Nike isn't a brand that Parthasarathy recommends in her practice, as some of their shoes don't offer enough structure or support, that doesn't mean that they don't have some good options for people who are enticed by the brand. Generally, Nike's shoes tend to be pretty narrow — the sleek design is part of what adds to the appeal — so, she says "If you have a narrow foot, you would find them more comfortable."

Two specific styles that she calls out as being good options for those hoping to add a pair of Nike sneakers to their closet are the brand's Pegasus and Tempo sneakers. "Both of them have good shock absorption and responsiveness when running," Parthasarathy says. She adds that those can also be good options for anyone looking for a walking or everyday sneaker. Plus, because the upper is made of mesh as opposed to leather, "that makes it breathable," she adds. "And although the toe box is narrow at least it will give you a little bit more room."

To check to see if any given pair of sneakers are supportive enough, Parthasarathy recommends doing a fold test. "If the front of the shoe can touch the back of the shoe, then they are not supportive enough."

Here, some of the best shoes from the brand, according to experts.

The best Nike shoes for your feet

The latest version of Nike’s Pegasus sneakers, the shoes are said to have medium cushioning and high responsiveness to provide a springy feel with each step. Compared to the previous versions, the brand says that this model features improved comfort and responsive midsoles. They also come in a wide version, for those who are concerned that the shoe might be too narrow.

Shop TODAY's deputy editorial director Alexandra Deabler owns a previous model of these sneakers. "I love these shoes," she says. She originally bought a pair in 2017 because they were on sale. And then, in 2020, when it came time to buy a new pair of shoes, she tried multiple brands and pairs and still, these were her top choice. "As soon as I put them on, it felt like I was coming home. They have the right amount of cushion and toe box width. Just a good basic sneaker you can wear walking or running."

These sandals are said to combine the cushioned sole of a running sneaker with the trendy style of a slide, so you get the best of both worlds.

"I’ve had these sandals for three or four years now and I won’t let them go until they absolutely fall apart," shares associate SEO editor Kamari Stewart. "These are some of my favorite sandals for summer because they work with everything, in my opinion. I’ve worn these for long days in Disney in the middle of the summer and I was the only person whose feet didn’t hurt by the end of the day."

“I used to train with the wrong lifting shoes years ago and the difference it has made has changed my workouts forever,” fitness influencer Sophie Sanguedolce previously told us about switching to Nike's Metcon shoes. “I now feel more mind to muscle connection when using Nike Metcons on lower body days, less back pain from trying to stabilize myself, and I have better form for those reasons as well since I can control the movement of my lifts more.”

Made to be worn during a range of activities, from cardio to weightlifting, they feature a lightweight foam material that the brand says won't weigh you down.

The men's version of the Pegasus 40 running shoes won a TODAY Wellness Award in 2023. They're said to provide responsive cushioning, so your steps feel springy and light as you run.

Why are Nike Air Jordans so popular?

In 1984, Nike gave up-and-coming basketball star Michael Jordan his own line of clothing and shoes, signing a $500,000-per-year contract with the athlete, a record-breaking number at the time. The first style under the Jordan brand, the Nike Air Jordan 1, debuted in 1985 and in just a few months Nike had sold $70 million worth of the shoes, ESPN reported. Through the years, the popularity of the Jordan brand has only grown, with iterations being named the most important and influential sneakers of all time by multiple publications while attracting a legion of celebrity fans.

The brand's long history in pop culture and status as a collector's item seems to help with its timeless popularity. Earlier this year, a pair of Michael Jordan's own Nike Air Jordan 13 sneakers became the most expensive sneakers ever sold, going for $2.2 million in an auction.

While there is now a range of styles and options that the Jordan line offers, from an expert standpoint, the classic shoes are probably better suited for the court than for being an everyday sneaker. "They're really made for basketball players," Parthasarathy says. Though the one big benefit of the shoes off the court would be that they could be helpful for anyone with weak ankles, as the mid-height collar could provide extra support. "I think that they're absolutely fine for basketball, because they're a mid-height shoe which provides stability around the ankle. And I'm sure that those shoes would not fold in half and provide some good arch support and traction on the court. But, again, we want to watch out for the width because some people can have issues with their baby toes rubbing against the shoe, especially with the lateral movement of basketball. So you want to make sure that they fit well."

Nike sneaker accessories

Sneaker Cleaner $ 6.99 Amazon What we like Portable size

Easy to use Something to note May need to use brush

Nike sneakers are an investment, so you want to keep them looking their best for as long as possible. If you do notice some dirt or scuffing, you can tackle any problem areas with this popular sneaker cleaning solution. Designed to remove dirt, grass, stains and grime, the brand says that it can be used on rubber, canvas and leather sneakers.

Shoe Cleaner Kit $ 18.97 $ 29.97 Amazon What we like No. 1 bestseller

Works on a variety of fabrics

A little goes a long way Something to note May need more than one wash

For tougher stains, this bestselling cleaning kit comes with a brush so you can give your shoes a good scrub. The brand says that you only need a few drops of the cleaning concentrate to see results, and it's designed to work on all washable shoes (the company specifically calls out Nike and Jordans).

You never really think about how long it takes you to tie your shoes until you're in a rush to get out the door and have to stop to lace up your sneakers. These laces turn will turn your sneakers into slip-ons, so you can throw them on and head out without losing those precious few minutes. I put them on both my casual sneakers and running shoes and was surprised to find that they held firmly in place during runs, HIIT classes and walks.

Float On Air Insoles $ 14.99 Amazon What we like Heel and arch support

Can be trimmed Something to note Wear down quickly

If you aren't completely comfortable in your sneakers, adding an insole could help. And these ones are an affordable pick with more than 7,000 five-star ratings. They're designed to fit all shoes comfortably, according to the brand, and feature cushioned foam and a contoured heel for arch support.

How we chose

We spoke with experts, combed through product reviews and sourced recommendations from Shop TODAY staffers to determine the best Nike shoes and accessories.
