1.title: Official Images Of The Nike Pegasus 41 “Doernbecher”
1.snippet: The Nike Pegasus 41 Doernbecher is scheduled to release January 25th, 2025. Tap to read our full breakdown, including official images.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Updated January 22nd, 2025: Official images of the Nike Pegasus 41 “Doernbecher” have surfaced; the shoes will release on SNKRS and select retailers on January 25th, 2025 for $130.

1 of 10

Nike’s 20th anniversary Doernbecher Freestyle collection continues to emerge via official images ahead of its January 25th release. Here we have a Nike Pegasus 41 designed by Tima Sviridenko; an 11-year-old bone marrow transplant recipient diagnosed with X-linked lymphoproliferative disease (XLP).

Right off the bat, the inspiration behind the design is clear as day. Tima’s Pegasus 41 is inspired by his love for cats, particularly his family cat Murka as well as his favorite feline stuffed animal. Murka can be spotted hanging off the lateral Swoosh logo, while his favorite cat stuffie, Murzik, shows up as a lace-hanging patch. These also come with custom outsoles featuring cat paws so you can leave prints everywhere you go, and moreover, when you hit the lights, the embossed paw print detailing over the forefoot glows in the dark.

As for the rest of the design, the tropical color palette was chosen to honor Tima’s bone marrow donor Dylan, who resides in Florida. The date of Tima’s bone marrow transplant appears on the ends of the laces, one of which reads “March 4th” while the other reads “March Forth” in a clever reinterpretation. The lace tips are also customized, featuring text reading “Dylan” and “Tima” as another nod to the 11-year-old’s donor.

Tima’s Pegasus 41 will release January 25th alongside five other shoes designed by Doernbecher Children’s Hospital patients, with all proceeds of course going to benefit the hospital. See official images below and tap our Sneaker Release Dates page to stay current on all the latest Nike drops throughout Spring 2025.

2.title: Nike Killshot 2 Blooms for Valentine’s Day with a “Floral” Twist
2.snippet: Name: Nike Killshot 2 “Floral” Colorway: TBC SKU: IF0672-101. MSRP: $100 USD Release Date: Spring 2025. Where to Buy: Nike.
2.content:
Name: Nike Killshot 2 “Floral”

Colorway: TBC

SKU: IF0672-101

MSRP: $100 USD

Release Date: Spring 2025

Where to Buy: Nike

Nike is giving its iconic Killshot 2 silhouette a romantic makeover. Renowned for its clean and minimalist design, the Killshot 2 embraces a fresh and charming update with the upcoming “Floral” edition, just in time for the season of love.

This new iteration boasts a beige canvas upper, accented by matching suede overlays on the toe and eyelet area for subtle textural contrast. The canvas sections are adorned with charming hand-drawn-style floral graphics, featuring vibrant red flowers and green stems that exude a playful yet sophisticated aesthetic. A bold black Swoosh adds a striking contrast to the soft, romantic base, while a gum rubber outsole ties the design together with a touch of classic appeal.

3.title: Iconic New York Venue CBGB Now Has Its Own Nike Shoes
3.snippet: Nearly two decades after it closed, iconic New York City venue CBGB is being honored with its very own Nike sneaker.
3.content:
Nearly two decades after it closed, iconic New York City venue CBGB is being honored with its very own Nike sneaker, and they are, for lack of a better term… DOPE.

Over on the House of Heat website, it’s noted that Nike chose to memorialize the “legendary” NYC club because of how it represented “the epicenter of punk rock and new wave music in the 1970s and 80s.”

Videos by VICE

“Opened in 1973 by Hilly Kristal, the East Village spot initially envisioned as a haven for Country, Bluegrass, and Blues (hence the CBGB name) soon transformed into a breeding ground for iconic acts like the Ramones, Blondie, Talking Heads, and Patti Smith,” Nike explains.

“Though it shuttered in 2006, the club’s influence reverberates through music and culture.”

CBGB Music Venue Honored with Nike Dunk Low Shoes

“Now, nearly 20 years later, Nike pays homage to CBGB’s legacy with a special Dunk Low “CBGB.” The design draws heavily from the venue’s gritty interior and unmistakable aesthetic,” Nike continues. “Torn and grunge-inspired textures cover the upper, reminiscent of the club’s poster-laden walls.”

“Branding at the heel and tongue nods to the iconic CBGB logo font, while inner tongues feature street signs for Bleecker and Bowery,” Nike adds, “the intersection where the club once stood, cementing its place in New York history.

Nike finally adds that “official release details remain under wraps” at this time, but assures fans that “the Nike Dunk Low ‘CBGB’ is expected to drop soon.”

4.title: Nike's Dunk Low Takes on A "Sail/Black" Finish
4.snippet: The iconic Nike Dunk Low has returned in a 'Sail/Black/Coconut Milk' colorway ready to release throughout Summer 2025.
4.content:
Peter Moore's iconic Nike Dunk Low design has emerged in countless styles since its early 1980s debut. And while spring and summer are still months away, the silhouette is quickly amassing a roster of releases perfect for the warmer months.

Akin to other editions of the Nike Dunk, the newly-surfaced pair opts for a two-tone makeover. Leather base layers keep things simple in pitch-'Black', allowing for even the slightest of contrast to revel in the spotlight. Hairy suede panels land around the forefoot, along the tongue, and at the heel, deviating from Moore's original vision. Nevertheless, the fabric update introduces a 'Sail' tone that creates a one-two-punch atop the popular sneaker. Underfoot, Air Jordan 1-reminiscent sole units also contribute to the straightforward style with their faux aged look.

Enjoy official product photography of the shoes ahead. A Nike.com and wide retailer drop should take place by June.

For more from the Swoosh empire, check out the Air Jordan 12 'Flu Game' retro set to release on March 1.

5.title: REI taps Nike, Athleta vet Mary Beth Laughton as CEO
5.snippet: REI taps Nike, Athleta vet Mary Beth Laughton as CEO. Eric Artz, who has led the outdoors retailer for six years, plans to retire at the end of March.
5.content:
Listen to the article 4 min This audio is auto-generated. Please let us know if you have feedback

Dive Brief:

Weeks after the retailer shuttered its experiences business, REI on Wednesday announced that CEO Eric Artz will retire in March as part of a planned succession process. Mary Beth Laughton, a former REI board director and one-time Athleta CEO, will take on the role, per a press release emailed to Retail Dive.

Laughton, who most recently led Nike’s global retail and digital direct-to-consumer business, will become president of REI on Feb. 3 and take over full CEO responsibilities on March 31. Artz spent 12 years with the company and six as its CEO, per a letter the executive shared with employees.

“While there is never a good moment to step away from an organization you love, we have positive momentum in the business and are in a much better position,” Artz told employees. “We’re seeing the fruits of our labor and have a solid foundation for a new leader to come in and take the co-op forward.”

Dive Insight:

REI is looking to a new CEO to guide its next phase as it works to regain solid financial footing. The outdoors retailer said in its announcement that it expects to reach breakeven operating profit (pre-dividend) and nearly breakeven free cash flow for the year, which is a “significant improvement” over 2023.

“Eric has led and stabilized REI through some of the most challenging years the retail sector and our co-op ever faced. REI is in a strong position today because he always kept our purpose, values, and people as his north star,” Chris Carr, REI’s board chair, said in a statement. “Mary Beth has the ideal experience to build on this foundation and to lead REI forward into our next chapter. The world needs a strong REI, and we are confident Mary Beth will hit the ground running.”

Mary Beth Laughton is a former REI board director and one-time Athleta CEO. Permission granted by REI

In Artz’s letter to employees, he also praised Laughton as the right leader for REI and noted that the two would work closely together during the transition period. Laughton plans to spend her initial couple of months with the business traveling to stores and distribution centers to build connections with employees and others. She will be based in REI’s office in Issaquah, Washington, according to a letter from Carr to employees and co-op members.

In addition to her experience at Nike, Athleta and as a board member at REI, Laughton also previously ran Sephora’s North American stores and digital operations. She takes over at REI after the retailer underwent two years of considerable layoffs, including 357 in January last year, 275 as part of a store operations overhaul in October 2023 and the more than 400 employees that were let go as the experience business closed this month.

Amid the cost-cutting, REI also changed its return policy in November to curb misuse by a small number of members.

In addition to Laughton, REI has a new chief marketer, who joined the company just a few months ago. The outdoors retailer remains focused on expansion as well, with six stores planned for this year and at least two in 2026.

In his farewell to the business, Artz highlighted the importance of the outdoors to everyday life and the retailer’s customers.

“Being outside means something different for everyone and our job is not to tell people what that looks like. It is to show one another and to welcome others, always making time outside more accessible to more people in more ways,” Artz said to employees. “That is worth fighting for and why I believe the world must have a strong REI.”

6.title: Nike Introduces the Air Force 1 Low "Black Tiffany" With Subtle Luxury
6.snippet: Nike reinvents the Air Force 1 Low with the "Black Tiffany," featuring Aurora Green accents and premium leather.
6.content:
Nike is back with another stunning iteration of its iconic Air Force 1 Low, this time paying homage to its celebrated 2023 collaboration with Tiffany & Co. While the original collaboration featured Tiffany’s unmistakable turquoise on a suede Air Force 1, the new Air Force 1 Low “Black Tiffany” reimagines the classic design with a fresh, standalone approach.

For sneaker enthusiasts who missed the original Tiffany collab or simply love a sleek, high-contrast aesthetic, this latest release offers an accessible yet eye-catching alternative.

Design Details That Shine

The Air Force 1 Low “Black Tiffany” channels the essence of the Tiffany & Co. x Nike release but introduces a host of new features that set it apart. Unlike the suede upper of its predecessor, this iteration boasts a pebbled leather finish that adds texture and durability. The shoe’s “Aurora Green” accents, reminiscent of Tiffany’s signature hue, give the design a vibrant yet sophisticated flair.

Key details include:

Top-Stitching: Aurora Green stitching adorns the eyestay, tongue, heel, and quarter overlays, creating a striking contrast against the black leather base.

Heel Branding: Nike Air embroidery in Aurora Green adds a pop of color to the heel tab.

Sole Unit: The midsole and outsole are finished with Aurora Green “Air” branding, emphasizing the shoe’s modern yet timeless appeal.

A Luxurious Alternative

While the Tiffany & Co. collab was undeniably a grail for many, the “Black Tiffany” offers a stylish and versatile option for sneaker fans without the exclusivity—and hefty resale prices—of the original. The use of premium pebbled leather ensures a luxe aesthetic, making these kicks perfect for casual wear or elevating an outfit for a night out.

Why the Air Force 1 Endures

The Air Force 1 Low is a cornerstone of Nike’s sneaker lineup, celebrated for its clean design and cultural relevance. Since its debut in 1982, the silhouette has transcended its basketball origins to become a global style icon. Releases like the “Black Tiffany” highlight the brand’s ability to continually innovate while honoring the model’s heritage.

This drop reinforces why the Air Force 1 remains a go-to for sneakerheads and casual wearers alike: it’s a perfect mix of simplicity, boldness, and versatility.

Release Information

The Nike Air Force 1 Low “Black Tiffany” is set to drop soon through Nike’s official website and select retailers. With its blend of understated luxury and iconic design, this release is poised to become a favorite among sneaker enthusiasts.

Pricing details are yet to be confirmed, but given the accessible nature of non-collaborative releases, the “Black Tiffany” should be within reach for most fans—making it even more enticing for those looking to add a splash of color to their rotation.

Why This Drop Matters

Beyond the aesthetic appeal, the “Black Tiffany” reflects Nike’s knack for evolving its classics. By drawing inspiration from a high-profile collaboration and reinterpreting it with subtle changes, Nike demonstrates its ability to cater to both collectors and everyday wearers.

For those who appreciate sneakers as wearable art, the Air Force 1 Low “Black Tiffany” is a reminder of how design can seamlessly blend functionality and elegance.

Styling the “Black Tiffany”

The “Black Tiffany” colorway lends itself to endless styling options. Pair it with dark denim for a casual vibe, or wear it with tailored trousers for a more elevated look. The pebbled leather finish ensures the shoe stands out whether you’re keeping things laid-back or dressing to impress.

Nike’s Air Force 1 Low “Black Tiffany” strikes the perfect balance between everyday wearability and standout design. By blending premium materials with a nod to one of its most iconic collaborations, Nike has delivered a sneaker that feels fresh, timeless, and undeniably stylish.

Don’t miss your chance to grab a pair when they hit shelves. With their versatile appeal and connection to sneaker history, the “Black Tiffany” is bound to turn heads wherever you go.

7.title: REI CEO announces retirement, former Sephora and Nike executive to lead company
7.snippet: The president and CEO of Pacific Northwest-based athletics retailer REI will be retiring from the company starting in February.
7.content:
The president and CEO of Pacific Northwest-based athletics retailer REI will be retiring from the company starting in February, marking a "new chapter" in the co-op's 87-year history.

Wednesday the upcoming departure of Eric Artz, who has led the company since 2019.

Mary Beth Laughton, a former REI Board Director and retail leader, will step in as president on Feb. 3, 2025 before taking over full CEO responsibilities on March 31.

RELATED |

Laughton previously served executive roles at Nike, Athleta, and Sephora, and has served on the boards of Impossible Foods and Instacart.

"Her experience and personal passion balance strategic vision for the future of retail, innovation and operational rigor, love for the outdoors, and appreciation for the co-op's unique culture," REI said in a press release.

"Eric has led and stabilized REI through some of the most challenging years the retail sector and our co-op ever faced," said Chris Carr, chair of the REI board of directors. "REI is in a strong position today because he always kept our purpose, values, and people as his north star."

Artz addressed his retirement in a letter to employees.

"Serving you and this enduring organization has been the honor of my professional life," Artz said. "Being outside means something different for everyone and our job is not to tell people what that looks like."

"It is to show one another and to welcome others, always making time outside more accessible to more people in more ways," Artz added. "That is worth fighting for."

Two weeks before Artz announced his retirement, REI made headlines when it revealed the company was .

RELATED |

The division included adventure travel, day tours, and classes. Thirty-one Washington employees were laid off.

In a press release, Artz said the closure decision was based on preliminary financial results showing that the company was close to breaking even for 2024.

Artz thanked the Experiences team and told employees the team had done nothing wrong. The division had been a part of REI for 40 years.

But that part of the business only served 40,000 customers in 2024—less than 0.4% of all co-op customers—and costs more to run than it brings in.

The REI Union said it was looking forward to a new CEO at the company.

“Today’s announcement reflects the feelings of REI Co-op members and workers alike, that it’s time for a change," the union said in a statement to KOMO News.

“We call on the incoming CEO, Mary Beth Laughton, to come to the table and work with us on ushering in a new chapter for REI that better represents its founding values and workers’ voices," the union added.

Since 2022, ten REI stores have voted to unionize, including the store in Bellingham. Other unionized stores include Boston, Cleveland, Chicago, and New York City.

The REI Union told KOMO News that it believes the retailer has used union-busting tactics in an attempt to squash an ongoing wave of organizing.

REI executives expressed confidence in Laughton's ability to lead the major outdoor retailer.

"Mary Beth has the ideal experience to build on this foundation and to lead REI forward into our next chapter," Carr said. "The world needs a strong REI, and we are confident Mary Beth will hit the ground running."

"No other company balances purpose and performance quite like REI, and we must ensure it thrives for generations to come," Laughton said. "That is a big responsibility—one I embrace with utmost respect for our millions of members and the thousands of employees whose passion for life outside and deep expertise set the co-op apart."

REI executives said they remain focused on maintaining stability for employees, members, and partners while building on the growth achieved at the end of 2024.

The co-op said it expects to meet its 2024 goals of break-even operating profit, marking a "significant improvement" over 2023.

9.title: The Nike Air Max 90 Infrared Gets a Carbon Fiber Makeover
9.snippet: The classic Nike Air Max 90 Infrared gets a makeover for February 2025. Overhauled in carbon fiber, find images and release info for these Air Maxes here.
9.content:
Updated on February 12, 2025 • Published January 22, 2025

While all eyes are on the 30th Anniversary of the Air Max 95, another classic Air Max is also celebrating a milestone birthday in 2025, the Air Max 90. A Tinker Hatfield classic, the AM 90 turns 35, and while its hype may not be at an all-time high, the coveted silhouette is still an all-time favorite amongst sneakerheads. With that in mind, Nike is set to drop plenty of Air Max 90s throughout the year, from GRs to limited releases and everything in between.

To kick things off for Spring 2025, the Nike Air Max 90 is back with a twist on the original Infrared edition. This pair comes in a Reverse Infrared iteration with carbon fiber upgrades. Black carbon fiber brings premium vibes throughout the sneaker and is found via the toe, tongue, mudguard, and wrapping around the heel.

This design adds a unique twist to this classic pair, highlighted by infrared, aka bright crimson accents in their traditional places. Cool Grey suede adorns the overlays while a photon dust Swoosh is on the sides. Visible Max Air cushioning is seen via the crimson-colored wedge, surrounded by a white midsole. The classic solid rubber outsole in black and crimson completes the look.

The Nike Air Max 90 Carbon Fiber Infrared is set to release on February 25, 2025, through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, retail is $140. Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

0.title: Nike Reintroduces the Air Superfly as a Low-Profile, Running-Inspired Sportswear Shoe for Women
0.snippet: Nike is fueling a new era of running-inspired design with the launch of the Air Superfly, a sleek sportswear silhouette reintroduced 25 years after its...
0.content:
Nike is fueling a new era of running-inspired design with the launch of the Air Superfly, a sleek sportswear silhouette reintroduced 25 years after its inception as a low-profile racing trainer.

Rooted in Nike’s running history, the contemporary Air Superfly carries forward the original trainer’s construction, serving women athletes and sneaker fans with a refined early-aughts look modernized to advance today’s sport style.

“Now, 25 years later, it feels like the perfect time to reintroduce the Air Superfly to a new generation, letting this distinctive silhouette take on a new era,” says Ellen Lekas, Expert, Women’s Footwear Product Management. “Racing trainers like this one are low to the ground, more minimalist, lightweight and really sleek — and we brought back this model specifically because it offers an authentic Nike perspective that is progressive, accessible and wearable, striking a perfect balance that’s so right for women today.”

Debuted by Nike athlete Sha’Carri Richardson in November, unveiled during last month’s SNKRS Showcase, and worn by global trendsetters, the restyled Air Superfly promises a streamlined, low-profile design that hugs the foot for all-day comfort.

A unique reverse seam construction provides a smoother fit and removes the need for a sock liner traditional to sportswear silhouettes, resulting in a deconstructed, minimal feel designed for everyday movement. Perforated medial and lateral quarter panels stay true to the initial Superfly design, promoting breathability and lightweight performance, and distinctive green dots on the original outsole mimic 2000s-era track spike placement.

A hidden Nike Air unit and Cushlon foam midsole deliver comfort that’s central to Nike’s running-inspired sportswear silhouettes, and a leather and synthetic suede upper offers a premium look and feel accentuated by the metallic silver launch colorway shared with the Air Max Muse, another new Nike Air style for women.

“The most exciting part of bringing the Air Superfly back to life was landing on the colors and materials that the shoe is going to take on,” says Thomasin Hummerstone, Director, Footwear Product Creation, Women’s Sportswear. “This shoe has an amazing chameleon-like quality that, depending on how you color and materialize it, can take on so many different personalities. That begins with the metallic silver launch colorway, which is a modern evolution of the silver anthracite look from the original design.”

The Nike Air Superfly will be available beginning January 27 at select Nike retail partners and February 7 globally on SNKRS.

1.title: The Nike AlphaFly 3 Preps For Racing Season With “Gridiron”
1.snippet: The Nike AlphaFly 3 is cleaning up in a simple "Gridiron" colorway for Spring 2025. Tap to see official images.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The Nike AlphaFly 3 isn’t for casuals; it’s for elite marathon runners and those who obsess about getting the absolute most out of their footwear on race day. We’re currently in a bit of a lull period in between racing seasons, but that’s not stopping Nike from teeing up fresh colorways. This white and “Gridiron” look is the Beaverton brand’s latest, and if its special markings are any indication, runners should expect a late Spring 2025 release.

Official images reveal a white knit upper, save for a “Gridiron” Swoosh that dips down into the midsole. The heel portion introduces a “Pure Platinum” gradient, hosting a text box reading “Road Racing AF” and “2025-03,” therefore hinting at a potential March 2025 release. Those same markings appears on the insoles, capping off all the notable design highlights. As far as performance goes, the AlphaFly 3 brings three key innovations to a helm; stacked Air Zoom units appear in the forefoot, ZoomX foam makes up the midsole, and a full-length carbon fiber plate enhances forward propulsion. It’s Nike’s lightest AlphaFly shoe to date and the sneaker of choice for elite runners like Eliud Kipchoge and Kelvin Kiptum, both of whom have broken world records in the shoe.

Scroll through detailed images of the Nike AlphaFly 3 “White/Gridiron/Pure Platinum” below and visit our Sneaker Release Dates page to preview more upcoming Nike Running shoes.

2.title: Nike Air Force 1 Low “Bling” Returns with a Luxe Makeover for 2025
2.snippet: Name: Nike Air Force 1 Low “Bling” Colorway: TBC SKU: TBC MSRP: $120 USD Release Date: Spring 2025. Where to Buy: Nike. One of the most striking releases of...
2.content:
Name: Nike Air Force 1 Low “Bling”

Colorway: TBC

SKU: TBC

MSRP: $120 USD

Release Date: Spring 2025

Where to Buy: Nike

One of the most striking releases of 2020 is making a dazzling comeback: the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Bling.” Originally launched as a women’s exclusive, this design quickly became a viral hit thanks to its jewel-inspired aesthetic. Now, in 2025, Nike is reintroducing the iconic pair with elevated features that enhance its luxurious appeal.

While the original “Bling” design showcased sapphire blue faux gems, the upcoming iteration shifts to a refined palette of purple and olive green stones. Adding to the glamour is a sparkling Swoosh charm embellishing the laces. The design also introduces a unique sheer tongue overlay, revealing a spongy interior for added depth and visual intrigue. The upper retains its timeless all-white leather construction, while a cream-toned midsole provides an elegant contrast, tying the design together with understated refinement.

4.title: Nike's Pegasus 41 Arrives with A Motivational Message for Women Runners
4.snippet: Nike Running has been hitting its stride over the last year, delivering compelling, oftentimes story-driven product to athletes of all levels. As Women's […]
4.content:
Nike Running has been hitting its stride over the last year, delivering compelling, oftentimes story-driven product to athletes of all levels. As Women's History Month inches closer, the Swoosh has seemingly prepped a special Pegasus 41 dedicated to women runners.

Over the years, the Oregon-based company has committed efforts to motivating this segment of athletes via product specifically developed with its insight and events catered to it. Throughout 2025, Nike will host the After Dark Tour race series for women in seven cities across the globe–including Mexico City, Los Angeles, and Seoul. The newly-surfaced Pegasus 41 trainer is rooted in this same commitment to women.

A multi-color arrangement takes over the shoes' breathable Flyknit upper, allowing runners to make a statement before even crushing their Personal Bests. The gradient look works in-tandem with shimmering 'Metallic Silver' touches to increase visibility and the pair's inherent attitude. Underfoot, the ReactX midsole delivers a tame aesthetic that allows the upper's colorful outfit to revel in the spotlight. Lastly, the Swoosh includes a special message on the sock-liner to its women athletes: Leave yourself open to feel and experience your run, your workout, your life.

A firm Nike.com launch should take place throughout March for the price of $150. While you wait, enjoy official photos of the women's Pegasus 41 ahead.

For more running shoes, check out the adidas Y-3 Adios Pro 4 marathon racer.

5.title: Nike Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead” Embodies DIY Punk Aesthetics
5.snippet: Nike Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead” channels punk's DIY spirit with rugged textures and bold details. Take a closer look!
5.content:
Nike continues to push the boundaries of sneaker design with the upcoming Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead.” Drawing inspiration from punk rock’s do-it-yourself ethos, this release merges rebellious creativity with a meticulously crafted design. Packed with unique details and rugged textures, the “Dunks Not Dead” model captures the spirit of individuality while staying true to the classic Dunk Low silhouette.

A Raw and Rugged Aesthetic

The Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead” stands out with a black textured leather base, offering a bold and edgy foundation. Complementing this backdrop are ripped canvas overlays in a muted olive green, lending the shoe a raw, weathered look that reflects punk’s DIY spirit. These elements combine to create a shoe that feels both vintage and modern, appealing to sneaker enthusiasts and style rebels alike.

Pops of Soft Pink for Contrast

Despite its gritty demeanor, the “Dunks Not Dead” features soft pink accents that provide a striking contrast. The swoosh on the canvas panel and the insoles are adorned with this unexpected hue, adding a playful touch to an otherwise rugged design. This blend of tough and tender highlights Nike’s ability to balance boldness with subtlety.

Thoughtful Branding Details

Nike has infused the Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead” with special branding elements that set it apart from other releases. The circular Nike tongue tag features customized graphics, while the embroidered heel emblem adds a distinctive flair. These details enhance the shoe’s rebellious identity and offer subtle nods to punk culture.

Built for Style and Comfort

The shoe rests on a speckled black midsole and outsole, contributing to its edgy, DIY vibe. Rugged cream laces tie the look together, emphasizing the handmade aesthetic. While its design is unconventional, the “Dunks Not Dead” doesn’t sacrifice functionality. The padded collar and cushioned sole ensure a comfortable fit, making it as practical as it is stylish.

A Celebration of Punk Culture

The “Dunks Not Dead” isn’t just a sneaker—it’s a celebration of punk culture and its influence on fashion and design. Punk has always been about rejecting the status quo and embracing individuality, and this Dunk Low perfectly embodies those ideals. From its distressed materials to its daring color choices, every element of this shoe speaks to a spirit of rebellion and self-expression.

Styling the “Dunks Not Dead”

This bold sneaker is perfect for making a statement. Pair it with ripped denim, a graphic tee, and a leather jacket for a punk-inspired look, or let it stand out as the centerpiece of a more subdued outfit. Its versatile design ensures it can be styled for various occasions, from casual outings to creative events.

Anticipating the Release

The Nike Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead” is expected to hit shelves soon, though an official release date has yet to be announced. Fans can look forward to its arrival on Nike’s official website and at select retailers. Given the buzz surrounding this release, it’s likely to sell out quickly, so sneaker enthusiasts should stay ready to secure their pair.

Why the Dunk Low Remains an Icon

The Nike Dunk Low has consistently evolved while retaining its signature style, making it one of the most iconic silhouettes in sneaker history. The “Dunks Not Dead” showcases how the Dunk continues to resonate with new audiences, blending timeless design with fresh, creative ideas. This release reinforces the Dunk’s status as a canvas for cultural expression, innovation, and individuality.

The Nike Dunk Low “Dunks Not Dead” is more than just footwear—it’s a bold statement. By channeling the essence of punk culture into its design, this sneaker invites wearers to embrace their creativity and individuality. Whether you’re a collector, a fashion enthusiast, or simply someone who loves standout sneakers, the “Dunks Not Dead” deserves a spot in your rotation.

Stay tuned for release updates and prepare to grab your pair as soon as they drop. With its rebellious aesthetic and attention to detail, the “Dunks Not Dead” is set to become a standout addition to Nike’s ever-evolving Dunk Low lineup.

Comfort remains a priority with Nike’s signature Air Max cushioning. The innovative midsole delivers excellent support for all-day wear. Meanwhile, the outsole features a sleek wavy pattern, ensuring reliable traction and enhancing the shoe’s futuristic vibe.

Mark your calendars for January 29, 2025, as the Nike Air Max Muse “Cave Stone” will be available at select Nike Sportswear retailers, online, and via Nike.com. Available in women’s sizing, the retail price tag is set at $160 USD. Don’t miss this chance to own a bold iteration of the iconic Air Max line.

Don’t miss out on this bold addition to the Air Max family. With its unique textures, premium construction, and iconic cushioning, this sneaker is a must-have for collectors and casual wearers alike.

8.title: NIKE to release CBGB Dunks to commemorate legendary NYC venue
8.snippet: Nike have unveiled a brand new CBGB-themed pair of Dunk Lows meant to honor the legacy of the New York City venue.
8.content:
Nike have unveiled a brand new CBGB-themed pair of Dunk Lows meant to honor the legacy of the New York City venue. A release date hasn't been set yet, but expect them soon.

Find further details here.

Originally founded as a "Country, Blue Grass, and Blues" club, CBGB emerged in the 1970s-80s as a hub for up-and-coming punk, new wave, and alternative rock bands in New York City. Bands like Ramones, Blondie, Talking Heads, and later acts such as Agnostic Front, Gorilla Biscuits, Cro-Mags, and more were all mainstays of the venue. It closed in 2006.

Here's what Nike had to say about the upcoming shoe:

9.title: The Nike Dunk Low NYC CBGB Pays Homage to New York’s Punk Rock Scene
9.snippet: NYC's now-defunct CBGB club is honored with an all-new Nike Dunk Low colorway. Discover images and info about the pair here.
9.content:
Published January 21, 2025

Regarding storytelling in sneakers, specifically those tied to cities, Nike often uses the Peter Moore-designed Dunk Low silhouette. Over the last few years, nods to various US cities have emerged on the sneaker, including pairs Philly, NOLA, ATL, and Los Angeles pairs. Now, Nike looks to NYC’s punk rock scene to pay homage to the city and the iconic CBGB club.

Initially opened in 1973, CBGB transformed from a dive and biker bar to an iconic part of NYC’s music scene. More specifically, the club hosted some of the most famous punk rock and new wave artists of the late 20th century, including Ramones, Beastie Boys, and, outside of these genres, even Madonna. After serving the community for decades, the club, located near Bleecker St and Bowery, closed on October 15, 2006.

Nike Dunk Low NYC CBGB

As for Nike’s tribute to the club, they’ve translated punk rock aesthetics onto the Dunk Low by applying a cracked leather finish with a worn-in black and grey look to the overlays. An earth-tone leather is present on the toebox and midfoot, with a darker panel located on the collar. One of the first homages to the club itself is found on the Nike branding of the tongue tag and heel tab, written in the same font and color as the CBGB club’s logo.

Inside, the insole features a collage of punk-inspired Nike logos and nods to NYC, with a direct nod to the location of the club found on the reverse of the tongue. The left pair features a street sign-inspired green tag that reads “Bleeker” (a misspelling of Bleecker St.) while the right reads “Bowery,” a nod to the location of the CBGB club. Finishing the design is the tonal rubber midsole and outsole.

The Nike Dunk Low NYC CBGB will release in Spring 2025 through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is set at $130. 5.snippet: The Nike Killshot 2 has surfaced in a new floral colorway for Spring 2025. Tap to read our full breakdown, including official images.
5.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The Nike Killshot 2 was inescapable in the back half of the 2010s, with the former J. Crew exclusive achieving mainstream success due to its recognizable silhouette and strong selection of simple, versatile colorways.

While the model isn’t necessarily “trendy” in 2025, Nike has been quietly aiming to re-ignite demand through new colorways that break from tradition. We saw the Beaverton brand release a soccer-inspired Killshot 2 last November, and now with Valentine’s Day on the horizon, we just uncovered official images of “Floral” edition pegged for Spring 2025.

Gum soles, black Swoosh logos, and “Light Orewood Brown” suede overlays are all standard applications, but the real intrigue lies on the base. There, Nike opts for canvas material featuring a floral mix of “Gym Red” flowers and green stems.

The “Floral” Killshot 2 will release via nike.com in the very near future, retailing for $100. See official images below and tap our Sneaker Release Dates page to preview more upcoming pairs by the Swoosh.

6.title: The Nike SB Force 58 "Lucky Green" Is Available Now
6.snippet: While not the Swoosh's premier skateboarding product, the Nike SB Force 58 has consistently delivered a number of reliable styles that don't break the bank.
6.content:
While not the Swoosh's premier skateboarding product, the Nike SB Force 58 has consistently delivered a number of reliable styles that don't break the bank.

Rooted in heritage across the Nike and Jordan Brand families, the low-top skate shoe has appeared in a number of colorways seemingly-inspired by the Air Jordan 1. The most recent example of the trend arrives in the form of a pair covered in 'White/Stadium Green/Black'. While not out-of-the-norm for the sneaker, the mix of tones and its presentation draws heavy comparison to the Air Jordan 1 High 'Lucky Green' that last released April 2023. The Boston Celtics-friendly color scheme forms part of #23's story, and its inclusion in Nike SB's lineup further demonstrates how self-referential the Swoosh conglomerate is. Canvas and suede panels across the upper divvy up the aforementioned colors in a manner that's undeniably Air Jordan. Skate-specific sole units underfoot round out the package in a clean finish that allows for the upper to steal the spotlight.

Enjoy official photos of the skate shoe below, and head over the Nike.com right now to secure your size for a budget-friendly $80.

For more from the Nike, Inc. family, check out Deion Sanders' Nike DT '93 Football Cleats in original 'Fire Red'.

Remember Nike and Tiffany & Co.’s collab from 2023? For those who missed the chance to cop the Tiffany & Co. edition, Nike is now reiterating a very similar colorway in a non-collaborative Air Force 1 Low silhouette.

8.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The “Home” version of anything may never amount to the real thing, but Nike came pretty close with this upcoming Air Force 1 Low “Aurora Green” that does its best impression of 2023’s Tiffany & Co. x Nike Air Force 1.

The “GR” version seen here has an all-black foundation, but its instantly elevated to luxury with the Aurora Green hits on the Swoosh logo. tongue and heel logos, and the contrast stitching. That signature shade of teal-ish blue is often committed to jewelry house Tiffany & Co.; in 2023, Nike officially collaborated with the brand for a highly-coveted Air Force 1 release, but that groundwork was of course set by LA-based Diamond Supply Co. and their SB Dunk collab unofficially based on the purveyor of fine stones.

1 of 8

Nike often creates “takedown” dupes of popular releases, many of them selling out for the obvious appeal. We foresee the same result for this Air Force 1 “Aurora Green” for its stylish colorway and accessible pricepoint relative to the $1,000+ it’ll cost to get a pair of the actual Tiffany Air Force 1s.

1.title: Dunks Not Dead: Nike Makes A Bold Statement With Upcoming Release
1.snippet: The Nike Dunks Not Dead Dunk Low is releasing Spring 2025. Tap in for official images, a full breakdown, and more.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Shoe critics and resellers have loudly claimed that Dunks are dead. Contrarily, Nike is objecting to that with this upcoming release that ties in one of the most important eras in music history.

If you still love Nike Dunks, then now’s the best time to go in and scoop up some solid releases for what will likely be all-time lows in pricing. It’s only a matter of time before the trend cycle makes a full revolution, because let us remind you, the Dunk “died” once before in the mid-late 2000s, only to come back stronger than ever.

While this upcoming release isn’t a direct commentary on the history of Dunk trends, the “Dunks Not Dead” certainly brings up the conversation. Punk music and fashion itself was a statement against the mainstream, with tattered military gear sending the provocative message.

In the case of this Dunk, you’ll find familiar olive green shades across the nylon overlay, while black leather and rip-stop on the tongue add to the surplus aesthetic. Tattered laces and army-style font continue the theme, while pins and patches add the final touch to punk-themed design.

With the recent surfacing of the Dunk Low “CBGB”, Nike could also be working on a music-themed pack of Dunks for Spring 2025.

2.title: Nike Stock Keeps Falling. Time to Buy?
2.snippet: Nike's stock has been crushed over the last year by weakening sales trends. The stock trades down 60% from its previous peak, which looks tempting for value...
2.content:
Nike (NKE -1.35%) is a ubiquitous sportswear brand with a trailing 12-month revenue of $49 billion. But after a decade of market-beating returns, Nike's stock has been crushed over the last year by weakening sales trends.

The stock trades down 60% from its previous peak, which looks tempting for value investors. The lower share price means that investors can buy the stock at a lower multiple of Nike's sales and earnings. Plus, Nike is still paying dividends, so the stock's haircut has brought its dividend yield to a 15-year high.

These indicators suggest that the shares are undervalued, and it's attracting investment from some of the smartest investors around. Billionaire Bill Ackman and other notable fund managers started positions in Nike stock last year.

Is it time to buy this beaten-down sportswear leader?

A turnaround could take time

Nike's sales were down 8% year over year in the November-ending quarter, and analysts who cover the company on Wall Street expect full-year sales for the May-ending fiscal year to be down 10% year over year. Lower sales are also taking their toll on the bottom line, with Nike's earnings expected to be down 45% for the current fiscal year.

Some of Nike's problems are self-inflicted. For example, new CEO Elliott Hill is implementing a strategy to reduce the reliance on promotional discounts to drive more full-price sales. This should lead to stronger profitability over the long term. The company is also boosting investment in sports, which should benefit Nike's core products like running and basketball shoes.

There is a trade-off in the near term. As Nike reduces promotional sales, people who have gotten used to Nike's discounts may turn to other brands, and that could further pressure sales. Because of this, it could take several quarters before Nike starts showing a significant improvement in financial results.

Increasing competition

Investors should also be aware that Nike is facing greater competition in the marketplace, which raises uncertainty about the timing of a turnaround. Over the last few years, competitors like Lululemon Athletica (LULU 0.44%), On Holding (ONON 0.15%), and Deckers Outdoor's (DECK 1.40%) Hoka have all delivered stronger sales growth than Nike.

Lululemon's revenue grew 9% year over year last quarter, and while Lululemon is mostly focused on premium apparel, management has noted success in growing its new footwear line.

Meanwhile, On's footwear is gaining wider appeal, with sales soaring 32% over the year-ago quarter. Additionally, Deckers reported a 20% year-over-year increase in sales last quarter, as it continued to report strong demand for its Hoka running shoe.

In comparison, sales of Nike's footwear tumbled 11% over the year-ago quarter. Nike's running shoes performed better, with sales flat in the men's category and up single-digit percentages in women's, but it seems to be losing market share to competitors.

Nike can win, but it may get worse before it gets better

But it's not game over for Nike. The one advantage it has that these other brands don't is massive scale and global reach. The company's marketing expense was almost double On Holding's total revenue over the last year. Obviously, that didn't prevent the company's sales from falling, but historically, Nike has demonstrated that it knows how to build brand awareness better than anyone. Marketing and innovation are why Nike is the industry leader. As it adjusts its product strategy and marketing message, Nike can energize sales again.

That said, investors may want to wait to buy the stock until there is better visibility on sales. The stock is sitting close to new lows at the time of this writing, and there is a real risk that Nike could struggle to grow sales in the near term, which could send the stock down to new lows before it rebounds.

3.title: Sneaker Talk: Nike SB Dunk Low "Crown Royal"
3.snippet: Sneaker Talk: Nike SB Dunk Low “Crown Royal” ... The Nike SB Dunk Low “Crown Royal,” inspired by Crown Royal whiskey bags, debuted in 2012, captivating sneaker...
3.content:
The Nike SB Dunk Low “Crown Royal,” inspired by Crown Royal whiskey bags, debuted in 2012, captivating sneaker enthusiasts with its rich design. Featuring premium purple suede uppers and gold accents, the pair drew from the regal branding of the iconic whiskey pouch. The luxurious materials and refined color scheme elevated its status among collectors. A crisp white midsole and matching purple outsole completed the design, adding a balanced touch to its bold look.

- Advertisement -

Upon release, this Dunk Low quickly became a favorite among Nike SB fans and collectors. Its unique storytelling and luxurious details reflected the creativity of Nike SB’s golden era. The bold yet sophisticated aesthetic stood out, making it a must-have for fans of the Dunk Low silhouette.

Today, the Nike SB Dunk Low “Crown Royal” remains a cherished piece of sneaker history. Its rich colorway and premium materials continue to resonate with enthusiasts who appreciate both design and storytelling.

Resale platforms like StockX still offer opportunities to own this iconic sneaker, though prices reflect its collectible status.

For fans of classic Nike SB releases, the “Crown Royal” is more than just a sneaker—it’s a nod to an era of bold innovation and creativity. Whether you’re a seasoned collector or a new enthusiast, this pair represents timeless style and craftsmanship worth revisiting.

Stay up to date with all upcoming sneaker releases from our Sneaker Release Dates page. Be sure to follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

Style Code: 313170-571

Price: $100

5.title: Nike's Iconic Fruit-Flavored Jordan 5 Gets a Deliciously Fresh Rebirth
5.snippet: The "Grape" Jordan 5, one of the top AJ5s of all time, is back. Early looks suggest a near-OG revival of the Jordan 5 "Grape," including the original Nike Air...
5.content:
It may be cold outside, but the Jordan Brand's got enough heat to get us through the season — honestly, the rest of the year. The Nike imprint celebrates 40 years in business and has decided to basically unload its archives and give its most coveted classics another life.

This includes the return of the fruity "Grape" Jordan 5 sneakers.

In 1990, a star was born: the Air Jordan 5 "Grape." The sneakers were quite literally famous out the gate, having co-starred on the man himself in the Will Smith-centric series The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.

A walking moodboard for '90s steez, Will's character (also named Will) owned some of the world's hottest Jordan sneakers.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this YouTube video. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy Subscribe to Highsnobiety on YouTube

He often laced up in some serious Jumpman classics, including the Grape 5s.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this YouTube video. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy Subscribe to Highsnobiety on YouTube

Sneakerheads even called the Grape AJ5s the "Fresh Prince" Jordans. Then in 2018, Nike dropped a special-edition "Fresh Prince" Jordan 5 sneaker celebrating the show's impact on the sneaker, which is pretty much a pop culture artifact.

Now, the "Grape" Jordan 5, one of the top AJ5s of all time, is back. Early looks suggest a near-OG revival of the Jordan 5 "Grape," including the original Nike Air branding on the heel again (the 2013 retro release swapped this out for the famed Jumpman logo).

Leaked photos also reveal the Jordan 5's familiar clean colorblocking: a crisp white leather canvas with fruit-flavored purple and teal blue hues splashed on the tongue and "shark teeth" midsole. Fans can also expect plenty more traditional AJ5 touches like the mesh-looking midfoot cage and the unforgettable lace trinkets.

Right now, the Air Jordan 5 "Grape" sneakers are expected to hit the streets again in June, 30 years after its initial debut. And there are more AJ5s where that came from.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

Jordan also anticipated to revive the great "Black Metallic" Jordan 5 through its Reimagined line. At the same time, a delicious "Gold Ticket" Jordan 5 awaits later this month.

6.title: 10 best Nike Air Jordans worn by Michael Jordan during the game
6.snippet: Michael Jordan is not only popular for his excellence in basketball but also for his cool and athletic shoes.
6.content:
Michael Jordan is not only popular for his excellence in basketball but also for his cool and athletic shoes. His Air Jordan signature sneakers have been major milestones of his career, on and off the court, defining his moments and the moments of basketball history. The first pair he wore broke the rules of the NBA; the others, which he wore while winning championships, each had a story to tell.

Let's walk through ten of the most memorable Air Jordans Michael Jordan wore at pivotal moments of his career.

Nike Air Jordan 1

San Diego Padres v San Francisco Giants - Source: Getty

The Nike Air Jordan 1 is the sneaker that started it all. The shoe was a bold move as it came out in 1985 with the red-and-black colorway. It was contrary to the then-uniform policy of the NBA; Jordan was wearing them for his rookie season. He won the Rookie of the Year award but challenged the norms of the league.

The league fined him $5,000 each game, but Nike saw this as an opportunity to launch a marketing blitz. The "Banned" storyline made the shoe an instant classic. Jordan's high-flying dunks and fearless gameplay in these sneakers laid the foundation for a legacy that extended beyond the court.

Nike Air Jordan 3

Nike Air Jordan 3 (Image via NIKE)

Michael Jordan had become, by 1988, a name everybody knew and respected. Nike Air Jordan 3 brought so much innovation that this shoe came with the first-ever visible Air unit and an already iconic Jumpman logo. These were what he wore when he made history with the memorable free-throw line dunk at the 1988 NBA Dunk Contest.

It was also during this model that elephant print detailing first appeared to mix performance and style. In addition to the Dunk Contest, Jordan's dominant season in these shoes included winning the NBA MVP and Defensive Player of the Year awards, making the Air Jordan 3 a symbol of peak performance.

Nike Air Jordan 4

Rami Almordaah, AKA @Ramitheicon, has social media fame as a sneaker buyer at Cook Kicks, on Melrose Ave, in Los Angeles, CA - Source: Getty

One of the most iconic moments in Jordan's career is when Nike Air Jordan 4 debuted in 1989 during "The Shot" against the Cleveland Cavaliers in the NBA Playoffs. These were designed for flexibility and airflow. Mesh panels, along with interchangeable lacing, made up these shoes.

Not only did the jumper from Jordan ensure the Bulls would win, but the shot at the buzzer made it one of the longest-lasting images of his clutch gene. This makes the Air Jordan 4, which married performance with style, a classic, and "The Shot" assured its place in the pantheon of basketball legend.

Nike Air Jordan 5

Rami Almordaah, AKA @Ramitheicon, has social media fame as a sneaker buyer at Cook Kicks, on Melrose Ave, in Los Angeles, CA - Source: Getty

Aggressive as Jordan was in his play in 1990, so was the Nike Air Jordan 5, which was inspired by WWII fighter planes. This shoe featured reflective tongues and translucent outsoles, and it was at once functional and eye-catching.

One of Jordan's most remembered games was against the Cleveland Cavaliers when he wore the shoes and had a 69-point game. The Air Jordan 5 is the epitome of his unyielding drive and athleticism. Its bold design and association with such a historic game make it a lasting icon of greatness.

Nike Air Jordan 6

2009 Air Jordan VI (6) Retro sneakers are pictured in the photo studio Tuesday evening. The sneakers were brought in by Jessica "Brooklyn" Teo, 31, of West Reading. Photo by Natalie Kolb 9/9/2014 - Source: Getty

The Nike Air Jordan 6 represents a special moment for Michael Jordan: it was his shoe when he won his first NBA championship back in 1991. That shoe had an added toe cap and two-hole pull tabs with comfort and utility.

Jordan was the Finals MVP against the Los Angeles Lakers that started the dynasty of the Bulls, so success is synonymous with the Air Jordan 6. Its role during one of Jordan's most prominent moments in career history cements it as something of an institution in basketball annals.

Nike Air Jordan 7

2010 Air Jordan VII (7) Retro sneakers are pictured in the photo studio Tuesday evening. The sneakers were brought in by Jessica "Brooklyn" Teo, 31, of West Reading. Photo by Natalie Kolb 9/9/2014 - Source: Getty

The Nike Air Jordan 7 stands out not only with its design but also with its association with two major benchmarks in the career of Jordan. He wore these when the Bulls went into their consecutive second championship and when he was with the Dream Team during the 1992 Barcelona Olympics.

The shoe was revolutionary not only with its inspiration from African art but also with sock-like footwear. Jordan dominated both the NBA season and the world, making the Air Jordan 7 a worldwide phenomenon. He represented not just individual brilliance but also team success, epitomizing the champion spirit.

Nike Air Jordan 11

Portland Trail Blazers v Golden State Warriors - Source: Getty

The Nike Air Jordan 11 has to be the most iconic sneaker in sneaker culture. When Jordan returned to basketball in 1995, he released the "Concord" colorway. The patent leather construction and sleek appearance were an innovation at that time for sports shoes.

A year later, Jordan wore the "Bred" edition in the 1996 NBA Finals. Jordan led the Bulls to an NBA-record 72 wins in the regular season and a championship that year. The Air Jordan 11 is more than just a sneaker; it's a testament to Jordan's ability to elevate his game and his brand.

Nike Air Jordan 12

Los Angeles Dodgers v Chicago Cubs - Source: Getty

Perhaps the most iconic visual of the Nike Air Jordan 12 is "Flu Game," Game 5 of the 1997 NBA Finals. At this point, Michael Jordan was looking very unwell, having fallen ill with the flu. That didn't keep him from producing 38 points to secure victory for the Bulls. The "Flu Game" black and red color scheme has since gone down in the books as only something Jordan can muster up through sheer will.

The Nike Air Jordan 12 is "Flu Game," Game 5 of the 1997 NBA Finals. At this point, Michael Jordan was wearing this performance shoe that combined style with a sleek, Rising Sun-inspired aesthetic. Its association with such an iconic moment places it in the history of basketball and sneakers.

Nike Air Jordan 13

Melbourne United v Los Angeles Clippers - Source: Getty

Inspired by a panther, the Nike Air Jordan 13 was created to symbolize Jordan's predatory instincts on court. The outsole in the shape of a cat's paw and eye that was holographic made this shoe stand out in style.

Worn by Jordan in the 1998 NBA season that ended with the sixth championship for the Bulls, the "He Got Game" colorway came into the limelight when Spike Lee used it for his film of the same name. The Air Jordan 13 is a representation of a player at the height of his powers, delivering unforgettable moments with every step.

Nike Air Jordan 14

Air Jordan 14 (image via StockX)

The Nike Air Jordan 14 marked the end. Jordan donned them to play his last game in the Chicago Bulls' 1998 NBA Finals. The jumper over Bryon Russell, known as "The Last Shot," gave the Bulls their sixth championship.

Chiseled from the inspiration of Jordan's taste for luxurious sports cars, the sneaker was a Ferrari prototype of design. Its association with this historic moment consigns it to a legendary status in the folklore of basketball and the world of sneakers.

Michael Jordan's Air Jordans are more than just sneakers; they are part of sports and cultural history, in which each pair tells the story of skill, resilience, and memorable moments on the court. From the rebellious Air Jordan 1 to the championship-clinching Air Jordan 14, these shoes represent an unparalleled legacy.

For the fans of the game and sneaker enthusiasts, they remind everyone of what could be achieved by talent, hard work, and innovation. The legacy of Jordan lives on not only in the annals of basketball but in the soles of these iconic sneakers.

​

7.title: This Day In Lakers History: Kobe Bryant Debuts Nike Zoom Kobe IV ‘MLK’
7.snippet: On Jan. 19, 2009 Los Angeles Lakers star Kobe Bryant debuted the Nike Zoom Kobe IV 'MLK' colorway against LeBron James and the Cavaliers.
7.content:
The NBA annually does their part to pay their respects on Martin Luther King Jr. Day, and they’re often joined by branding partners Nike and Adidas, among others. On Jan. 19, 2009, Kobe Bryant and the Los Angeles Lakers faced the Cleveland Cavaliers in a highly-anticipated matchup.

The Lakers were coming a season that ended in a disappointing loss to the Boston Celtics in the NBA Finals. The Cavaliers themselves were title contenders, and both teams entered the night with 31 wins and single-digit losses.

At the time, Bryant and James represented two of Nike’s standout pillars. As such, Bryant was outfitted with what became one of his most recognizable sneakers in a long-running signature shoe line with Nike — the Zoom Kobe IV ‘MLK’ colorway.

A white-based model featured a purple toe box, gold swoosh, gold color and snakeskin detailing. The shoe was later released in limited quantities on May 8, 2009.

As for matters on the court, Bryant dislocated the ring finger on his right hand while diving for a loose ball a mere two minutes into the game. He of course returned, and proceeded to score

20 points, to go along with six rebounds and 12 assists in 41 minutes.

Bryant scored nine points as part of a Lakers 16-7 run to open the fourth quarter. James finished with 23 points, nine rebounds and four assists.

While Bryant helped drive the engine, it was Pau Gasol (22 points and 12 rebounds) and the rest of the supporting cast that led the way in a Lakers 105-88 win. The victory snapped a two-game losing streak and prevented the Lakers from suffering their first stretch of three consecutive losses that season.

LeBron James reflects on first matchup against Kobe Bryant

This wasn’t the first time that James and Bryant squared off as that came all the way back in 2004. Years after their playing careers were over, James reflected on that first matchup with Bryant.

Have you subscribed to our YouTube channel? It’s the best way to watch player interviews, exclusive coverage from events, participate in live shows, and more!

8.title: Jayden Daniels Sends Commanders to NFC Championship in Custom Nike Kobe 6 Cleats
8.snippet: Rookie QB phenom Jayden Daniels took the field for the Washington Commanders in a custom pair of Nike Kobe 6 Cleats. Check here for details.
8.content:
Jayden Daniels' Custom Nike Kobe 6 Cleats

The Washington Commanders are headed to the NFC Championship Game for the first time in 33 years. During last night’s game against the Detroit Lions, the number one seed many assumed would pull away with the victory; rookie QB Jayden Daniels put up a historic performance. Daniels channeled his inner Mamba Mentality as he took the field in a custom pair of Nike Vapor Edge Kobe 6 Cleats in burgundy and gold hues of the Washington Commanders.

Daniels employed his long-time customizer, Joe Castro, who goes by @arts_undefined on Instagram, to create these cleats for the NFC Divisional game. This isn’t the first time Daniels laced up some heat as last week, in the Commanders’ first playoff win in 19 years, Jayden rocked a custom pair of Nike Vapor Edge Pro 360 cleats in his team’s colors. In the weeks prior, Jayden rocked more “hype” designs like his custom Travis Scott-inspired Air Jordan 1 Low cleats and Kobe 5-inspired cleats, but decided he wanted to channel Kobe Bryant’s “Mamba Mentality” against the Detroit Lions.

Becoming the second rookie QB to defeat a number one seed in the playoffs, Daniels’ performance last night included 22/31 passing attempts, 299 yards, two touchdowns, and 51 rushing yards. His first-half performance also set a new record, as his 242 yards in the first half were the most ever by a rookie QB in an NFL playoff game.

As for the cleat’s design, the pair is a burgundy-and-gold customized version of the Nike Vapor Edge Kobe 6, which was released in the Grinch colorway in November and a mismatched Grinch and Reverse Grinch color in December. On top of these released colors, Mole gave multiple NCAA programs PE colors for their football teams, including the Oregon Ducks, who wore a pair during the Rose Bowl.

Next up for Daniels and the Commanders is the Eagles and Rams game-winner, which will go down today at 3:00 PM ET. Hopefully, whatever pair he wears next week will help propel him and the team to a shot at the Super Bowl. Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest happenings in the sneaker and streetwear world.

Images via arts_undefined & Washington Commanders

9.title: Longhorns signee Aaliyah Crump selected for 2025 Nike Hoop Summit
9.snippet: For Longhorns fans, the 2025 Nike Hoop Summit has taken on special meaning. Texas women's basketball signee Aaliyah Crump will get to showcase her skills on...
9.content:
Longhorns signee Aaliyah Crump selected for 2025 Nike Hoop Summit

For Longhorns fans, the 2025 Nike Hoop Summit has taken on special meaning. Texas women's basketball signee Aaliyah Crump will get to showcase her skills on the national stage. The 26th Nike Hoop Summit will feature the top American high school athletes facing off against some of the top international players 19 and younger in the world.

While Crump's college debut is still months away, she has created excitement for the future over the last few months. During her junior season, Crump averaged 24.4 points, 8.2 rebounds, 3.7 steals, and 3.3 assists a game. Due to her play, the future Longhorns star was named the 2024 MaxPreps Minnesota Player of the Year.

Following her best season to date, Crump will work on her game on a talented team. Her teammates will include Darriana 'Dee' Alexander, Sienna Betts, Aaliyah Chavez, Jasmine 'Jazzy' Davidson, Alexandra Eschmeyer, and Madison Francis. Texas is also in the running to land Chavez, a highly regarded prospect.

The Longhorns are hoping to land Chavez and pair her with Crump, who was ranked among the top five players in the 2025 class.

Entering the summit, the USA men's and women's athletes have combined for 27 gold medals. They hope to add to their trophy case with more eyes on them than ever before. The Women's game will be televised live on the USA Network and streamed on Peacock is set for April 12th.

0.title: Nike Dunk Low "CBGB" Celebrates the Legacy of New York's Iconic Music Venue
0.snippet: Nike pays homage to CBGB's legacy with a special Dunk Low “CBGB.” The design draws heavily from the venue's gritty interior and unmistakable aesthetic.
0.content:
Few music venues hold the legendary status of CBGB, the New York City club that became the epicenter of punk rock and new wave music in the 1970s and 80s. Opened in 1973 by Hilly Kristal, the East Village spot initially envisioned as a haven for Country, Bluegrass, and Blues (hence the CBGB name) soon transformed into a breeding ground for iconic acts like the Ramones, Blondie, Talking Heads, and Patti Smith. Though it shuttered in 2006, the club’s influence reverberates through music and culture.

Now, nearly 20 years later, Nike pays homage to CBGB's legacy with a special Dunk Low “CBGB.” The design draws heavily from the venue’s gritty interior and unmistakable aesthetic. Torn and grunge-inspired textures cover the upper, reminiscent of the club’s poster-laden walls. Branding at the heel and tongue nods to the iconic CBGB logo font, while inner tongues feature street signs for Bleecker and Bowery—the intersection where the club once stood, cementing its place in New York history.

Though official release details remain under wraps, the Nike Dunk Low "CBGB" is expected to drop soon. Stay tuned for updates as Nike honors the raw energy and cultural impact of New York’s most famous punk rock venue.

In very closely related news, Nike has proclaimed the "Dunks Not Dead" on another punk-rock-inspired release.

1.title: Nike Air Sport bags
1.snippet: The Air Sport bag weights just five pounds, which helps keep the weight carrying a bag down. The features Nike's proprietary EquaFlex Max Air curved revolving...
1.content:
Nike Air Sport bags

No matter who you are as a golfer, you need a bag.

Yes, without a bag you don’t have a place to carry your clubs, you tees, balls, maybe a towel and other accessories. So the bag you chose is important.

For Nike, the new bag is the Nike Air Sport carry bag. It’s certainly not a tour bag, but it’s far from just a canvas back to sling over your back.

The Air Sport bag weights just five pounds, which helps keep the weight carrying a bag down. The features Nike’s proprietary EquaFlex Max Air curved revolving double strap system, which distributes bag weight evenly across the shoulders. Coupled with a ventilated air mesh back pad, the Nike Air Sport helps amplify endurance while reducing fatigue on the course.

Of coufse, none of that means much of you are strapping the bag to the back of a golf cart. In that case, you might be more impressed with the Air Sport’s eight-way, three full-length divider system, its nine functional pockets, including a water-resistant fleece-lined valuables pocket, insulated cooler pocket, quick access drawstring pocket, full-length apparel pocket and scorecard/pencil pocket, offer plenty of storage space for everything an athlete needs during a round.

The Nike Air Sport carry bag is available in nine color combinations hues featured in Nike Golf’s Spring 2014 apparel line.

Additional features include iIntegrated GPS loop, pen sleeve and glove patch, custom grip leg end caps and matching rain hood.

MSRP is $149.99.

Information: Nikegolf.com.

2.title: The Nike Pegasus Premium “Atmosphere” Launches This Spring
2.snippet: The Nike Pegasus Premium "Atmosphere" will launch Spring 2025 for $210. Tap in for a look at this women's exclusive colorway.
2.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Nike wields its magic wand the best when it creates a piece of sports equipment that looks so good that it needs to be worn with casual clothes. After all, every popular lifestyle shoe on the market was at once a piece of athletic wear. The Pegasus Premium is poised to joined that exclusive group.

Debuting at the Nike’s On Air innovation summit in Paris last April, the Pegasus Premium instantly wowed the crowd with its simplicity. To its benefit, Nike kept the upper design rather pedestrian; nothing about it strikes as new. However, the full-length Zoom Air bag at the midsole is what had us excited for the first time in a while.

Nike opted for full-length visible Zoom Air on a running shoe on just one other occasion (the Zoom All Out Flyknit). The ergonomic shape of the unit on the Pegasus Premium is what makes it so much more attractive to the eye. Upon testing the shoe, the Pegasus Premium is a medium-distance runners dream. For commuters, you may never want to take these off.

On January 30th, the Swoosh will launch the Nike Pegasus Premium in the grey/orange colorway for $210 in both mens and womens sizes. More colorways will arrive later this Spring and into Summer, like this women’s exclusive “Atmosphere” colorway that features the Zoom Air in a metallic silver. Official images are just below.

3.title: Nike Plans Full-Building Wrap at 278 Post Street by Union Square
3.snippet: Planning permits have been filed for a temporary building wrap-around the Nike store at 278 Post Street across from Union Square, San Francisco...
3.content:
Planning permits have been filed for a temporary building wrap-around the Nike store at 278 Post Street across from Union Square, San Francisco. The billboard is proposed as a celebration of the NBA All-Star Game coming to Chase Center next month. Colliers Inc. is the property owner.

The planning application estimates that the project will cost around $50,000. Plans write that the billboard is “non-invasive, tension-held, and would not require any destructive attachments to the building.” Installation is expected to occur from February 10th through 12th and be live from February 13th through 18th. The exhibition game will occur at the San Francisco Chase Center on Sunday, February 16th.

The seven-story building was constructed in 1910 with a mix of Renaissance and Baroque influences and was designed by Willis Polk at Daniel H. Burnham & Co. The 1974 field notes from city staff describe the structure as “very important to the Union Square,” praising its relationship with surrounding buildings and its importance as a contribution to the cluster.

Nike has occupied the corner building on Union Square since early 1997. City records show the property last sold in 1998 for $52.12 million.

4.title: "Light Bone" Arrives on the Nike Air Max Muse
4.snippet: "Light Bone" Arrives on the Nike Air Max Muse, Combining with a light blue hue at the heel to create a new look for the women-oriented silhouette.
4.content:
Name: Nike Air Max Muse “Light Bone”

Colorway: Light Bone/Metallic Silver/Phantom

SKU: HV4445-072

MSRP: $160 USD

Release Date: 2025

Where to Buy: Nike

A new generation of Nike Air Max shoes is here for 2025. While the Air Max Dn8 is due to drop later this year, the Air Max Muse just made its global debut earlier this month. The shoe, which is designed with women in mind, was teased throughout 2024 before being officially revealed in November. Since then, a wide variety of colorways have popped up, ranging from a stealthy “Triple Black” to a textured “Cave Stone.”

Now, a new “Light Bone” iteration has been previewed by the Swoosh. This take on the shoe sees its shade of off-white occupy a majority of the mixed material upper. “Metallic Silver” is present at the small Swooshes on each side of the midfoot while the outsole favors a semi-translucent finish. As for the Air unit, it is surrounded by a light blue that breaks up the otherwise monochromatic makeover.

At the time of writing, Nike has not yet indicated when this “Light Bone” version of the Air Max Muse will be releasing. Stay tuned for updates, including the reveal of additional colorways, as we currently expect this take on the shoe to drop in the coming months via Nike SNKRS and select retailers at a starting price of $160 USD in women’s sizing.

6.title: Nike Ja 2 "Coconut Milk" Releases February 2025
6.snippet: Engineered for the court, the Ja 2 features Nike Air Zoom technology for responsive cushioning. The durable outsole ensures excellent grip, making it ideal for...
6.content:
Nike continues to expand Ja Morant’s signature line with the Ja 2 “Coconut Milk.” This colorway combines softer tones with high-performance features, staying true to Morant’s style and energy.

- Advertisement -

The design showcases a creamy “Coconut Milk” upper made with mesh, nubuck, and suede. These materials create a textured, premium look. Black accents on the heel and midsole add bold contrast, while a Pink Foam Swoosh offers a subtle pop of spring-ready color. Embroidered “12 AM” branding on the heel pays tribute to Morant’s dedication and late-night practice sessions, completing the sneaker’s distinct style.

Engineered for the court, the Ja 2 features Nike Air Zoom technology for responsive cushioning. The durable outsole ensures excellent grip, making it ideal for intense games. Whether you’re playing basketball or rocking them casually, this sneaker offers the perfect mix of style and function.

The Nike Ja 2 “Coconut Milk” is set to drop on February 1, 2025. It will be available at select Nike Basketball retailers, in-store, and on Nike.com for $120 USD. This versatile addition to Ja Morant’s lineup is a must-have for athletes and sneaker enthusiasts.

7.title: Nike Proclaims "Dunks Not Dead" on this Punk-Themed Dunk Low
7.snippet: This new Nike Dunk Low channels punk themes from the golden eras of The Sex Pistols, Dead Kennedys, and even modern acts like Rancid and The Casualties. The...
7.content:
While the Nike Dunk has seen a decline in sales over the past 18 months, Nike isn't ready to let the silhouette fade into the background. The Swoosh has cleverly embraced the spirit of rebellion with its latest release, drawing inspiration from the iconic punk mantra, "Punks Not Dead," to deliver a design brimming with attitude and nostalgia.

This new Nike Dunk Low channels punk themes from the golden eras of The Sex Pistols, Dead Kennedys, and even modern acts like Rancid and The Casualties. The design stays true to the gritty, DIY aesthetic of the subculture, featuring black leather uppers paired with rugged, rough-cut canvas overlays. The overlays are accented with exposed stitching reminiscent of punk-era clothing modifications, adding a layer of authenticity to the design.

Customization plays a major role in this release, with velcro panels under the Swoosh's tack stitching and on the tongue, allowing for personalized patch additions—a nod to the era's emphasis on individuality. The rebellious look is rounded out by removable button badges, including one emblazoned with the phrase "DUNKS NOT DEAD," driving home the collection's theme.

The Nike Dunk Low "Dunks Not Dead" is expected to arrive in Spring 2025, proving that the Dunk still has plenty of fight left.

Stay tuned for official release details on our Nike Releases page as the season approaches.

In other Punk-Dunk news, Nike honors CBGB with a special-edition design.
