0.title: Nike tops StockX sneaker sales in 2024
0.snippet: Nike tops StockX sneaker sales in 2024. Other popular brands on the online resale platform included Supreme, Fear of God, Ugg, Crocs and Timberland.
0.content:
Listen to the article 4 min This audio is auto-generated. Please let us know if you have feedback

Dive Brief:

Nike was the best-selling sneaker brand on StockX for the third year in a row in 2024, according to the online resale platform’s newly released Big Facts: Current Culture Index report.

Jordan, Adidas, New Balance and Asics rounded out the top five sneaker list in that respective order, with all of them maintaining their positions for a third straight year. Ugg and Crocs ranked first and second in non-sneaker shoe sales for the second straight year, followed by Timberland. Fear of God was the most popular apparel brand for the third straight year.

EssilorLuxottica’s recently acquired brand Supreme remained in first place for accessories, a spot it has kept since StockX began releasing its rankings in 2020. Supreme kept its spot as the second most-popular apparel brand. It has held that position since Fear of God took the top spot for the category in 2022, per the report.

Dive Insight:

The annual report from StockX covers 2024 trends and makes predictions about 2025. In addition to tracking which brands see the most sales, StockX also tracks growth.

China-based brand Anta was the fastest growing sneaker label on the platform in 2024. The report said Kyrie Irving’s signature shoe, called the Kai 1, helped drive the brand to a staggering 1,901% year-over-year increase in platform sales, which StockX refers to as trades.

Maison Margiela was the second fastest growing sneaker brand, with trades up 425% year over year. Meanwhile, Saucony was the fifth fastest-growing sneaker brand, with trades up 120%. This marks the first time the brand has landed in the top 5 for growth, which the platform attributed to the company’s big investments and high-profile collaborations including those with Jae Tips, Bodega and Minted New York.

Gucci and Timberland were the fastest growing non-sneaker shoes brands, with trades up 410% and 237%, respectively. StockX credited Gucci’s sandals and pool slides for the brand’s growth, and said Timberland’s collaborations with Louis Vuitton, Supreme and JJJJound were pivotal. Also relevant was The Notorious B.I.G. Wheat, which Timberland released in September in honor of the late musician’s “Ready To Die” album, which celebrated its 30th anniversary.

In apparel, Polo Ralph Lauren sales were up 600%, making it the fastest growing brand in the category in 2024. StockX said the growth was due to “the emergence of Ralphcore on TikTok,” which led to a new generation of consumers who “embraced and even redefined what the label stands for.”

Looking ahead to 2025, StockX said new brands would take hold in the competitive sneaker resale market. Creativity would also win over consumers, as evidenced by the popularity of New Balance’s 1906 sneaker loafer, the Simone Rocha collab with Crocs, and the enduring appeal of MSCHF’s Big Red Boots, per the report.

Newer apparel brands, such as Hellstar and Revenge, “are seeing rapid growth, suggesting streetwear is not dead as some have reported over the last year,” StockX said. In addition, Tremaine Emory’s Denim Tears streetwear brand is the platform’s third fastest-growing apparel label.

The report also said there could be a recovery in terms of resale prices and price premiums with respect to Nike and Jordan Brand, “assuming the sportswear giant honors its promise to return to a model centered around scarcity.”

“The resale market proved its resilience in 2024, with more than 100 brands closing the year with record sales on StockX,” Greg Schwartz, co-founder and CEO of StockX, said in the release. “We’re incredibly optimistic about the year ahead. Whatever 2025 has in store — whether that be new names in streetwear, viral collectibles brands, or a fresh set of players in the sneaker space — our product offering will continue to diversify to serve our customers as new trends take hold.”

2.title: The 2-Minute Test That Helps Every Runner Move Better
2.snippet: Using motion-capture technology and a self-learning algorithm developed by the Nike Sport Research Lab, NSRL Form is a head-to-toe analysis of how you move...
2.content:
Less than 400 meters from the Santa Monica coastline, curious runners lined the corner of a vacated parking lot. It was February of 2022. Blaise Williams, PhD, MPT, remembers the conditions well. He was ushering runners who were competing in a Redondo Beach 10K race through a pop-up experience of NSRL Form, the Nike Sport Research Lab’s newest movement-analysis tool, which was still in beta testing. Williams, a Principal Sport Scientist in the NSRL, had brought his team to gauge interest among the participating runners.

To the naked eye, the testing area featured a tent, a treadmill and 10 high-speed cameras mounted onto struts. But the reality was much more rigorous, culminating years of professional research inside and outside the lab. The cameras tracked an athlete’s biomechanical gait as they jogged for two minutes on the treadmill. Afterward, they’d receive a one-on-one consultation and a customized head-to-toe report on their movement pattern once it was fed through an NSRL-generated algorithm. The report was supplemented with running form suggestions, salient NTC workouts, and shoe recommendations based on the runner’s current profile to help them achieve their goals.

That day, things were not going to plan. The computer monitors tracking the data inputs were fizzling out in the sun. The cameras were overheating. Later that night, Williams and the team would stay up until 3 a.m. trying to help bulletproof the equipment against the mid-afternoon heat for the following day’s testing. They woke up that morning exhausted, struggling to keep their eyes open, which made the sight in front of them that much more remarkable: a line of runners trailing outside the tent, ready to get in on this first-of-its-kind feedback tool.

The moment sealed the notion that NSRL Form was a tool athletes wanted, says Williams. “Even though everything seemed to go wrong, to see that kind of curiosity from runners — we knew we were onto something.”

6.title: Nike Free Golf NN Performance Review
6.snippet: The Nike Free Golf is the perfect shoe for new golfers, but it's also a safe and comfortable choice for seasoned players. I'm currently a 14.4 handicap, and I...
6.content:
Classic Nike Free technology has found its way to Nike golf on the Nike Free Golf NN. Of course we had to review it. Let’s find out how this beloved tech translates to golf.

Nike Free Golf NN Price: $130 (some colorways at $78) Sizing: True to size Buy at Nike

Nike Free Golf NN Testing Process

The Nike Free Golf NN was the only time I’ve put over 20 miles on a golf shoe…and I intend to keep it that way (I’ve never been more tired).

I decided to do my testing while spending the week covering the Black Desert Championship in Saint George, Utah.

An article posted by Glenmuir claims the average golfer walks roughly five miles per round. I put five miles on the Nike Free Golf on day one, and somewhere close to fifteen more throughout the rest of the week.

I experienced all types of terrain and slopes, so I can confidently tell you how the Nike Free Golf felt and whether or not they’re worth your hard-earned cash.

At first glance, the Nike Free Golf NN might make you think you’re preparing for a quick run under the city lights. It brought me back to my junior high days with its simple design, reminiscent of the Nike Free Run models.

Enough reminiscing, though—let’s dive in.

Traction

The Nike Free Golf NN is spikeless and was built specifically to perform well in wet climates.

The traction is a mix of different rubberized shapes, with the heel having the most consistent ridge-like structure. As I mentioned earlier, I put twenty miles on the Nike Free Golf NN and never experienced slippage.

On top of the intense walking at Black Desert, I also made sure to get a quick round in while the weather was nice. The Nike Free Golf NN performed great on the course—even though I shot a below-average round.

I noticed the best traction on the fairway and felt no struggle with more powerful shots on the tee box.

I wouldn’t go as far as to say this is the best spikeless traction on the market, but I would recommend the Nike Free Golf NN to any casual golfer looking for a solid starter shoe.

Fit

I went all in by wearing the Nike Free Golf NN to the Black Desert Championship. It was pretty risky to show up to a tournament in a shoe I hadn’t worn yet.

How did it turn out for me? Just fine.

I wear an 11.5, and the 11.5 Nike Free Golf fit perfectly. No slippage, blisters, or need to re-tighten throughout the day. The Nike Free Golf NN felt great and ran true to size.

I’ve mentioned this in previous articles, but if you’re new here, I’ll say it again: My feet are somewhere between narrow and wide. I wouldn’t consider myself to have wide feet, but they’re definitely not narrow either.

That being said, the fit was nice and roomy for me. Honestly, they could’ve given me even less room around the toes, and it would have been fine.

My recommendation to our wide-footed readers is to look for the “wide” option on Nike’s website. When a direct wide option is available, go with your normal size but in wide.

Cushion

Nike Free Run shoes were created to give athletes a shoe that mimics the feeling of being barefoot as Nike struggled to keep up with the ultimately doomed barefoot running craze that was happening at the time.

Honestly, the midsole was great considering what I put it through during week one. My feet were tired, but I was impressed by how good they felt overall. It was a little bit stiffer than I would’ve liked, but this helped on the different types of terrain I encountered on the course.

This was the first time I’ve ever worn a shoe designed to mimic barefoot movement, and I took note of the slight increase in flexibility and natural feel.

The only downside was slight soreness on my heels. The Nike Free Golf NN felt a little tall at the heels, which led to mild soreness from the heel to the midfoot.

It’s a trivial issue and not a major concern, but it’s worth noting if you’re someone with sensitive heels.

Support

If you can put twenty miles on a golf shoe in seven days without major blisters or pain, it’s safe to say the support is solid.

Nike added a bulky plastic clip around the heel, extending up to the start of the midsole, which contributes to excellent support.

On top of that, Nike reinforced the upper to securely attach it to the outsole, adding extra stability.

This is a great shoe with multiple elements contributing to strong support.

Style

The Nike Free Golf NN is an adaptation of the Nike Free Run line, making it recognizable right off the bat.

The original Nike Free Run was released in the early 2000s, and the most recent Free Run model came out several years ago.

Some may find it odd that Nike decided to release a Nike Free Golf model in 2024, but as I mentioned, the Nike Free Golf NN is both recognizable and familiar. I remember a TED Talk by Derek Thompson in which he discusses the importance of creating something new while still maintaining a sense of familiarity.

That’s exactly what Nike did with the Nike Free Golf NN.

Price

The Nike Free Golf NN is currently on sale on Nike’s website. At $78 and $92 (at the time of publication) for some colorways, it ranks among the top five budget options for Nike golf shoes. When comparing price to performance, I feel the Nike Free Golf NN is priced appropriately, and you’ll definitely get your money’s worth.

It’s not the flashiest golf shoe of all time, but it gets the job done for the golfer focused on casual performance.

Considering its similarities to the Nike Free Run shoes, the price is in line. The biggest difference is the golf-specific traction, which justifies the slightly higher price compared to the regular Nike Free Run shoes. Nike gets an A+ on this one.

Nike Free Golf NN Summary

For anyone who plays golf casually, the Nike Free Golf NN will suit your game well. If you’re an aspiring tournament golfer, I’d opt for a spiked shoe.

The Nike Free Golf is the perfect shoe for new golfers, but it’s also a safe and comfortable choice for seasoned players. I’m currently a 14.4 handicap, and I felt the Nike Free Golf suited my game just fine.

For its performance, the Nike Free Golf would make a great addition to your golf closet, especially if you’re just getting into golf and looking for your first pair.

connorlwt 9 / 10 Total Score

How the Author Golfs

Tyler Allred (19 handicap): Golfs 2-3 times a week spending the bulk of his time playing actual rounds. Mostly pushes himself to improve every part of his game, but also enjoys a casual round of golf every now and then.

Disclosure

While Nike did send a pair of the Free Golf NN to facilitate this review, the company had no involvement in this review, didn’t receive an advance look at it, and has not attempted to influence it.

7.title: Over $400,000 worth of stolen Nike products recovered from High Desert train burglary
7.snippet: What is article sharing? ... Two teens were arrested and over $400,000 worth of stolen Nike products were recovered from a train burglary in the Amboy area...
7.content:
Two teens were arrested and over $400,000 worth of stolen Nike products were recovered from a train burglary in the Amboy area Wednesday, January 15, officials said.

Around 6:40 p.m. deputies responded to the area of Amboy and National Trails Highway after BNSF police reported multiple suspects burglarizing a train, San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department said in a statement. Deputies later attempted to stop an unmarked white van headed west on Amboy Road near Zelda Lane in Wonder Valley that led to a brief pursuit. The van became disabled on a dirt berm and two occupants fled on foot, according to the statement.

Two teens, ages 16 and 17, were later apprehended.

The California Highway Patrol assisted and stopped an additional vehicle believed to be related as it traveled northbound on South Old Woman Springs Road near Butte Street in Landers. The driver, whose details were not released, fled on foot and has not been arrested, officials said.

Investigators recovered all 218 cases of stolen Nike products worth approximately $408,000. Details on where exactly the products were found or what charges the teens faced were not released.

In Nov. 2023, the California Highway Patrol seized roughly $200,000 worth of Nike products stolen from a train in the Amboy area.

8.title: Nike’s RTFKT Imprint Is Over, But It Isn't Bowing Out Quietly
8.snippet: The collection, available on Zellerfeld's website on January 16, includes six sneaker models: the RTFKT Dunk, CodeX Dunk, Bladed Dragon, Undead Evo, Reptile Evo...
8.content:
Nike's RTFKT is closing its final chapter with one last drop — and it happens to be its most disruptive yet.

After four years, Nike has shut down RTFKT, a virtual fashion and technology brand that created one-of-a-kind sneakers and NFTs. The decision to dissolve likely comes as a result of declining interest in NFTs in recent years. The digital disruptor won’t go out without a bang, though. As its last hurrah, RTFKT is dropping the MNLTH X Blade collection, designed in collaboration with 3D printing company Zellerfeld.

https://www.instagram.com/p/CrYolT-xkI5/?hl=en 1 / 2

The collection, available on Zellerfeld's website on January 16, includes six sneaker models: the RTFKT Dunk, CodeX Dunk, Bladed Dragon, Undead Evo, Reptile Evo and the aptly titled Cybr Stomper, a boxy silhouette fit for a cyborg. Unlike previous RTFKT Nike sneakers, this latest collection abandons traditional Nike silhouettes like the Air Force 1 for more obscure builds like the Undead Evo, which boasts a midsole resembling a reptile jaw, molars and all.

RTFKT wasn't around for a long time but in its short life, it redefined the intersection of technology and fashion through first-in-kind collaborations with cultural tastemakers like Takashi Murakami and Byredo, bringing 2D fashion and beauty into the third dimension.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

Alas, parting is such sweet sorrow. RTFKT will be missed and remembered as one of digital fashion's biggest triumphs. RIP!

9.title: Cactus Plant Flea Market Will Launch Three Nike Swamp Sponge Dunks in Fall 2025
9.snippet: CPFM is getting a new Nike sneaker in Fall 2025 dubbed the Nike Swamp Sponge Dunk. Find details and release info here.
9.content:
CPFM x Nike Swamp Sponge Dunk Teaser

Cynthia Lu has long impacted the fashion scene, starting as an assistant to the legendary Pharrell Williams and eventually her brand, Cactus Plant Flea Market. Co-signs from her former boss and other figures in the hip-hop, fashion, and streetwear scenes grew the brand’s recognition, but the collaboration with Nike on the VaporMax in 2019 put the brand on the map for sneakerheads.

Following this, the duo worked on various Nike products, including two Swarovski-covered Dunk Lows, the Overgrown Flea 1, the CPFM Air Flea 2, and most recently, new colorways of the AF1. Now, CPFM is working on a new silhouette in Fall 2025 dubbed the Swamp Sponge Dunk.

CPFM's Nike Blazer Mid Sponge By You from 2019

While no images of this new CPFM silhouette have appeared, we can confirm that this sneaker will have three different colorways. One takes on a tonal Sequoia finish, another mixes photo blue, digital pink, and sequoia, and the last one combines psychic purple, photo blue, and gold suede. We should expect an avant-garde design that defies the typical Nike design language as CPFM’s previous two Nike models, the unreleased Flea 1, Flea 1 Overgrown, and Flea 2; all turn heads with their wild design details.

Previously, CPFM worked with Nike on a Nike By You Blazer Mid called Sponge By You, featuring a mixture of spongy and natural materials that one could choose from. With this new Dunk model bearing the same sponge moniker, the spongy material found on the Blazer Mid will likely appear here.

The CPFM x Nike Swamp Sponge Dunk Collection will release in Fall 2025 through CPFM and Nike SNKRS online. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is $150. 2.title: “Batman” Descends On The Nike Air Max 90
2.snippet: The Nike Air Max 90 carries "Batman" colors into Spring 2025. Click in for release info and official images.
2.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Nike and DC Comics have never come together for an official collaboration, yet the Caped Crusader has more ties to Beaverton than you might think. Most prominent in that category is the special retoolings of the Air Jordan 6 and Air Trainer III for Michael Keaton’s Batman Returns. Additionally, the Dark Knight’s ineffable black and yellow combination continues to drape Nike seasonal product with regularity, once again the case with the Nike Air Max 90 “Batman.”

Certainly additional gold-on-black monikers (“Steelers” chief among them) would’ve applied here, but the addition of ripstop panelling as a foundation makes the grungy, crime-fighting lean all the more fitting. Flashes of “Buff Gold” on branding hits throughout the shoe, including a forefoot mini-Swoosh and the “Nike Air” tag on the heel, further reinforcing the comic book ties and brightening up the profile a bit in the process.

Moreover, this mainline look lands among a crowded group of colorways coming to light, a major push no doubt aligning with the silo’s 35th anniversary. Taken alongside the Air Max 90 “Camo Pack” and Air Max 90 “Racing,” this “Batman” do-up ensures that there’ll be plenty of options for Air Max 90 purists throughout 2025. The Nike Air Max 90 “Batman” is expected to land in the near future, arriving with the usual $130 sticker price.

Elsewhere in our coverage, Jordan Releases 2025 are fully underway, with the Air Jordan 4 “Aluminum” emerging as a major one on our radar.

3.title: Even Drenched in "Oil," Nike's Newest Air Max Chunkster Is a Stunner
3.snippet: Nike's Air Max Muse is a super thicc running shoe designed with Y2K flair. Even in "Oil Green," the chunky sneaker is a stylish Swoosh masterpiece.
3.content:
Nike's Air Max Muse is about to take over 2025. Well, maybe. The all-new Air Max sneaker hasn't gotten the big Nike push you'd expect of a flagship shoe but, then again, it did only just debut in proper.

In mid-2024, first looks at Nike's Air Max Muse emerged thanks to, of all people, Nike athlete and Olympian gymnast Jordan Chiles.

Certainly, Chiles is deserving of the title of "Muse" but that she would be the Nike ambassador tapped to introduce a fresh Air Max sneaker speaks to the crossover appeal that the Muse is intended to foster.

You can see the appeal, either way: Nike's Air Max Muse debuted in a smart black and metallic silver colorway that infused flashy Y2K appeal into a covetable dad shoe shape.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

The Air Max Muse has all the hallmarks of a wholly different sleeper Nike hit, in fact. Compare the Muse to Nike's famously thicc Air Monarch and its stylish M2K Tekno cousin. The comparative chunk is all too obvious.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this YouTube video. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy Subscribe to Highsnobiety on YouTube

As such, the Air Max Muse may be more intended to slowly rev up in demand as opposed to suddenly explode with vitality, akin to the Air Monarch's patient buildup in hype.

That'd at least explain why Nike is being so deliberate with its rollout of new colorways for the thus-unreleased Air Max Muse.

Now, the Air Max Muse is quietly releasing in a statement design that dresses the thicc sneaker in a variety of contrasting hues.

Besides the familiar black base, there's also a smattering of "University Red" (on the Swoosh), "Metallic Silver" (on the heel's Air bubble), and most plainly, "Oil Green," which gives the Air Max Muse a real visual weight.

nike 1 / 3

Not that it needed much help in that department.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Tiktok. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

Considering the recent Air Max innovations and delightful colorway contrivances that've recently come out of Nike's design HQ, the new Air Max Muse isn't even the wildest sneaker to step onto the streets but it is, if anything, a sign that the weighty dad shoe is poised for great things in 2025.

Makes sense that the oily green colorway is releasing alongside the more classic silver Air Max Muse on January 10 via Nike's website and SNKRS app, kicking off what could be a very big year for the very big shoe.

6.title: LeBron James' Mom Said, 'Trust Your Gut,' While Considering A $10M Reebok Offer, Then In 2015, He Signed A $1B Lifetime Deal With Nike
6.snippet: LeBron James has revealed why he turned down a $10 million shoe deal at 18. The Los Angeles Lakers player appeared on the “New Heights” podcast to reflect...
6.content:
LeBron James has revealed why he turned down a $10 million shoe deal at 18.

The Los Angeles Lakers player appeared on the “New Heights” podcast to reflect on the array of shoe deals he considered during his early days in the league. While currently signed with Nike, James once weighed different options.

At a young age, James was inspired by Michael Jordan and Penny Hardaway, who were both signed to Nike. When he began playing for AAU, he grew fond of Adidas, Nike’s retail competitor.

“It was Adidas from seventh, eighth grade to pretty much my junior senior year. They sponsored us. Every year, we played in all the Adidas tournaments,” he said on the podcast.

At one point, a wave of companies approached James, but he felt that Reebok had delivered the most compelling pitch.

“I’m sitting across from the table. I’m a senior in high school…I’m going back to class the next day. They flew me in. I’m going back to St. Vince St Mary the next day, my senior year, and the guy slides over a check to me at the end of the table. It’s me, my mom, and Maverick Carter, at the end of the table, and he says, ‘If you don’t go talk to any other companies, this is yours.’ And I look at it, $10 million f-cking dollars,” James recalled.

0.title: The Nike Air Max 90 "Batman" Is Ready for Gotham

Since its debut 35 years ago, the Nike Air Max 90 has done a lot. In addition to high-profile collaborations and limited Quickstrike releases, Tinker Hatfield's iconic design has also taken on straightforward but fresh makeovers. Case in point?: A newly-surfaced 'Black/Yellow' outfit reminiscent of Gotham's Batman.

The 'Caped Crusader'-like color combination previously appeared on other Air Max silhouettes. Base layers on the upcoming pair replace traditional fabric with a sturdier ripstop nylon; the tongue and panels around the heel follow suit. Branding hits throughout the iconic model deviate in a muted yellow that helps draw the connection to Batman's on-screen costume in the late 1980s.

Enjoy official photos of the two-tone pair ahead, as you wait for a firm Nike.com release. The shoes are expected to hit retailers at $135 USD.

3.title: Q&A: U.S. Olympian Aaliyah Butler Signs NIL Deal With Nike
3.snippet: Interview with Aaliyah Butler, Team USA Olympian and University of Georgia 400m runner, after signing an NIL deal with Nike.
3.content:
Was there any part of you that felt like there was less pressure on you going into the Trials as opposed to if you would have ran really well at NCAAs?

Definitely. If I did make the final [at NCAAs] and ran a crazy time, there definitely would have been a lot of pressure to make that team. I still had the same goal to just go out there and try to make the team, which I did, but yeah there was just a different mindset. Go out there and have fun, and what happens happens.

You talked about the difference that Coach Karim coming in made, and that wasn’t just for you because it also happened to Christopher Morales-Williams on the men’s side. Can you speak to how special it was to have two of the fastest 400m runners in NCAA history both representing Georgia on the national stage last year?

It was an amazing feeling knowing that we both ran the 400m, getting coached by the same coach, running the same workouts, and just seeing how far along we came since our freshman year. It was definitely special and it kind of put our names on the map. You’d think Georgia would just be a short sprint school, but it’s not.

What was your experience in Paris like on your first senior national team?

I was nervous, but I wasn’t really nervous because I know I have more chances to make Olympic teams. It was a learning experience for me to know what to do when I go again to another Olympics. I was learning from other people that are professionals and have been there and done that before, getting to know them and getting advice, and getting that information so I can take it along all the way to the next Olympic Trials.

When you come back to the NCAA this season, two of your biggest competitors in the collegiate scene this season [Bella Whittaker and Kaylyn Brown] were your teammates in Paris. Does seeing them up close and how they worked through relay camps and situations like that get you a little more excited for coming back home and going head-to-head against them this season?

Yes, I definitely think we all can do something really special in the 400m. They’re training together right now, and I know when we go head-to-head it’s going to be something special.

We’re here to announce your NIL deal with Nike. Could you talk a bit about what appealed to you about Nike and what has you most excited about what is to come from this partnership?

I’ve been a Nike girl since I was born and it’s always been Nike for me. I’ve never worn any other brands so when Nike came to me and wanted an NIL deal it was a no-brainer. Being with Nike, how they treat their athletes is really good and seeing what they do for their professional track athletes right now. I knew it was Nike all the way.

4.title: K-State Signee Speiser Selected for Nike Hoop Summit
4.snippet: Kansas State women's basketball 2025 signee Jordan Speiser has been named to the USA roster for the 26th Nike Hoop Summit, which features a men's and...
4.content:
MANHATTAN, Kan. – Kansas State women's basketball 2025 signee Jordan Speiser has been named to the USA roster for the 26th Nike Hoop Summit, which features a men's and women's game between the top American players against the top international players 19-and-younger, on April 12, at Moda Center in Portland, Oregon.



The 2025 Nike Hoop Summit games will be televised on USA Network and streamed on Peacock. The women's game will tip-off at 6:30 p.m.



Speiser, a 2024-25 Jersey Mike's Naismith Trophy Girl's High School Player of the Year Preseason Watch List, is a five-star prospect and ranked sixith overall by On3 and ranked 10th overall in the class of 2025 by ESPNHoopGurlz.



According to ProspectsNation.com, Speiser is ranked 14th in the nation and the number five wing in the country. According to 247sports, Speiser ranked 19th overall, rated as the number four shooting guard in the nation and the top player in the state of Missouri.



Following the conclusion of the summer of 2024, Speiser was rated as one of the top shooters in the nation by ESPN.com. During the summer, Speiser shot 54.5 percent at Nike Nationals and tallied an overall EYBL shooting percentage of 47.3 percent.



During her career at Lutheran of St. Charles County, Speiser is a two-time Missouri Basketball Coaches Association (MBCA) All-State Class 5 selection and a two-time MBCA Class 5 District 4 recipient. She helped the program to a state title in 2023 and a runner-up finish in 2024.



(11/10) K-State begins a two-game homestand on Thursday, January 16, as the Wildcats host new Big 12 member Arizona at 6:30 p.m. For tickets, visit kstatesports.com/tickets or call (800) 221-CATS.



Thursday's game will air on ESPN+ and will also be available on the K-State Sports Network and the flagship stations of K-State women's basketball in Manhattan, Sunny 102.5 and 1350 KMAN.

6.title: The Nike Air Max 90 Drift Reaches For Eclectic Light Blue And Brown
6.snippet: The Nike Air Max 90 Drift reaches for eclectic light blue and brown. The offshoot series continues with a attention-grabbing outfit.
6.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Nike has never been to precious about their most beloved models. In fact, it’s almost the opposite; the more popular a silhouette, the more likely is to receive some sort of retooling, reimaging or offshoot. It’s why we were unsurprised at the top of last year to catch wind of the Air Max Plus Drift, a TPU-heavy offshoot of the Tn proper that later became a wider theme with the release of the Air Max 90 Drift.

We wondered aloud whether additional Air Max models would join those two in changing shape, something that still hasn’t come about, but one of those standard bearers is marching on with a chaotic new colorway. It’s an inherently clashing palette atop the mechanized model, blending neutral notes of black, cream, brown and grey on the foundation and TPU extensions at the quarter.

Two accent shades play in the space in between, with aquamarine tonality taking over the Swoosh and two pull-tabs down the midline, while a yellow ribbon weaves throughout the profile to match the vamp Air Max branding. Buying any pair of the Nike Air Max 90 Drift requires a love for the unconventional, likely making this half-earthy edition a strength-on-strength sort of pair.

Look for this Nike Air Max 90 Drift hitting shelves in the coming weeks, projected to carry its standard $160 retail price.

Across the hall in Beaverton, we’re starting to see tangible 2025 Jordan Releases, including the Jordan 11 Low “Year of the Snake” and Jordan 5 “Earth,” both expected towards the end of January.

8.title: The Nike Air Max Plus Golf Hyper Blue Releases January 2025
8.snippet: The Nike Air Max Plus Golf Hyper Blue will release on January 24, 2025, through Nike and select Nike Golf retailers online and in-store. Available in men's...
8.content:
Published January 15, 2025

Since launching in 1997, the Air Max Plus has been a consistent part of Nike’s Air Max lineup. Over the last two years, fans of the Tuned Air-laden model have been blessed with retros of OG colorways, like the Sunset, Voltage Purple, and Hyper Blue, with the latter also joining a new variant to the Air Max Plus family in 2025. Alongside the Sunset colorway, the Air Max Plus Golf will launch in the Hyper Blue colorway.

On its base, the sneaker retains its mesh base, with a blue gradient color scheme that transitions from a light blue near the toe and tongue down to a darker blue near the edge and heel. Wavy, black TPU overlays inspired by the palm trees designer Sean McDowell saw on his vacation in Florida are placed across the upper to help with durability, matching the black lace set, sockliner, and the top of the tongue tag. Like the OG Hyper Blue variant of the Air Max Plus, this pair retains its yellow pops along the Nike Air logo on the tongue, the midfoot Swoosh, and the Tuned Air logo on the insole and heel.

Nike Air Max Plus Golf Hyper Blue

The midsole is slightly different from the standard Air Max Plus. Instead of the traditional tooling, the Air units near the forefoot, which are yellow on this pair, resemble those found on the Air Max Plus Ultra. However, the same white foam midsole and blue TPU shank remain. Finishing the sneaker is the black rubber outsole with a spikeless, course-ready traction pattern engineered for the greens.

The Nike Air Max Plus Golf Hyper Blue will release on January 24, 2025, through Nike and select Nike Golf retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is $185. Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

9.title: Women’s Basketball signee Aaliyah Crump selected for 2025 Nike Hoop Summit
9.snippet: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colorado — Texas women's basketball signee Aaliyah Crump has been named to the 2025 Nike Hoop Summit team USA Basketball announced today.
9.content:
COLORADO SPRINGS, Colorado — Texas women's basketball signee Aaliyah Crump has been named to the 2025 Nike Hoop Summit team USA Basketball announced today.

The 26th Nike Hoop Summit, which features a men's and women's game of the top American high school athletes facing off against a World Team of top international players 19-and-younger, is scheduled for Saturday, April 12, at Moda Center in Portland, Oregon.

Crump won gold with USA Basketball at the 2023 FIBA U16 Women's AmeriCup in León, Mexico.

In her junior season Crump averaged 24.4 points, 8.2 rebounds, 3.7 steals and 3.3 assists in leading her high school, Minnetonka to the 2024 4A State Championship. Crump is a two-time All-State honoree, team captain and was selected the 2024 MaxPreps Minnesota Player of the Year.

Crump was named to the 25-player Midseason Team for the 2024-25 Naismith Trophy Girl's High School Player of the Year award.

The 2025 USA Women's Nike Hoop Summit roster includes Darriana 'Dee' Alexander, Sienna Betts, Aaliyah Chavez, Aaliyah Crump, Jasmine 'Jazzy' Davidson, Alexandra Eschmeyer, Madison Francis, ZaKiyah Johnson, Grace Knox, Emilee Skinner, Jordan Speiser and Hailee Swain.

Overall, the USA men's and women's athletes have combined for 27 gold medals as members of USA Basketball junior national teams.

The 2025 Nike Hoop Summit, which will be televised live on USA Network and streamed on Peacock, will tip off with the women's game at 7:30 p.m. ET/4:30 p.m. PT followed by the men's game at approx. 10:00 p.m. ET/7:00 p.m. PT. The Nike Hoop Summit has been held annually since 1995.

0.title: Nike - Statistics & Facts
0.snippet: Nike is the world's largest supplier and manufacturer of athletic shoes and apparel, as well as a major supplier of sports equipment.
0.content:
A short introduction to Nike

Just Do It

The company that named itself after the Greek goddess of victory markets several products under its own brand, including, but not limited to Nike Pro, Nike+, Nike Blazers, Nike Dunk, as well as Air Max, Air Jordan, Phantom. Globally, Nike sponsors many high-profile athletes, such as Cristiano Ronaldo, Rory McIlroy, LeBron James, and Rafael Nadal, as well as sports clubs like FC Barcelona, and Paris Saint-Germain.Nike is the most valuable apparel brand , boasting a brand value of over 30 billion U.S. dollars. In other words, Nike is not just the world’s leading sports clothing brand, it is also the single most valuable apparel brand overall. The company also has a very strong financial record, generating over 50 billion U.S. dollars in revenue during its latest two financial years. There are three main business segments from which Nike generates its sales, namely, footwear, apparel, and equipment. The largest segment, footwear, led the way in terms of sales revenue, bringing in approximately 33 billion U.S. dollars in the fiscal year ended May 2024.Although Nike's 2024 revenue is nothing to scoff at, less than one percent of sales growth had been recorded compared to the previous financial year. The company's North American sales decreased slightly compared to 2023, while the company's direct-to-consumer segment "NIKE Direct" did not perform as well as expected.

3.title: These $18 Sneakers Look Nearly Identical to Nike, but Cost 82% Less and Have No Break-in Period
3.snippet: Walmart's No Boundaries $18 platform white sneakers look nearly identical to Nike's $115 Air Force 1s. The style is comfy, even for shoppers that walk 10000...
3.content:
Everyone’s travel wardrobe might look a little different, but there is one key staple that’s a luggage must-have, no matter the destination: a pair of comfy and stylish sneakers. Whether you’re racing through the airport to board a flight or walking 15,000 steps through Paris, you’ll want a supportive and cushioned shoe to get where you need to go — and look good while doing it.

Quality sneakers can be a pricey purchase, especially if you’re looking for something that ticks both the style and function boxes. However, we found an $18 pair at Walmart that look nearly identical to NIke’s $115 Air Force 1s.

No Boundaries Platform Casual Lace-Up Sneakers

Walmart

The No Boundaries Platform Casual Lace-Up Sneakers come in a variety of sizes, as well as medium and wide widths. They’re crafted from a smooth faux leather that looks like the real thing and easily wipes clean. The shoes were also designed with comfort in mind. They have a padded foam collar, which also provides support, and a memory foam footbed.

The Nike Air Force 1s look strikingly similar to the Walmart version — though the latter is, naturally, missing that signature swoop. The No Boundaries style is just as versatile as its lookalike version, so you can wear them with a variety of outfits, including a skirt or dress for a more elevated look or a paired down style with casual denim.

Over 1,100 shoppers praised the sneakers, including one customer, who walks an average of 10,000 steps a day. They said that they’re so comfortable, they’ve bought the style three times. The shopper added that the shoes match everything and take no time to break in. A second reviewer noted that they’ve repeatedly bought them for concerts and musical festivals because they look so much like Nike Air Force 1s but aren’t nearly as pricey.

Head over to Walmart to snag these affordable designer-inspired sneakers, or keep scrolling for more staples that will make an excellent addition to your footwear collection.

4.title: Nike’s Answer to the Adidas Samba Could Be a Future MVP of Retro Sneakers
4.snippet: Nike's first Field General of 2025 features an authentic white upper and black waffle outsole, contrasted with blue detailing.
4.content:
The reissued Field General is a blueprint for vintage-inspired kicks.

white and blue nike sneaker

Every product is carefully selected by our editors. If you buy from a link, we may earn a commission. Learn more

Heritage. Comfort. Simple colorways. A budget-friendly price tag. These are just some of the qualities that have turned the Adidas Samba into one of the most important sneakers of the 2020s.

That said, they’re not exclusive to the 76-year-old design that first debuted in 1949 as a winter soccer for icy pitches.

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

Nike, too, has its fair share of old-school silhouettes and it’s betting the house that one called the Field General can compete with its longtime rival from Herzogenaurach, Germany.

Nike’s first Field General of 2025 features an authentic white upper and black waffle outsole, contrasted with blue detailing. - Credit: Nike

Out of left field

Originally designed to meet the needs of football quarterbacks in the early ’80s, the Field General faded into obscurity after its initial release, only to resurface in 2024 as the Swoosh’s retro-inspired answer to the Samba craze.

Now, thanks to a new blue-and-white colorway, Nike’s shown the sneaker world it has every intention of keeping its foot on the gas coming into the new year.

Like the original Field General from the 1980s, the reissue combines leather and ballistic nylon for the upper. - Credit: Nike

Typical of the original Field General worn by NFL legends Archie Manning and Dan Fouts, the reissued sneaker boasts a leather-and-nylon upper, grounded by a black waffle sole designed for multi-directional movement.

Unlike the Samba, the Field General carries a waffle outsole design, originally intended to give NFL quarterbacks traction on grass and turf. - Credit: Nike

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

A white upper here keeps the overall package authentic to the original, while a royal-blue swoosh and heel panel sub in for the red detailing found on those first designs.

Pricing and availability

The blue-and-white Nike Field General ’82 SP is now available with an approachable price tag of $100. It also comes in an impressive number of sizes, ranging from men’s 3.5 to 15.

white and blue nike sneaker

Nike Field General ’82 SP

5.title: Naomi Osaka is Dominating The Australian Open in Sunflower-Inspired Nike GP Challenge 1
5.snippet: Naomi Osaka's Nike GP Challenge 1, worn during the 2025 Australian Open, is going viral. Check here for how and where to buy her sunflower sneakers.
5.content:
Published January 14, 2025

Naomi Osaka’s Nike GP Challenge 1 Sunflower Buy at Nike

Buy now

Although non-Tennis fans may know Naomi Osaka because of her previous relationship with music artist Cordae, she’s one of the best players on the face of the planet. She has also had many viral moments on the court wearing Nike footwear and continues to do so during the Australian Open. In her first match of the 2025 tournament, she sported a pair of sunflower-inspired Nike GP Challenge 1s.

Retaining the GP Challenge 1 performance features, the model comes coated in sunflower yellow hues alongside baroque brown and silver hits. While the color palette alone evokes the sense of sunflowers, multiple direct references are found throughout the design. Along the toe is an embroidered sunflower design, while the tongue comes with two sunflowers constructed out of suede and Naomi Osaka’s logo. Osaka chose the sunflower design to symbolize longevity and vitality and as a way to wish good luck for the new year.

Naomi Osaka’s Nike GP Challenge 1 Sunflower

Moving to the lateral midfoot, we can see a baroque brown TPU panel helps reinforce the mesh base, while metallic silver makes up the Swoosh logo. On the opposite side, we see a smaller metallic silver Swoosh and text that reads “The sun shines where you are” near the collar. Even with this playful colorway, the model is still tooled for the court, coming with an Air Zoom unit and high-abrasion rubber on the forefoot for traction and durability.

Naomi Osaka’s Nike GP Challenge 1 Sunflower W for the Australian Open was released on January 10, 2025, through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Right now, they’re available to purchase on nike.com for $160. Check below for a direct link to cop Osaka’s viral sunflower shoes, and download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

Naomi Osaka’s Nike GP Challenge 1 Sunflower Buy at Nike

7.title: Nike Air Max 90 "Speed Red" Releases Spring 2025
7.snippet: Nike Air Max 90 Speed Red IF0670-600 Release Date: 2025 Color: Speed Red/Black-White Price: $130 USD Where to Buy: Nike.com.
7.content:
The Nike Air Max 90 is gearing up for its 35th anniversary with a bold “Speed Red” colorway. Paying tribute to motorsport aesthetics, this release honors the legacy of one of Nike’s most iconic silhouettes. With its dynamic design and rich history, the “Speed Red” edition is a must-have for sneaker enthusiasts.

- Advertisement -

Inspired by vintage racing themes, the Air Max 90 “Speed Red” incorporates unique insole details. Bold “Air Max 90” typography and retro logos evoke classic motorsport branding. These elements tie the design to Nike’s past explorations of racing-inspired collections, adding depth to its story.

The upper features an all-leather construction with vibrant chili red hues and sleek black accents. This sharp color contrast creates a bold, eye-catching design that works well for casual or statement outfits. Premium materials ensure the sneaker is both durable and comfortable, making it a practical yet stylish choice.

Scheduled to release in Spring 2025, the Nike Air Max 90 “Speed Red” will be available at select Nike Sportswear retailers, Nike.com, and in-store locations. Priced at $130 USD, this special edition offers a fresh take on a timeless classic. Fans and collectors alike will appreciate the thoughtful design and craftsmanship.

As the Air Max 90 reaches its 35th year, the “Speed Red” colorway celebrates its lasting influence in sneaker culture. Whether you’re revisiting a favorite or discovering the silhouette for the first time, this motorsport-inspired design delivers both style and nostalgia. Don’t miss the chance to own this vibrant piece of Air Max history.

Stay up to date with all upcoming sneaker releases from our Sneaker Release Dates page. Be sure to follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

Nike Air Max 90

Style Code: IF0670-600

Release Date: 2025

Price: $130

0.snippet: The top 20 girls and boys teams at each Nike Cross Regional will be acknowledged as NXR All Region Teams. Nike will send congratulatory banners marking the...
0.content: 2024 NXR All Region Teams Published by The top 20 girls and boys teams at each Nike Cross Regional will be acknowledged as NXR All Region Teams. Nike will send congratulatory banners marking the achievement of each of the 20 different club teams from the girls' competition and the 20 different club teams from the boys' competition. The award is based on each team's combined average time from their top 7 runners, regardless of the race. As an example, you could have your 5th, 6th and 7th best 5K times at NXR be run by athletes on your JV or B squad. Each team must have a minimum of 7 finishing runners to be eligible for the award. The 2024 NXR All Region teams are listed below. 1.title: East Texas A&M announces partnership with Nike, BSN SPORTS
1.snippet: COMMERCE – East Texas A&M University has announced a multi-year partnership with Nike and BSN SPORTS on Monday morning. Nike, the Oregon-based global leader...
1.content:
-ETAMU-

East Texas A&M University has announced a multi-year partnership with Nike and BSN SPORTS on Monday morning. Nike, the Oregon-based global leader in sports apparel will become the official outfitter of East Texas A&M beginning June 1, 2025.In conjunction with the partnership with Nike, BSN SPORTS, the premier platform for team sports solutions, will serve as the official supplier of Lion Athletics uniform, apparel and footwear needs for the duration of the partnership."Our partnership with Nike and BSN Sports marks an exciting new chapter for East Texas A&M University. This collaboration reflects our shared commitment to excellence, innovation, and the development of our student-athletes. Nike's leadership in the world of sports aligns perfectly with our mission to provide a transformative educational experience, and we are thrilled to bring their cutting-edge technology and unparalleled support to our university," said President Dr. Mark Rudin.East Texas A&M becomes the only school currently in the Southland Conference to be outfitted by Nike, who will provide on-field and training apparel and equipment for all 14 intercollegiate sports."This is a monumental day in the history of Lion Athletics. The East Texas A&M brand is on the rise, and this partnership announcement is just another milestone in our journey to become one of the preeminent Division I FCS institutions in the country," said Director of Athletics"We are grateful to Nike and BSN SPORTS for their belief and investment in our vision for Lion Athletics and recognizing the growth and trajectory of the university as a whole. There is no better time than now to be associated with East Texas A&M."Across the state of Texas, East Texas A&M becomes the eighth Division I institution, and just the second within Division I FCS to be outfitted by Nike.On the cutting edge of design and innovation, East Texas A&M student-athletes will receive the latest styles that Nike has to offer, providing them with the opportunity to maximize their performance in and out of competition."This partnership brings a powerful combination of elite product selection and industry leading service solutions to the athletes, coaches and community surrounding East Texas A&M athletics. BSN SPORTS is thrilled to help usher in the next chapter of Lion Athletics and support the University's aspirations as a trusted provider and advisor for athletic uniform, apparel and equipment needs," said Vice President of BSN SPORTS Collegiate Select Division, Todd Northrop.More information on how fans can purchase officially licensed East Texas A&M Nike apparel will be announced later this year.Farmers Branch-based BSN SPORTS is a leading marketer, manufacturer and distributor of sporting goods apparel and equipment. A division of Varsity Brands, BSN SPORTS markets and distributes its products to over 150,000 institutional and team sports customers in colleges and universities, middle and high schools, and recreational programs throughout the United States via catalog, e-commerce, and direct sales. Focused on providing game-changing solutions through local partnerships, multi-brand selection and one-stop shopping for equipment and uniforms, BSN SPORTS' more than 3,000 employees have been helping elevate participation in team sports since 1972. For more information about BSN SPORTS please visit www.BSNSPORTS.com

2.title: Official Images Of The Nike Sabrina 2 “Doernbecher”
2.snippet: Sophia Jenkins picks the Nike Sabrina 2 for her Doernbecher collaboration -- the full collection releases on January 23rd. Click in for more.
2.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

The Nike-Doernbecher partnership, a sneakers-meets-cancer-care initiative that’s raised nearly $50 million dollars over its lifespan, is ringing in its 20th anniversary in just a few days’ time. While the requisite Air Jordan model arrives as a part of the capsule, so too does a range of the Swoosh’s latest offerings. When it comes to basketball shoes, there’s no better representative of their recent chapter than the Nike Sabrina 2, the choice for 9-year-old osteosarcoma survivor Sophia Jenkins.

“Happy go-lucky” is the term attached to Sophia by her care team at Doernbecher, and clearly the guiding principle across her version of the Sabrina 2. Look to the sole unit for proof; smiley faces, hearts and flowers adorn the underfoot section, with some clever branding inserted via a Swoosh mouth. Some of Jenkins’ favorite keepsakes also make appearances, with Nike recreating the print from her favorite fuzzy blanket on the sock-liner and planting her favorite pickle stuffie on the vamp.

Overall, it’s hard not to feel the love that went into this design, owing in no small part to the dominant purple and pink tonality that defines this shoe. We finish with a truly one-of-a-kind touch: each pair of Sophia’s Sabrina 2 from the Doernbecher 20 collection comes with a friendship bracelet kit, reflecting Jenkins’ love for Taylor Swift and the hobby’s synonymous status in the fandom in the wake of the Eras Tour.

The Sophia Jenkins Nike Sabrina 2 “Doernbecher” drops via SNKRS on January 23rd, the same day all the pairs from this year’s collection will land. Be ready for a $130 retail price upon arrival.

Additional Retailer Images

3.title: Nike has some catching up to do in 2025
3.snippet: Nike only updated its running shoe lineup and released no new models. Nike has said it will launch the Pegasus Premium in late January and the Vomero 18 in...
3.content:
Nike plans to launch new running shoes this year.

In 2024, Nike trailed competitors like ASICS and Adidas in running-shoe launches.

BMO analysts are optimistic about Nike's 2025 lineup despite past performance challenges.

Nike's shoe competitors were on a tear in 2024, so expectations are high for the sportswear giant this year.

Data from BMO indicates most footwear brands launched at least six shoes in 2024. ASICS, Adidas, Brooks Running, and Hoka led the way in running-shoe launches, but Nike had fewer than six.

As part of its moves to improve sales, Nike is getting back to basics. That includes redefining itself as a running brand. To keep up with the competition, it will have to prove that in 2025.

According to BMO, ASICS launched new models or updated performance running models 11 times last year, while Adidas and Brooks launched or updated 10 and nine models. Nike only updated its running shoe lineup and released no new models.

Nike has said it will launch the Pegasus Premium in late January and the Vomero 18 in late February. It said the Vomero Plus, the Vomero Premium, and the new Structure model would come "later in 2025."

Retail analysts at BMO say that with this running lineup, Nike's launch schedule in 2025 "looks more promising." Its new product line received a positive response from consumers and industry watchers when it was announced at The Running Event, a trade show held in November.

"We believe NKE's inflection is a question of 'when' compelling product begins to roll in rather than 'if,'" BMO analysts wrote.

Brands like On Running and Hoka have been growing in popularity over the past few years. Brooks said this summer that it reached a quarterly revenue record, adding that its North American sales in the second quarter grew by 19%.

In October, Nike brought a veteran employee, Elliott Hill, out of retirement to take over as CEO, and he has his work cut out for him. Revenue for the Nike brand grew by only 1% in the latest fiscal year, dragged down partially by declines in North America.

The company has acknowledged that it will take time to see its desired results.

"A comeback at this scale takes time, but we see early wins — from momentum in key sports to accelerating our pace of newness and innovation," Matthew Friend, Nike's executive vice president and chief financial officer, said during its first-quarter earnings call.

4.title: Nike Swoosh Reenters The Surf Chat
4.snippet: Sierra Kerr has signed a 2-year deal with footwear giant Nike, marking their return to surfing after a multi-year hiatus.
4.content:
A swoosh appeared at the World Junior Championships in the Philippines this week.

Adhered to the rail halfway up Sierra Kerr’s JS Industries tractor, the Nike logo designed in 1971 by Carolyn Davidson, a graphic design student at Portland State University who received a measly $35 for her now-iconic swoosh (and later stock options), marks the return of the footwear giant to surfing after a multi-year long hiatus.

Following ABG’s licensing beef with Liberated Brands, which had major implications for brands: Volcom, Billabong, Quiksilver, RVCA + more, Volcom’s star Gen Z talent has shifted Red Bull to the nose position as a mark of their strong support.

Nike, with whom Sierra has had a footwear partnership for two years, is now elevating her to their Global Athlete Roster and adding their iconic Swoosh to her board’s mid-rail. Discussions are ongoing for her apparel sponsorship, however Volcom are reportedly still in the mix. We’ll keep you posted on the wash up.

When Nike first entered surfing in 2006, it seemed like an absurd pairing at the time. Nike stood for everything that was athletic and elite. Surfers, for the most part, still despised anything that might be perceived as either athletic or elite. The brand’s failed attempt at making aqua socks a thing didn’t help its street cred.

“I don’t like outsiders coming into this industry thinking they’re smarter than us,” said former Billabong CEO Paule Naude in HSGP, recalling their first USD $750K gamble on a pubescent Kolohe Andino. “They wanted the youth to be the face of the brand,” explained photographer and Nike staffer, Jason Kenworthy. “Not the established guys like Andy, Bruce, Cory and Wardo, which I was initially apprehensive about.”

You can deep dive into Nike’s complicated 20-year relationship with surfing here. For now, let’s focus on the present, and what this latest deal suggests about the industry’s health and Nike’s revised playbook.

In his 2025 Predictions podcast, NYU business professor Scott Galloway listed Nike, Intel, Boeing, and Target as prime candidates for acquisition or privatization, describing them as companies that have been “beaten up” in the public markets. Simultaneously, private equity’s capital has boomed, he notes, “Private equity firms have almost $3 trillion in capital that they need to deploy. They’re just going to go shopping.”

Over the past three years, Nike’s market capitalization has declined significantly. At the end of 2021, Nike’s market cap was approximately $263.55 billion. As of January 8, 2025, it stands at around $105.31 billion, representing a decrease of about 60%, making it an attractive target for private equity firms, who are in a strong position to pursue large-scale buyouts of these ‘fallen angels’.

In October 14, 2024, Nike appointed Elliott Hill as its new President and Chief Executive Officer. Last month, Hill announced his ‘turnaround plan’–citing reigniting the brand’s “obsession with sport” by prioritizing athlete-focused innovation, product segmentation, and bold marketing.

While none of that screams ‘pouring cash into surf culture will dig us out of this financial rut,’ Nike’s renewed focus on action sports and strategic athlete partnerships suggests a calculated effort to rebuild its brand beyond the track and field.

By backing emerging talents like Sierra Kerr and reentering the surf market with a (hopefully) revised playbook, Nike may be signaling its intent to reestablish credibility and tap into niche but influential communities. Whether this move proves to be a savvy long-term investment or another misstep remains to be seen, but it underscores the brand’s willingness to take risks as a shadow of its former self.

Ergo: Just Do It.

Per Nike’s Brand of Athletes description, “Nike exists to serve the complete athlete, and shares their winning mentality.”

Decorated with winning the WSL 2023 World Junior Championships, ISA World Juniors, Stab High Lakey Peak (with the best full-rote ever documented by a female), and 4/7 events listed on the 24/25 QS calendar, all while releasing groundbreaking films such as ‘Pre-Kerrsor’ on the side, Sierra aligns perfectly with Nike’s unapologetic quest to support cream talent.

You can read our Stab Interview with Sierra Kerr here.

6.title: Nike Isn’t Giving Up on Its Weirdest Running Shoe
6.snippet: The Streakfly is the black sheep of Nike's road-running lineup. But rumored changes to the unsung model show a shoe ready to join the pack.
6.content:
Every running brand has a black sheep in the family. For Nike, it’s a shoe called the Streakfly, which you’ll find tucked away in the discount bin of the nearest outlet store (if you even know to look for it).

That said, an unexpected update to the model may soon put it on the radar of runners everywhere … and just maybe some fast feet, too.

The new Streakfly 2 is available from March 1 for $180. Nike

From the back of the pack

Released in 2022 at the height of the super-shoe era, the original Streakfly catered to runners seeking something closer to a traditional racing flat for mid-distances races and the occasional tempo-based workout.

Or that was the plan, anyway.

Following the return of the Nike Air Max Plus OG “Hyper Blue,” the Swoosh is expanding the ever classic Sean McDowell model for golf. The retro return of the colorway lands on the green in a standout color scheme that is made up of black, chamois, sky blue and hyper blue. 9.title: Nike Air Max 90 "Neapolitan" Now Available (January 2025)
9.snippet: Nike Air Max 90 Neapolitan HM9451-600 Release Date: January 13, 2025 Color: Dark Team Red/Platinum Tint-Pure Platinum-White Price: $130 USD.
9.content:
Nike is treating sneaker enthusiasts to a sweet surprise with the Air Max 90 “Neapolitan,” arriving in Spring 2025. Inspired by the classic tri-flavored ice cream, this sneaker mixes playful colors with a clean, sophisticated design.

- Advertisement -

The Air Max 90 “Neapolitan” channels the charm of the beloved dessert. The upper showcases a crisp white mesh base paired with bone-colored leather overlays, offering a neutral backdrop for its flavorful details. Subtle pink accents represent strawberry tones, while deep “Team Red” suede panels nod to rich chocolate swirls. These elements combine effortlessly, creating a harmonious and nostalgic colorway.

This version retains the Air Max 90’s hallmark comfort and iconic style. The visible Air cushioning in the midsole provides responsive support, perfect for all-day wear. To complete the look, the outsole alternates between “Team Red” and pink tones, amplifying the Neapolitan theme and adding a dynamic touch to the overall design.

Set to release on January 13, 2025, the Nike Air Max 90 “Neapolitan” will be available at select Nike Sportswear retailers, online, and on Nike.com. Priced at $140 USD, it is expected to be a popular choice among sneaker fans and collectors alike.

With its unique dessert-inspired theme and classic Air Max comfort, the “Neapolitan” offers a fresh twist to the lineup. Don’t miss the chance to grab a pair and add some flavorful flair to your sneaker rotation.

Stay up to date with all upcoming sneaker releases from our Sneaker Release Dates page. Be sure to follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

1.title: WATCH: Aryna Sabalenka serves up "power like no other" in first Nike solo ad
1.snippet: Two-time champion Aryna Sabalenka is getting the star treatment from Nike as her sponsor unveiled a creative tribute to her explosive game.
1.content:
On the eve of her Australian Open title defense, two-time champion Aryna Sabalenka is getting the star treatment from Nike as her sponsor unveiled a creative tribute to her explosive game.

In a video published on Sunday to the sportswear giant’s various social media platforms, Sabalenka takes center stage in a room filled with shattered debris—all unfortunate victims of her booming serves and forehands.

As Sabalenka winds up again, Nike provides a tongue-in-cheek warning: “The following is a test. Do not attempt to recreate the power of Aryna Sabalenka at home.”

Read More: Aryna Sabalenka departs IMG for Naomi Osaka's EVOLVE agency: "A multi-faceted icon with limitless potential"

Throughout the 40-second video, which is set to the tune of Nancy Sinatra’s cover of “Bang Bang (My Baby Shot Me Down)”, the destroyed items are depicted alongside speed readings. Each one refers to a speed Sabalenka's serve has been previously measured at—a cheeky way of visualizing her signature power. One 134 km/h (83 mph) delivery is apparently enough to break a vase, while the aftermath of a 188 km/h (117 mph) shot is shown as a smashed-in television.

2.title: The Nike Air Max Plus Drift Takes on White and Tan for Spring 2025
2.snippet: As the Nike Air Max Plus Drift enters the later stages of its initial run, its releases have become more selective. However, the silhouette isn't bowing […]
2.content:
As the Nike Air Max Plus Drift enters the later stages of its initial run, its releases have become more selective. However, the silhouette isn’t bowing out yet, with a new White and Tan colorway arriving in time for Spring 2025.

This iteration takes cues from the model’s popular “Panda” edition, featuring a gradient mesh upper paired with crisp white caging and midsoles. The rest of the design embraces a single accent color—tan—which coats the liners, tongues, laces, heel Swooshes, Air supports, and rubber soles. The minimalist yet striking palette brings a refined look to the futuristic silhouette, making it a versatile option for the upcoming season.

Pairs are now available on Nike.com.

4.title: Hiroshi Fujiwara Reveals a fragment design x Nike Air Force 1 Low/Air Presto Sample
4.snippet: Hiroshi Fujiwara Reveals a fragment design x Nike Air Force 1 Low/Air Presto Sample: Fujiwara recently discussed the story behind the unreleased sample in...
4.content:
fragment design and Nike have worked together for over 20 years, and in that time, the two have created dozens of sneaker collaborations — not to mention all the pairs that, for one reason or another, didn’t make it past the sampling phase. fragment design founder Hiroshi Fujiwara was recently interviewed for QUIET #7, and he revealed one of those models: a never-before-seen Air Force 1 Low collaboration with influences from the Air Presto.

The silhouette features a deconstructed ethos, with leather overlays sitting atop an Air Presto-esque neoprene base that’s cut slightly higher than what you’d typically see on a low-top Air Force 1. Of particular note is that the leather heel overlay, unlike its counterparts, is not stitched to the base. Instead, it hangs loose, supplying breathing room to the heat-applied midfoot Swoosh. Further details include hiking boot-esque rope laces with flecks of reflective material and a two-tone midsole. Three colorways of the design were shown in the feature, namely a mostly black version, a black-and-white version and a navy/white iteration.

“I thought it would be interesting if I could connect the midsole of the sample I tried directly to the upper, but it seems to be quite difficult,” Fujiwara is quoted as saying. “However, this first sample was comfortable to wear and was fairly well made. I feel like with a little more trial and error I could make something even better, but that’s for another time.”

Though this pair won’t see a retail release, you can check it out above. fragment design also recently linked with Nike for two takes on the Air Zoom Spiridon.

5.title: Nike's '00s Laceless Air Max Sneaker Is Part Slip-On, All Crazy Tech
5.snippet: The Air Max Craze explodes with innovative tech, from visible Air windows in the chunky soles to the zipper "lace" closure similar to Nike's Air Max Sunder,...
5.content:
It's a pretty exciting year ahead for not only Nike but also the brand's most committed, longtime fans. Why? The sportswear brand is resurrecting some serious Swoosh classics for 2025, including the Air Max Craze, Nike's wildly techy sneaker from the early 2000s.

Specifically, the Nike Air Max Craze debuted around 2001 as a cross-training sneaker, as branded on its rubbery, rugged toe cap. The sneaker's incredible design was anything but quiet, as several advanced details helped it live up to the "craze" name.

The Air Max Craze explodes with innovative tech, from visible Air windows in the chunky soles to the zipper "lace" closure similar to Nike's Air Max Sunder, another zip-tastic Swoosh shoe that recently got another chance at life. But this ain't a Sunder.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

The Air Max Craze isn't a Air Huarache, either. However, it does have a heel strap detail like the Nike runner. Indeed, the biggest standout on the Nike Air Max Craze is its heel cage, which is quite literally the only part holding the shoe (and your heel) back from being another great mule-sneaker hybrid.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

Even still, with no real shoelaces and some slide-in appeal, the Air Max Craze can still easily pass as a slip-on sneaker. And so that's what it shall be!

Adding to the retro fervor, Nike has prepared the sneaker in one of its OG colorways, a navy blue and orange color scheme known as "Bright Citrus." Just a little something to get the OG Craze heads amped up.

Nike will also launch the reborn Air Max Craze in a spotless "White/Gold" color option, expected to land sometime in the spring.

Your Highsnobiety privacy settings have blocked this Instagram post. Enable All Media Manage consent Privacy policy

Collecting dust? Nah, Nike's archival models will continue to see more action this year. In addition to the Nike Air Max Craze, Nike confirmed the return of its dressy Superfly, Deion Sanders' Air Diamond Turf, and those wonderfully weird Aqua Turf water shoes.

Gather your coins, Nike lovers. This year's drops just might break the bank.

6.title: This Black And Orange Nike Cortez Is Perfect For San Francisco Giants Fans
6.snippet: The Nike Cortez has surfaced in a black and orange colorway reminiscent of the SF Giants. Tap in for full details.
6.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Nike has been tending to Dodgers fans with Los Angeles Dunks and the upcoming release of the Kobe 6 Dodgers in April, but they haven’t forgotten about the squad’s longstanding NL West rival. If you’re among San Fransisco Giants fans, this Nike Cortez is for you.

The play here is a familiar one; the base of the shoe appears in black nylon and suede, contrasted by “Safety Orange” on the Swoosh and backtab for a team-friendly mix. The tongue, lining, and laces all clean up in white, while the top portion of the midsole adds a slight vintage vibe in “Sail” (which is similar to the Giants’ home uniform color). These are deserving of an unofficial “Giants” nickname, although if you’re a fan of the Baltimore Orioles, Cincinnati Bengals, or any other team that wears black and orange uniforms, they’re equally appropriate for all your game day fits.

The Nike Cortez “Black/Safety Orange” aka “Giants” retails for $100 and is expected to roll out via nike.com and retailers during the Spring 2025 shopping season. See official images below if you’re moved to cop a pair upon arrival.

8.title: Devin Booker Debuted a New Version of His ‘Cortez’ Nikes — but Don’t Expect Them to Be Released
8.snippet: With his Cortez-inspired 'Forrest Gump' Nike Book 1 sneakers coming out soon, Devin Booker debuted another version of the shoe in Phoenix Suns colors.
8.content:
With the release of Devin Booker’s Forrest Gump-inspired signature Nike sneakers just a little over a week away, the Phoenix Suns star debuted a new colorway of Cortez-themed exclusives Saturday night.

As the Suns hosted the Utah Jazz at the Footprint Center, Booker laced up a previously unseen Nike Book 1 with Cortez-informed details. But unlike the red-and-blue accented “Forrest Gump” that will be arriving at stores soon, Booker’s Saturday sneakers adopted the colors of his Suns team.

The on-court pair featured the same Cortez-inspired white leather-and-canvas upper and serrated eyestay, but swapped red for purple and replaced blue with orange. Booker’s Saturday style also lacked the custom “Book” logo on the left tongue, instead using Nike logos on both shoes.

Watch on FN

Devin Booker’s Phoenix Suns-colored ‘Cortez’ Nike Book 1. Credit: @suns

It’s unlikely that Booker’s Suns-colored Book 1 will be released at retail, but it’s not completely out of the realm of possibility. The NBA star’s upcoming “Forrest Gump” pair was once believed to be an exclusive before being confirmed for a release.

Other upcoming Nike Book 1 releases of note include the “1995 All-Star” colorway worn by Booker during NBA All-Star Weekend 2024 and a “Flagstaff” colorway inspired by the Arizona city, which is a follow-up to January’s “Sedona” iteration. A collaboration with Hiroshi Fujiwara’s Fragment Design brand was also recently shared online, but it’s unconfirmed if that pair will be available at retail.

The Cortez-inspired Nike Book 1 “Forrest Gump” will be officially released from SNKRS and select Nike Basketball retailers on Jan 24. The SNKRS launch takes place at 10 a.m. ET and the shoes will retail for $140.

Nike Book 1 ‘Forrest Gump.’ Credit: Nike

0.title: Ja Morant Leaked New Colorways of His Nike Sneakers: ‘Let Me Be Ja’ & ‘Ja Raffe’
0.snippet: Morant shared on his Instagram story Friday two PE versions of his signature Nike Ja 2 sneakers along with an Air Force 1 featuring his logo.
0.content:
Ja Morant took to social media Sunday to announce he would start leaking his own shoes and a week later, the NBA superstar is making good on his promise.

Morant shared on his Instagram story Friday two PE versions of his signature Nike Ja 2 sneakers along with an Air Force 1 featuring his logo.

First up was the “Let Me Be Ja” Ja 2 and its matching Air Force 1 Low counterpart. The two sneakers feature identical black-and-yellow color blocking with patent leather Swoosh logos. The inner medial side of both the Ja 2 and Air Force 1 reads “let me be Ja.” The heel debossing of the Air Force 1 is the first time Morant’s logo has been featured on a Nike lifestyle sneaker.

For his second leak of the day, Morant debuted something more playful: a Nike Ja 2 “Ja Raffe” PE. The colorway is inspired by a giraffe named after Morant which was once housed at the Memphis Zoo — but now resides at Utah’s Hogle Zoo. The sneaker features a spotted brown upper with pink accents on the Swoosh and outsole, making for one of the more eye-catching Nike Ja 2 styles yet.

Watch on FN

Despite the new leaks, it’s not clear if any of the pairs previewed by Morant will be released at retail or if they will remain exclusive to the Memphis Grizzlies star.

Nike Ja 2 and Air Force 1 ‘Let Me Be Ja’ (lateral). Credit: @jamorant

One recently leaked Nike Ja 2 sneaker that does appear destined for a retail launch is a mismatched colorway in collaboration with Kool-Aid. After it appeared in early photos last week, Morant responded by saying he would begin leaking his shoes himself. That pair is expected to be released in May for a retail price of $130.

Next up for the Nike Ja 2 is a Valentine’s Day-themed “Heart Eyes” colorway scheduled to hit stores on Feb. 7. Then, on Feb. 14, the sneaker will arrive in a $550 Swarovski collaboration which is limited to 1,999 pairs.

Nike Ja 2 and Air Force 1 ‘Let Me Be Ja’ (medial). Credit: @jamorant

4.title: The Nike Air Force 1 Is Officially a Flawlessly Glossed-Up All-Star Now
4.snippet: Nike has unveiled an Air Force 1 Low "All-Star" sneaker, transforming the classic Triple Black design into a literal shining star with metallic details.
4.content:
The Nike Air Force 1 sneaker was quite literally born a star, rising to fame on the courts and eventually becoming even bigger as a certified fashion legend. For the model's latest drop, Nike officially crowns the sneaker as a "All-Star" (no Converse associate here).

Nike has unveiled an Air Force 1 Low "All-Star" sneaker, transforming the classic Triple Black design into a literal shining star with metallic details. Specifically, the back of the iconic sneakers gets a glossy metal-like coating, which also swallows up the Swoosh on the sidewall.

But hold on to your laces, 'cause this Air Force 1 sneaker gets better. The All-Star Forces also includes a neat silver star charm atop its smooth wax shoelaces. Additionally, the Air Force 1 boasts these quiet, reflective patterns around the toe, which come to life when light is cast on them in a dark setting.
