8.title: 15 best Nike running shoes to try in 2025
8.snippet: If you're bored of your old running shoes, Nike has some amazing options that offer both support and aesthetics.
8.content:
If you're bored of your old running shoes, Nike has some amazing options that offer both support and aesthetics. We have listed down 15 shoes from Nike that you should definitely consider adding to your running shoe collection in 2025. Be it just switching your old shoes or starting your running journey, these shoes are your way to go.

​

1) Nike Invincible 3

Men's shoes (Image via Nike)

These running shoes come in 11 colorways and one custom color option through which you can design your own sneakers. There's a heavy layer of cushioning to provide support during longer runs. The upper is made of Flyknit, and the added ZoomX foam makes it lightweight so your feet don't feel heavy during runs. It retails for $180 on Nike's website.

​

2) Nike Alphafly 3

Unisex shoes (Image via Nike)

These shoes are built to bring performance and style into one. It comes in four colorways to choose from. The sneakers have Air Zoom and a carbon fiber plate, which provides support during running, preventing any sudden movement. There's also a ZoomX foam added to it, which makes the shoes lightweight. It retails for $320. If you want a new launch, you can wait for the Alphafly 3 Premium in Habanero Red, which retails for $285.

​

3) Nike Pegasus Plus

Women's shoes (Image via Nike)

The Pegasus series has been loved by many athletes and fitness enthusiasts. These are some of the best running shoes for women, which have responsive cushioning to adapt to your feet and help you run at ease. The upper is made of Flyknit, which helps air to flow. ZoomX foam provides support and energy to the feet. It retails for $180 and comes in nine colorways.

​

4) Nike Pegasus Trail 5

Women's shoes (Image via Nike)

These women's shoes come in 9 colorways, along with a customer design-your-own option. The ReactX foam absorbs sudden movement and helps you run smoothly. This particular design of the shoes is inspired by China's Donghai Yunding Trail's forest trail, which gives the shoe a nature vibe. It retails for $150 on Nike's website.

​

5) Nike Downshifter 13

Men's shoes (Image via Nike)

These sneakers are best for beginners who are just starting their fitness or running journey. It has a mesh upper that is stretchy and provides comfort during your run. The outsole gives good grip to prevent slipping on wet roads. Also, it's very lightweight, which doesn't feel heavy on the feet, so you can run for a long time. These retail for $75 and come in four colorways.

​

6) Nike Zoom Fly 6 Premium

Unisex shoes (Image via Nike)

These unisex shoes are made of ZoomX foam, which absorbs sudden movements and returns the energy back. It has a carbon fiber plate that further provides stability. The upper is made of mesh for airflow so your foot doesn't feel blocked. These running shoes retail for $180 on Nike's website.

​

7) Nike Journey Run

Men's shoes (Image via Nike)

These shoes are meant to give you enough stability and support during the run. The mesh upper provides comfort, and the cushioning throughout the shoe helps with support so your feet stay at ease. The outsole is made of rubber to provide grip and prevent slipping on wet roads. It retails for $90 and comes in seven colorways to choose from.

​

8) Nike Winflo 11 SE

Men's shoes (Image via Nike)

The highlight of these running shoes is their Cushion 3.0 foam that provides energy and support during runs. The upper is made of stretchy mesh so your feet don't feel compacted and stay in shape. The outsole is made in a waffle shape that provides grip and stability. It retails for $115 and comes in eight colorways to choose from.

​

9) Nike Vaporfly 3

Unisex shoes (Image via Nike)

These shoes come in 9 amazing colorways with everything from pink, yellow, and black. The carbon fiber Flyplate provides stability and support during the run. As for the cushioning, it has the latest ZoomX foam that provides energy, and the rubber outsole provides traction and grip for stability. The midsole has extra padding for a natural push during runs. The shoes retail for $270 on Nike's website.

​

10) Nike Run Swift 3

Men's shoes (Image via Nike)

These are simple and affordable running shoes that are great for beginners to expert runners. The cushioning is done with foam so your feet stay secure throughout the journey. The rubber outsole has a groove pattern that helps with traction and provides grip for slippery roads. It comes in the Iron Grey/Total Orange/Volt/Black colorway and retails for $80.

​

11) Nike Journey Run PRM

Women's shoes (Image via Nike)

The standout feature of these sneakers is their reflective film that helps you be more visible in low light. The upper is made of breathable mesh for airflow, and the rubber outsole provides stability and grip during the run. Extra padding is added to the heel collar and tongue to provide a bouncy feel and support. It retails for $100, but one can get it for $85.97 on discount from Nike's website.

​

12) Nike Structure 25

Women's shoes (Image via Nike)

These highly rated shoes are made of Zoom Air and Cushion 3.0 foam that provides extra energy to the runner. The mesh upper helps with airflow and keeps the feet secured. The waffle-inspired rubber outsole is great for grip and traction, preventing runners from slipping on wet roads. It retails for $140 and comes in 13 colorways.

​

13) Nike Interact Run EasyOn

Women's shoes (Image via Nike)

It comes in a Light Bone/White/Black colorway and retails for $85. The Flyknit upper has target areas to provide extra airflow and support. The outsole has Nike Grind material, and responsive foam is added to the midsole to return energy and provide support during the run. It also has a QR code on the tongue, which one can scan to see further benefits of the shoes. Wearing it is easy, as it's a slip-on and doesn't require any lace tie-ups.

​

14) Nike Rival Distance

Unisex shoes (Image via Nike)

These stylish shoes, which are inspired by The Armory in New York, come in the Red Stardust/Malachite/University Red/Pale Ivory colorway. The mesh upper with spike dials on the outsole provides comfort and energy return for longer runs without tiring your feet. It is specially designed for games like 400m to 10,000m races. One can also wear it for long jumps, hurdles, the triple jump, cross country, and pole vault. It retails for $75.

​

15) Nike Zegama 2

Men's shoes (Image via Nike)

It comes in five colorways and retails for $180. It has a Vibram Zegama outsole that makes the sneakers perfect for long runs and terrain journeys where you have to walk in sloppy areas. The ZoomX cushioning provides comfort and energy, and the durable mesh protects and helps with airflow. It also has an ankle gaiter, which stops the debris from getting inside.

​

9.content:
Nike SB is reviving its "Pro B" series of Dunks, as evidenced by these newly leaked images of an inline pair dropping soon. News of the release was first reported by Sole Retriever, who wrote that this "Parachute Beige" colorway will hit retailers in Spring 2025.

The leaked images shared by @bitchlikemykicks on Instagram show a sample version of the forthcoming "Parachute Beige" SB Dunk Low (style code HJ0367-200), as marked by the text on the sock liner. The sneaker dons a "Parachute Beige/Desert Khaki" color scheme and is equipped with a predominantly tan suede upper offset by a thick beige tongue, tan midsole, and gum outsole.

The Pro B Dunks were introduced in the early 2000s as a fat-tongue predecessor to the skateboarding-specific Nike SB Dunk. They were a preferred Nike model for skateboarders in that era thanks to the extra padding on the tongue and interior, which provided protection when skating.

At the time of writing, this "Parachute Beige" Nike SB Dunk Low Pro B colorway is scheduled to launch sometime in Spring 2025. Check back soon for official updates in the coming months.

0.title: Official Images Of The Nike Book 1 “Flagstaff”
0.snippet: The Nike Book 1 “Flagstaff” is expected to release on February 15th, retailing for $140. Catch in-hand images ahead — watch our Sneaker Release Dates hub and...
0.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Updated January 18th, 2025: Official images of the Nike Book 1 “Flagstaff” have been updated. The shoes are due out on February 15th, 2025.

1 of 9

It feels like yesterday Devin Booker had his name called by Adam Silver, but quietly, he now stands as one of a handful of players approaching a decade of service with his squad. With so many seasons under his belt in Phoenix, the superstar SG has naturally grown an affinity for his new home state, and it’s becoming a theme on his signature shoe. After drawing up the “Sedona” colorway to the desert town of the same name, he’s taking a quick 30 mile jaunt for his next, the Book 1 “Flagstaff.”

The shoe’s chief inspiration comes from Flagstaff’s defining ponderosa pine trees. However, those with familiarity with the aforementioned “Sedona” will immediately clock major similarities despite their differing regional inspo, carrying over the topological print on the upper and “No Service” text on the heel.

While the embroidered tongue tag remains, the Book 1 “Flagstaff” instead depicts a moody sunset, a contrasting look given the shoe’s green-on-gum overall palette. Finally, this again showcases that the further that we get into the Book 1, the more it seems the defining “pages” pull tabs are becoming a thing of the past, particularly for lifestyle-minded editions like the one at hand. .

The Nike Book 1 “Flagstaff” is expected to release on February 15th, retailing for $140. Catch in-hand images ahead — watch our Sneaker Release Dates hub and Nike’s new arrival page for additional updates as the launch nears closer.

For DBook completionists, the Book 1 “Forrest Gump” will precede this drop by about three weeks.

1.title: The Nike Shox Ride 2 Embraces a Distressed Design for 2025

1.content:
Nike continues its creative era with the 2000s-era Shox Ride 2, introducing fresh textures and trail-ready updates to the retro runner.

The latest iteration swaps out traditional mesh for grid-patterned ripstop on the forefoot and underlays, offering added durability for off-road adventures. The upper combines “Light Bone” suede across the collar and eyelet sections, harmonizing with the ripstop base. In stark contrast, the lower half is bathed in black, creating a balanced yet striking aesthetic. Pops of bright yellow bring a retro hiking vibe, subtly integrated into the tongue and heel Shox branding, visible forefoot Air unit, and trail-inspired rope laces.

The Nike Shox Ride 2 “Light Bone” is set to drop in Spring 2025 with a $190 price tag.

3.title: Nike’s investigation of ‘Starfish’ workplace complaints left stones unturned
3.snippet: Nike apologized for concerns raised in a survey known as “Starfish,” in which employees recounted their experiences with discrimination and harassment.
3.content:
In May 2018, Nike CEO Mark Parker walked onto the stage of the Tiger Woods Conference center, the largest meeting venue on Nike’s 400-acre campus. He wanted to apologize.

About two months earlier, Parker had received a stack of surveys that documented employees’ experiences with discrimination and sexual harassment, igniting the biggest scandal at Nike since sweatshop allegations stained the company’s reputation in the 1990s.

4.title: The Nike Book 1 Flagstaff Releases February 2025
4.snippet: Devin Booker pays homage to Flagstaff, Arizona, on his latest Nike Book 1 colorway. Check here for images and release information.
4.content:
Updated on January 21, 2025 • Published January 10, 2025

Colorways of Devin Booker’s first signature model with Nike, the Book 1, have been masterfully executed. Some recent and upcoming colorways have been able to harken back to classics in Nike’s archives, like the Forrest Gump and Mowabb renditions, and recall some of Book's interests, like hiking in Sedona. This theme of the great outdoors was also explored on previous Book 1s and will continue with the all-new Flagstaff colorway.

Paying homage to Flagstaff, Arizona, the pair follows in the footsteps of the aforementioned Sedona pair in referencing a region of Arizona where Booker calls home during the NBA season as a member of the Phoneix Suns. We see a reworked construction, swapping out the usual canvas twill and leather for an all-over nubuck finish covered in topographic-inspired embroidery. This look, alongside the embroidery, comes in a single shade of fir green to reference the forests that surround the city.

Nike Book 1 Flagstaff

Contrasting the deep green shade is a white outlined Swoosh on the midfoot and the textile surrounding the topmost eyelet, the former working back to the heel tab that removes the usual book spine-inspired pull tab. Here, we find the phrase “No Service” on the left pair and “Flagstaff” on the right, cementing the connection to the Arizona city. Like the Sedona pair, the tongue tag contains a custom mountain graphic depicting a serene sunset alongside Book branding and a nod to Humphreys Peak, the highest mountain in the state of Arizona. The tonal green rubber midsole finishes the design and is paired with a gum rubber outsole.

The Nike Book 1 Flagstaff will release on February 15, 2025, through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is $140. Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

Images via Nike

9.title: Nike’s New Momentum: Piper Sandler Raises Target After Upgrade
9.snippet: Piper Sandler has recently shifted its stance on Nike (NKE), upgrading the stock from 'Neutral' to 'Overweight', with an increased price target from $72 to...
9.content:
Piper Sandler has recently shifted its stance on Nike (NKE), upgrading the stock from ‘Neutral’ to ‘Overweight’, with an increased price target from $72 to $90. This optimistic revision comes amid a backdrop of negative buy-side sentiment but is predicated on an “intensified urgency” from Nike’s CEO, Elliott Hill, to address marketplace issues. The firm acknowledges the timing of this call might be premature, yet they see it as a precursor to a more tangible recovery narrative for Nike as the company approaches fiscal 2026.

Currently, Nike’s shares have shown a slight increase, opening at $71.85 after closing at $71.29 the previous day, now trading at $71.91, up by $0.63 or 0.88%. Despite this modest uptick, the company, valued at a $105.45 billion market cap, has experienced a significant depreciation, losing over 32% of its value year-over-year. The stock’s 52-week range indicates a low of $70.75 and a high of $107.43, reflecting considerable volatility. Nike’s price-to-earnings ratio as of January 08, 2025, stands at 21.23, which, while not unusually high, suggests the market’s expectation of future earnings growth considering the current stock price.

The all-time high for Nike’s stock was $170.84, recorded on November 05, 2021, which underscores the steep decline the company has faced in recent years. This downgrade in stock value can be attributed to various factors, including supply chain disruptions, shifts in consumer behavior, and intensified competition within the sportswear sector.

Piper Sandler’s upgrade is based on the belief that CEO Elliott Hill’s strategy to clean up the marketplace will pay off by making Nike’s recovery story more evident to investors. This strategy likely involves streamlining operations, optimizing product offerings, and enhancing brand value to counteract the negative sentiment currently prevailing among investors. The firm’s decision to raise the price target by 25% to $90 a share suggests confidence in Nike’s potential to navigate through these challenges effectively.

However, the market’s reaction, with only a slight increase in stock price post-upgrade, shows that investors are cautious. The negative sentiment might stem from skepticism about the speed and effectiveness of Nike’s turnaround strategy, especially in a market where consumer preferences are rapidly evolving and competition is fierce.

This scenario places Nike at a crossroads, where the execution of its recovery plan under Hill’s leadership will be crucial. If successful, it could see Nike not only regaining lost ground but also setting a new course for growth. For investors, the current stock price and Piper Sandler’s optimistic outlook might present an opportunity to buy into Nike at a potentially undervalued price, with the caveat of closely monitoring the company’s progress in implementing its strategic initiatives.

WallStreetPit does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

0.title: Nike's Prototype Shoes Squeezed and Heated Our Weary Feet at CES 2025. Here's What They Feel Like
0.snippet: We got a chance to walk around in the new Nike x Hyperice recovery shoes, which are designed to let you leave the heating pad and compression socks in the...
0.content:
"So far it feels like it's vibrating, almost like a massage, sort of." Those are the words of my colleague, CNET Senior Editor Lisa Eadicicco, when she slipped her feet into a new kind of Nike shoe at CES 2025. Made in partnership with Hyperice, these boatlike booties are basically recovery high-tops festooned with buttons and designed to help your weary tootsies recover from soreness and strain.

Read more: These are the official CES 2025 winners, awarded by CNET Group

The innovative footwear, which we saw in person for the first time in Las Vegas, takes the idea of heating pads and compression socks as part of physical recovery for feet and calves and it makes that idea mobile. Instead of you being laid up on the couch with heating pads, or sliding into compression socks with no additional heating element, these on-the-go boots put heat and compression both into footwear that works on you while you walk around.

What's more, buttons let you adjust the compression to your feet and calves as well as the amount of heat blasting into your weary muscles. There are three settings for each.

"You can definitely feel the heat in here," Eadicicco said as she walked across a demo room in Vegas. The boots massage and compress your ankles and feet, and in our test we could especially feel the heat around the ankles.

Watch this: New Nike Boots Include Compression and Heat for Post-Workout Recovery 02:38

Though the Nike x Hyperice shoes first debuted at the Paris Olympics this past summer, we jumped at the chance to try them for ourselves, as a preview of what's ahead in the space where electronics help with active recovery and not just with monitoring your vitals.

The boots are battery-powered and are intended to be used for both warm-ups and postworkout recovery. Nike says a "system of dual-air Normatec bladders bonded to warming elements" spreads heat evenly throughout the boots, aiming to warm the muscle and tissue in your feet and ankles.

Without testing them longer, it's hard to tell how effective the shoes would be as a workout warm-up or recovery system. But at first use, the features are definitely noticeable.

The shoes have Velcro straps, felt soft and comfortable to walk in, and for now come in a size range rather than individual sizes -- so men's size 10-12 for example. Nike is working on a consumer version to go on sale, but there's no word yet on when it'll launch or how much it'll cost.

Nike is also developing a compression and heat vest as part of the wearable line.

For more from CES 2025, check out the most innovative products from the show that you can actually buy now.

The Nike Dunk Low SE continues to push bold new iterations, with the upcoming “Laser Orange/Aluminum” a striking complement to the previously revealed “Paramount Blue” colorway. Both releases share the same elevated design approach, combining rich hues with high-gloss materials for an eye-catching look.

This iteration centers on a vibrant Laser Orange leather upper, offset by black patent leather overlays that add depth and a sleek finish. The Aluminum blue patent leather Swooshes and heel overlays deliver a contrasting yet harmonious pop of color. Clean white laces and midsoles complete the design, providing a crisp balance to the energetic palette.

Like its “Paramount Blue” counterpart, the “Laser Orange/Aluminum” Dunk Low SE showcases Nike’s ability to innovate in a classic silhouette. Both pairs are a testament to the Dunk’s enduring appeal, even as its popularity experiences cycles of highs and lows.

Enjoy the official images below, and stay tuned to our Nike Release Dates Calendar for updates on the release details.

3.title: Sources: Barça VP steps down over Nike deal
3.snippet: Barcelona vice president Juli Guiu has stepped down over discrepancies relating to the club's new deal with Nike, sources have confirmed to ESPN.
3.content:
Barcelona boss Hansi Flick believes it is the "right decision" to register Dani Olmo and Pau Victor for the Spanish Supercopa final this weekend. (1:06)

Open Extended Reactions

Barcelona vice president Juli Guiu has stepped down over discrepancies relating to the club's new deal with Nike, sources have confirmed to ESPN.

Barça confirmed Guiu's resignation in a short statement on Thursday.

"Barcelona inform that Guiu has presented his irrevocable resignation as vice president for personal reasons," the club said.

"We would like to thank him for his services and dedication to the institution since joining the board of directors in 2021, during which time he has been a key player in the agreements with the club's major partners in recent years."

Sources explained to ESPN that Guiu's decision came on the back of Barça's new multi-year agreement with Nike, which is worth over €100m ($103m) a year.

Guiu disagreed with some of the terms of the deal, ended up being sidelined in the negotiations and also protested the amount of commission paid to the agent Darren Dein, who acted as an intermediary between Barça and Nike.

Barça announced the deal with long-term partner Nike in November, with president Joan Laporta claiming it is the biggest of its kind in football.

Juli Guiu has left his role at Barcelona vice president. Marc Graupera Aloma/Europa Press via Getty Images

The agreement was ratified by members at an emergency meeting called in December and has helped improve the club's financial situation.

Guiu was one of four vice presidents and was in charge of marketing.

During his time at the club he played a key role in bringing several new sponsors on board, including Spotify, who are Barça's main sponsor and have also bought the naming rights to Camp Nou.

His resignation comes as off field issues continue to make headlines at Barça, with Spain's sports ministry the Consejo Superior de Deportes (CSD) this week allowing temporary player registrations for Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor.

The CSD's decision goes against ruling made by LaLiga and the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF), which said Barça had missed a deadline to prove they were compliant with financial fair play regulations (FFP) and could not register players for a second time in the same season.

The decision has been met with incredulity by LaLiga sides, with Atlético Madrid and Las Palmas condemning the ruling, but sources said the saga has nothing to do with Guiu's departure.

4.title: The Nike Book 1 Mowabb Releases March 2025
4.snippet: Devin Booker and Nike are paying homage to the Nike ACG Mowabb with an all-new Nike Book 1 colorway. Discover images and details here.
4.content:
Updated on March 10, 2025 • Published January 9, 2025

Nike Book 1 Mowabb Buy at Nike

Buy now

Unlike many of his contemporaries, the design language around Devin Booker's first signature sneaker with Nike, the Nike Book 1, leaned more into a retro and vintage aesthetic that Book and Nike dubbed a "future classic." This ethos has helped inform the sneaker's design, giving it the exterior look of a retro model with the interior tooling of a modern-day performance sneaker and allowing the model to borrow from classic Nike sneakers. Most of these pairs have been worn by Booker on the court, with some, like the Forrest Gump, coming to retail. Joining the PE-to-retail train is the Book 1 Mowabb.

Inspired by the Nike ACG Mowabb, the silhouette directly translates the color palette used on this '90s model onto the Book 1, specifically the OG Twine colorway. Traditional construction for the sneaker is present, using a workwear-inspired canvas twill on the midfoot panel, perforated suede on the collar and tongue, and leather panels on the mudguard and eyestays. A sesame shade is present on most of the upper, with aqua-blue pops on the collar and tongue.

Nike ACG Mowabb Twine

More accenting hits are located on the Swoosh, which takes on a black finish and is outlined in bright mandarin, the mini Swoosh on the lateral toe, and the lace aglets. Back on the heel, we see a book spine-inspired pull tab resting above the dark green suede patch. The speckled rubber midsole finishes the design and is paired with a blue and black rubber outsole.

The Nike Book 1 Mowabb was released on March 1, 2025, and is available now through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. In men’s sizing, the retail price is $150. 5.title: Bandits make off with nearly $50,000 worth of Nike shoes in Arizona train heist
5.snippet: This week, four people...
5.content:
PHOENIX (AZFamily) — At least 100 trains roll through Arizona communities daily, often carrying valuable cargo. Valley rail expert Scott Jones says that makes them easy targets.

“It’s really created a market for a lot of these gang organizations,” he said.

He says long trains with miles of cars are especially vulnerable to crime in what’s become the Wild West.

“They wait until the train gets out into a more desolate remote area where you have fewer law enforcement and people that could report any type of suspicious activity,” said Jones.

This week, four people were indicted after being caught with nearly $50,000 worth of Nike shoes en route to Dick’s Sporting Goods stores.

All were stolen from a BNSF train and hidden near tracks in the northern Arizona desert.

The frequency of these kinds of robberies has been on the rise over the past two years.

“Just bad people that want to do bad things and it’s a money maker for them,” said Jones.

Homeland Security says it commonly involves transnational theft groups working throughout the Southwest.

“It’s well planned,” said Jones. “Well-orchestrated.”

Court records reveal how it usually happens, and it usually starts with thieves scouting out containers carrying high-dollar goods.

Once they find one with electronics, tools, and footwear, they hop onto the moving train and break high-security locks with saws and bolt cutters.

The criminals cut the train’s brakes and signal control wires to complete their heist, causing an emergency stop.

The crooks decide when and where this happens, looking for places to remain undetected as they unload the loot, hide it in nearby fields, and brush.

Those on the train communicate with accomplices in vehicles that act as surveillance.

Later, box trucks come to pick up the merchandise and often take it to California to be sold online on Amazon or eBay.

“How are they doing this? Is there somebody on the inside? I mean, that’s a good question. I’d like to think not, but we don’t know that,” said Jones.

Jones says this is dangerous; Abruptly stopping trains can cause derailments and risk the lives of crew members.

He hopes these suspects are prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law, and he’s calling for added security measures and rail safety legislation to address this growing issue.

Nobody likes a remix more than Nike. That’s why before the ink was even dry on the return of the Nike Pegasus 2k5, the Nike Air Pegasus Wave began to circulate, its first colorway landing just months after the Peg proper reappeared. With the two now sharing shelf space, the Wave is starting to work out its own trademark design language, something that the latest “Football Grey” variation goes a long way in accomplishing.

Nike has primarily played the Wave’s parent model as a down-the-middle tech runner, clad in palettes you can easily find on competitors like the New Balance 1906R or ASICS GEL-Kayano 14. 7.title: Nike Is Dropping an All-Star Lineup of Kobe Sneakers for Lunar New Year
7.snippet: The date of the release stays the same as the original, though: February 8. A week later, on February 13, the lauded Kobe 6 Protro comes back in an all-white...
7.content:
There’s no better way to ring in the Year of the Snake than with Kobe Bryant. The Mamba’s sneaker legacy has carried on well since his estate re-partnered with Nike back in 2022 to revive the late athlete’s iconic footwear line. In keeping with the spirit of Bryant’s ‘Protro’ revivals (retros refitted with updated tech, a favorite of players across the NBA), the Swoosh has actually been fairly averse to out-and-out revivals of iconic Kobe colorways. They don’t stray from the path entirely, but they’re far more prone to exciting new makeups tied to the Mamba legacy. Starting this week, the brand kicks off the Year of the Mamba in style with a quartet of beautiful new colorways tapping into the spirit of Lunar New Year—and harkening big things ahead.

The Year of the Mamba starts out with the Kobe 5 Protro in a special pair of colorways designed to commemorate the Lunar New Year. The wide release sees the silhouette wrapped in an eggplant purple upper with black midsole and translucent blue midsoles. What really makes it pop is the primary detailing, a gold snake wrapped around the entirety of the upper and finished in a textured snakeskin pattern. Purple and gold? Pretty good combo–somebody should deck out an NBA team in those colors. China is getting an exclusive play on this colorway, which preserves the snake detailing and switches things up with a black sole and a vibrant red upper (perfect for the holiday) to play off the gold snake.

8.title: Is Nike a Top Buy in 2025?
8.snippet: Nike screens as a compelling watch list candidate at the start of 2025, but not exactly a must-own stock.
8.content:
Like an athlete going through a slump, Nike (NKE -1.35%) finds itself at a critical juncture. The sportswear giant's shares have tumbled nearly 30% over the prior 12 months, while the S&P 500 (^GSPC 2.13%) has delivered total returns of 27.5%, including dividends.

Despite the sharp decline, Nike's stock still commands a premium valuation at 30.8 times forward earnings. Let's break down the athletic apparel giant's fundamentals to determine if this contrarian setup presents a buying opportunity at the onset of 2025.

An unmatched legacy in transition

Nike's dominance of the global sportswear market remains unrivaled, with a 16.4% market share, according to Euromonitor. This commanding position stems from decades of brand-building and marketing excellence since the company's founding in 1964.

The company's financial strength shows in its consistent dividend growth. Nike has increased its dividend payments for 23 consecutive years, with a robust five-year annualized growth rate of 10.7%. This performance puts Nike firmly in the elite category of dividend growth stocks.

Recent missteps create an opportunity

Nike's recent challenges stem primarily from its aggressive push toward direct-to-consumer sales at the expense of wholesale relationships. This strategy backfired as post-pandemic shopping habits normalized and consumers returned to physical retail stores.

The company also stumbled in product innovation by overly relying on classic footwear lines, while competitors like On and Hoka (owned by Deckers Brands) gained ground in key categories such as running shoes. These setbacks contributed to declines of 8% in sales and 26% in net income during the second quarter of fiscal 2025.

Fresh leadership charts a new course

New CEO Elliott Hill brings deep institutional knowledge from his 32-year tenure at Nike. His strategy focuses on rebuilding wholesale partnerships and revitalizing product innovation to reconnect with core customers.

Hill's planned investments in global sports partnerships target Nike's historical strength while implementing cost reductions in other areas. This balanced approach aims to restore the company's mid-teens operating margins through increased full-price selling and expansion in high-margin markets.

Market expectations and valuation

Nike stock commands a premium valuation at 30.8 times projected earnings, notably higher than the S&P 500's multiple of 21.7. This elevated valuation suggests investors remain confident in the company's strong brand equity and potential for margin expansion under its new leadership initiatives.

The company continues to prioritize shareholder returns through multiple channels. Its 2.08% dividend yield is well-protected by a conservative 46.6% payout ratio, offering investors steady income during the ongoing business transformation.

Nike has also maintained an aggressive capital return program, exemplified by its $1.1 billion share repurchase in fiscal 2025 Q2, demonstrating its commitment to creating shareholder value beyond dividends. Over the prior 10-year period, the athletic apparel company has reduced its outstanding share count by a healthy 13.5%.

Is Nike stock a contrarian buy?

While Nike faces near-term headwinds, its dominant market position, proven dividend growth, and fresh leadership create an appealing opportunity for patient investors seeking both income and capital appreciation potential. The company's renewed focus on product innovation and wholesale partnerships under Hill's leadership could catalyze a return to form, or as Hill noted in the fiscal 2025 Q2 press release, "Nike being Nike again."

However, the stock's premium valuation at 30.8 times forward earnings suggests investors might need considerable patience while the turnaround plays out. So, all things considered, Nike screens as a compelling watch list candidate at the start of 2025, but not exactly a must-own stock. For contrarian investors focused on dividend growth and multiyear turnaround stories, though, the athletic apparel giant offers an intriguing entry point despite its premium valuation.

9.title: Nike makes cycling move with FDJ-Suez sponsorship
9.snippet: The partnership makes FDJ-Suez the only professional cycling team, across both the women's and men's pelotons, to have a sponsorship deal with Nike. The...
9.content:
US sportswear giant Nike has agreed an exclusive sponsorship deal with top-tier women’s professional cycling team FDJ-Suez.

Contract:

Nike becomes UCI Women’s WorldTour team’s official lifestyle apparel supplier from the 2025 season

FDJ-Suez athletes and staff will wear lifestyle apparel designed by Nike

Context:

The partnership makes FDJ-Suez the only professional cycling team, across both the women’s and men’s pelotons, to have a sponsorship deal with Nike. The sportswear brand already has an endorsement deal with FDJ-Suez rider Demi Vollering, which was announced in April 2024.

Vollering, who signed a two-year contract with FDJ-Suez ahead of the 2025 season, is one of only a handful of cyclists partnered with Nike. The company also sponsors record men’s Tour de France stage winner Mark Cavendish, as well as Letizia Paternoster and Cameron Wurf.

The deal with FDJ-Suez sees Nike return to cycling after largely staying away from the sport since the doping scandal involving Lance Armstrong, who was dropped from the sportswear company’s roster in 2012.

Comment:

“This partnership with Nike is a unique opportunity for our team,” said Stephen Delcourt, general manager of FDJ-Suez.

“Collaborating with such an iconic brand will strengthen our identity while bringing a fresh dimension to our project. We look forward to building this collaboration over the long term, enhancing our team’s image both on and off the competition stage.”

Coming next:

FDJ-Suez will showcase their new Nike apparel during the UCI ProTour event Tour Down Under from 17th to 19th January.

0.title: Nike Announces the 2025 After Dark Tour, a Women’s Race Series — NIKE, Inc.
0.snippet: This unique series of nighttime running events is crafted to bring women runners together, fostering a sense of community, self-expression and belief that will...
0.content:
For more than five decades, Nike has been at the forefront of the running revolution, driven by a relentless passion to empower and inspire runners of all levels. The brand has been a pioneer in pushing the boundaries and expanding opportunities for women in running, serving the future of sport and the next generation.

As a continuation of Nike’s mission to invite more women into sport, the brand is announcing the 2025 After Dark Tour, a global women’s race series designed to be the ultimate girls’ weekend.

This unique series of nighttime running events is crafted to bring women runners together, fostering a sense of community, self-expression and belief that will leave athletes feeling seen, supported and motivated to take on their next challenge.

The After Dark Tour invites women runners to race the night away in 10Ks and half marathons in six major cities: Sydney, Shanghai, Seoul, Mumbai, Los Angeles and Mexico City.

Beyond chasing times and miles, each event reflects the convergence of nightlife, running, community, culture and style — and is designed to feed the passion athletes have for sport, connection and shared experiences.

Each race weekend will include Nike product and style experiences, expert coaching guidance and motivation, race day preparation services, recovery zones and post-race celebrations to end the night.

“We’re creating a space where women runners feel welcome and empowered,” says Seema Simmons, VP, Global Women’s Running and Training. “The After Dark Tour is about more than crossing a finish line — it’s about joining a community that supports and uplifts you, no matter where you are in your running journey. We’re inviting all women to come as they are and discover the strength within themselves and the power of our collective energy.”

Further, the After Dark Tour is designed to empower women to perform their best and create lasting connections through a training journey that begins well before race day and fosters a love for sport that extends far beyond the finish line — reflecting Nike’s longstanding and lasting commitment to supporting women runners.

Beginning today, Nike invites women and their communities to take their place at the starting line, and to experience the ultimate girls’ weekend.

Runners will be able to access official After Dark Tour training plans through the Nike Run Club App, complete with specialized instruction from Nike Run Coach Diljeet Taylor that’s designed to build runners’ endurance and confidence to take on a 10K, half marathon or both distances. The 10K plan spans six weeks, and the half marathon plan includes 12 weeks of instruction.

“Getting athletes to the starting line knowing that their coach believes in them is the best race day preparation,” says Taylor. “I am so excited to be part of this journey where I have the opportunity to motivate and train an entire community of runners that maybe wouldn’t have sought out a goal like this, and I get to be someone who helps them set and chase that goal and cross the finish line. To me, that’s very humbling and fulfilling.”

In the lead-up to race day, the Nike Run Club App will help athletes connect with friends and other runners through experiences and challenges in their neighborhoods and across the globe. The Nike Run Club App now provides with athletes localized tips before they head out and allows them to share their real-time location with friends and family during their run.

Nike is also enabling the full training journey and race day experience with the latest innovations and running essentials, which are purpose-built to help women train and compete at their peak.

The After Dark Tour begins April 12 in Sydney and concludes June 21 in Mexico City. Learn more and register for a race at afterdarktour.nike.com.

1.title: Nike’s .SWOOSH Prepares for Next Air Force 1 Drop with “Triple Triple Black” Edition
1.snippet: Nike's virtual Web3 platform, .SWOOSH, is set to release its latest Air Force 1 offering, taking a simpler approach compared to its earlier digital-driven [...
1.content:
Nike’s virtual Web3 platform, .SWOOSH, is set to release its latest Air Force 1 offering, taking a simpler approach compared to its earlier digital-driven designs. Dubbed the “Triple Triple Black,” this new iteration delivers a sleek, minimalist aesthetic with subtle updates to the iconic silhouette.

The shoe features a dark anthracite leather upper, complemented by a miniature Swoosh on the toe and “SWOOSH AIR” branding on the heel. Premium details extend to the tongue label and interior lining, both crafted from leather, while the .SWOOSH logo is subtly stamped on the insole.

Adding a playful twist, the release includes a toothbrush hang-tag, a callback to the Air Force 1 Retro releases of 2022. This version updates the tag’s message to “You Missed A Spot,” though the bristles are purely decorative.

The release is expected to be exclusive to .SWOOSH members, with official details anticipated soon.

Stay tuned to our Nike Release Dates page for updates on the pair's release.

2.title: The Slawn x Nike Air Max 90 Pack Releases Spring 2025
2.snippet: British-Nigerian artist Slawn is launching two colorways of the Nike Air Max 90 in 2025. Check here for images and release info.
2.content:
Slawn x Nike Air Max 90 Pack

Although the Air Max 90 is a staple silhouette for Nike, collaborators don’t regularly add their touch to the Tinker Hatfield-designed model. In what will hopefully kickstart a trend of more projects on the Air Max 90, British-Nigerian artist Slawn is slated to work on the silhouette, with images of two Slawn x Nike Air Max 90s appearing online.

While retailer Asphalt Gold posted the two colorways with no branding or mention of Slawn being connected to the releases, Brendan Dunne of Complex reported that the artist was, in fact, the reason behind the wild redesign of the classic Air Max model. For those unfamiliar with Slawn, whose real name is Olaolu Akeredolu-Ale, the 24-year-old artist and designer first began to make moves as a teenager when he created the brand Motherlan with a group of friends, which caught the attention of the legendary Virgil Abloh. Later, he began to paint and showcase his work on social media, eventually gaining enough recognition that at 22, he designed the statues and sets for the 2023 Brit Awards.

Images via Asphalt Gold

As for Slawn’s two Air Max 90s, we see a splatter paint finish applied to the front half of the sneaker, which is relatively untouched compared to the back half. From the midfoot panel back to the heel, including the Swoosh, we see a molded and textured leather that appears almost handcrafted. A direct reference to one of Slawn’s art pieces, Ugly Bastard, is found on the heel tab, replacing the usual Nike Air Text. Another detail unique to Slawn’s AM90 is found on the top eyelets, in metallic silver on the Black pair and metallic gold on the Sail pair.

The Slawn x Nike Air Max 90 Pack will release in March 2025 through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is $150. 3.title: Slawn x Nike Air Max 90s Are Releasing This Spring
3.snippet: The heel badges feature a Slawn-like face with long semicircular eyes. It's tough to make out from the Asphalt Gold photos, but the uppers on the Air Max 90s...
3.content:
Nike is collaborating with Slawn, the irreverent British-Nigerian artist known for his bold characters and spray paint work, on two pairs of Air Max 90s that are set to release in March, sneaker industry sources tell Complex. Nike hasn’t announced the project, but images of the collab circulated online this week.

Sneaker News unwittingly leaked the Slawn shoes on Tuesday, posting two previously unseen colorways of the Air Max 90 that were listed for sale online at German retailer Asphalt Gold. The store likely did not realize the Air Max 90 was a special project intended for a later release.

Neither Sneaker News nor Asphalt Gold made mention of Slawn in their descriptions of the shoes.

A close look at the details on the sneakers reveals their origin. The heel badges feature a Slawn-like face with long semicircular eyes. It’s tough to make out from the Asphalt Gold photos, but the uppers on the Air Max 90s appear to feature Slawn drawings embossed on the leather. The shoes have redone mudguards, paint speckles, and imperfectly-shaped Swooshes on their uppers. The Slawn x Nike Air Max 90s come in black (style code FD6492-001) and white (style code FD6492-100).

At least one pair of shoes already made it out into the wild. On Tuesday, a YouTube user from the Netherlands published a barely-viewed video featuring the black Air Max 90. Like Sneaker News, the user did not make the connection to Slawn, but the clip shows the words “Air Slawn” written on the box in graffiti lettering.

Asphalt Gold, no doubt realizing it accidentally previewed the first collaboration from an artist that’s new to the Nike roster by posting the shoes early, has pulled the Air Max 90s from its website.

Nike and Slawn did not respond to requests for comment about the collaboration.

While Nike hasn’t made its partnership with Slawn public, there have been quiet signals pointing to their alignment. At Art Basel in Miami last December, Slawn spent time with Nike employees who work on the brand’s collab product. He attended the pre-launch party for the Stash x Nike “Blue Is Back” pack at Concepts wearing the upcoming Air Max DN8, a 2025 shoe that Nike is in the early stages of building hype around. Weeks later, on Dec. 19, he posted a photo that appeared to show him on a conference call with Nike as part of a carousel on Instagram.

UPDATE (02/27): Slawn has officially unveiled his two Air Max 90 collabs on Instagram today. Additionally, the artist announced the opening of a pop-up space at the Truman Brewery in London this Saturday, March 1, for his Air Max 90s. At the time of writing, a wider release for the project has not yet been announced by the brand.

5.title: Where To Buy The Nike Pegasus Premium
5.snippet: The Nike Pegasus Premium is releasing on January 30th, 2025 for $200. Tap in for official images, store list info, and more.
5.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Before the Air Max 95, Air Max TL 2.5 and other bubbled icons became smash hits as casual lifestyle shoes, Nike’s Running shoes were entirely meant for…running. It’s the crossover from track to street that provided the roots of what the Swoosh calls its Sportswear division, and as design and performance engineering became more and more technical, so did the shoes that were meant for the sport.

Running shoes of the modern day look nothing like the aforementioned Air Max classics. You won’t find leather, suede, or mesh, but rather super-thin skin-like synthetics and state-of-the-art foams to keep the sneaker as light as possible. The AlphaFly 3 and upcoming Nike VaporFly 4 may be concept cars in sneaker form, but realistically, they look absolutely goofy when worn with anything but running shorts or tights.

That’s why when Nike unveiled the Pegasus Premium in Paris last April, many sneaker media folks reported experiencing a visceral reaction. For myself, it was similar to the one I felt when I first laid eyes on the Air Max 93 at the Foot Locker on Roosevelt Ave. in Flushing decades ago.

Full length Air will never not grab attention, despite various iterations coming to market. But the Pegasus Premium is different. It’s not exactly a thick, fat bubble like you see in Air. It’s not the first time full-length visible Zoom was done either (see: Air Zoom All Out Flyknit).

But the ergonomic shape, the choice in Total Orange, and the orange “eye-liner” to enhance the dimensions is all I needed to start budgeting for several pairs upon its retail arrival. Above the technical aspects, the Pegasus Premium brings us back to the era when wearing performance kicks was the preferred choice.

1 of 9

Where To Buy The Nike Pegasus Premium

Onto the brass tax: The Nike Pegasus Premium is set to release on January 30th, 2025. The pair pictured above reflects both mens and womens release, although they have different SKUs. Several colorways are also planned for Spring 2025 and on, including a grey pair with a full-length Zoom Air unit in Volt neon. According to an official Nike release calendar, the MSRP is expected to be $200.

Nike’s Road Running Footwear Line-up

The Pegasus Premium is part of Nike’s new Road Running Footwear Line-up category. Obviously under the Pegasus family, the top-level Premium version offers the utmost in Responsive Cushioning via the full-length Zoom.

Within each of these columns exist an icon silhouette, an elevated Plus option, and the super-powered Premium. As of now, only the Pegasus family has iterations on all three tiers. The below infographic best lays out how Nike’s simplified structure can help you pick the right road running shoe.

6.title: Nike Vs Adidas Stock: Which is the Better Investment for 2025?
6.snippet: As we begin 2025, Nike (NKE) shares have hovered near 52-week lows while Adidas (ADDYY) stock is not far from its highs.
6.content:
As we begin 2025, Nike NKE shares have hovered near 52-week lows while Adidas ADDYY stock is not far from its highs. Surely, investors may wonder if a sharp rebound is in store for Nike shares or if Adidas stock can reach higher highs.

This makes it a worthy conversation of which iconic shoe and retail apparel company is the better investment at the moment.

Zacks Investment Research



Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Why NKE is Down and ADDYY is Up

Attributed to what has been a constant need to revamp its product line, Nike is dealing with increased competition outside of Adidas from the likes of Under Armour UAA and New Balance. Correlating with such, slower sales growth and inventory issues have weighed on investor confidence.

Meanwhile, Adidas has been able to capitalize on Nike’s downturn by strategically increasing its product offerings. This has led to improved financial metrics for Adidas which has bolstered market sentiment.

Outlook Comparison & EPS Revisions

Based on Zacks estimates, Nike’s total sales are expected to decline 10% in fiscal 2025 to $46.34 billion compared to $51.36 billion last year. Fiscal 2026 sales are projected to stabilize and rise 1% to $47.11 billion.

Nike’s annual earnings are currently slated to drop 47% this year to $2.10 per share versus EPS of $3.95 in 2024. That said, FY26 EPS is projected to rebound and rise 12% to $2.36. However, it’s noteworthy that FY25 and FY26 EPS estimates have continued to decline over the last quarter and are noticeably lower in the last 30 days.

Zacks Investment Research



Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

As for Adidas, its top line is expected to increase 6% as the company rounds out FY24 with total sales projected to expand another 10% in FY25 to $27.3 billion. Even better, annual earnings are now expected to climb to $2.15 per share in FY24 from an adjusted EPS loss of -$0.36 in FY23. More intriguing, FY25 EPS is forecasted to soar another 88% to $4.05.

Notably, over the last 60 days, Adidas FY24 EPS estimates are up 4% although FY25 EPS estimates are slightly down.

Zacks Investment Research



Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Valuation Comparison

Trading at $71 a share, NKE is at a 34.3X forward earnings multiple with ADDYY at $125 but at 30.9X. Still, both trade at premiums to the benchmark S&P 500’s 22.1X and their Zacks Shoes and Retail Apparel Industry average of 14.4X.

In regards to price to sales, Adidas is more attractive as well with ADDYY under the optimum level of less than 2X while NKE is at 2.3X.

Zacks Investment Research



Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Dividend Comparison

Nike does have a clear edge as it relates to dividends with a 2.22% annual yield that towers over Adidas’s payout of 0.19% and tops their industry average of 1.92%.

7.title: Another .SWOOSH x Nike Air Force 1 Low Is Coming
7.snippet: Another .SWOOSH x Nike Air Force 1 Low Is Coming. The web3 platform is back with a “Triple Black” rendition of the sneaker.
7.content:
Name: .SWOOSH x Nike Air Force 1 Low “Triple Black”

Colorway: Black/Black/Black

SKU: HJ9348-001

MSRP: $130 USD

Release Date: 2025

Where to Buy: Nike

Nike continued its foray into the web3 space in 2022 by launching .SWOOSH — the home of its virtual creations. Within a year, the Air Force 1 Low “TINAJ” (aka “THIS IS NOT A JPEG”) dropped for .SWOOSH members, with an alternate look appearing — but not dropping — in 2024. The AF1 Low “404 Error” came next for members and now we have a preview of yet another Air Force 1 Low following the Kai Cenat-led Air Max 1 “Low Poly” campaign.

At first glance, this “Triple Black” iteration of the Air Force 1 Low is rather ordinary. However, a premium composition and .SWOOSH branding gives it a nice twist. The smooth leather upper dons a very dark gray and hosts not only the standard Swooshes, but a mini Swoosh at the midfoot of the lateral too. Plain Swoosh branding adorns the tongue tag while the heel tab sees a special “SWOOSH AIR” callout nod to the program. From there, the .SWOOSH logo hits the sockliner while a toothbrush-shaped accessory with “You missed a spot” text rounds out the pair.

.SWOOSH has not yet announced the release of its “Triple Black” take on the Air Force 1 Low. Stay tuned for updates as it’s likely to arrive as a .SWOOSH member-exclusive drop later this year via the Nike SNKRS platform at a starting price of $130 USD.

8.title: Nike Debuts LeBron James' First-Ever Training Shoe, Designed for Versatility and Comfort
8.snippet: The LeBron TR1 is perfect whether you're hitting the hardwood, engaging in CrossFit, or doing anything in between.
8.content:
You could theoretically use most athletic shoes for working out but with today’s footwear lineup, you don’t really need to. Nike has arguably the best range of workout shoes, from the Romaleos designed for weightlifting to the Metcon popular in the HIIT world. Now, the athletic giant’s range gets even wider as it taps future hall-of-famer LeBron James for a new kind of workout shoe favoring versatility and all-day wear.

Photo: Nike

Recently passing Michael Jordan for the most career 30-point games, James has been going strong with Nike ever since signing his signature shoe contract back in his 2003 rookie season — a series that is currently on its 22nd iteration this year. But the NBA star has also branched out with some other purpose-built models like his first-ever training shoes, which you see here. Currently available in five different colorways, the LeBron TR1 is perfect whether you’re hitting the hardwood, engaging in CrossFit, or doing anything in between. According to Nike, the shoe was made to “appeal to athletes across multiple disciplines.”

Photo: Nike

Lightweight and durable, the sneakers are constructed for all-day wear but can give you some solid support in the gym with their large rubber outsole lugs and waffle herringbone pattern for traction. These are supplemented by flex grooves on the heel and forefoot for improved mobility and ergonomics. Comfort and stability are provided by the foam wrap, which also adds a glove-like bootie designed to expand as your foot swells during intense activity. Meanwhile, the cable laces ensure that you always have the right fit. From a design perspective, the shoes favor a street style but still fit well in a gym setting.

Photo: Nike

To enhance your next workout, get yourself a pair of the LeBron TR1 training shoes. Priced at $130, the sneakers are currently available from Nike’s website.

9.title: Nike Air Max 90 "Dusty Cactus" Releases Spring 2025

The design starts with perforated “Wolf Grey” leather on the toe box and collar, creating a sporty yet polished look. A closer glance at the mudguard reveals a modern grey carbon fiber texture, adding a unique twist. “Cool Grey” suede on the quarter panels pairs beautifully with “Anthracite” accents on the mudguard and sole, crafting a sleek and versatile foundation.

What makes this colorway truly special are the striking “Dusty Cactus” details. The vibrant shade enhances the Swoosh, tongue, backtab text, and mudguard window, delivering a refreshing burst of energy against the muted grey tones. These pops of color honor the legacy of bold Air Max designs, ensuring the shoe stands out both on the streets and in sneaker culture.

The Air Max 90 “Dusty Cactus” maintains the classic comfort and durability the model is known for. Signature Air cushioning and the waffle-patterned outsole provide support and a smooth ride, making it as functional as it is stylish.

Mark your calendars—this fresh colorway drops in Spring 2025. Find the Nike Air Max 90 “Dusty Cactus” at select Nike Sportswear retailers, online, and on Nike.com. The pair is priced at $130 USD and promises to be a must-have for sneaker enthusiasts.

0.title: Nike Ushers in the Year of the Mamba with New Kobe Footwear and Apparel — NIKE, Inc.
0.snippet: Nike's new Year of Mamba collection of Kobe apparel and footwear, which intertwines the legendary Mamba Mentality with the rich cultural symbolism of Lunar...
0.content:
Nike is introducing the Year of the Mamba: a challenge to athletes, as the calendar turns, to choose the hard, uncomfortable path in the year ahead, all in dedication to fulfilling their most audacious dreams in life and sport.

The challenge encapsulates Kobe Bryant’s Mamba Mentality, a mindset born from a relentless, passionate and fearless pursuit of better, fueled by more grit and sacrifice than most are willing to give.

To power that never-ending commitment to greatness and pay tribute to Kobe’s memory, Nike designers embrace their own Mamba Mentality to obsess every detail in each product that bears his name — advancing the game; connecting athletes with Mamba Mentality; and helping them reach their goals, no matter how bold.

That obsessive drive toward betterment takes form in Nike’s new Year of Mamba collection of Kobe apparel and footwear, which intertwines the legendary Mamba Mentality with the rich cultural symbolism of Lunar Year 2025 and the Year of the Snake.

“This collection is an introduction to the Year of the Mamba — and, for our younger athletes, a deeper education on Mamba Mentality and the tenacity Kobe brought to the game,” says Bronson Yim, Product Line Manager, Kobe footwear. “With this capsule, we’re not extending athletes a year of good luck. We’re not saying, ‘Have a good year.’ We’re challenging athletes to have a tough year, proving to themselves that they can channel Mamba Mentality to unlock their goals.”

At the center of the collection is the Kobe 5 Protro “Year of Mamba,” which adds a forefoot Zoom Air unit and Protro midfoot foam to an iconic silhouette known for its combination of lightweight performance and standard-setting court feel.

These Nike Basketball innovations are paired with an iridescent “Eggplant” launch colorway that provides a familiar, elevated look, complete with graphic references to Kobe’s career and a nod to the Year of the Snake, inscribed in Mandarin on the tongue. An additional “University Red” colorway will be available exclusively in China.

A premium Kobe jacket leads the apparel collection, incorporating a satin-like material that protects against rain and a quilted interior that delivers comfort and warmth. An embroidered pattern on the back of the jacket pays homage to Kobe’s five championships and the work it took to win them, with a snake entangling five rings and a call to Kobe’s Mamba Mentality. Similar motifs anchor the T-shirt, crew and fleece pant that comprise the rest of the collection.

“We know athletes are inspired to live and breathe Mamba Mentality, and this collection extends that mindset off the court with Kobe lifestyle apparel rooted in Nike Basketball performance,” says Treniere Moser, Director, Kobe apparel. “Mamba Mentality doesn’t stop when you leave the gym, and this collection is designed to reflect that tenacity in sport and life — helping athletes achieve their dreams during the Year of the Mamba.”

Joining the Year of Mamba apparel later this winter is the Details Collection, which is inspired by Kobe’s ability to fine-tune every aspect of his game and make it better. From transforming the traditional on-court tear-away pant into a modern pleated look, to reimagining the classic shooting shirt as a dress, each piece in the collection takes something familiar and pushes it into the unexpected, reimagining the familiar material of basketball mesh and incorporating insider references to Kobe’s career.

Further honoring Kobe’s legacy and challenging the next generation to live by Mamba Mentality are the Kobe 9 Elite High Protro “Masterpiece” and Kobe VI Protro “Sail” — beloved silhouettes restyled to meet the moment of today.

Ten years after its initial release, the Kobe 9 Elite High Protro has been updated with a contemporary React foam midsole and new traction pattern on the inside of the foot while carrying forward the Flyknit upper athletes know and love. The Kobe VI Protro, meanwhile, advances the silhouette’s legacy with two new colorways: one honoring Kobe and his namesake NBA All-Star Game trophy with a star-studded upper, and another referencing a mamba shedding its skin.

“When you put Protros on, you know there are no shortcuts: The steps to success are right there,” says Yim. “You have to enjoy the journey more than just the end destination. If you study the greats, you know what it takes to be great — and we’ve channeled inspirations from one of the greatest to ever play into these Protro silhouettes.”

Nike is also challenging athletes to embody Mamba Mentality through weekly workouts in the Nike App. Follow the Kobe Interest to see if you have what it takes.

The Kobe 5 Protro Year of Mamba silhouette and apparel will be available globally at nike.com and select retail locations January 9. The Kobe 9 Elite High Protro “Masterpiece” and Details Collection will be available February 8. The Kobe VI Protro “Sail” will be available February 13.

3.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Prior to the three collaborative releases with London-based streetwear label Cortez, the Air Trainer Huarache hadn’t seen the light of day since mid-2019. That’s quite a gap between circulation, which in today’s retro product strategy is quite a long bit of time.

Luckily for fans of the Tinker Hatfield-designed Huarache series, the Training iteration is set to have its moment again in 2025 as a number of general release colorways are in the works. This firs tlook at a “Blue Tint” colorway skews towards the softer side of things in order to maintain more of a lifestyle aesthetic, but at quick glance, models like these are better suited with that early-90s era vibe.

We’d love to see white leathers and black suedes dotted with hits of neon greens and purples similarly to the Air Huarache running model, but this all-blue styling with Summit White soles should pique the interests of a few.

This new colorway of the Air Trainer Huarache is expected to launch late Spring 2025 with an MSRP of $140; more colorways are certainly in the works, so stay tuned for updates and first looks.

4.title: Nike’s New CEO: It’s All About the Athlete
4.snippet: In the first earnings report as CEO, Elliott Hill said the iconic brand's return to greatness will be through sport.
4.content:
Nike is getting back to basics.

Just redo it. In the first earnings report as CEO, Elliott Hill said the iconic brand’s return to greatness will be through sport.

“We lost our obsession with sport. Moving forward, we will lead with sport and put the athlete at the center of every decision.”

Turnaround. Nike’s stock declined ~29% this year, shedding $50B in market cap as competitors like On and HOKA gained ground.

Identifying missteps, Hill said the company over-indexed on lifestyle sneakers, performance marketing, and direct sales. Retooling, his turnaround hinges on sport-first innovation, brand storytelling, and marketplace integration.

Uphill climb. Accepting the challenge, Hill expects near-term setbacks but said his “singular focus” is to “get back to winning.”

A long way to go, Q2 ‘25 sales were down 8% YoY to $12.4B.

Looking ahead: After losing its way, Hill is reaffirming Nike’s mission to “bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world” – emphasizing the footnote that everyone’s an athlete.

When Nike chooses to bring back a silhouette from the archives, it's not uncommon to see them tap a collaborator to help get some energy and familiarity to the model before a full-on GR release schedule. 8.title: Nike’s ‘Racist Sneaker’ Debacle: Should Marketers Be Involved In Product Development?
8.snippet: Nike's recall of a line of shoes slammed by many consumers as racist has sparked major debate across America. "The controversy," according to the BBC,...
8.content:
Nike’s recall of a line of shoes Opens a new window slammed by many consumers as racist has sparked major debate across America. “The controversy,” according to the BBC Opens a new window , “has reignited the anger at the heart of America’s gaping political divide.”

Featuring our nation’s first flag, created by Betty Ross during the American Revolution, the sneaker was no doubt meant as a patriotic tribute that would be released in time for Independence Day.

Many consumers, however, complained that the flag represents an era of slavery, with many quickly pointing out in the past that particular flag has been adopted by various extremist groups — including the American Nazi Party.

While there has been significant support of the sportswear giant’s withdrawal of the footwear — Nike said its decision to recall the sneakers was a result of “concerns that it could unintentionally offend and detract from the nation’s patriotic holiday” — there also has been vehement backlash from conservative-leaning consumers.

Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has even weighed in, saying he would make the first order if Nike changes its mind and re-releases the shoe.

As I watch Nike navigate yet another public and heated racism-related debate play out on social media and online (see: Colin Kaepernick-starring campaign that led many angry consumers to burn their Nike apparel), I wonder if such a public response could have been predicted in the first place.

I may be biased with my pro-marketer viewpoint but I believe this whole ordeal illustrates why marketers should be more involved in product development.

Admittedly, I don’t know the extent to which Nike’s marketing team was clued in leading up to the release of the sneaker. Marketing may very well have had plenty of input and simply not connected the shoe to racist implications, but clearly nobody else at Nike did either (unless concerns were expressed and discarded).

Nevertheless, this controversy offers a textbook example of why in our digital world company leaders should consider incorporating a marketing focus in product development and management.

It’s all about the data

Consumer data is now at the heart of digital marketing and, as such, the best marketers now must be data-savvy.

Crucially, the data we’re primarily working with is consumer data, which means that beyond data expertise, marketers are also fast becoming customer experts.

Indeed, to market successfully and effectively to consumers online, it’s vital to know everything about them, from personal preferences, habits and behaviors, to their consumer journey and buy cycle.

I’m sure there are many product managers who will disagree with my assertion that marketing departments are turning into the company’s foremost authority on what makes their customers tick. After all, product teams are the ones who speak directly with users and elicit feedback.

Marketers, though, are increasingly tracking every element of their operations — gathering and analyzing key consumer data, such as which specific messages are getting prospects over the line and which campaigns are resonating most, not only with their customer base but also with the wider public.

Whether or not you agree with me, this is important data that can provide high-value insights to the product team on the market, competitors and prospective (and current) customers.

In Nike’s case, for example, marketers may have been more sensitive to the fact that the company’s customer base will be highly involved when it comes to race-related social causes and discourse.

Reducing friction

As most of us know, all too often marketers must manage friction and sometimes even combative relationships with other company departments. It usually reduces to differing priorities and goals across the various teams that also report to different executives.

One of the better-documented adversarial, inter-departmental dynamics in many organizations lies between marketing and sales. Slowly and surely, though, this is changing – finally – as business leaders realize that unifying the traditionally disparate data silos between these two teams leads to improved demand generation and conversions, faster sales cycles and better customer retention.

That same improvement in departmental cohesion now needs to make its way to marketing and product.

Generally, the main causes of discord between these two teams are:

Different sets of success metrics;

Short-term goals overshadowing the company’s big-picture, strategic-level objectives;

Dynamics and relationship between marketing and product lack definition, which leads to indecision, gaps/overlap in functions, and sometimes even territorial disputes;

Lack of adequate communication.

To combat this friction, company leaders should consider the following improvements to the way their product and marketing teams interact:

Get the two departments working together as early as possible in the product development process;

Identify and agree on the key roles and responsibilities of each based on specific skillsets and capabilities rather than an organizational chart;

Keep clear lines of communication throughout and ensure transparency from both sides;

Define early which strategic success metrics are most important for all involved.

Ultimately, bringing marketing closer to the product development and management process not only will help businesses design better products and services, but can also help avoid potential Nike-like scandals.

Finally, while loathe to contradict myself I admit that marketers are still liable to make stupid mistakes — after all, we are human — and fail to understand current political and social climates, as Alitalia showed us this weekOpens a new window .

The Italian airline suffered painful backlash for releasing a social media ad that featured a white actor wearing blackface to portray former President Barack Obama.

You’d think a consumer expert, of all people, would know that blackface will never play well with audiences today. Go figure — and take it as a warning.

9.title: Nike partners with FDJ-SUEZ in exclusive team lifestyle apparel sponsorship
9.snippet: Nike partners with FDJ-SUEZ in exclusive team lifestyle apparel sponsorship ... When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission.
9.content:
Nike has agreed to an exclusive partnership with top-tier women's professional cycling team FDJ-SUEZ that begins in 2025.

As the team's official "lifestyle apparel supplier" the new deal means that FDJ-SUEZ is the only professional cycling team, across both the women’s and men’s pelotons, to work directly with the globally recognized brand.

The partnership marks another coup for the French team after signing former Tour de France Femmes winner Demi Vollering on a two-year contract for 2025 and 2026 seasons. She joins the team as a co-leader alongside Évita Muzic and new-signing Juliette Labous.

Vollering announced a personal sponsorship with Nike, outside of her former SD Worx-Protime squad sponsorship line-up, last April. She joined Mark Cavendish, Letizia Paternoster and Cameron Wurf, who have had similar agreements with the US-based sportswear brand. Although Nike does not currently produce cycling products, Cavendish and Wurf wore shoes with a prominent Nike Swoosh on them.

FDJ-SUEZ confirmed that athletes and staff will wear lifestyle apparel designed by Nike this season, which blends aesthetics with functionality. "A mutual commitment to connecting sport and culture," read a team press release.

For Nike and FDJ-SUEZ, the team stated that the collaboration represents a unique opportunity to explore new horizons while partnering with one of the most iconic brands in the world.

"This partnership with Nike is a unique opportunity for our team. Collaborating with such an iconic brand will strengthen our identity while bringing a fresh dimension to our project," said Stephen Delcourt, General Manager of FDJ-SUEZ.

Get The Leadout Newsletter The latest race content, interviews, features, reviews and expert buying guides, direct to your inbox! Contact me with news and offers from other Future brands Receive email from us on behalf of our trusted partners or sponsors

"We look forward to building this collaboration over the long term, enhancing our team’s image both on and off the competition stage."

FDJ-SUEZ has already undergone a bike sponsorship change switching from Lapierre to Specialized, in an announcement in December. The deal coincided with both the team’s 25th anniversary and the signing of Vollering.

While Specialized will outfit FDJ-SUEZ with their bikes, it will continue to partner with Vollering's former team SD Worx-Protime for the foreseeable future, too, with a deal in place through to the end of the 2028 season.

0.title: Did Nike Really Rip-Off Satisfy MothTech?
0.snippet: Nike's newest Dri-Fit tee features a certain running tee with very similar hole patterning to Satisfy's MothTech.
0.content:
Mothman Prophecies

As a runner who may or may not have chewed on the remnants of notebook paper as a child, I like my shirts eaten, preferably by moths. Which is why I lean towards Satisfy’s MothTech ventilation when I’m looking for a shotgun-style hole pattern on a cotton t-shirt for all my running needs in the 50-52 degree Fahrenheit temperature range. (Look, it’s a very specific use-case scenario, but for that one morning in late April, I go full devil-wears-Strava for my run and it absolutely kills.)

If you’re new to running, or a peasant who can only afford Lululemon, then you may be unfamiliar with Satisfy MothTech. In short, it’s a very specific cotton t-shirt ventilation system pioneered by Satisfy, a Parisian boutique run apparel brand that essentially spearheaded the run fashion ethos of today. In short, MothTech is a bunch of holes in a cotton t-shirt, pre-distressed, like me about to go on a run after eating the Chick-fil-A spicy chicken sandwich meal the night before. Anyway, it looks like this (not an affiliate link!).

Nike is delivering a sleek and moody addition to its Dunk Low lineup with the upcoming "Dark Team Red" colorway, slated to drop in Spring 2025. This iteration offers a premium take on the classic silhouette, blending luxurious materials with a bold, understated palette.
