2.title: Ja Morant And Kool-Aid Stir Up A Nike Ja 2 Collaboration
2.snippet: The Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 is expected to hit shelves in May 2025, retailing for $130 upon arrival. Keep an eye on our Sneaker Release Dates page as that date...
2.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Always the trailblazer, Ja Morant isn’t letting anyone else get the scoop on what he’s cooking up in Beaverton. He reported via his socials that he plans to “start leaking his own shoes” and kicked off that initiative by teasing two upcoming collaborations: the Swarovski pair we recently reported on and a brand new edition, the Kool-Aid Nike Ja 2.

Though Morant himself was the first to officially crack the seal on this syrupy Ja 2, detailed in-hand looks preceded his by just a few hours, giving us a pretty defined understanding of what this shoe brings to the table. The central design feature is a cracked graphic sitting behind the Swoosh, hitting on the Kool-Aid man’s iconic demolition-centric ads that have been a pop cultural staple since the 1970s.

In line with that, his “oh yeah” catchphrase is printed on the inside of the tongue, an alternating touch that itself aligns with the mismatched colorway on display. Already a calling card of Ja’s Nike output, it’s a sugary combination of neon blue and peach pink, furthered by the glossy “condensation” spots on the mudguard and heel counter.

Anticipated to release before the Swarovski Ja 2, this will mark the second collaboration in Morant’s signature line, coming on the heels of a link-up with the crystal company on his first model. Zooming out, this continues a pretty novel streak of collabs in the Nike Basketball universe, elucidated by the LeBron 22 “What the Monopoly,” its preceding pairs, and more recently, the Titan Sabrina 2.

The Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 is expected to hit shelves in May 2025, retailing for $130 upon arrival. Keep an eye on our Sneaker Release Dates page as that date approaches for updates on where and when you can grab your pair.

3.title: Customized Sneakers in the Spotlight in Nike, Goyard Lawsuits
3.snippet: The Shoe Surgeon's customization business became the target of trademark-centric lawsuits from Nike and Goyard in 2024.
3.content:
The Shoe Surgeon’s customization business became the target of two lawsuits in 2024, with Goyard filing suit against it in June and Nike following up less than a month later with a headline-making complaint of its own. The French luxury goods brand and the American sportswear giant wage trademark-centric claims against the Shoe Surgeon and its founder Dominic Ciambrone (collectively, the “Shoe Surgeon” or “defendants”) in their respective complaints, alleging that by making authorized use of their well-known marks, the Shoe Surgeon is likely to confuse consumers and damage their brands. While Goyard’s lawsuit appears to be winding down, with a settlement in sight, the case waged by Nike is still underway.

Goyard v. the Shoe Surgeon

Goyard and the Shoe Surgeon appear to have resolved their clash over customized footwear. In the notice of settlement that it filed with a federal court in California on December 20, the French luxury goods brand revealed that it has reached a settlement to the trademark infringement, false designation of origin, and unfair competition claims it has waged against the sneaker and apparel customizer.

The Background : Goyard filed suit against the Shoe Surgeon in June, alleging in a complaint with the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California that the Shoe Surgeon is on the hook for an array of trademark causes of action as a result of its sale of footwear, apparel, and accessories that it markets as being made with “authentic” Goyard canvas. The problem, according to Goyard, is that it has “not verified [the trademark-bearing canvas at issue] as genuine.”

Given that the Shoe Surgeon’s sneakers and other offerings contain trademarks that are “identical, substantially indistinguishable, or confusingly similar to the Goyard marks,” Goyard claimed that consumers are likely to be confused as to the nature/source of the goods “at the time of initial interest, sale, and/or in the post-sale setting.” The likelihood of confusion is compounded, per Goyard, by the defendants’ “legitimate collaborations with other famous brands,” which could “suggest to consumers that the defendants may have a legitimate collaboration with Goyard, when they do not.”

With the foregoing in mind, Goyard set out claims of trademark infringement, false designation of origin, and unfair competition, and is seeking preliminary and permanent injunctive relief, as well as monetary damages.

The Shoe Surgeon’s Response : In response to Goyard’s suit, the Shoe Surgeon presented several defenses. It admitted that Goyard did not grant it an express license to use Goyard intellectual property, including its name and trademark-bearing textiles, but argued that no such license or permission is required for it to “truthfully claim to customize shoes with ‘authentic’ Goyard canvas material,” particularly as “the clients for whom [it has] customized shoes with authentic Goyard fabric and others viewing those shoes are not confused about any connection with Goyard.”

Among other things, the sneaker customizer maintained that its bespoke services, aimed at individual clients, are not likely to confuse consumers about whether it has any affiliation with Goyard. Beyond that, the Shoe Surgeon asserted that its use of Goyard’s materials is artistic, as it enhances the aesthetic of client-owned shoes without competing with Goyard’s products, and is not commercial in nature.

Still yet, the defendants argued they they should be shielded from the claims in Goyard’s lawsuit since the “accused customization services [are] performed using authentic Goyard bags purchased directly from Goyard” and thus, “amount to a resale and/or use by the first purchaser.”

Nike v. the Shoe Surgeon

Despite a pending settlement with Goyard, the lawsuit that Nike waged against the Shoe Surgeon, which centers on the trade dress of its “iconic” Air Jordan 1, Air Force 1, Air Jordan 3, and Air Jordan 4 silhouettes, is still playing out before a federal court in New York.

The Background : In the case that it lodged, Nike accuses the Shoe Surgeon of constructing “a multifaceted retail empire built around the unauthorized use of [its] trademark rights and the associated goodwill that [it has] spent decades accruing.” Nike asserts in the complaint, which it filed with the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York in July, that the defendants have engaged in an “egregious display of widespread infringement that has even crossed into willful counterfeiting of iconic Nike products.”

Specifically, Nike claims that the Shoe Surgeon’s business is built around customized footwear, which the defendants either create “from scratch” or by “modify[ing] and offer[ing] for sale large quantities of [otherwise authentic] Nike-branded products.” Additionally, the defendants enter into “Nike-focused collaborations with other rights holders using Nike’s intellectual property, [and] ink digital rights agreements based on Nike trademarks,” Nike maintains.

“To make matters worse,” Nike argues that the defendants “are engaging in all of this behavior while falsely leading consumers to believe that Nike is affiliated with their businesses or has otherwise authorized their conduct.” In reality, Nike states that it “has not authorized any of [the] complained-of conduct, and this conduct – coupled with the false air of credibility the defendants are intentionally creating – is likely to cause and is already causing confusion in the marketplace that the parties are associated, when they are not.”

As a result, Nike sets out claims of direct and contributory trademark infringement, counterfeiting, unfair competition and false designation of origin, and trademark dilution.

The Shoe Surgeon’s Response : The Shoe Surgeon and Chambrone filed a lengthy answer and counterclaims in November, in which they highlight a history of collaborations with Nike and allege wrongdoing on the part of the Swoosh. The Shoe Surgeon alleges that Nike not only commissioned its services for high-profile projects, but also used their expertise to shape its own customization ventures, including the launch of its “Nike By You” service, all while failing to pay for their services.

“Indeed, starting back in 2017, Nike fostered a relationship with the Shoe Surgeon to find out what had made this ‘humble self-taught cobbler’ into the pioneering shoe-customizer and go-to artist for celebrities,” the Shoe Surgeon asserts in its filing. At the same time, the Shoe Surgeon alleges that that Nike “reached out to [it for] over a dozen projects and collaborations over the last seven years,” including with “requests for which Nike indicated it would pay but ultimately failed to pay.” Nike “strung the Shoe Surgeon along not only as to payments that never came,” the company contends, but also as to “a potential relationship for future projects between Nike and the defendants.”

In addition to lodging an unjust enrichment cause of action against Nike as a result of such alleged payment failures, the Shoe Surgeon sets out a defamation and/or trade libel cause of action against Nike after the sportswear co. “launched a public smear campaign against it, falsely accusing the company of manufacturing counterfeit products.” Still yet, the Shoe Surgeon is seeking a declaratory judgment of invalidity/cancellation for functionality for all thirteen of the trade dress registrations that Nike relies on in its suit.

The case is Nike, Inc. v. S2, Inc. d/b/a The Shoe Surgeon, et al., 1:24-cv-05307 (SDNY).

4.title: SATISFY Calls Out Nike for MothTech™ Lookalike
4.snippet: It has been revealed that Nike's new running t-shirt features holes throughout and is expected to provide runners with better air circulation. The original...
4.content:
Nike‘s new running t-shirt recently surfaced online and it has now been the topic of public scrutiny due to its resemblance to SATISFY‘s signature MothTech™.

It has been revealed that Nike’s new running t-shirt features holes throughout and is expected to provide runners with better air circulation. The original design was made popular by French-based running brand SATISFY and has been known to be called MothTech™. Following the reveal of Nike’s new shirt, SATISFY caught wind of the product and has taken to social media to clarify that the shirt is not in fact a collaboration between them and the Swoosh. In a post on LinkedIn, the company responds the Nike lookalike stating, “We were surprised to see a product from Nike surface that closely mirrors our distinctive design. To clarify, SATISFY has no involvement in this project. The design appears to draw heavily from our signature MothTech™ aesthetic, which is disappointing to see from a major corporation known to defend its own image and intellectual property so fiercely.”

The company goes on to explain how founder and creative director Brice Partouche came up with MothTech™, “It represents the genesis of SATISFY’s DNA. It crystallizes the intersection of culture, performance, and functionality, serving as the foundation for our disruptive approach to redefining running culture.” They added, “Our designs resonate with runners seeking gear that meets their performance needs and reflects their identity, challenging the status quo. We’re grateful to our community for their vigilance and unwavering support as we continue to push the boundaries of running culture together.” Nike’s new running shirt has sparked a debate online with some calling for SATISFY to be recognized and other running enthusiasts claiming that holes in shirts for ventilation is not new technology and that Nike has done so in the past.

Take a look at the full statement below.

5.title: Nike, Inc. (NYSE:NKE): A Bullish Investment Perspective
5.snippet: We came across a long thesis on Nike, Inc. (NYSE:NKE) on ValueInvestorsClub by ThinkAnew. In this article we will summarize the bulls' thesis on NKE.
5.content:
We came across a long thesis on Nike, Inc. (NYSE:NKE) on ValueInvestorsClub by ThinkAnew. In this article we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on NKE. The company’s shares were trading at $83.56 when this thesis was published, vs. closing price of $73.31 on Jan 3rd.

© https://sgbonline.com/

Nike, Inc. (NYSE:NKE) is the largest seller of athletic footwear and apparel in the world, with the primary activity of designing, developing and worldwide marketing and selling of athletic footwear, apparel, equipment, accessories and services. Footwear generates around two-thirds of total revenue, featuring renowned brands like Nike, Jordan and Converse.

Despite recent struggles and a 20-year history of flat operating margins, the author believes that Nike, Inc. (NYSE:NKE) represents an attractive investment opportunity. The bull thesis is primarily centered around the company’s scale, history and wide network of partner athletes – while it is undeniable that NKE operates in one of the most competitive industries in the world, the author believes that the company’s scale allows it to invest billions of dollars annually to be around the best athletes in the world and appear at the most popular sport events. This allows NKE to remain in the spotlight and create never-ending demand year after year (an amazing stat: three-quarters of NBA players wear either Nike/Jordan brand and half of the 2022 FIFA World Cup players wore Nike uniforms). Consequently, the company should be able to continue to sign up the majority of the best athletes within every generation, as long as management doesn’t mess up the execution.

The author also believes that NKE has made good progress in addressing past mistakes, such as benevolently giving up space at the largest retailers like Foot Locker to focus on direct-to-consumer distribution. This has led to more consumer attention towards competing brands, but management has already revised this policy, which should positively impact demand for NKE brands. Another potential catalyst for NKE is the upcoming 2026 World Cup and 2028 Olympics both happening in the US, which could bring unprecedented attention and advertising opportunities for NKE. All in all, the author estimates FY2030 EPS of $6.20-$6.30, which coupled with a target forward P/E of 20.0x, yields a target price of $125.00, or 70% upside to be realized over the next 5 years.

While we acknowledge the potential of NKE as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than NKE but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

6.title: How women at Nike set out to save the company from toxic culture

6.content: Nike employees walked out at the company's Washington County campus on Dec. 9, 2019, in support of Mary Cain, a runner who alleged she'd been abused by her coach at the Nike Oregon Project. The demonstration came the year after Nike apologized for concerns raised in a survey known as "Starfish," in which employees recounted their experiences with discrimination and harassment.Wesley Lapointe

7.title: Nike Dunk Low "Dark Team Red" Releases Spring 2025
7.snippet: The Nike Dunk Low “Dark Team Red” will release in Spring 2025 available at select Nike Sportswear retailers, both in-store and online, including Nike.com.
7.content:
Nike is set to expand its iconic Dunk lineup with the Dunk Low “Dark Team Red,” dropping in Spring 2025. The Dunk Low remains a favorite among sneaker fans, thanks to its classic look and fresh updates.

- Advertisement -

This upcoming release combines premium materials with a standout color palette. The shoe starts with a smooth black leather base, delivering a sleek and durable texture. Dark team red suede overlays bring depth and contrast, elevating the design with a bold yet refined vibe. To tie it all together, the dark team red outsole pairs perfectly with the black midsole, completing the look with understated elegance.

The Dunk Low “Dark Team Red” reflects Nike’s commitment to blending style and functionality. Whether for casual wear or a statement piece, this sneaker offers versatility and undeniable charm. Its timeless silhouette continues to captivate both new and long-time Dunk enthusiasts, making this release a must-have addition to any collection.

The Nike Dunk Low “Dark Team Red” will release in Spring 2025 available at select Nike Sportswear retailers, both in-store and online, including Nike.com. Priced at $125 USD, this pair is poised to be a standout choice for the season.

Don’t miss your chance to own this stunning rendition of the Dunk Low. With its premium build and bold design, the “Dark Team Red” edition is sure to turn heads and elevate your sneaker rotation.

9.title: Nike’s New Running Shoe Looks Like It Came Out of a Military Surplus Store
9.snippet: A new colorway of the Alphafly 3 just surfaced with hues plucked out of a military surplus store: Light Army, Ironstone and Desert Moss.
9.content:
The Alphafly might have the most impressive CV in the history of running.

Nike’s top-of-the-line racer is the only shoe to go under two hours in the marathon; it currently holds both the men’s and women’s world records in the distance; and, according to recent data, it’s the best-selling race shoe in the world.

According to Strava data, the Alphafly (bottom) is the most popular shoe in marathons around the world. Photo by Jack Seemer for Gear Patrol

All to say, the Alphafly is fast. It’s popular. It’s the undisputed GOAT of long-distance running.

But it’s also something else: an eye-sore, with its half a dozen colorways coming in various shades of neon yellow, pink and orange.

A new direction

Finally, Nike’s designed team has decided to point the shoe in a different direction in 2025.

A new lifestyle-friendly colorway of the Alphafly 3 just dropped online, draped in hues that sound like they came straight out of a military surplus store: Light Army, Ironstone, Light Khaki and Desert Moss.

0.title: The Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 Releases May 2025
0.snippet: Ja Morant pays homage to Kool-Aid on his signature sneaker with Nike, the Nike Ja 2. Find images and details about the Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 here.
0.content:
Published January 5, 2025

Ja Morant’s second signature sneaker has been on the market for over three months at this point, and just like his first model, the sneaker has been a hit amongst ball players. Entering the new year, previews of pairs for 2025 have been making the rounds online, including the Exposure, Twelve Time, and Valentine’s Day-ready Heart Eyes variants. In what will mark the model’s second-ever collaboration, the first with Swarovski, Ja Morant is set to pay homage to everyone’s favorite sugary drink, Kool-Aid.

Featuring a mismatched appearance, the silhouette takes on a gradient color pattern along both the left and right sneakers. Starting with the left pair, we see shades reminiscent of Kool-Aid’s blue raspberry flavor, beginning at the toe and working back to transitioning into a dark black near the collar and heel. For the right sneaker, the classic cherry red starts at the toe and turns into orange once you hit the heel.

Images via yyt_snkrs

While these colors obviously evoke the image of these flavors, the tongue hosts a direct nod to the drink, with the Kool-Aid Man “breaking through” a wall in his classic red appearance. On the reverse of the tongue sits his catchphrase, “Ohhh Yeah!” Other details in reference to the drink are found on the lateral midfoot, with “cracks in the wall” reminding us of the Kool-Aid Man’s preferred entrance.

Splatter paint details grace both the lateral and medial profiles, the latter taking on a knit appearance and featuring black Swoosh details. You can also find condensation drops on the quilted heel counter, which also plays host to Ja Morant’s “12 AM” text in the font used by Kool-Aid. Finishing the design is the white foam midsole with splatter details paired with a glow-in-the-dark outsole.

The Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 will release May 15, 2025, through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is set at $130. Download the Sole Retriever mobile app to stay updated on the latest releases, raffles, news, and more in the sneaker and streetwear world.

Images via yyt_snkrs

1.content:
The Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 brings a burst of flavor and fun with its mismatched design. The left sneaker showcases a bold blue raspberry gradient that fades into sleek black. Meanwhile, the right shoe features a fiery cherry red transition into orange. This vibrant contrast mirrors the colorful essence of Kool-Aid’s iconic flavor lineup.

- Advertisement -

Details make this release unforgettable. The tongue proudly displays the beloved Kool-Aid Man, while his legendary “Ohhh Yeah!” catchphrase is embroidered inside the collar. Additional touches include splatter paint details, quilted heel counters mimicking condensation, and Ja’s “12 AM” branding in Kool-Aid’s playful font.

Function meets flair with a glow-in-the-dark outsole, ensuring these sneakers stand out even in low light. Whether you’re on the court or out with friends, these kicks offer both style and performance.

With its bold colors, nostalgic details, and functional design, the Kool-Aid x Nike Ja 2 is a must-have for sneaker enthusiasts and Kool-Aid lovers alike.

2.title: The Nike Shox R4 "Orlando" is Available Now
2.snippet: As the Nike Shox R4 continues its resurgence, Nike taps into the nostalgia of 1990s basketball with its upcoming "Orlando" colorway.
2.content:
As the Nike Shox R4 continues its resurgence, Nike taps into the nostalgia of 1990s basketball with its upcoming "Orlando" colorway.

This release channels the spirit of the Orlando Magic's golden era, marked by the dynamic duo of Penny Hardaway and Shaquille O'Neal, whose influence on the court was as profound as their impact on sneaker culture.

The "Orlando" edition of the Nike Shox R4 features glistening metallic uppers that echo the futuristic aesthetics that Shox technology is known for, coupled with clean white sidewalls. Rich Royal Blue accents embellish the Swoosh embroidery and highlight the Shox columns, providing a vibrant contrast that recalls the Magic's distinctive uniforms. Completing the theme, a bold black rubber tread anchors the design, completing the classic Magic trifecta of colors.

The Nike Shox R4 "Orlando" is now available at Foot Locker.

@goat

3.title: Lil Yachty Is Expected to Release His Most Colorful Nike Collab Yet
3.snippet: Lil Yachty is expected to release a new Nike Air Force 1 collaboration in a patent leather 'Lucky Green/Mystic Red/University Gold' colorway.
3.content:
After launching his debut Air Force 1 collaboration in December 2024 and previewing another version of the sneaker weeks later, Lil Yachty’s Nike partnership is expected to continue in the new year with the release of yet another style.

This time, it’s the glossy patent leather look worn by the artist during his April ’24 Coachella performance that’s expected to drop soon. The yellow, green and red sneakers have an official colorway of “Lucky Green/Mystic Red/University Gold” and feature a full patent leather upper.

Watch on FN

Like his ’24 release, Lil Yachty’s Concrete Boys collective is represented with a stick man logo embroidered on the heel. It’s also possible the upcoming pair features the same “It’s Us” tongue branding, although that detail has yet to be revealed.

Lil Yachty x Nike Air Force 1 Low ‘Lucky Green.’ Credit: Lil Yachty

The bold patent leather colors seen on Lil Yachty’s “Lucky Green” Air Force 1 echo trends of the 2000s and resemble a colorway Nike (or Japanese brand A Bathing Ape) could have released in the Y2K era.

Lil Yachty’s first Air Force 1 release was not without controversy. It had received critique from some — including an in-person spat with industry veteran Brandon “Bimma” Williams — for what was perceived to be an uninspired colorway. This new patent leather pair, and the potential release of the aforementioned croc style, should be more than enough to satisfy those looking for a more pronounced design.

According to sneakermarket.ro, the new Lil Yachty x Nike Air Force 1 Low “Lucky Green” is expected to be released during summer 2025. This story will be updated with confirmed details once they’re announced.

6.title: I ran 35 miles in the Nike Pegasus Premium — here’s my verdict
6.snippet: The Pegasus Premium is the springiest Pegasus I've ever tested, but this bounce is undermined by the weight of the shoe, and it's also quite unstable.
6.content:
When you buy through links on our articles, Future and its syndication partners may earn a commission.

Credit: Future

It’s the Nike Pegasus, but not as we know it. The Nike Pegasus Premium sits at the top of Nike’s Pegasus range and is a very different shoe to the Nike Pegasus 41 and Nike Pegasus Plus, mostly thanks to the wild midsole design that contains three different materials.

The high stack and combination of materials create a bouncy and enjoyable ride and the Pegasus Premium is the springiest Pegasus I’ve ever tested, but this bounce is undermined by the weight of the shoe, and it’s also quite unstable.

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

While it’s fun, and a great-looking shoe you can also wear casually, the Nike Pegasus Premium doesn’t match the performance of the best running shoes. In my Nike Pegasus Premium review I’ll explain why and compare it to the best Nike running shoes and alternatives I’ve tested from other brands.

Nike Pegasus Premium review: price and availability

Nike Pegasus Premium

The Nike Pegasus Premium is due to go on sale on 30 January 2025 and will cost $210 in the U.S. and £185 in the U.K., making it considerably more expensive than the other Pegasus shoes in Nike’s range. The price is in line with top max-cushioned shoes like the Asics Superblast 2 and Hoka Skyward X.

Nike Pegasus Premium review: design and fit

The Nike Pegasus Premium will launch in the ‘Airscape’ color I tested, with other colors sure to follow. The shoe has a very high midsole stack of 45mm at the heel and 35mm at the forefoot, keeping the same 10mm drop that you have on the Pegasus 41 and Pegasus Plus.

I found that the shoe fit me well in my normal running shoe size, which is the same size I use for the other Pegasus shoes and have done with all Nike shoes for years. Given the high stack on the Pegasus Premium it isn’t a surprise that it’s a heavy shoe — at 11.6oz in a men’s size 10 it’s over an ounce heavier than the Pegasus 41, and 2.5oz heavier than the Pegasus Plus in my size.

Upper

Nike Pegasus Premium

The Pegasus Premium has an engineered mesh upper with plenty of padding around the collar. The tongue is also well padded, which increases the step-in comfort of the shoe but might make it feel a little hot if running in warm conditions. It was breathable enough for my use in the UK winter though, and overall I found the upper comfortable throughout my testing, with no rubbing or hot spots.

Midsole

Nike Pegasus Premium

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

Nike has thrown everything at the midsole of the Pegasus Premium, which contains three different materials. The top layer is ZoomX foam, which is the springy, lightweight material used in the Nike Alphafly 3 and Vaporfly 3 racing shoes.

Then you have a full-length Air Zoom unit, which is the main innovation in the Pegasus Premium. Nike has used Air Zoom pods in other running shoes for years, but this is the first time a full-length unit has been put into a shoe, and it delivers a highly-responsive ride feel with the Pegasus Premium.

Underneath the Air Zoom unit there is a layer of ReactX foam running from the heel to the midfoot of the Pegasus Premium. This is likely there to protect the softer foams above and add some more stability to the shoe, which is needed because the high stack and narrow midfoot on the Pegasus Premium does compromise its stability.

Outsole

Nike Pegasus Premium

There is a long cutout on the bottom of the Pegasus Premium which shows off the Air Zoom unit, but the key impact zones on the shoe are covered with a layer of rubber. During my runs in wet conditions the shoe has gripped well, and I don’t expect any problems with the outsole’s durability.

Nike Pegasus Premium review: running performance

I’ve tested all three Nike Pegasus shoes in the current line-up and the Pegasus Plus is a natural step up on the Pegasus 41, with a similar design but a better foam in the midsole that makes it lighter and more responsive.

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

The Nike Pegasus Premium is, however, something very different to the other two shoes in the Pegasus stable. It’s more akin to max-stack cruisers from other brands like the Hoka Skyward X or Brooks Glycerin Max, and offers a fun and bouncy ride that adds enjoyment to easy runs.

It’s certainly the springiest Nike Pegasus shoe I’ve tried, and it has a lot more foam underfoot than the Pegasus 41 and Pegasus Plus. This is especially noticeable under the forefoot on the run. The Pegasus 41 and Plus sometimes felt a bit flat to me there, and aren’t as comfortable as shoes from other brands with lower drops and higher forefoot stacks, but there’s certainly no lack of comfort with the Pegasus Premium.

Nike Pegasus Premium

All that foam underfoot does come with two considerable drawbacks though. The first is the weight. Even for a high stack shoe, the Pegasus Premium is heavy — it’s much heavier than the Asics Superblast 2, and also weightier than the Hoka Skyward X and Brooks Glycerin X, and this makes it harder to enjoy faster runs in the Pegasus Premium.

Also, most high-stack cushioned shoes I’ve tested have a wide base to make them more stable, including the Hoka and Brooks shoes mentioned above, but this isn’t the case with the Pegasus Premium. It has a narrow pinch-point at the midfoot and I don’t think it’s a stable shoe — even as a neutral runner I could feel my foot rolling inwards sometimes.

Advertisement Advertisement

Advertisement

If Nike had made the shoe wider it would have been even heavier, so the Pegasus Premium might be stuck between a rock and hard place on that front. If you’re a neutral runner and running on flat surfaces then the instability shouldn’t be a problem, but if you need any extra support then I’d probably avoid the Pegasus Premium.

Should you buy the Nike Pegasus Premium?

While the Nike Pegasus Premium is a fun shoe and I’m interested to see where Nike takes the Air Zoom tech in its midsole next, it’s not one I recommend to most runners. The combination of the high price, heavy design and instability mean that there are better options available, so unless you really love the look of the shoe and want to use it for general use as well as running, I’d look elsewhere.

The Asics Superblast 2 is the most versatile max-stack shoe I’ve tried, and brilliant for easy, hard, short and long runs alike, while the Hoka Skyward X offers a bouncy, enjoyable ride for easy runs while being more stable than the Nike Pegasus Premium.

Within Nike’s own range the Pegasus Plus is a more versatile daily trainer, if less comfortable, while the Nike Zoom Fly 6 is a fantastic plated super-trainer I love doing all types of run in. The standard Pegasus 41 is a better option for new runners thanks to its stable and protective design, and relatively low price.

8.title: Review: Lil Yachty’s ‘Concrete Boys’ Nike Air Force 1
8.snippet: Lil Yatchy's collaborative Nike Air Force 1 mightn't work in pictures, but it's a detailed, beautifully made tribute to sneaker history.
8.content:
Complex’s “Sneaker of the Year” panel is the biggest conversation on the sneakerhead calendar. Each year, at the ComplexCon convention, Joe LaPuma and a panel of notable guests talk through Complex’s draft “Best Sneakers of the Year” list, invariably arguing about unwarranted inclusions, unfair snubs, and various side issues. It can get surprisingly testy, and this year, that was more true than usual.

The rapper Lil Yachty arrived late to the stage, having landed late at Vegas, bringing his immense passion for and knowledge of sneakers, but also a chip on his shoulder. In 2024, Yatchy had finally got a Nike deal, and slowly been teasing his collaborative Air Force 1 sneakers, which were released in late 2024. The online response hadn’t been entirely positive.

He’d been allowed to collaborate on one of the most iconic sneaker silhouettes of all time, and given that free reign, he’d made an almost all-white pair with a deep navy sole and lining. From the photos, at least, this limited, collaborative pair looked a lot like the general release pairs you see sitting on sale on JD Sports shelves, and the sneaker internet mocked him for this “lazy collaboration.” One of the people pointing this out had been former sneaker-industry insider Bimma Williams, who was in the ComplexCon audience, and Yatchy lashed out at him on stage, calling him a “dick sucker,” among various other less than eloquent remarks.

This moment eroded much of my goodwill toward Yatchy — an otherwise humble, curious, pleasant-seeming person — but having tried his shoes, I understand why he was so defensive. I had never intended to own a pair, but a sneaker collector friend, Kevin Gerdes — whose total collection is worth six figures — had told me they were his favorite pair of the year. And with a recommendation like that, I had to get a pair, and I’m glad I did.

Yes, they are a subtle pair of shoes — white with navy — but the materials and details make all the difference. Rather than the sheer bleach white of retail Air Forces, this is an ever so creamier, off-white shade; the navy is this deep French navy, and the leather is of a far higher quality than most modern Air Forces, which typically use a heavily lacquered leather, which creases easily. No, it’s not a bold design. Yet it looks exactly like the cool subtle pairs you’d see in early 2000s East Coast hip-hop videos. The details — like the original Air Force 1 dubree and the leather tongue tag — make it seem well thought out and authentic, and you can feel the passion in their design.

They won’t draw attention and get hype, but that’s not their point. They’re a celebration of “if-you-know-you-know” sneaker culture, and wearing cool, well-made, detailed shoes; and it’s one of the rarer Nike releases of last year, with Europe notably only receiving around five thousand pairs through Nike’s SNKRS app. Best of all, because they’re not hyped up, they’re still available on the reseller marketplaces for about $150.

It’s one of those shoes that don’t work from the photos, yet it’s easily one of my favorite sneakers of 2024. I can’t wait to try his next pair.

Release Date: February 14

Originally released in 2012, the Nike KD 4 ”Scoring Title” honors Kevin Durant‘s historic achievement as the youngest player to win three consecutive NBA Scoring Titles with this particular colorway, celebrating his 2011-2012 season victory.

The design features a dynamic blend of blue and yellow, paying homage to KD’s time with the Oklahoma City Thunder. The blue dominates the upper, while vibrant yellow accents highlight key design elements, creating a visual narrative of KD’s scoring dominance. Intricate geometric patterns extend across the upper, from the tongue to the sock liner and heel, while a distinctive ankle strap adds both style and support.

Bold yellow Swooshes and KD’s signature branding complete the design, turning the KD 4 into a timeless piece of basketball history.

0.title: Nike Tacks on Tassels to the Air Force 1 Low
0.snippet: This latest Air Force 1 Low iteration introduces a bold twist with suede tassels adorning the vamp. The all-pink design sits atop a sail sole unit, blending...
0.content:
Bruce Kilgore’s legendary Air Force 1 design has long been celebrated for its versatility, effortlessly transitioning from "Color of the Month" staples to high-fashion collaborations with Louis Vuitton. With such a wide range, you never quite know what’s next—but it’s safe to say that tassels were not on anyone’s bingo card to start 2025.

This latest Air Force 1 Low iteration introduces a bold twist with suede tassels adorning the vamp. The all-pink design sits atop a sail sole unit, blending barely pink leather uppers with rich blush suede overlays. Swoosh and heel panels showcase distinct contrast stitching, while premium leather tongues feature a debossed finish, adding a touch of elegance.

The suede tassels undoubtedly steal the show, bringing a dramatic flair to the classic silhouette. For those who prefer a more traditional look, the tassels are easily removable, ensuring versatility for different styles.

Set to release in the Spring/Summer 2025 season, this unique Air Force 1 Low offers a fresh take on a timeless design. Stay tuned for more details as information arrives.

1.title: Official Images Of The Nike Air Max Uptempo OG “Mystic Teal”
1.snippet: The Nike Air Max Uptempo “Mystic Teal” is expected to launch on March 2025 for $165. Also dropping later this year is the Air Max Uptempo “Lakers”.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

If you love Retro, Nike has a mammoth list of drops waiting for you in 2025. Basketball icons are the focus for the Swoosh’s strategy to regain the attention of sneakerheads, and this March it will be the Air Max Uptempo that’ll be do a lot of the heavy lifting in regards to drawing interest from the community.

The Air Max Uptempo earns its spot in Nike history as the first-ever basketball shoe with a full-length visible Air unit. According to Nike, it was the “most Air cushioning we’ve ever put into a sole” and quickly became a hit both on and off the court once it debuted at retail in late 1995. It laid the groundwork for the rest of the legendary Uptempo series, which includes the Air Max Uptempo 97 and the iconic Air More Uptempo.

This March, Nike will indeed bring back the original colorway — the “Mystic Teal”. This exact pair was featured in the unforgettable phone ad series.

The Nike Air Max Uptempo “Mystic Teal” is expected to launch on March 2025 for $165. Also dropping later this year is the Air Max Uptempo “Lakers”.

4.title: Nike’s Fur-tastically Flat Retro Sneaker Has That Dog in ‘Em
4.snippet: Nike unveils "Dalmatian" Field General 82 sneaker featuring spotted fur. The Swoosh shoe proves itself to be the the top dog, after all.
4.content:
With new spotted hair, Nike's Field General is here to prove that its the top dog of flat Swoosh sneakers.

In 2024, Nike plucked the Nike Field General from the archives, reintroducing the reborn flat-soled classic in retro-style flavors and even outfits similar to adidas' TikTok-approved Gazelle sneaker. The Nike Field General even got CdG and Union collaborations for its big return to the shoe game.

The Nike Field General has gotten much more stylish in its revival era, too. Remember when Nike delivered the resurrected football shoe in the fashionably fuzzy "London" iteration last year? Good times for good Swoosh steppers.

Next up? The Nike Field Field general does "Dalmatian."

Nike

Nike's Field General "Dalmatian" sees the old-school Swoosh sneaker dressed up with creamy leather and spotted fur moments throughout the upper, resulting in this textural pleasing version of the Nike sneaker.

Anywho. Nike's Field General 82 "Dalmatian" sneakers are anticipated to release during the spring season alongside a luxurious snakeskin pack and classic "Oregon Ducks"-flavored pairs.

9.title: Nike Took Unconventional Turn for Simone Biles and LeBron James’ Olympics Designer Shoes
9.snippet: Nike hired Logan Hickox as a design engineer. Eventually, his contributions to the brand led to his promotion to design engineer II.
9.content:
The Olympic Games in Paris greeted sports fans with many spectacles. Indeed, the participating athletes, such as Simone Biles and LeBron James, were at the pinnacle of their respective sports. Both the Americans took their team to the top and secured Olympic gold medals. While they were at their peak moments in the coveted event, it was also a proud time for many people associated with them.

And guess what? It was also a big moment for their shoe designer, who was behind the shoe that they wore at the coveted event. Indeed, that certain piece has its own story, and thanks to Nike for giving them the opportunity to get their design out there to two of the best athletes in the world.

ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad

Surprised to see Simone Biles and LeBron James wearing his design

Back in 2021, Nike hired Logan Hickox as a design engineer. Eventually, his contributions to the brand led to his promotion to design engineer II. However, there’s a lot more to shoe designing than what an average person thinks. As reported by Face 2 Face Africa, Hickox explained in an interview, stating, “If you’re looking at a shoe, there’s a whole world of science that goes behind it. In the Bowerman Footwear Lab at Nike, it’s an innovation space. It’s a thinker space.”

Nike gave him the opportunity to bring in the big ideas, and he was never disappointed. Logan also revealed the way he designed different components, as he used a variety of CAD programs. Furthermore, he spilled his beans on the shoe giant, stating, “At Nike, prototyping is the name of the game, and what people don’t see is that you might have one pair of shoes, but really, what went behind it was hundreds of designs.”

Eventually, he was given another opportunity to contribute to the design of the Nike Air Max Dn USA. Yes, this particular shoe was worn by Team USA athletes like Simone Biles and LeBron James at the Paris Olympics, and he was just mesmerized by his accomplishment, revealing his emotions, he stated, “Seeing LeBron James and Simone Biles, the GOATs of their respective sports, wearing some of the shoes that I designed, that was incredible.” With this accolade on his resume, he thanked Nike for the opportunity and described how, with the right motivation, people can achieve many heights in their careers.

via Imago Simone Biles USA, AUGUST 1, 2024 – Gymnastics – Artistic : Women s Individual All-Around Final Balance Beam during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, Olympische Spiele, Olympia, OS at Bercy Arena in Paris, France. Noxthirdxpartyxsales PUBLICATIONxNOTxINxJPN 263491864

Indeed, Logan has had his own journey filled with challenges. He graduated with a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Florida. However, his interest was much more in sports than in engineering. And eventually, he found himself in Nike with the right amount of hard work. Designing shoes for these big names must be exciting, isn’t it? The market surely revolves around one, and even many athletes chase a dream of having a signature shoe to their name.

ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad

A market that never dies down

Individuals have a unique passion for shoes. There are many enthusiasts who like their footwear designed by big designers in the world, and they would pay any price for it. And the marketplace for shoes is huge! However, only a handful of brands excel in their respective fields. Similarly, Noah Lyles, who is sponsored by Adidas, demanded his signature sneakers from the shoe giant after winning his career-first Olympic gold medal in the men’s 100m sprint at the Paris Olympics.

ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad

Indeed, the accolade was significant, marking Team USA’s first men’s 100m Olympic gold 20 years after Justin Gatlin. But did the brand listen to one of its major sponsors? Not really. Adidas wasn’t interested in a custom Noah Lyles shoe, but it could’ve been something to look out for shoe enthusiasts. It’s not uncommon for shoe brands to create custom shoes for track athletes, as evidenced by the popularity of Michael Johnson’s 1998 Nike Air Zoom JST. Indeed, it featured golden stripes over a black shoe, symbolizing the Olympian’s career of winning only gold medals.

What do you think about this move from the shoe giant? Let us know in the comments below.

1.title: Nike Air Max 95 “Pink Foam” Returning April 2025
1.snippet: The Nike Air Max 95 "Pink Foam" is expected to return April 2025. Tap to read our full breakdown ahead of the release.
1.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

Nike is celebrating the 30th anniversary of the Air Max 95 in the exact way sneaker purists have been hoping for. On top of another “Neon” Air Max 95 retro, the first half of 2025 also includes a handful of beautifully simple gradient looks that play off the cherished original colorway.

Following official images of a new greyscale option, we’re learning that the beloved “Pink Foam” from 2020, which went mainstream thanks to Kim Kardashian, is returning April 2025. The style code is different this time around, but the 2025 retro is expected to feature the exact same color blocking. Expect grey gradient sidewalls and tasteful pops of “Pink Foam” on the mini Swoosh, eyelets, and Air chambers; basically a swatch-out of “Neon” in favor of a different accent color.

Importantly, it’s possible that the 2025 edition will feature OG tooling and premium materials a la the upcoming “Neon” retro. In any case, know that we’ll be pushing out timely updates as official images emerge over the coming months.

Enjoy official images of the “Pink Foam” Air Max 95 from 2020 below and periodically revisit our Sneaker Release Dates page to keep up with the model’s 30th anniversary run throughout the year.

4.title: Best Nike Golf Shoes 2025
4.snippet: Here are the best Nike golf shoes on the market, ranging from some of the best spiked shoes, to more traditional and more street-styled silhouettes.
4.content:
Nike may not make any golf clubs, bags and balls anymore, but the brand, as you would expect, still continues to make some of the finest golf apparel. This undoubtedly includes a host of best golf shoes in the game and, in our opinion, Nike make some of the best casual golf shoes and best golf sneakers for those who prefer a more street-like style out on course.

Its apparel and footwear is seen on some of the world's best players including Rory McIlroy, Brooks Koepka and Tommy Fleetwood. The brand has plenty of styles including many inspired by its legendary street shoes including the Air Max. It has also shown a clear willingness to bring designs and technologies over from other aspects of the business, such as running shoes and basketball shoes. That way Nike continues to remain at the cutting-edge of golf shoe design not just in terms of looks, but in terms of performance. To help you choose which particular models are the right ones for you, here are the best Nike golf shoes on the market, ranging from some of the best spiked shoes, to more traditional and more street-styled silhouettes.

WATCH: Dan Parker tests over 25 pairs of the best golf shoes to crown his 2024 winner!

The Quick List

Best Nike Golf Shoes

Top pick

(Image credit: Golf Monthly)

Replacing the Victory Tour 2 shoes, the newer 3 model takes total performance even further, getting 5 stars in our review. Why? Well looks wise Nike improved the aesthetics in several subtle ways - the new Full-grain leather upper has a supple feel and sophisticated look. I also absolutely loved the color I got sent and there are also several other colors to choose from, as well as special edition designs too for events like The Masters.

Comfort wise these are right up there with the best on the market thanks to the extra padding around the ankle, and the internal strap on the inside of the shoe which actually contours to your feet. Nike also stitched a Zoom Air unit directly to the upper which delivered exceptional feel, and the foam towards the heel felt very cushiony, almost bouncy when walking on the course.

Grip and stability was also good, and the shoes are 100% waterproof as well. In short, I love this shoe and it covers all the bases to a very high standard. It may come with a pretty punchy price tag, but I really do think it is worth it.

Read our full Nike Air Zoom Victory Tour 3 Golf Shoe Review

Best spikeless

(Image credit: Golf Monthly)

We love this recent trend of popular sneaker designs being made into golf shoes and the Pegasus from Nike is one of our favorites in this category. Our testing showed them to be a worthy addition to this guide because the blend of comfort and retro looks are as close to perfect as you'll find.

The underfoot cushioning was remarkably soft, while we also enjoyed the hidden Zoom Air unit in the heel which contributes to that springy feeling when walking down the fairway. The heel area does feel slightly higher than other golf shoes so this may take a bit of time to get used to, but this is only a minor point.

The rubber traction delivers superb multi directional grip on all types of terrain and the outsole will maintain a good grip when the ground underfoot is damp. That being said, we wouldn't want to use these shoes in the rain because of the suede elements on the shoe. The shoes may still be 100% waterproof, but I would recommend getting a spray protector for the suede areas. These are a fantastic summer shoe because in addition to being great for golf, you can wear them off the course too. In fact they are our favorite Nike spikeless golf shoe at the moment.

Read our full Nike Air Pegasus '89 Golf Shoe Review

Most comfortable

(Image credit: Future)

The Next% 2 is the next generation of golf shoe in the Infinity Tour line and is Brooks Koepka's shoe of choice at the moment. From our testing, it's no surprise that this shoe has also made it onto our lists for best golf shoes for walking and most comfortable golf shoes respectively.

Why you may ask? Well these are arguably the most comfortable golf shoe currently on the market. Straight out of the box, we tested the shoes on a 72 hole event, which may seem like we were set up for failure but we had zero issues. The Air Zoom unit really adds that 'cloud-like' feeling under your foot. The cushioned upper feels excellent and importantly these are all-year round shoes thanks to the waterproofing and 2-year guarantee.

The sporty look of the shoe will definitely divide opinion, it seems to have split the Golf Monthly team! But many will love it, the pops of green as well as the multi-colored sections on the bottom of the shoe really stand out and highlight the impressive technology on the shoe. Not to mention there are more and more colorways coming out of later which offer something slightly different each time.

Finally it has added additional spikes in the forefoot, raising the total of spikes to six, which is two more than the previous Infinity Tour Next%. As a result the traction during testing was outstanding. Oh and these are 100% waterproof as well, making them one of the best waterproof golf shoes anywhere too.

Read our full Nike Air Zoom Infinity Tour Next% 2 Golf Shoe Review

Best looking

(Image credit: Golf Monthly)

The Infinity Tour Next% is the choice of many golfers around the professional tours, it did indeed used to be Koepka's shoe of choice before the 2 above replaced it.

Having put these to the test on the golf course, we were impressed with how well these shoes fit and how comfortable they were. The design offers a sporty and modern aesthetic that has a profile that is akin to some of the best golf sneakers on the market. The black and white colorway maintains an understated and premium finish that makes it usable on most golf courses, to the point I think these might be some of the best looking golf shoes anywhere. But there are plenty of other options out there including the yellow pair Koepka was wearing at The Masters back in 2023.

Taking them out on the course, the comfort was right up there with some of the most comfortable golf shoes on the market. The soft cushioning around the heel really felt nice and even when taking out of the box for the first time the comfort around the foot was excellent. They are very lightweight but this wasn't at the expense of stability because the two spikes on the forefoot and two on the heel deliver exceptional grip, especially when combined with the traction pattern on the outsole. The shoes are also waterproof and deliver excellent ventilation to your feet making them an excellent option to wear on the course in both summer and winter conditions.

Read our full Nike Air Zoom Infinity Tour NEXT% Shoes Review

Most snug fit

(Image credit: Future)

Next we have the Air Max 1, which has been updated for the world of golf in a number of ways. For example the synthetic upper has been made water-resistant, whilst the sole of the shoe has been given an update, with a new traction pattern providing more grip.

Starting with that, in our testing we felt that there was ample traction in good conditions and the shoe performed well in slightly wetter weather. Obviously, these aren't going to rival the best spiked golf shoes and, given their sneaker-design, it's likely that you won't want to wear them in winter, as the '86 OG G is definitely more tailored to summer months.

We would definitely put these amongst the best sneaker golf shoes on the market as we love the subtle details, such as the paint splatter around the length of the sole and the iconic swoosh, which give the Air Max 1 '86 OG G a really premium aesthetic. Although the fit is snug, it does have a somewhat locked-in feel, but if it is possible to try the shoes on before buying them we would highly recommend that.

Read our full Nike Air Max 1 '86 OG G Golf Shoe Review

Most versatile

(Image credit: Future)

Perhaps one of the best golf sneakers in the game, the Air Max 270 G shoe is a sporty and stylish option that can be worn both on and off the course. It comes in three different colorways with each delivering a clean and crisp aesthetic, that looks great paired up with some of the best golf pants.

The shoe certainly appeals to a younger audience, but there is no mistaking that it is great for those looking for more comfort too. it does fit fairly snug so you may want to order a size up if you want a non-restrictive fit. It is extremely breathable and offers up plenty of ventilation thanks to the mesh covering around the upper, which is water-resistant and easy to clean.

Akin to many of the best spikeless golf shoes out there, the Air Max 270 delivers plenty of traction on the turf thanks to the rubber ridges and bumps on the sole of the shoe. We felt pretty stable in damp conditions and that also adds to the versatility of the shoe, which we felt could be worn in almost any situation, from the course to the shops.

Read our full Nike Air Max 270 G Golf Shoes Review

Best casual

(Image credit: Future)

A high-quality and stylish pair of golf shoes, the Air Jordan Low G Golf Shoes are built from genuine leather to deliver extreme comfort on the course. Their classic look pays tribute to the original Air Jordans, first released in the early 80s. But these have been re-designed for golf and feature encapsulated air in the heel cushions that make every step a joy.

While the outsole has been adjusted to suit added grip on the golf course, it's still incredibly low profile. The adjustments on the outsole include a forefoot pivot circle, which offers extra traction on one of the most vital areas of the foot. We found no problems with grip in dry and damp conditions. That being said we certainly wouldn't wear these shoes in properly wet conditions, but the grip in damp morning conditions was impressive.

While these shoes are designed for use in warmer conditions, they do also come with a 1 year waterproof warranty, which is a great addition as you can never predict when the heavens will open on the course. Ultimately, these shoes exist to look really good on - and off - the golf course with the comfort we had while walking was an added bonus. With that in mind, these are brilliant casual spikeless golf shoes and the color choice is excellent. The Pine Green finish is one of our absolute favorites.

Read our full Nike Air Jordan Low 1 G Golf Shoe Review

Most lightweight

(Image credit: Nike)

The Nike Free technology has been used in the Tiger Woods 13 golf shoes and, for 2024, it returns, with the design of the shoe offering complete freedom of movement as well as a natural, flexible feel when wearing and walking.

Aesthetically, we think the Free Golf NN are a really good-looking pair of golf shoes, as the low profile and reflective details on the toe of the shoe really stand-out. What's more, it is available in a number of colorways, which means there should be a style or look for everyone.

Grip-wise, they performed well for a spikeless model, but the main standout was the lightweight comfort, as the NN felt and moved like a running shoe, and didn't require any breaking in at all - they were comfortable straight out of the box. In fact these are some of the most breathable golf shoes on the market as well. Along with the comfort, it is very well made and also boasts a one-year waterproof warranty.

Read our full Nike Free Golf NN Shoes Review

How we test golf shoes

We test out golf shoes very regularly because each member of the Golf Monthly team plays golf regularly as well. The procedure revolves around using the golf shoes over several rounds and in different conditions to test things like grip, stability, comfort and so on. We always test shoes for waterproofing too which either means playing in the rain, or pouring some water on the shoes if the weather doesn't deliver some dark clouds!

Our ethos is to be as honest and insightful as possible in our reviews and guides so you are more informed. To learn about the products in great detail, we usually attend product launches and meet with the manufacturer’s R&D experts to understand the new technology.

That isn't to say manufacturers can buy a good review though, because we tell it how it is for all golf product reviews, not just golf shoes.

How to choose golf shoes

There are a number of factors to consider when picking out your next pair of golf shoes especially if you have wider feet than others. Let's take a look at them.

Measurements

Obviously, you should start by knowing what size your feet are not just in terms of length but width too. Because shoe sizes often vary from brand to brand, you yourself knowing your feet size is invaluable to knowing which models to go for.

Spiked or spikeless?

Next up is to decide between spiked and spikeless. There is a mix of styles above but you should know that they have pros and cons. Spiked golf shoes offer better grip and stability but don't sit as low to the ground as spikeless models. Spikeless golf shoes offer off-course versatility but might not offer as much traction. Have a think about which factor is most important to you here.

Comfort

Once you know the right size to go for, and the type of shoe, comfort is the next factor to be aware of. If a shoe isn't comfortable, you aren't going to wear it so we recommend trying on different models before you buy.

When you are trying shoes on, listen for a 'whoosh' sound which should indicate air leaving the shoe which usually suggests a good fit. Walk around in the shoes too so you can feel any pinching and whether your feet are moving around inside them. A correctly fitted shoe should so neither of these things.

This is important because if your feet slide around inside, or you get rubbing and blisters, you won't wear them again and they could damage your feet and performance.

Waterproofing

If you have large, small, narrow or wide feet, waterproofing is always important. Us golfers are outside all day sometimes and that means the occasional bit of rain is inevitable sometimes and your shoes need to be able to deal with this. Therefore always check if a model is waterproof.

Styling

We are sure you agree the models above show how golf shoe design is so diverse and different at the moment. Brands not only create traditional, classic-looking shoes, but also modern styles that can be used off the golf course too. Therefore it is important to think about what your shoes look like and what style suits you. Whatever you like or dislike, there is something for everyone these days.

Budget

Finally be aware of your budget because you can find a good, comfortable golf shoe for your wide feet at every price point. Speaking of which our guide on the best budget golf shoes houses our top picks in this regard.

Additionally for more golf shoe buying advice, read our guides on the best golf shoes for plantar fasciitis, best women's golf shoes, or best golf shoes for seniors.

FAQs

Do Nike still make golf shoes? Yes, and very good golf shoes at that. The brand stopped making hardware such as clubs and ball back in 2016, but continues to make market-leading apparel and shoes to this day.

5.title: Nike’s Iconic Super Shoe Goes Full Stealth Mode for 2025
5.snippet: The Vaporfly will turn a corner to go full-on stealth mode, adopting a blacked-out color scheme as part of Nike's new “Metallic Medium Ash” collection.
5.content:
The Vaporfly is hard to beat and harder to miss.

Since its debut in 2017, Nike’s record-breaking super shoe has ushered in a new era of not only lightweight, plated trainers but bold colorways like highlighter green and neon pink.

One recent release, for example, went so far as to carry a bright-red flame graphic, emblazoned near the forefoot of the shoe.

The Vaporfly adopted a bold flame graphic in late 2024. Nike

Coming into 2025, however, the Vaporfly will turn a corner to go full-on stealth mode, adopting a blacked-out color scheme as part of Nike’s new “Metallic Medium Ash” collection.

The new Vaporfly pairs a black upper with a matching midsole for a stealthy makeover. Nike

Here, the swoosh logo is barely discernible, printed on both sides of the black Flyknit upper. A matching midsole completes the covert makeover, with a small green cutout providing the only pop of color.

6.title: The Nike Air Trainer SC High LA Rams Returns Fall 2025
6.snippet: Nike is reviving the Air Trainer SC High in the LA Rams colorway that first hit shelves in 2020. Find details and images here.
6.content:
Published January 3, 2025

In the early 2020s, Nike brought forth a slew of retros of classic models like the Air Trainer SC to the market. We were fortunate to receive OG colorways and new takes on these silhouettes. While we know that the Auburn colorway, which was retroed in 2022, is coming back in Summer 2025, Sole Retriever can confirm that the LA Rams colorway, which debuted in 2020, is getting a retro release in Fall 2025.

Retaining the same SKU from the 2020 drop, this pair will remain identical regarding material and colorblocking. Textured leather in a bright blue hue is applied to the mudguard and Swoosh, while the perforated leather base comes in a deep navy finish. Earthy accents of brown find a home on the leather near the lateral toe and the eyelets.

Nike Air Trainer SC High LA Rams

Further contrasting shades and furthering ties to the LA Rams are found on the TPU eyelets, the tongue lining, and the nylon straps on the midfoot, all of which come in a Rams-friendly yellow hue. Final details on the upper include the white lace clashing with the navy tongue and the Nike logo outlined in yellow on the heel. Down below, the model comes complete with a white and navy foam midsole containing an Air unit in the heel paired with a navy, white, and yellow outsole.

The Nike Air Trainer SC High LA Rams will release in Fall 2025 through Nike and select retailers online and in-store. Available in men’s sizing, the retail price is $135. The rest of the sneaker follows a familiar formula: a black rubber tread underfoot that complements the dark upper, ensuring that the Ironstone Shox columns stand out even more. 9.title: Drake and Nike Are Painting the Town Pink with NOCTA’s Latest Air Force 1 Collaboration
9.snippet: Scheduled for a Spring 2025 release, the NOCTA Air Force 1 Low “Pink Foam” brings a fresh, romantic twist to the iconic silhouette.
9.content:
Drake’s partnership with Nike continues to make waves in the sneaker world, and the latest addition to the NOCTA x Nike lineup is no exception. Scheduled for a Spring 2025 release, the NOCTA Air Force 1 Low “Pink Foam” brings a fresh, romantic twist to the iconic silhouette, turning heads with its monochromatic pink design and thoughtful details. Sneaker enthusiasts and Drake fans alike have been eagerly awaiting this drop since its surprise debut in NOCTA’s recent campaign video featuring rapper Latto.

A Bold Take on a Classic

The Air Force 1 has been a streetwear staple for decades, and Drake’s NOCTA rendition takes this timeless design to a whole new level. The “Pink Foam” iteration features a soft leather upper drenched in a tonal pink shade, delivering a sleek and stylish aesthetic. The bold yet minimalist look is further enhanced by the subtle NOCTA branding that sets it apart from traditional Air Force 1s.

Heartfelt Details

What truly elevates the NOCTA Air Force 1 Low “Pink Foam” are the details that reflect Drake’s signature touch. The midsole is embossed with the mantra “Love You Forever,” a phrase that feels like a direct nod to Drake’s lyrical themes of love and connection. The outsole features a unique heart pattern, adding a playful yet sophisticated element to the design. This attention to detail transforms the sneaker into more than just footwear—it’s a statement piece that blends style with sentiment.

A Premium Finish

The “Pink Foam” sneakers aren’t just about aesthetics; they also showcase premium craftsmanship. The translucent midsole adds a modern twist, complementing the tonal pink design while giving the shoe a dynamic, multi-dimensional look. Silver dubraes on the laces bring a hint of luxury, tying the entire design together in a polished package.

Campaign Star Power

The sneaker’s unveiling in NOCTA’s campaign video starring Latto added an extra layer of excitement. The campaign not only highlights the “Pink Foam” Air Force 1 but also reinforces NOCTA’s role in blending sportswear with contemporary culture. Latto’s dynamic presence and the video’s vibrant visuals perfectly capture the energy and appeal of this latest collaboration.

When and Where to Cop

Mark your calendars—Spring 2025 is shaping up to be a season of pink dominance. The NOCTA Air Force 1 Low “Pink Foam” is expected to drop via Nike’s official website, select retailers, and the SNKRS app. With its unique design and the Drake seal of approval, this release is sure to sell out quickly. Pricing details have yet to be confirmed, but if previous NOCTA collaborations are any indication, it will be worth every penny for collectors and sneakerheads alike.

The NOCTA Legacy

Drake’s NOCTA line with Nike has consistently pushed boundaries, offering a mix of streetwear essentials and innovative sneaker designs. From functional outerwear to cutting-edge footwear, NOCTA continues to blur the lines between athletic performance and everyday style. The “Pink Foam” Air Force 1 Low is a testament to this vision, blending timeless design with contemporary flair.

Why It Matters

The “Pink Foam” Air Force 1 isn’t just another sneaker; it’s a cultural moment. Drake’s influence on music and fashion makes every NOCTA release a topic of conversation, and this latest drop is no different. By introducing a colorway that’s as bold as it is versatile, the “Pink Foam” caters to a wide audience, from die-hard Drake fans to sneaker collectors looking for something unique.

Whether you’re planning to style them with your favorite NOCTA apparel or let them stand out on their own, the NOCTA Air Force 1 Low “Pink Foam” is a must-have for Spring 2025. Don’t miss your chance to add this head-turning pair to your rotation.

0.title: Kevin Durant’s Nike KD 17 “Easy Money” Is Poised For All-Star Debut
0.snippet: The Nike KD 17 "Easy Money" is expected to release this Spring 2025 season for $160. Tap in for official images and more.
0.content:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. The opinions and information provided on this site are original editorial content of Sneaker News.

From the heralded Producer Pack to the viral KD 17 “Aunt Pearl”, Kevin Durant’s latest Nike signature shoe is as relevant as it is high-performing. For the upcoming All-Star Weekend, an event that KD will undoubtedly be a part of, Nike has prepared the KD 17 in fitting form, draping the upper in a variety of colors the reflect global currency.

Inspired by Durant’s chill and laid back moniker, the “Easy Money” KD 17 features a rainbow-like upper gradient that involves shades of purple, pink, green, blues, and more. These colorful tints are often seen on bills used across the world, but the design team at the Swoosh has created a mock currency that features his 35 jersey number and his bust at the center.

A similar approach was utilized for last year’s KD 16 “All-Star”, which also employed a unobstructed blast of colors with an infusion of cash.

Official Nike release calendars currently have these marked as a January 16th release, but given its involvement in the mid-February exhibition, it is very likely that these KD 17s will launch next month.

1.title: Nike Air Max DN "Darth Maul" Brings Sith-Inspired Vibes for Summer 2025
1.snippet: Nike's Air Max DN takes on a bold and menacing look with its upcoming "Darth Maul" colorway, set to release in Summer 2025.
1.content:
Nike’s Air Max DN takes on a bold and menacing look with its upcoming "Darth Maul" colorway, set to release in Summer 2025. While not an official collaboration with Star Wars—thanks to the franchise’s ongoing deal with Adidas—the striking black and red design draws a loose connection to the iconic Sith Lord’s aesthetic.

The "Darth Maul" Air Max DN features streaking red overlays across a sleek black base, evoking a sense of power and aggression reminiscent of Maul’s signature dual-bladed lightsaber and iconic complexion. The shoe’s sharp lines and bold contrasts further enhance the Sith-like vibe, while the oversized Air cushioning pods in the sole add a futuristic and bulbous element to the design.

This striking color palette is no stranger to Nike, having famously debuted on the Air Jordan 1 "Bred" and becoming a cornerstone of the brand’s visual identity.

Official images of the "Darth Maul" Air Max DN have been revealed, and the pair is expected to hit shelves on March 6.

Stay tuned for release updates and details, which will be reflected on Nike’s dedicated Nike Release Dates Calendar in the coming weeks.

5.title: Meet Logan Hickox, A Nike Design Engineer Who Has Influenced Footwear Worn By LeBron James And Serena Williams
5.snippet: Engineering was once foreign to Logan Hickox but is now integral to his daily work at Nike. During an interview with Fast Company, he shared that while...
5.content:
Engineering was once foreign to Logan Hickox but is now integral to his daily work at Nike.

During an interview with Fast Company, he shared that while sports had been a significant part of his upbringing, engineering was not. His interest in the field was sparked when he noticed flyers at his school promoting a meeting for students interested in robotics.

“You have the notion that engineers might be of the nerdier type, or maybe they’re not athletic, or they’re not into theater, or whatever it might be,” he said to the outlet. “And especially as a Black man myself, not having seen that representation before, that was something that I was definitely apprehensive about at first. Being able to really push outside of my comfort zone and being able to see it’s not just one mold that people fit, that was something that was super eye-opening to me.”

Hickox attended the University of Florida in 2016 and obtained a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering five years later, his LinkedIn notes. In 2020, he further honed his skills through several internships, including a design internship with Nike.

By August 2021, he had been hired as a design engineer at the company and has since been promoted to design engineer II.

“If you’re looking at a shoe, there’s a whole world of science that goes behind it,” he explained to Fast Company. “In the Bowerman Footwear Lab at Nike, it’s an innovation space. It’s a thinker space… So for me, being able to design these different components, I use a variety of different CAD programs. At Nike, prototyping is the name of the game, and what people don’t see is that you might have one pair of shoes, but really, what went behind it was hundreds of designs.”

Hickox’s design contributions include collaborating on the Nike Air Max Dn USA, which was worn by the U.S. team at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

“Seeing LeBron James and Simone Biles, the GOATs of their respective sports, wearing some of the shoes that I designed, that was incredible,” he expressed.

Reflecting on his journey thus far, Hickox is both humbled and amazed by his accomplishments, yet steadfast in his mission to build a lasting legacy for the next generation.

“Never in my wildest dreams would I have thought I would be working with Nike world headquarters. The biggest thing that I want to leave behind is just the legacy of, ‘Hey, you belong. Do you have opportunity here? Go chase it,'” he said.

9.title: Nike’s Top SNKRS Drops of 2024: Travis Scott Dominates Again
9.snippet: Travis Scott still reigns supreme, dominating the list with four of the top five spots. 2024 proved to be another banner year for SNKRS.
9.content:
As the sneaker community reflects on another year of fire releases, Nike has officially revealed its list of the most popular SNKRS drops for 2024. Continuing its annual tradition, the Swoosh breaks down the pairs that drove the most hype, traffic, and engagement on its platform. Spoiler alert: Travis Scott still reigns supreme, dominating the list with four of the top five spots.

2024 proved to be another banner year for SNKRS, with collaborations, reimagined classics, and innovative designs captivating sneakerheads worldwide. Let’s dive into the breakdown of this year’s most sought-after releases and the trends that shaped the sneaker world.

Travis Scott: The Unstoppable Force

Travis Scott’s partnership with Jordan Brand remains the gold standard for hype collaborations. His Air Jordan 1 Low OG designs once again claimed multiple spots at the top of Nike’s list, with the “Medium Olive” colorway taking first place, followed closely by the “Dark Mocha” in second and the “Canary” edition rounding out the top five. Scott’s CJ1 T-Rexx “Sail” also snagged the fourth spot, proving that his creativity extends beyond the AJ1 silhouette.

The Bred Reimagined and Industrial Blue AJ4s

It wouldn’t be a year of SNKRS without the Air Jordan 4 making waves. The “Bred Reimagined” captured third place, showcasing a modern twist on the classic “Bred” colorway. Meanwhile, the “Industrial Blue” AJ4 added a fresh, versatile vibe to the lineup, landing in sixth place. These entries highlight the enduring popularity of Tinker Hatfield’s iconic design.

Non-Jordan Collaborations Steal the Spotlight

Though Jordan Brand dominated the list, a few notable non-Jordan entries made their mark. The Nike Kobe 6 Protro “Italian Camo” brought a nostalgic yet bold energy, placing seventh. Meanwhile, the Futura x Nike SB Dunk Low claimed the eighth spot, drawing attention from skate culture and art enthusiasts alike. These pairs showcase Nike’s ability to create buzz outside the Jordan ecosystem.

Trophy Room and J Balvin Bring the Heat

Rounding out the top 10 are the Trophy Room x Air Jordan 1 Low OG “Rookie Card – Away” and J Balvin x Air Jordan 3 “Rio.” Trophy Room, led by Marcus Jordan, continues to celebrate basketball’s heritage with premium designs that resonate deeply with fans of the game. On the other hand, J Balvin’s “Rio” AJ3 injected vibrant Latin American flair into the mix, making it an instant standout.

Key Takeaways from 2024’s SNKRS List

The data reveals some intriguing trends about sneaker culture this year:

Travis Scott’s Dominance: The Houston rapper’s name is synonymous with SNKRS success. His influence was felt across 40% of the top 10 list.

The Houston rapper’s name is synonymous with SNKRS success. His influence was felt across 40% of the top 10 list. Low-Tops Reign Supreme: Six of the 10 featured pairs were low-top silhouettes, emphasizing their versatility and year-round appeal.

Six of the 10 featured pairs were low-top silhouettes, emphasizing their versatility and year-round appeal. Jordan Brand’s Power: Eight of the top 10 releases were Jordans, further solidifying the legacy of the Jumpman logo.

Eight of the top 10 releases were Jordans, further solidifying the legacy of the Jumpman logo. Decline of Nike-Only Models: Only two non-Jordan Nike models made the list, a significant drop from previous years.

As 2024 winds down, sneaker enthusiasts are already anticipating what 2025 has in store. Will Travis Scott continue his streak of dominance? Can Nike balance the influence of collaborations with the appeal of in-line releases? Only time will tell, but one thing is certain: the SNKRS app will remain the go-to destination for sneakerheads around the globe.
